Result	Its role in the etiology of human obesity is only demonstrated in the very rare situations of absence of the leptin signal ( mutations of the leptin gene or of the leptin receptor gene ) , which produces an internal perception of starvation and results in a

Method	A large prospective longitudinal cohort study ( n = 1204 ) to identify prevalence of new or recurrent injury and risk factors in a rehabilitated chronic disabling spinal disorder patient group with matched control subjects .
Background	To evaluate prevalence and risk factors for new or recurrent injury on a chronic disabling spinal disorder population .
Background	The rate of symptom recurrence after acute low back pain , like the rate of initial back pain episodes , is extremely high ( 40-70 % ) .
Background	However , although the incidence of recurrent back pain after chronic disabling spinal disorder represents a small subcomponent of these cases , there is a large socioeconomic impact .
Background	An individual attempting to return to work after a chronic disabling spinal disorder episode usually bears a stigma of `` high risk '' for recurrent injury and related work disability that may result in barriers to reemployment or work retention .
Background	Before the present research , no large scale studies had been conducted to evaluate whether recurrent spine injuries or new injuries to other musculoskeletal areas could be prevented by medical treatment .
Background	In addition , no studies had emerged to evaluate physical and psychologic risk factors of injury recurrence in this context to facilitate design of prevention programs .
Method	The present study assessed the incidence of claimed recurrent spinal and new musculoskeletal injuries in a population of 1204 workers .
Method	A subgroup of 5.3 % ( n = 64 ) of treated patients with a new injury claim in the ensuing 12 months was matched for gender , age , race , length of disability , workers ' compensation venue , previous surgery , and litigation status to an identically sized control group who did not report new or recurrent injuries .
Method	Demographic , physical , and psychologic measures were obtained prospectively on all patients , before and after treatment , to be analyzed as risk factors .
Result	During the year after treatment , 1.3 % ( n = 16 ) of patients reported another injury to the same spinal area , with only a 0.9 % ( n = 11 ) recurrent disability rate .
Result	A new injury to a different musculoskeletal area was reported by 4.0 % ( n = 48 ) of patients .
Result	Only 3.4 % of the whole cohort , or 64.1 % ( n = 41 ) of the sample reporting reinjuries after returning to work , experienced lost work time ( i.e. , disability ) after the reinjury .
Result	Only a modest predictive association was found between risk for new or recurrent injury and two self-report indices .
Result	The present study suggests that even a sample of the most severe chronic disabling spinal disorder workers ' compensation patients who complete a tertiary functional restoration program are at relatively low risk for either a recurrent spinal disorder or n
Result	No major physical or psychologic risk factors for recurrent injury could be identified in this large cohort .
Result	These findings argue powerfully against employer bias in not rehiring employees with previous chronic disabling spinal disorder or discriminating in pre - or reemployment on the basis of putative reinjury risk factors after an appropriate rehabilitation pr
Result	Literature review documents a surprising paucity of quality studies examining variables predictive of this important socioeconomic outcome variable .

Background	Severe pain occurs in 5-30 % of the spinal cord-injured ( SCI ) population and is difficult to treat .
Background	Subarachnoid lidocaine has been used in selected patients with some success .
Background	Mexiletine , an analog of lidocaine that acts at Na + / K + channels in the peripheral nerve , has been found effective in persons with diabetic dysesthetic neuropathy .
Background	The effect of mexiletine in the treatment of spinal cord dysesthetic pain was examined in this study .
Method	Fifteen patients were enrolled , and 11 patients completed the prospective , randomized , placebo-controlled , double-blind , crossover design trial .
Method	Inclusion/exclusion criteria were carefully defined .
Method	A 1-wk washout period was followed by a 4-wk drug trial of either mexiletine ( 450 mg/day ) or placebo .
Method	This was repeated for the second medication in the second arm of the study .
Method	Patients were followed weekly with McGill and visual analog pain scales .
Method	Baseline , midpoint , and endpoint Barthel function scores were recorded .
Method	The Wilcoxon 's signed-rank test and paired t test were used for statistical analysis .
Result	Results showed no significant effect of mexiletine on SCI dysesthetic pain scales or Barthel index .
Result	In conclusion , in this trial , mexiletine did not appear to decrease spinal cord injury-related dysesthetic pain .

Background	The Cochrane Library of Systematic Reviews is published quarterly .
Background	It now contains 3094 complete reviews , 1707 protocols for reviews in production and 6817 one page summaries of systematic reviews published in the general medical literature .
Method	In addition there are citations of 495,000 randomized controlled trials , and 9458 cited papers in the Cochrane methodology register .
Background	The health technology assessment database contains 6817 citations .
Background	This edition of the Library contains 97 new reviews of which 9 have potential relevance for practitioners in pain and palliative medicine .

Background	Several epidemiological surveys have suggested that an alteration in the habitual intake of the type rather than the amount of dietary fat may offer a nutritional means for a reduction in mortality from severe cardiac arrhythmia which can not be achieved a
Background	We have examined this possibility in a series of long-term feeding studies with the small non-human primate marmoset monkey Callithrix jacchus .
Result	In both in vitro and in vivo studies of the mechanical performance of cardiac muscle we have found that diets rich in saturated fatty acids promote arrhythmia when the heart is subjected to pharmacological or ischemic stress .
Result	Conversely , diets enriched in either omega-6 or omega-3 PUFA are beneficial , reducing the vulnerability to pharmacologically induced dysrhythmia in vitro or ischemic arrhythmia in vivo .
Result	In addition , PUFA enriched diets enhance myocardial performance ( left ventricular ejection fraction and end diastolic volume ) and raise the electrical threshold at which ventricular fibrillation can be induced .
Result	These diet-induced changes in cardiac performance are accompanied by significant alterations in the PUFA composition of cardiac muscle membranes , and the subsequent production of myocardial eicosanoids .

Background	In Bolivia , 50 % of pregnant women experience pregnancy and childbirth without any medical attention .
Background	Bolivia has the highest rate of maternal mortality in South America .
Background	Family planning programs not only teach women about the benefits of spacing children several years apart , breast feeding , good nutrition , prenatal and postpartum visits , and safe deliveries , they also reduce the incidence of abortion , help to alleviate po
Method	The government , nongovernmental organizations , and the medical community therefore joined forces to launch a nationwide family planning campaign in Bolivia .
Method	The US Agency for International Development has provided Bolivia with financial and technical assistance to establish a network of primary health care clinics .
Background	The author , US First Lady , visited one of the clinics during her trip to participate in the Sixth Conference of Wives of Heads of State and Government of the Americas .
Background	The US Congress recently slashed funds for international family planning program assistance by 35 % and added restrictions on the delivery schedule of aid for the first 9 months of the fiscal year .
Background	Similarly harsh cuts and delays are included in the current budget .
Background	A recent analysis by five population organizations found that these funding cuts will result in 1.6 million more abortions , more than 8000 maternal deaths , and 134,000 infant deaths in developing countries .
Background	Policymakers must be made to understand that family planning campaigns in operation in Bolivia and elsewhere are sensible , cost-effective , and long-term strategies for improving women 's health , strengthening families , and lowering abortion rates.americasb

Background	Motoneuron damage occurs in spinal cord injury and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis .
Background	Current advances offer hope that human embryonic stem cells [ Science 282 ( 1998 ) 1145 ] or neural stem cells ( NSC ) [ Exp Neurol 161 ( 2000 ) 67 ; Exp Neurol 158 ( 1999 ) 265 ; J Neurosci Methods 85 ( 1998 ) 141 ; Proc Natl Acad Sci USA 97 ( 2000 ) 14720 ; Exp Neurol 156
Background	Previously , we developed a priming procedure that produced cholinergic cells that resemble motoneurons from human NSCs grafted into adult rat spinal cord [ Nat Neurosci 5 ( 2002a ) 1271 ] .
Background	However , effective replacement therapy will ultimately rely on successful connection of new motoneurons with their muscle targets .
Method	In this study , we examined the potential of human fetal NSC transplantation to replace lost motoneurons in an animal model of chronic motoneuron deficiency ( newborn sciatic axotomy ) [ J Comp Neurol 224 ( 1984 ) 252 ; J Neurobiol 23 ( 1992 ) 1231 ] .
Result	We found , for the first time , that human neural stem cell-derived motoneurons send axons that pass through ventral root and sciatic nerve to form neuromuscular junctions with their peripheral muscle targets .
Result	Furthermore , this new cholinergic innervation correlates with partial improvement of motor function .

Background	Stage IV non-small cell lung cancer is a fatal disease , with a median survival of 14 months .
Background	Systemic chemotherapy is the most common approach .
Background	However the impact in overall survival and quality of life still a controversy .
Method	To determine differences in overall survival and quality of life among patients with stage IV non-small cell lung cancer non-metastatic to the brain treated with best supportive care versus systemic chemotherapy .
Method	From February 1990 through December 1995 , 78 eligible patients were admitted with the diagnosis of stage IV non-small cell lung cancer .
Method	Patients were divided in 2 groups
Method	Group A ( n = 31 - treated with best supportive care ) , and Group B ( n = 47 - treated with systemic chemotherapy ) .
Result	The median survival time was 23 weeks ( range 5 - 153 weeks ) in Group A and 55 weeks ( range 7.4 - 213 weeks ) in Group B ( p = 0.0018 ) .
Result	In both groups , the incidence of admission for IV antibiotics and need of blood transfusions were similar .
Result	Patients receiving systemic chemotherapy were also stratified into those receiving mytomycin , vinblastin , and cisplatinum , n = 25 and those receiving other combination regimens ( platinum derivatives associated with other drugs , n = 22 ) .
Result	Patients receiving mytomycin , vinblastin , and cisplatinum , n = 25 had a higher incidence of febrile neutropenia and had their cycles delayed for longer periods of time than the other group .
Result	These patients also had a shorter median survival time ( 51 versus 66 weeks , p = 0.005 ) .
Result	In patients with stage IV non-small cell lung cancer , non-metastatic to the brain , chemotherapy significantly increases survival compared with best supportive care .

Background	Patients with transmurally invasive , lymph node negative colorectal carcinoma ( Dukes ' B ) have a 5-year survival rate ranging from 53.9 % to 84.9 % .
Background	The authors postulate that patients with Dukes ' B colon cancer who die of their disease have occult micrometastases in their pericolic lymph nodes at the time of original diagnosis .
Background	In an attempt to identify these occult micrometastases , pericolic lymph nodes from Dukes ' B colon cancer resections were stained retrospectively with antibodies against cytokeratin ( anti-keratin AE1/AE3 , Boehringer Mannheim , Indianapolis , IN ) and CC49 ( a
Method	The results were analyzed by univariate and multivariate analysis .
Result	Fifty cases with 568 lymph nodes ( 11.3 per case ) were examined with each antibody using standard immunoperoxidase techniques .
Result	Positive staining for cytokeratin was seen in 14 patients ( 33 lymph nodes ) , 6 of whom died of colon cancer within 66 months ( 43 % ) .
Result	Only 1 of the 36 patients with cytokeratin-negative lymph nodes died of colon cancer over the same time period ( 3 % , P = 0.0009 univariate , P = 0.0013 multivariate ) .
Result	There was no significant difference in survival between the CC49-positive and CC49-negative groups .
Result	Immunoperoxidase techniques are capable of identifying micrometastatic disease in lymph nodes missed by routine hematoxylin and eosin staining .
Result	Further , the presence of cytokeratin-positive cells within lymph nodes correlated with a significantly poorer prognosis .
Result	Therefore , cytokeratin staining of pericolic lymph nodes in patients with Dukes ' B colorectal cancer is recommended .
Result	Larger multicenter studies are needed , however , to confirm these results and to evaluate the appropriateness of adjuvant chemotherapy in patients whose disease is upstaged by immunohistochemical staining .

Background	To establish ( 1 ) whether associated reactions could contribute to contracture formation and ( 2 ) whether the presence of spasticity was essential for their expression , after stroke .
Method	Subjects were 24 hemiparetics within 13 months of a stroke , unselected for contracture or spasticity .
Method	Associated reactions were identified by the presence of muscle activity in the affected biceps brachii and quantified as the amount of affected elbow flexor torque produced during a moderate contraction of either the contralateral biceps brachii or the contralateral quadriceps muscles .
Method	Contracture was measured as loss of elbow joint range of motion and spasticity as the presence of abnormal reflex activity .
Result	Associated reactions were present in at least one testing condition in seven subjects .
Result	During contractions of the contralateral biceps brachii , the median amount of elbow flexor torque produced was 0.39 ( interquartile range , IQR 2.5 ) Nm while during contractions of the contralateral quadriceps muscle it was 0.19 ( IQR 1.6 ) Nm .
Result	Associated reactions were not associated with contracture ( p = 0.39 ) which was present in over half of the subjects .
Result	The incidence of associated reactions was about the same as that of spasticity , but the two were not related ( p = 0.61 ) .
Result	Even though associated reactions were present in 29 % of the subjects during moderate contraction of the contralateral muscles , they were not large , nor were they associated with contracture or spasticity , suggesting that this phenomenon is not usually a m

Background	This is the first report of delayed cervical epidural hemorrhage caused by an onlay silastic graft placed over the dura after laminectomy .
Background	There are several reports of intracranial hemorrhage associated with silastic implants in the literature .
Background	A 49-year-old woman suddenly developed severe neck pain and quadriplegia during sexual intercourse .
Background	A C5-C7 laminectomy had been performed 17 years earlier for cervical stenosis .
Method	Magnetic resonance imaging showed an epidural mass compressing the cord at the level of the previous laminectomy .
Method	Laminectomy was performed within 5 hours of symptom onset .
Method	Postoperatively , the patient regained leg strength .
Method	After 2 months of physical therapy , she had minimal residual leg rigidity and returned to work .
Method	At surgery , the cervical cord was compressed by a solid fibrous scar surrounding a silastic onlay graft and the dura .
Method	An epidural hematoma was beneath the silastic implant .
Method	The dense scar tissue , hematoma , and silastic implant were removed .
Result	Bleeding associated with silastic sheets starts with movement of this nonadherent implant .
Result	The movement disrupts the underlying fine vessels on the surface of an encasing connective tissue membrane .
Result	Overgrowth of this membrane can cause mass effect and simulate a tumor , even without associated bleeding , within weeks .
Result	Delayed hemorrhage is more common .
Result	We recommend removal of these implants electively , especially if a thick membrane surrounding the dura is detected with postcontrast-enhanced magnetic resonance imaging .

Background	A 35-year-old woman with a long standing history of relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis became physically incapacitated by heat-induced muscle weakness while sunbathing and suffered fatal sun exposure .
Background	These deleterious effects of increased core temperature on the neurological symptoms have been documented for a half century .
Background	Elevation of the patient 's core temperature may lead to either transient or permanent neurologic symptoms and signs that predispose to considerable morbidity and mortality .

Background	Studies aimed at characterizing the operation of cognitive functions in normal individuals have examined data from patients with focal cerebral insult .
Background	These studies assume that brain damage impairs functions of the cognitive processes along lines that honour the ` normal ' pre-morbid organization of the cognitive system .
Background	For example , detailed study of individual brain-damaged patients has revealed apparently selective disruption of cognitive functions such as auditory/verbal working memory , phonological processing ability , grapheme-to-phoneme translation procedures and se
Background	Warrington et al. have studied patients with even more fine-grained selective disturbances of the semantic system .
Background	The most selective deficits have been reported for four patients who were significantly better at identifying inanimate objects than they were at identifying living things and foods .
Background	These patterns of selective deficit after localized brain damage provide important information about the normal organization of the lexicon , and ultimately about how components of the lexical system are related to particular neural substrates .
Method	Here , we report a case study of a patient demonstrating a very selective disturbance of the ability to name items from two related semantic categories .
Result	Despite normal performance on a large battery of lexical/semantic tasks , the patient shows a consistent and striking disability in naming members of the semantic categories of ` fruits ' and ` vegetables ' .
Result	The selectivity of this deficit supports a category-specific organization of the mental lexicon , and suggests independence of the processing routes involving naming and name recognition .

Background	There is great interest in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) and the associated large burden of disease .
Background	COPD is characterised by frequent day by day fluctuations , and repetitive clinical exacerbations are typical .
Background	Self-management is a term applied to educational programmes aimed at teaching skills needed to carry out medical regimens specific to the disease , guide health behaviour change , and provide emotional support for patients to control their disease and live
Background	In COPD , the value of self-management education is not yet clear .
Background	The first Cochrane review about self-management was published in 2003 .
Background	It was intended to shed light on the effectiveness of self-management programmes in COPD and the relative efficacy of their constitutive elements .
Background	No conclusions about the effectiveness of self-management could be drawn because of the large variation in outcome measures used in the limited number of included studies .
Method	This article describes the first update of this review .
Method	The objective of this review was to assess the settings , methods and efficacy of COPD self-management education programmes on health outcomes and use of health care services .
Method	We searched the Cochrane Airways Group trial register , MEDLINE ( January 1985 to January 2006 ) , reference lists , and abstracts of medical conferences .
Method	Controlled trials ( randomised and non-randomised ) of self-management education in patients with COPD .
Method	Studies focusing mainly on pulmonary rehabilitation and studies without usual care as a control group were excluded .
Method	Two reviewers independently assessed study quality and extracted data .
Method	Investigators were contacted for additional information .
Result	The reviewers included 15 group comparisons drawn from 14 trials .
Result	They assessed a broad-spectrum of interventions and health outcomes with different follow-up times .
Result	Meta-analyses could often not appropriately be performed because of heterogeneity among studies .
Result	The studies showed a significant reduction in the probability of at least one hospital admission among patients receiving self-management education compared to those receiving usual care ( OR 0.64 ; 95 % CI ( 0.47 to 0.89 ) ) .
Result	This translates into a one year NNT ranging from 10 ( 6 to 35 ) for patients with a 51 % risk of exacerbation , to an NNT of 24 ( 16 to 80 ) for patients with a 13 % risk of exacerbation .
Result	On the disease specific SGRQ , differences reached statistical significance at the 5 % level on the total score ( WMD -2.58 ; 95 % CI ( -5.14 to -0.02 ) ) and impact domain ( WMD -2.83 ; 95 % CI ( -5.65 to -0.02 ) ) , but these difference did not reach the clinically re
Result	A small but significant reduction was detected in dyspnoea measured with the BORG-scale ( WMD -0.53 ; 95 % CI ( -0.96 to -0.10 ) ) .
Result	No significant effects were found either in number of exacerbations , emergency department visits , lung function , exercise capacity , and days lost from work .
Result	Inconclusive results were observed in doctor and nurse visits , on symptoms other than dyspnoea , the use of courses of oral corticosteroids and antibiotics , and the use of rescue medication .
Result	It is likely that self-management education is associated with a reduction in hospital admissions with no indications for detrimental effects in other outcome parameters .
Result	This would in itself already be enough reason for recommending self-management education in COPD .
Result	However , because of heterogeneity in interventions , study populations , follow-up time , and outcome measures , data are still insufficient to formulate clear recommendations regarding the form and contents of self-management education programmes in COPD .
Result	There is an evident need for more large RCTs with a long-term follow-up , before more conclusions can be drawn .

Background	Spinal epidural hematoma ( SEH ) is rare and not without serious sequelae .
Background	We report a patient who developed Brown-Séquard syndrome from SEH after fluoroscopic-guided cervical steroid injection and favorable response to methylprednisolone ( MP ) .
Method	A 56-year-old man reported immediate sharp shooting pain to the upper extremities on introduction of epidural toughy needle .
Method	A total of 5 mL of 0.2 % ropivacaine and 120 mg methylprednisolone acetate suspension was administered at the C6-7 interspace .
Method	Within half an hour , a neurologic deficit occurred at C7-8 and right Brown-Séquard syndrome developed .
Method	Once SEH was suspected ( 3 hours after onset of neurologic deficit ) , a protocol of high-dose MP intravenous infusion was initiated .
Result	Immediate incomplete recovery of motor , sensory , and sphincteric functions was noted within 30 minutes of infusion .
Result	Emergency spinal C6-T2 bilateral decompressive laminectomies and evacuation SEH were performed within an expected delay ( 10 hours from the onset of neurologic deficit ) .
Result	Fluoroscopic guidance does not take the place of adherence to meticulous technique .
Result	An unexplained neurologic deficit after invasive spinal procedures should raise the concern for SEH .
Result	Early recognition and emergent evacuation remain the mainstay management for SEH .
Result	This case suggests some neuroprotection from MP in cases of cervicothoracic cord compression secondary to traumatic SEH .
Result	When potential risks for SEH exist , it is advisable not to administer local anesthetic so as not to interfere with neurologic assessment and delaying the diagnosis .

Background	Although clinical trials demonstrate the efficacy of quality improvement outreach in improving service delivery , evidence for broad community effectiveness has been lacking .
Background	The objective of this study was to test the effectiveness of a statewide pediatric quality improvement outreach program in improving preventive services for children who are younger than 5 years .
Method	All pediatric practices in Vermont ( n = 35 ) were invited to participate in a preventive services quality improvement initiative .
Method	Ninety-one percent agreed .
Method	Participating practices serve > 80 % of all Vermont children who are younger than 5 years .
Method	The main outcome measured was change in 9 preventive services areas ( 1 ) immunizations up to date ; ( 2 ) anemia screening ; ( 3 ) tuberculosis risk assessment and indicated screening ; ( 4 ) lead screening ; ( 5 ) infant sleep position counseling ; ( 6 ) environmental tobacco smoke-exposure risk assessment ; ( 7 ) blood pressure screening ; ( 8 ) vision screening ; and ( 9 ) dental risk assessment .
Result	All practices demonstrated improvement in 1 or more preventive services areas .
Method	The mean number of areas chosen was 5 ( range 1-9 ) .
Result	Practices that selected a specific preventive service area as a quality improvement goal were more likely to demonstrate improvement in that area than practices that did not choose to focus on that preventive services area .
Result	The work in this project has provided the evidence for an effective statewide pediatric quality improvement outreach program to improve preventive services for children who are younger than 5 years .
Result	Practices ' decision to focus on a specific preventive service area as a quality improvement goal seems necessary for improvement in that area .
Result	This approach may be effective in other states or regions .

Background	Screening for ovarian cancer in the general population presents several unique challenges .
Background	Without a clearly identified premalignant state , efforts have focused on detection of early stage disease .
Background	Towards this end , investigators have focused on the use of serum markers and transvaginal ultrasound .
Method	CA125 determination is the most reliable serum marker in use , and utilization of serial measurements to calculate risk of cancer appears to have greater utility than evaluation of a single value .
Background	Multimodality screening focuses on combining serial CA125 measurement with transvaginal ultrasound follow-up for those with abnormal values .
Background	Large prospective trials , such as the United Kingdom Collaborative Trial of Ovarian Cancer Screening ( UKCTOCS ) , are currently underway to assess the impact of various screening strategies on mortality , and to evaluate feasibility , acceptability , and morbi
Background	Future research efforts will undoubtedly focus on promising techniques to examine the serum proteosome for patterns to identify early ovarian cancer .

Background	Atrial arrhythmias often complicate congestive heart failure ( CHF ) .
Method	We characterized inducible atrial tachyarrhythmias and electrophysiologic alterations in dogs with CHF and atrial enlargement produced by rapid ventricular pacing .
Method	Endocardial pacing leads were implanted in the right ventricle , right atrium , and coronary sinus in 18 dogs .
Method	The right ventricular lead was connected to an implanted pacemaker capable of rapid ventricular pacing .
Method	The atrial leads were used to perform electrophysiologic studies in conscious animals at baseline in all dogs , during CHF induced by rapid ventricular pacing at 235 beats/min in 15 dogs , and during recovery from CHF in 6 dogs .
Result	After 20 + / - 7 days of rapid ventricular pacing , inducibility of sustained atrial tachycardia ( cycle length 120 + / - 12 msec ) was enhanced in dogs with CHF .
Result	Atrial tachycardia required a critical decrease in atrial burst pacing cycle length ( < or = 130 msec ) for induction and often could be terminated by overdrive pacing .
Result	Calcium antagonists ( verapamil , flunarizine , ryanodine ) terminated atrial tachycardia and suppressed inducibility .
Result	Effective refractory periods at 400 - and 300-msec cycle lengths in the right atrium and coronary sinus were prolonged in dogs with CHF .
Result	Atrial cells from dogs with CHF had prolonged action potential durations and reduced resting potentials and delayed afterdepolarizations ( DADs ) .
Result	Mitochondria from atrial tissue from dogs with CHF were enlarged and had internal cristae disorganization .
Result	CHF promotes inducibility of sustained atrial tachycardia .
Result	Based on the mode of tachycardia induction , responses to pacing and calcium antagonists , and presence of DADs , atrial tachycardia in this CHF model has a mechanism most consistent with DAD-induced triggered activity resulting from intracellular calcium ov

Background	A prospective study was performed to determine why some persons with spinal cord injury ( SCI ) fail to return for scheduled evaluations in order to identify predictive factors that could be used to target those at greatest risk for noncompliance and facili
Method	Sixty-one noncompliant subjects and 102 persons compliant with regularly scheduled annual examinations were paid to come to the clinic for evaluation .
Method	Each participant completed a psychological questionnaire comprised of theoretical and socioeconomic variables .
Result	There was no difference between the two groups according to gender , race , level or completeness of injury , education , etiology of injury , responses to questions from the Health Locus of Control Scale , Health Beliefs Model , inconvenience or discomfort .
Result	For noncompliant versus compliant persons , cost ( P = 0.0002 ) , distance ( P = 0.0047 ) , transportation ( P = 0.0330 ) , belief that follow-up was not necessary ( P < 0.0001 ) , availability of good local doctor ( P = 0.0001 ) and time ( P = 0.0209 ) were identified
Result	These data indicate a need to improve the education for newly injured persons as well as those persons residing in the community on the importance of regular urological follow-up , to maintain close contact post-discharge and to assist in identifying commu

Background	To assess the efficacy of transvaginal sonography ( TVS ) in differentiating endometriomas from other adnexal masses .
Method	One thousand thirty-five adnexal masses undergoing laparoscopy or laparotomy were evaluated prospectively using TVS .
Method	Masses diagnosed as endometrioma according to their sonographic appearance were divided into two groups those with a round shape , regular margins , thick walls and homogeneous , low-level echoes ( group A ) ; or those with irregular margins , internal septations and an anechoic appearance ( group B ) .
Result	The sensitivity of TVS in diagnosing endometriomas was 86.50 % and the specificity 99.11 % .
Result	The positive predictive value ( PPV ) and the negative predictive value of the test were calculated to be 91.45 % and 98.14 % , respectively .
Result	By using the criteria determining group A , the PPV of the test increased to 97 % , whereas group B had a lower PPV ( 70.85 % ) .
Result	We propose that the accuracy of TVS in diagnosing endometriomas may be beneficial in various clinical conditions .

Background	To address the following questions : ( 1 ) What evidence ( ie , psychometric data collected in pediatric primary care , patient outcome data ) exists for the various methods used to identify adolescent depression in primary care ?
Background	and ( 2 ) What identification practices are currently in use ?
Method	We systematically searched MEDLINE for English-language articles using specific search terms and examined relevant titles , abstracts , and articles .
Method	We reviewed 1743 MEDLINE abstracts .
Method	Seventy-four articles were pulled for examination , with 30 articles meeting full criteria .
Method	Five studies had adequate psychometric data on various adolescent depression identification methods in primary care .
Method	Only 1 compared the diagnostic accuracy of physicians trained to ask depression questions vs physicians trained in the use of a diagnostic aid .
Method	Six studies reported on current practice .
Method	Evidence regarding sensitivity , specificity , positive predictive value , and negative predictive value was sought for question 1 .
Method	Frequency of screening was sought for question 2 .
Result	Review of these articles found that few health care professionals use systematic depression identification methods , despite some growing evidence for their validity , feasibility , and possible efficacy .
Result	Available evidence indicates that primary care professionals would improve their rates of depression diagnosis through training , but even more so by using adolescent symptom rating scales .

Method	STUDY DESIGN : Case report .
Method	To report a rare case of spinal cord infarction following therapeutic computed tomography-guided nerve root injection .
Background	Diagnostic and therapeutic image-guided nerve root injection is commonly performed in the management of low back pain and sciatica .
Background	The severe complication of spinal cord infarction has been reported in only 3 cases previously .
Method	Retrospective review of case records and imaging .
Method	A 71-year-old woman presented with symptoms and signs of left L2 nerve root compression .
Result	She was managed with computed tomography-guided left L2 nerve root injection using bupivacaine and triamcinolone and developed immediate bilateral sensory loss and paraplegia .
Result	Magnetic resonance imaging demonstrated diffuse hyperintensity within the distal thoracic cord and conus on T2-weighted images , consistent with spinal cord infarction .
Result	We report the fourth case of spinal cord infarction following nerve root injection .
Result	The severity of this complication warrants that it should be considered during patient consent for this procedure .

Background	Medically impairing injuries among medical personnel ( n = 209 ) were analyzed based on data obtained from the Work-Related No-Fault Liability Insurance 's ( TFA ) injury registration system .
Background	Almost half ( 98 ; 47 % ) were injured during patient care , of which 29 were injured as a result of physical trauma inflicted by the patient .
Background	When moving themselves between the homes of the patients and between different wards , 94 ( 45 % ) were injured ( 18 in vehicle crashes ) .
Background	The injuries most often resulting in medical impairment were sprains and/or strains ( 101 ; 48 % ) and fractures ( 67 ; 32 % ) .
Method	The injuries primarily affected the upper extremities ( 48 % ) .
Background	Fifteen percent had a medical impairment of 10 % or more , and in about half of the cases , the impairment was 1 % to 4 % .
Background	Every injured person was on sick leave for 7 months , on average , during the 2-year follow-up period .
Background	In 12 % of the cases , the injury led to a disability pension .

Method	Seventy consecutive patients with injuries of the thoracic and lumbar spine accompanied by neurological deficit were prospectively studied and follow-up .
Result	In 40 of these patients with a burst fracture , the degree of involvement of the cross-sectional area of the spinal canal , as revealed on first CT after admission , was not correlated with the type and degree of initial neurological deficit .
Result	In patients with injuries of the lumbar spine , neurological deficit may be mild , although the sagittal diameter of the spinal canal may be reduced by as much as 90 % .
Result	We can not establish a difference in neurological recovery between those cases who were managed conservatively and those in whom a surgical decompression and stabilization procedure was performed .
Result	Surgical stabilizing procedures , however , result in immediate stabilization of the spine , they diminish pain , facilitate nursing care and allow more rapid mobilization and earlier active rehabilitation .
Result	If major extraspinal injuries form a relative contra-indication to surgical decompression of the cord and stabilization of the spine injury , the patient can quite well be treated conservatively without endangering neurological recovery .

Background	Adult males with and without permanent damage to the spinal cord were contrasted in terms of their sexual responsiveness to erotic stimulation in film , spoken-text , and fantasy modes .
Result	Among the 16 spinal cord injured ( SCI ) men who were studied , several who had anticipated they would achieve erection failed to do so , whereas others demonstrated penile tumescence during erotic stimulation despite claiming they had lost the capacity for p
Result	Self-report is thus not a valid index of sexual responsivity following spinal cord injury .
Result	Levels of tumescence varied across modalities of stimulation in the same manner for SCI and non-SCI men , and within each modality the two groups demonstrated similar rates of buildup of arousal over segments of stimulation .
Result	The SCI men without erections should not be considered asexual since their subjective arousal paralleled the subjective arousal of the non-SCI men and the SCI men with erections .

Background	The objectives of this randomised controlled study were to determine if pre-admission patient education affects post-operative pain levels , domiciliary self-care capacity and patient recall following a laparoscopic cholecystectomy ( LC ) .
Method	Participants were randomised to receive the standard preadmission program ( SP ) or an individualised , education intervention ( El ) .
Method	A pre-operative questionnaire was administered in the pre-admission clinic to determine participants ' knowledge of LC and post-operative management .
Method	Telephone follow-up and post-operative questionnaire were conducted approximately 14 days post discharge .
Method	Preadmission clinic of a Sydney , Australia , tertiary referral hospital .
Method	Ninety-three elective LC patients .
Result	EI participants experienced lower pain levels and had significantly greater recall of provided information .
Result	However , no significant differences were found between the control and intervention groups for domiciliary self-care .
Result	Pre-admission education intervention helps reduce post-operative pain levels following LC and significantly increases patients ' knowledge of self-care and complication management .

Background	Pain resulting from a usually nonpainful stimulus ( allodynia ) is a common characteristic of neuropathic pain .
Background	Among animal models of allodynia , tight ligature of lumbar spinal nerves has been of special interest because it has been reported to be relieved by sympathectomy .
Background	The purpose of this study was to determine whether spinal analgesic agents , which have opposite effects on sympathetic nervous system activity ( clonidine decreases it and neostigmine increases it ) , have differing efficacy in this model .
Method	Male Sprague-Dawley rats were anesthetized , and the left L5 and L6 spinal nerves were ligated .
Method	At least 2 weeks later , a lumbar intrathecal or jugular intravenous catheter was inserted .
Method	Withdrawal threshold to mechanical stimulation of the hind paw was determined by application of von Frey filaments before surgery ; after surgery ; after intrathecal injection of clonidine , neostigmine , or their combination ; after intravenous injection of p
Result	Spinal nerve ligation reduced withdrawal threshold ipsilateral to the lesion .
Result	Neither chemical nor surgical sympathectomy altered allo
Result	Therefore , intrathecally administered analgesic agents , one that reduces sympathetic outflow from the spinal cord ( clonidine ) and one that increases it ( neostigmine ) , were similarly effective in this model .

Background	Neck disorders are common , disabling and costly .
Background	The effectiveness of electrotherapy as a physiotherapy option has remained unclear .
Method	To assess whether electrotherapy , either alone or in combination with other treatments , relieves pain , or improves function/disability , patient satisfaction , and global perceived effect in adults with mechanical neck disorders ( MND ) .
Method	Computer-assisted searches of bibliographic databases CENTRAL , MEDLINE , EMBASE , MANTIS , CINAHL , and ICL , without language restrictions , from their beginning to March 2003 .
Method	Randomised or controlled clinical trials with quasi-randomisation ( alternate allocation , case record numbers , dates of birth , etc. ) , in any language , investigating the effects of electrotherapy as a treatment for MND .
Method	At least two authors independently conducted citation identification , study selection , data abstraction , and methodological quality assessment .
Method	Using a random-effects model , relative risk , and standardized mean differences were calculated .
Method	The reasonableness of combining studies was assessed on clinical and statistical grounds .
Method	Due to heterogeneity , pooled effect measures were not calculated .
Result	Fourteen comparisons ( 525 people with MND ) , in 11 publications , were included in this review .
Result	The analysis was limited by underpowered low quality trials , paucity of literature , and heterogeneity of treatment subtypes .
Result	The results for the electrotherapy subtypes are : Limited evidence of benefit : low or high frequency pulsed electromagnetic field ( PEMF ) compared to placebo , provides immediate post treatment pain relief only for chronic MND , acute whiplash ( WAD ) Unclear o
Result	We can not make any definitive statements on electrotherapy for MND .
Result	The current evidence on Galvanic current ( direct or pulsed ) , iontophoresis , TENS , EMS , PEMF and permanent magnets is either lacking , limited , or conflicting .
Result	Possible new trials on these interventions should have larger patient samples and include more precise standardization and description of all treatment characteristics .

Background	The authors investigated the weight loss and maintenance in type 2 diabetic obese patients undergoing biliopancreatic diversion ( BPD ) .
Method	Two series of diabetic and non-diabetic obese patients matched for gender , age and baseline body mass index ( BMI ) were evaluated prior to BPD , on the occasion of the regular follow-up visit at 1 , 2 and 3 years following the operation , and at the fifth pos
Method	At each follow-up point , body weight ( BW ) , BMI , and serum glucose concentration were measured .
Result	In all type 2 diabetic patients , the serum glucose level fell to within the normal range at the first postoperative year and remained within normal limits without any medication throughout all the follow-up period .
Result	In preoperatively diabetic subjects , mean values of BW and BMI were closely similar to those of non-diabetic subjects at all follow-up points , and the stabilization weight was independently related to age and to initial BW values .
Result	In obese patients with type 2 diabetes , the glucose level steadily normalized in every case following BPD , and values remained unchanged throughout the follow-up period .
Result	After the operation , the type 2 diabetic obese patients experienced the same stable weight reduction as their non-diabetic counterparts .

Background	Acute urinary retention ( AUR ) is characterized by the sudden inability to urinate , which is usually extremely painful and requires catheterization .
Background	Prostaglandins play an important role in the genitourinary function as they provoke contractions of the detrusor muscle .
Background	Relaxation of the detrusor muscle , via the inhibition of the prostaglandin synthesis , could result in AUR .
Method	We conducted a population-based case-control study within the Integrated Primary Care Information project in the Netherlands to investigate whether the use of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) is associated with an increased risk of AUR .
Method	All men 45 years or older registered in the database between 1995 and 2002 and with at least 6 months of valid history were included .
Method	Cases were all men with a validated diagnosis of AUR .
Method	To each case , up to 10 controls were matched on age and calendar time .
Result	Within the source population of 72 114 men , we identified 536 cases of AUR and 5348 matched controls .
Result	Risk of AUR was 2.02-fold higher in current users of NSAIDs than in nonusers ( 95 % confidence interval , 1.23-3 .31 ) .
Result	The highest risk for AUR ( adjusted odds ratio , 3.3 ; 95 % confidence interval , 1.2-9 .2 ) was observed in patients who recently started using NSAIDs and in those using a dose equal to or higher than the recommended daily dose .
Result	This study shows that the risk of AUR is about 2-fold higher in men who use NSAIDs .

Background	Two experiments were performed regarding the effect of conscious control on handwriting fluency in healthy adults and ADHD children .
Method	First , 26 healthy students were asked to write a sentence under different conditions .
Result	The results indicate that automated handwriting movements are independent from visual feedback .
Method	Second , the writing performance of 12 children with ADHD was examined on their usual medication with methylphenidate and under placebo .
Result	In comparison to placebo , medication with methylphenidate resulted in a reduced fluency of handwriting .
Result	Automated handwriting movements could be elicited in children with ADHD on medication .
Result	The results suggest that both visual and mental control of handwriting movements affect the automation of handwriting movements .
Result	Furthermore , a simple training procedure was designed and performed in a case study of a boy with ADHD .

Background	To describe potential therapeutic uses of calcitonin in the prevention and treatment of osteoporosis .
Method	Parenterally and intranasally administered calcitonin ( eel , salmon or human ) .
Result	Fracture , fracture pain and loss of bone mineral density in osteoporosis ; increased bone mass , prevention of fractures , reduction of pain and improved quality of life associated with calcitonin treatment .
Method	Relevant clinical studies and reports were examined , with an emphasis on recent randomized , placebo-controlled trials .
Method	In vitro and in vivo studies of osteoclast activity were also considered .
Method	Reducing fractures and fracture pain , increasing bone mineral density and minimizing side effects of treatment were given a high value .
Result	Calcitonin reduces acute pain associated with osteoporotic fractures and has been found useful in treating chronic back pain following vertebral fractures in spinal osteoporosis .
Result	It can prevent bone loss and may be effective in preventing fractures .
Result	Side effects are dose related and generally mild ; they include gastrointestinal , vascular and dermatologic conditions that can be treated symptomatically or by varying the dosage .
Result	Side effects are much rarer with nasal administration than with injection .
Result	True allergic reactions are rare .
Result	Calcitonin in both intramuscular and intranasal forms can reduce the pain of acute osteoporotic vertebral fractures and may be effective in treating that associated with chronic vertebral osteoporotic fractures .
Result	Calcitonin may also prevent postmenopausal bone loss and increase bone density in those with established osteoporosis .
Result	Current evidence for long-term prevention of fractures is limited and does not support the use of calcitonin as a first-line treatment for established osteoporosis .
Result	Most side effects can be avoided with nasal administration .
Result	Further trials are needed to assess fracture prevention and effective dose ranges for treating pain and increasing bone mineral density and to determine the long-term efficacy of calcitonin in secondary osteoporosis , in premenopausal women , in men and in

Background	Patients with refractory angina are not candidates for revascularization and have both class III or IV angina and objective evidence of ischemia despite optimal medical therapy .
Background	An estimated 300,000 to 900,000 patients in the United States have refractory angina , and 25,000 to 75,000 new cases are diagnosed each year .
Background	This review focuses on treatment strategies for refractory angina and includes the mechanism of action and clinical trial data for each strategy .
Method	The pharmacological agents that have been used are ranolazine , ivabradine , nicorandil , L-arginine , testosterone , and estrogen ; currently , only L-arginine , testosterone , and estrogen are approved by the Food and Drug Administration .
Result	Results with the noninvasive treatments of enhanced external counterpulsation and transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation are provided .
Result	Invasive treatment strategies including spinal cord stimulation , transmyocardial revascularization , percutaneous myocardial revascularization , and gene therapy are also reviewed .

Background	Perineural invasion is a histologic feature usually diagnostic of invasion in malignancies .
Background	In the breast , however , it has been associated with benign lesions such as sclerosing adenosis ( SA ) , complex sclerosing lesion/radial scar ( CSL/RS ) , and ductal carcinoma in situ ( DCIS ) .
Method	This article describes perineural invasion associated with atypical ductal hyperplasia ( ADH ) , florid hyperplasia without atypia ( FH ) , and DCIS .
Method	All cases with a diagnosis of perineural invasion were selected from a series of 10,000 breast consult cases .
Method	Invasive mammary carcinomas were excluded .
Result	Fourteen cases of perineural invasion were found and associated with the following diagnoses : ADH ( 5 ) , DCIS ( 3 ) , FH ( 5 ) , and ductal adenoma ( 1 ) .
Result	Nine cases developed in CSL/RS , 4 cases in SA , and 1 case in a previous biopsy site of ductal adenoma ; lesions were all less than 3 mm .
Result	The glands involving nerves showed cytologic and architectural features of the adjacent ADH , DCIS , and FH .
Result	Immunostaining for protein gene product ( PGP ) 9.5 marked nerves , and smooth muscle actin antibody highlighted the myoepithelial cells around glands .
Result	Perineural invasion seen in association with DCIS and ADH , in a background of CSL/RS and SA , may pose difficulty in diagnosis , especially in small biopsy specimens .
Result	It should be assessed with care to avoid misinterpretation as invasive mammary carcinoma .

Background	The goal of medical residency is to provide the best clinical education for future practice , while increasing quality and safety in current and future healthcare .
Background	This goal is not being met .
Background	Traditional residency programs often continue to utilize individually oriented , shame-and-blame approaches that do not recognize the systems nature of outcomes , care , and patient safety .
Background	Appropriate substantive methods , content , and training tools are also lacking , while residents continue to labor in a poor working environment .
Background	All these factors create a system that serves no one-not the resident , the patient , or the system in which both interact .
Background	Residency reforms are proposed to address these imperative concerns .

Background	Overactive bladder is a common health problem that affects millions of men and women .
Background	Despite its prevalence , provider knowledge is lacking with regard to evaluation and treatment modalities .
Background	Although bladder control problems are less common in men than in women , the burden of incontinence may be more significant .
Background	In men presenting with symptoms of urgency and frequency , a differential diagnosis between overactive bladder and benign prostatic disease must be made because their cause and treatment are different .
Background	Empiric treatment of urgency symptoms may cause them to worsen if the diagnosis is not correct .
Method	Symptom assessment should include a medical history , physical examination , urinalysis , and post void residual study .
Result	Over the past several years , many new medications have become available to treat both overactive bladder and benign prostatic disease .
Result	These medications , in combination with behavioral interventions , are safe and effective .
Result	The evaluation and treatment of men with symptoms of overactive bladder and/or incontinence is discussed .

Background	Neoplastic or traumatic lesions of the brain stem or the upper spinal cord frequently cause respiratory insufficiency necessitating permanent mechanical ventilation .
Background	If the integrity of the diaphragm and its nerves is not affected , adequate ventilation can be achieved by electric stimulation of the phrenic nerves .
Background	Diaphragm pacing systems mean the patients can be independent of ventilator treatment .
Background	This is a psychological advantage for the patient , giving him or her the option of living in less specialized medical care units and perhaps even at home .
Method	We report the case of a 47-year-old man with a brain stem tumour , which was resected in large pieces .
Method	During the postoperative period an increasingly severe respiratory insufficiency developed , which finally made continuous mechanical ventilation necessary .
Method	After the viability of the phrenic nerves and contractility of the diaphragm had been shown by direct stimulation of the nerves to be still intact , it was decided that a diaphragm pacer system should be implanted .
Method	A `` Diaphragm Pacer System S232 G '' ( Avery Laboratories , Glen Cove , N.Y. , USA : external transmitter , antenna , implanted electrode and receiver ) was implanted .
Method	Using a supraclavicular approach , phrenic nerve electrodes were placed around each nerve and connected with subcutaneous implants of radio signal receivers .
Method	Six days after implantation phrenic nerves were stimulated for a first short period .
Method	External antenna loops were taped to the skin over the implanted receiver sites ( Fig. 3 ) .
Result	The impulses produced by the transmitter were delivered via these antenna loops and led to contraction of the diaphragm , providing almost normal respiration .
Result	The duration of stimulation was increased stepwise from 1 h a day to full-time stimulation .
Result	Three weeks after implantation of the diaphragm pacer system the patient could be totally weaned from mechanical ventilation .
Result	After a further 2 weeks it was possible to discharge him from the intensive care unit , and he was then transferred to a rehabilitation centre .

Background	Nootropic drug nefiracetam and related compounds are used in diseases with learning and memory deficits .
Background	Recent studies have implicated relationships between learning , memory , and chronic pain .
Method	Thus , in the present report , we have studied the effects of nootropic drug nefiracetam on the thermal and mechanical hyperalgesia induced by partial sciatic nerve ligation or streptozotocin treatment in mice .
Result	In the thermal paw withdrawal test , p.o. , s.c. , i.t. , and i.c.v. administration of nefiracetam dose dependently reversed the thermal hyperalgesia observed in nerve-injured mice .
Result	Nefiracetam ( p.o. and i.t. ) also significantly reversed the thermal hyperalgesia observed in streptozotocin-induced diabetic mice .
Result	In the paw pressure test , p.o. and i.t. administration of nefiracetam dose dependently reversed the mechanical hyperalgesia observed in both nerve-injured and diabetic mice .
Result	In contrast , nefiracetam had no effect in sham-operated or control nondiabetic mice in all paradigms .
Result	Among other pyrrolidine nootropics ( p.o. ) , aniracetam produced significant analgesic effects .
Result	Other analogs also had some , but not significant , analgesic effects .
Result	Finally , nefiracetam ( p.o. ) - induced analgesia in injured mice was not affected by opioid antagonist naloxone ( s.c. , i.t. , and i.c.v. ) but was dose dependently inhibited by nicotinic antagonist mecamylamine ( i.t. and i.c.v. ) .
Result	The analgesic effect of i.t. nefiracetam was also blocked by i.t. mecamylamine pretreatment .
Result	Together , these findings suggest that nefiracetam , a new member of the piracetam group of cognition enhancers , could be a good therapeutic tool against neuropathic pain .
Result	We also demonstrate that nefiracetam-induced analgesic action was nonopioid in nature and was due to stimulation of nicotinic cholinergic system at spinal and supraspinal levels .

Background	To determine whether enhanced access to primary care affects the diagnostic evaluation , pharmacologic management , or health outcomes of patients hospitalized with congestive heart failure ( CHF ) .
Method	Multisite randomized , controlled trial .
Method	Nine Veterans Affairs medical centers .
Method	443 patients who were hospitalized with a diagnosis of CHF .
Method	Enhanced access to primary care , including assignment of a primary care nurse and physician , increased telephone contact , additional outpatient visits , and patient education .
Method	Diagnostic evaluation , pharmacologic management , health-related quality of life , and hospital readmission rates .
Result	About 80 % of patients who had enhanced access to care and patients receiving usual care underwent recommended evaluation of left ventricular ejection fraction .
Result	Among the subset of patients for whom an angiotensin-converting enzyme ( ACE ) inhibitor was recommended ( i.e. , ejection fraction < 40 % ) , three quarters of the patients in both the enhanced access and usual care groups received the drug ( 75 % vs. 73 % ; P >
Result	Enhanced access to primary care did not improve quality of life and increased hospital readmissions , with an average of 1.5 + / - SD 2.0 readmissions per 6 months of follow-up for patients who had enhanced access compared with 1.1 + / - SD 1.8 for those who r
Result	Compliance with recommended CHF testing and treatment guidelines was equally high in both study groups .
Result	Enhanced access to primary care did not improve patients ' self-reported health status and was associated with more frequent hospitalizations .

Background	In 1998 , a research study was conducted to compare existing programs in the European Union providing both care to people with senile dementia of the Alzheimer type , and support to their informal caregiver .
Method	Five programs were selected in seven centres .
Method	Home social services ( Denmark ) , Day centres ( Germany ) , Expert Centres ( Belgium , Spain ) , Group Living/Cantou ( Sweden , France ) , Respite hospitalization ( France ) .
Method	In each centre , 50 patients were randomly selected .
Method	The questionnaire addressed informal caregivers ( or referents ) .
Method	It included the Nottingham Health Profile ( NHP ) , the Zarit Scale , and it collected data on age , sex and position ( spouse or child ) of the informal caregiver , as well as age , level of mental deterioration and disabilities of the patient .
Result	( n = 322 subjects ) Comparatively with caregivers of Respite hospitalization patients chosen as the reference , caregivers of patients cared by Group living/Cantou and Home social services experienced a significantly lower burden .
Result	The benefit from the Expert centre program concerned emotional reactions ( depression ) ( odds ratio = 0.32 ; P = 0.02 ) and work burden ( Zarit ) ( OR = 0.32 ; P = 0.04 ) .
Result	The main benefit for caregivers who received Day centre help was the important reduction of feelings of social isolation ( OR = 0.13 ; P = 0.0003 ) .
Result	The Group Living/Cantou program appeared as the most efficient way to reduce informal caregiver burden , independently from the country considered .

Background	The aim of the study was to investigate the effect of chronic administration of paroxetine ( selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor : SSRI ) on motor cortex excitability in healthy subjects by means of transcranial magnetic stimulation ( TMS ) , functional magn
Method	In a randomized , double-blind , crossover study , twenty-one right-handed subjects received 20 mg daily of either paroxetine or a placebo over a period of 30 days separated by a period of 3 months wash-out .
Result	The TMS study is presented here correlated with some results of the motor behavior study ( finger tapping test ) and the fMRI study ( primary sensorimotor cortex ( S1M1 ) volume of activation ) .
Result	TMS was used to test motor threshold ( MT ) , motor evoked potential recruitment curve ( RC ) , cortical silent period ( CSP ) and paired-pulse intracortical inhibition and facilitation ( ICI , ICF ) .
Result	Chronic administration of paroxetine did not modulate ICI or CSP but induced a significant enhancement of mean ICF ( ANOVA P = 0.04 ) , which significantly correlated with increase of speed in a finger tapping test ( P = 0.02 ) .
Result	This suggests a modulation of cortical interneuronal excitatory pathways without changes in the excitability of cortical inhibitory GABAergic interneurons .
Result	A decrease of RC ( ANOVA P = 0.05 ) was also observed after 30 days intake of paroxetine in comparison with placebo and was associated with changes of fMRI activation intensity ( left S1M1 hypoactivation , ) , without changes of S1M1 activation volume .
Result	Finally , the different modulation of RC and ICF after chronic administration of paroxetine compared to single dose ( opposite effects ) emphasizes the different pharmacological action of the drug at cortical level depending on its acute or long-term adminis

Background	A 38-year-old man in a wheelchair for spinal cord injury from a traffic accident was referred to our hospital with complaint of dull right flank pain .
Background	The patient had a history of skin ulcer formation on both toes due to poor circulation .
Background	Abdominal ultrasonography and computed tomographic scan revealed a huge retroperitoneal tumor compressing the right kidney .
Background	Serum levels of cortisol , adrenocorticotropic hormone , aldosterone , adrenalin , noradrenalin , urinary levels of vanillylmandelic acid , homovanillic acid , 17-ketosteroid and 17-hydroxycorticosteroid were all within normal limits .
Method	Combining all preoperative diagnostic information , the possibility of retroperitoneal liposarcoma could not be thoroughly ruled out .
Method	The patient consented to undergo resection of the tumor with the right kidney .
Method	Prior to the scheduled operation simulation of the positioning on the operation table was done to evaluate the compressing pressure .
Method	During operation decompressing pads were used to minimize the compressing pressure and intermittent pneumatic compression was also used to prevent pressure ulcer and facilitate circulation to the lower extremities .
Method	Five thousands units of heparin ( FragminR , Pfizer , USA ) was used daily to prevent deep vein thrombosis until the patient could use his wheelchair .
Method	Perioperative rehabilitation was conducted by a team of physical therapists .
Method	The excised tumor weighed 1,320 g.
Result	Pathologic diagnosis was an adrenal myelolipoma .
Result	Convalescence was uneventful and the patient was discharged on the 10th post operative day .
Result	Between 1992 and 2006 , 80 cases of adrenal myelolipoma were reported in Japan .
Result	Our case was found to be the second largest one .
Result	We reviewed these 80 cases and discussed the diagnosis and treatment strategy of the adrenal myelolipoma .
Result	We also discussed the perioperative management for patients with spinal cord injury .

Background	The recent literature on the antinociceptive action of ionotropic glutamate receptor antagonists is reviewed with special emphasis on their clinical potential .
Background	Actually the glutamatergic pathways descending from the brain stem into the spinal cord may generate analgesia .
Background	However , physiologically more important is that glutamate and aspartate are apparently the main neurotransmitters along the ascending nociceptive pathways in the spinal cord .
Background	Glutamate , aspartate and their receptors can be detected in particularly high concentrations in the dorsal root ganglia and the superficial laminae ( I , II ) of the spinal cord .
Background	In low doses glutamate receptor antagonists only slightly elevate the threshold of the physiological pain sensation .
Background	However , they suppress the process of pathological sensitisation i.e. lowering of the pain threshold seen upon excessive or lasting stimulation of C-fibre afferents , a process that takes place during inflammation or other kinds of tissue injury .
Background	At electrophysiological level antagonists of both the NMDA - and AMPA/kainate receptors inhibit wind up i.e. lasting activation of the polymodal , second-order sensory neurones in the deeper layers of the dorsal horn .
Background	During sensitisation the resting Mg ( + + ) blockade of transmembrane Ca ( + + ) channels is abolished , certain second messenger pathways are activated , the transcription of many genes is enhanced leading to overproduction of glutamate and other excitatory neurot
Background	This cascade of events leads to increased excitability of the pain pathways .
Background	NMDA antagonists are apparently more potent in experimental models of neuropathic pain , whereas AMPA antagonists are more effective in abolition of hyperalgesia seen during experimental inflammation .
Background	Clinically , of the previously known NMDA antagonists amantadine , dextromethorphan and ketamine have been tested , the latter extensively .
Background	Ketamine has been found quite active in certain cases of neuropathic pain and it reduced the opiate demand when used for postoperative analgesia .
Background	However , in other types of clinical pain their efficacy is less convincing .
Method	Not being registered there are no clinical data on the AMPA antagonists .
Background	There are , however , some investigational new drugs and some novel compounds in the stage of preclinical development which antagonise the AMPA receptors in competitive fashion or allosterically .
Background	Of the latter molecules 2,3-benzodiazepines are particularly promising .

Background	One aspect of the Clinton Healthcare Reform programme is to assist health maintenance organizations ( HMOs ) in collecting and analysing data for the purpose of continuous quality improvement .
Background	The HEDIS 2.0 quality performance measurement model is currently in use and endorsed by the National Committee for Quality Assurance ( NCQA ) .
Background	Outlines a process using HEDIS 2.0 by which an HMO can identify crucial problem areas and track the success of the solution process .
Background	Discusses the use of other relevant statistical tools .

Background	The purpose of this health technology assessment ( HTA ) , commissioned by the German Federal Ministry of Health and Social Security , was to systematically review the evidence for the effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of antiviral treatment ( AVT ) with int
Method	We performed a systematic literature search on effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of AVT and summarized results using meta-analysis and evidence tables .
Method	We applied the German Hepatitis C Model ( GEHMO ) , a decision-analytic Markov model , to determine long-term clinical effectiveness , costs , and incremental cost-effectiveness ratios ( ICER ) of the examined treatment strategies .
Method	Model parameters were derived from German databases , published international randomized clinical trials ( RCT ) , and a Cochrane Review .
Result	Overall , nine RCTs , two HTA reports , one Cochrane review , two meta-analyses , and seven economic evaluations met the inclusion criteria .
Result	These studies indicate that PegIFN + RBV achieved the highest sustained virological response rates ( SVR ) ( 54-61 percent ) , followed by IFN + RBV ( 38-54 percent ) and IFN monotherapy ( 11-21 percent ) .
Result	Based on our meta-analysis , PegIFN + RBV reduced cases without SVR by 17 percent compared with INF + RBV .
Result	International cost-effectiveness studies indicate that INF + RBV is cost-effective when compared with INF monotherapy .
Result	For PegIFN + RBV , our decision analysis yielded an ICER of 9,800 Euros per quality-adjusted life-year gained .
Result	This HTA suggests that initial combination therapy prolongs life , improves quality of life , and is cost-effective in patients with CHC .
Result	Peginterferon plus ribavirin is the most effective and efficient treatment among the examined options .
Result	However , because not all chronic hepatitis C patients will develop progressive liver disease , a thorough assessment of the eligibility and appropriateness of treatment with combination therapy must be performed in each individual patient .

Background	Mechanical bowel preparation before colonic surgery is widely advocated but remains controversial .
Background	Recent guidelines published by the Clinical Standards Board for Scotland recommend mechanical bowel preparation prior to surgery for all colorectal cancers but this may be inappropriate .
Method	This study examines the outcome of a policy of no mechanical preparation before elective right hemicolectomy .
Method	Data on 102 consecutive patients undergoing elective right or extended right hemicolectomy for colonic adenocarcinoma were extracted from a prospective database .
Result	No clinical anastomotic leaks were observed .
Result	Two patients developed wound infections and one patient died with no autopsy evidence of anastomotic leak .
Result	Mechanical bowel preparation can safely be omitted prior to right hemicolectomy in patients with colonic cancer .

Background	The antihypersensitivity actions of gabapentin and pregabalin have been well characterized in a large number of studies , although the underlying mechanisms have yet to be defined .
Background	We have been focusing on the supraspinal structure as a possible site for their action and have demonstrated that intracerebroventricular ( i.c.v. ) administration of gabapentin and pregabalin indeed decreases thermal and mechanical hypersensitivity in a mu
Result	This novel supraspinally mediated analgesic effect was markedly suppressed by either depletion of central noradrenaline ( NA ) or blockade of spinal alpha ( 2 ) - adrenergic receptors .
Result	Moreover , i.c.v. injection of gabapentin and pregabalin increased spinal NA turnover in mice only after peripheral nerve injury .
Result	In locus coeruleus ( LC ) neurons in brainstem slices prepared from mice after peripheral nerve injury , gabapentin reduced the gamma-aminobutyric acid ( GABA ) type A receptor-mediated inhibitory postsynaptic currents ( IPSCs ) .
Result	Glutamate-mediated excitatory synaptic transmission was hardly affected .
Result	Moreover , gabapentin did not reduce IPSCs in slices taken from mice given a sham operation .
Result	Although gabapentin altered neither the amplitude nor the frequency of miniature IPSCs , it reduced IPSCs together with an increase in the paired-pulse ratio , suggesting that gabapentin acts on the presynaptic GABAergic nerve terminals in the LC .
Result	Together , the data suggest that gabapentin presynaptically reduces GABAergic synaptic transmission , thereby removing the inhibitory influence on LC neurons only in neuropathic pain states , leading to activation of the descending noradrenergic system .

Background	Cannabis has been known as a medicine for several thousand years across many cultures .
Background	It reached a position of prominence within Western medicine in the nineteenth century but became mired in disrepute and legal controls early in the twentieth century .
Background	Despite unremitting world-wide suppression , recreational cannabis exploded into popular culture in the 1960s and has remained easily obtainable on the black market in most countries ever since .
Background	This ready availability has allowed many thousands of patients to rediscover the apparent power of the drug to alleviate symptoms of some of the most cruel and refractory diseases known to humankind .
Background	Pioneering clinical research in the last quarter of the twentieth century has given some support to these anecdotal reports , but the methodological challenges to human research involving a pariah drug are formidable .
Background	Studies have tended to be small , imperfectly controlled , and have often incorporated unsatisfactory synthetic cannabinoid analogues or smoked herbal material of uncertain composition and irregular bioavailability .
Background	As a result , the scientific evaluation of medicinal cannabis in humans is still in its infancy .
Background	New possibilities in human research have been opened up by the discovery of the endocannabinoid system , a rapidly expanding knowledge of cannabinoid pharmacology , and a more sympathetic political environment in several countries .
Background	More and more scientists and clinicians are becoming interested in exploring the potential of cannabis-based medicines .
Background	Future targets will extend beyond symptom relief into disease modification , and already cannabinoids seem to offer particular promise in the treatment of certain inflammatory and neurodegenerative conditions .
Background	This chapter will begin with an outline of the development and current status of legal controls pertaining to cannabis , following which the existing human research will be reviewed .
Background	Some key safety issues will then be considered , and the chapter will conclude with some suggestions as to future directions for human research .

Method	Hyperbaric oxygenation ( HBO ) in a pressure chamber with an oxygen pressure of up to 2.8 absolute atmospheres administered to patients with various lesions of the spinal cord ( trauma sequelae , discogenic ischemic myelopathy , states after tumor removal , etc
Result	Pelvic and motor functions as well as sensitivity and reflexes returned to normal and the pain syndromes were alleviated .
Result	The therapeutic response to HBO is directly dependent on the role played by reversible functional lesions of the spinal cord in the general picture of the disease .

Background	The study examined whether associations between bone , body composition and strength are age dependent .
Method	Two age levels ( premenarcheal girls and postmenopausal women on HRT ) were studied in a 10-month follow-up .
Method	Bone , lean and fat mass were measured by dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry ( DXA ) , and strength was measured using an isokinetic dynamometer .
Result	In girls , significant correlations were found between mass ( lean , fat and body mass ) , strength and most bone characteristics ( r = 0.15-0 .93 ) .
Result	At the proximal femur changes in bone mineral density ( BMD ) were moderately related to changes in body composition .
Result	In the women , body mass and lean mass were significantly correlated with most bone characteristics ( r = 0.34-0 .82 ) .
Result	Low to moderate correlations were observed between changes in bone and changes in body composition .
Result	After controlling for lean mass the relation between strength and bone was no longer significant .
Result	In premenarcheal girls , bone is partly determined by mass , with lean mass the most important predictor at the femoral sites .
Result	In postmenopausal women , lean mass is an important determinant of bone mineral content ( BMC ) and BMD , but changes in BMD are related to changes in fat .
Result	The relation between strength and BMD is mainly attributable to the relation between lean mass and BMD .
Result	The contributory effects of soft tissue to bone change over different life periods .

Background	Dynorphin is a neuropeptide that is present in high quantities in the dorsal horn of the spinal cord .
Background	The peptide is actively involved in pain processing pathways .
Background	However , its involvement in spinal cord injury is not well known .
Method	Alteration in dynorphin immunoreactivity occurs following a focal trauma to the rat spinal cord .
Method	Infusion of dynorphin into the intrathecal space of the cord results in ischemia , cell damage and abnormal motor function .
Method	Antibodies to dynorphin when injected into the intrathecal space of the spinal cord following trauma improve motor recovery , reduce edema and cell changes .
Background	However , influence of dynorphin on trauma induced alteration in spinal cord bioelectrical activity is still not known .
Background	Spinal cord evoked potentials ( SCEP ) are good indicator of spinal cord pathology following trauma .
Background	Therefore , in present investigation , influence of dynorphin antibodies on trauma induced changes in SCEP were examined in our rat model .
Background	In addition , spinal cord edema formation , microvascular permeability disturbances and cell injury were also investigated .
Result	Our results show that topical application of dynorphin antiserum ( 1 : 200 ) two min before injury markedly attenuated the SCEP changes immediately after injury .
Result	In the antiserum treated animals , a significant reduction in the microvascular permeability , edema formation and cell injury was observed in the traumatised spinal cord .
Result	the peptide actively participates in the pathophysiological processes of cell injury in the spinal cord trauma , and

Method	The relative specificity of CDS versus conventional TVS was assessed in 96 women with surgically excised and pathologically examined pelvic masses .
Result	In general , CDS was more specific than TVS in 43 % of cases , both were equally specific in 41 % , neither was more specific in 10 % , and TVS was more specific than CDS in 6 % .
Result	In particular , CDS seemed to be most specific in detecting ovarian malignancies , ovarian torsion , and ectopic pregnancy .
Result	The positive and negative predictive values of CDS were higher in postmenopausal women than in premenopausal women .
Result	The use of CDS as an adjunct to TVS is supported by the data from this study .

Method	The design and conduct of a randomized , double-blinded , placebo-controlled , multicenter , phase III study of recombinant interferon beta-1a ( IFN-beta-1a ) as treatment for exacerbating-remitting MS are described , as are baseline characteristics of the study
