Background	The purpose of the study was to determine if 6.0 x 10 ( 6 ) IU ( 30 micrograms ) of IFN-beta-1a , administered by weekly intramuscular ( i.m. ) injections , was effective in delaying the onset of sustained disability .
Method	The primary outcome measure was time to onset of treatment failure , defined as a worsening on the Kurtzke Expanded Disability Status Scale ( EDSS ) of greater than or equal to 1.0 point compared with baseline , persisting for at least 6 months .
Method	An intent-to-treat design was used .
Method	The primary outcome measure was analyzed using the Mantel-Cox log-rank statistic and Kaplan-Meier survival curves .
Method	Secondary outcomes included quantitative measures of upper and lower extremity function , neuropsychological test performance , functional and quality of life assessments and several measures derived from annual brain MRI studies .
Method	Entry criteria included prestudy exacerbation rates of at least 0.67 per year and EDSS scores of 1.0-3 .5 .
Method	A total of 301 MS patients were randomly assigned to receive weekly i.m. injections of IFN-beta-1a or placebo .
Result	The average age of the study population at entry was 37 years ; 92 % were Caucasian and 73 % were women .
Result	The mean prestudy disease duration was 6.5 years , mean prestudy exacerbation rate was 1.2 per year and the mean EDSS score was 2.3 .
Result	The randomization yielded well-balanced treatment arms .
Result	Various aspects of the study are discussed , including : ( 1 ) the decision to focus study design on sustained disability ; ( 2 ) the rationale for the treatment regimen ; ( 3 ) measures taken to assure the reliability of the primary outcome measure ; and ( 4 ) a desc

Method	STUDY DESIGN : Cross-sectional .
Background	The objective of this study was to examine the association between the characteristics of individuals with spinal cord injury ( SCI ) and self-reported health-related quality of life ( HRQoL ) .
Method	The United States .
Method	Questions from the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System ( BRFSS ) survey were sent to veterans with SCI .
Method	The analyses included 2302 respondents .
Method	Logistic regression analysis was used to examine the association between subject characteristics and the following four measures of HRQoL frequent physical distress ( FPD ) , frequent mental distress ( FMD ) , frequent depressive symptoms ( FDS ) and poor or fair self-reported health .
Result	Approximately 19 % of the respondents reported FMD , 27 % reported FPD , 17 % reported FDS and 29 % reported poor or fair health .
Result	Veterans who self-reported chronic illnesses , had higher odds of reporting FPD , FMD , FDS and poor or fair health than veterans who did not report chronic illnesses .
Result	Smoking was significantly associated with decreased HRQoL .
Result	Older veterans had higher odds of reporting poor or fair health and FPD than younger veterans .
Result	Higher levels of education were associated with lower odds of FMD , FDS and poor or fair health .
Result	Chronic illnesses and smoking have a substantial effect on HRQoL for persons with SCI , suggesting the importance of continued efforts to improve smoking cessation methods and to treat and prevent chronic conditions .

Background	During the past year , investigations involving the etiology , diagnostic evaluation , and therapy of low back pain have reported interesting new data .
Background	The natural history of degenerative intervertebral disk disease may be explained by peripheral annular fiber injury that results in damage to the nucleus pulposus .
Background	Diurnal changes in patient clinical symptoms and signs may have a correlate in alteration of spinal mechanics that occurs during the course of a day .
Background	The diagnostic evaluation of low back pain continues to be revolutionized by magnetic resonance imaging .
Background	Although magnetic resonance imaging is able to detect specific lesions with greater sensitivity than other radiographic techniques , correlation between clinical symptoms and signs and anatomic abnormalities is essential for correct diagnosis .
Background	Therapeutic controversies continue concerning the efficacy of chiropractic intervention and transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation for low back pain patients .
Background	Microsurgical techniques for disk removal may prove to be associated with less morbidity than diskectomy with laminectomy , but require additional study .

Background	Congestive heart failure ( CHF ) is associated with a decrease in renal perfusion .
Background	Because endothelium-derived NO is important in the regulation of renal blood flow ( RBF ) , we tested the hypothesis that an impairment in the NO system may contribute to the decrease in RBF in rats with experimental CHF .
Method	Studies were performed in rats with experimental high-output CHF induced by aortocaval ( AV ) fistula and sham-operated controls .
Result	In controls , incremental doses of acetylcholine ( ACh , 1 to 100 microg x kg ( -1 ) x min ( -1 ) ) increased RBF and caused a dose-related decrease in renal vascular resistance ( RVR ) .
Result	However , the increase in RBF and decrease in RVR were markedly attenuated in rats with CHF .
Result	Likewise , the effects of ACh on urinary sodium and cGMP excretion were also diminished in CHF rats , as was the renal vasodilatory effect of the NO donor S-nitroso-N-acetylpenicillamine ( SNAP ) .
Result	These attenuated responses to endothelium-dependent and - independent renal vasodilators in CHF rats occurred despite a normal baseline and stimulated NO2 + NO3 excretion and normal expression of renal endothelial NO synthase ( eNOS ) , as determined by eNOS mR
Result	Infusion of the NO precursor L-arginine did not affect baseline RBF or the response to ACh in rats with CHF .
Result	However , administration of the nonpeptide angiotensin II receptor antagonist A81988 before ACh completely restored the renal vasodilatory response to ACh in CHF rats .
Result	This study demonstrates that despite a significant attenuation in the NO-related renal vasodilatory responses , the integrity of the renal NO system is preserved in rats with chronic AV fistula .
Result	This impairment in NO-mediated renal vasodilation in experimental CHF appears to be related to increased activity of the renin-angiotensin system and may contribute further to the decrease in renal perfusion seen in CHF .

Background	Sleep disorders are frequent and well documented in patients with Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) .
Background	The effect of depression and anxiety on sleep in PD patients has not been carefully studied however , despite the fact that both depression and anxiety are common in PD and well known to affect sleep in patients without PD .
Method	In this questionnaire study , sleep , anxiety , and depression were evaluated in 99 patients with PD and 47 control subjects .
Result	PD patients had significantly higher scores on a variety of sleep variables as well as on measures of anxiety and depression .
Result	While anxiety and depression were correlated with some sleep measures , neither contributed significantly to overall variance in sleep quality .
Result	The effect on sleep variables was dominated by on-off symptom phenomena , levodopa dose , and age .

Background	To determine the relation between various components of spasticity evaluated clinically in persons with spinal cord injury ( SCI ) .
Method	Case series evaluating spasticity using clinical scales commonly referenced in contemporary literature , including the Penn Spasm Frequency Scale , the Ashworth Scale , and standard scales of tendon taps , clonus , and plantar stimulation .
Method	A Veterans Affairs Medical Center Spinal Cord Injury Center .
Method	Eighty-five spinal cord injured individuals with varying degrees of spasticity .
Result	Correlations demonstrated weak relationships between Spasm Frequency Scale and self-report scales of interference with function ( .407 ) and painful spasms ( .312 ) .
Result	No clinical examination score correlated with self-report scores greater than 0.4 .
Result	Three clinical examination scores correlated modestly ( > 0.5 ) - Ashworth score with patellar tendon taps ( .553 ) , ankle clonus with Achilles tendon tap ( .663 ) , and patellar tendon tap with adductor tendon tap ( .512 ) .
Result	Two other clinical scales correlated weakly ( > 0.4 ) - Achilles tendon tap with patellar tendon tap ( .417 ) and plantar reflex with adductor tendon taps ( .423 ) .
Result	Clinical scales currently used to evaluate spasticity in SCI correlate poorly with each other , suggesting that they each assess different aspects of spasticity .
Result	The use of any single scale is likely to underrepresent the magnitude and severity of spasticity in the SCI population .
Result	In the absence of agreement among these various scales and with the absence of an appropriate criterion standard for evaluation of spasticity , assessments of spasticity , whether clinical or neurophysiological in nature , should be comprehensive in scope .

Background	Neuropathic pain after spinal cord injury is not well understood and is difficult to treat .
Background	One possible cause is mismatch between motor commands and sensory feedback .
Method	This two-part study in five paraplegic patients investigated whether a visual illusion aimed to correct this mismatch reduces pain .
Method	In study 1 , patients undertook three conditions : ( i ) virtual walking : with a mirror placed in front of a screen , patients aligned their own upper body with a film of a lower body walking .
Method	Patients imagined walking and ` watched themselves ' walk ; ( ii ) guided imagery ; ( iii ) watching a film .
Method	One patient withdrew from virtual walking because of distress .
Result	For all patients , the mean ( 95 % CI ) decrease in pain ( 100 mm VAS ) was 42 mm ( approximately 65 % ) ( 11-73 mm ) for virtual walking , 18 mm ( 4-31 mm ) for guided imagery and 4mm ( -3 to 11 mm ) for watching the film .
Result	Mean ( 95 % CI ) time to return to pre-task pain was 34.9 min ( 20.1-49 .8 min ) for virtual walking ; 13.9 min ( -0.9 to 28.8 min ) for the guided imagery and 16.3 min ( 1.5-31 .2 min ) for the film .
Result	To investigate its clinical utility , four patients underwent virtual walking every weekday for 3 weeks .
Result	Mean ( 95 % CI ) decrease in pain was 53 mm ( 45-61 mm ) at post training and 43 mm ( 27-58 mm ) at 3-month follow-up .
Result	Virtual walking may be a viable treatment for pain after spinal cord injury .
Result	A clinical trial seems warranted .

Method	The authors have completed a large descriptive study of the system of psychiatric aftercare in Metropolitan Toronto .
Method	This article describes the relevant 6-month and 2-year postdischarge outcome in each of five aftercare components for 505 subjects in a traditional system of service delivery .
Method	Provincial hospital , research institute , and general hospital subgroups are compared .
Result	For the total group , recidivism and employment rates are similar to those found in previous studies .
Result	Symptoms and distress levels are high .
Result	Considerable numbers of subjects live in inadequate and unsatisfactory housing .
Result	Social isolation , inadequate income , and difficulties with instrumental role functioning are persistent problems with little improvement between 6 months and 2 years postdischarge .
Result	Differences among the subgroups vary according to type of outcome and , for the most part , can be explained by differences in the characteristics of the patients served by the three types of inpatient treatment settings .
Result	These findings provide additional information about serious deficiencies in discharge planning and aftercare service delivery that is focused primarily upon the treatment of illness .
Result	The authors conclude that a more balanced system of aftercare requires a shift in resources to rehabilitation programs in the community .

Background	Assess modifications of sexual function in men treated with intrathecal baclofen for spinal spasticity .
Method	Prospective before-after trial .
Method	A rehabilitation department of a university hospital ; follow-up was on an outpatient basis .
Method	A convenience sample of nine consecutively recruited men with spinal cord injury or multiple sclerosis who were receiving intrathecal baclofen by an implantable pump ; average follow-up was 44.4 months .
Method	A questionnaire focusing on libido ; ability to sustain reflexive and psychogenic erections ; rigidity , evaluated by a visual analog scale ; maximum duration of erection ; possibility of ejaculation .
Result	Libido and the ability to obtain psychogenic or reflexogenic erections were not modified .
Result	However , eight patients reported a decrease of erection rigidity and/or duration .
Result	Ejaculation was possible in three cases before implantation .
Result	It disappeared in two patients , and was more difficult to obtain in the last one .
Result	It reappeared after treatment withdrawal .
Result	No differences were found between multiple sclerosis and spinal cord injured patients .
Result	Intrathecal baclofen may compromise erection and ejaculation .
Result	This effect is reversible .
Result	Patients should be informed of this effect .

Background	Patients with isolated supratentorial brain tumours , presumed to be primary on imaging , have two surgical management options - biopsy or resection .
Background	Surgical opinions appear to be equally divided when considering the relative risks and benefits of these two procedures .
Method	To estimate the clinical effectiveness of radical surgical resection compared to simple biopsy in patients with malignant glioma .
Method	Electronic database searches of COCHRANE CONTROLLED TRIALS REGISTER ( including the Cochrane Cancer Network Specialised Register of Trials ) , MEDLINE , CANCERLIT , EMBASE , BIOSIS and SCIENCE CITATION INDEX .
Method	Hand searching the references of all identified studies ; hand searching the Journal of Neuro-Oncology over the previous 10 years , including all conference abstracts ; personal communication .
Method	Randomised and clinical controlled trials were included if they compared biopsy to resection , or looked at effect of extent of resection on survival , time to progression or quality of life , for malignant glioma patients of all ages .
Method	Studies were to be identified , critically appraised and data extracted by the author ( SEM ) .
Method	For dichotomous data , Peto odds ratios ( OR ) with 95 % confidence intervals ( CI ) were hoped to have been estimated .
Method	Normal continuous data were to have been summated using the weighted mean difference ( WMD ) .
Result	The electronic database search yielded 2100 citations .
Result	Of these , two articles were identified for possible inclusion , however both were excluded .
Result	The hand search and personal communication were similarly unproductive .
Result	No studies were included in the review and no data was synthesised .
Result	Given that no qualifying studies were identified and because this is an important issue , both in terms of patient risk and benefit and health economics , the author feels it important to conduct a randomised controlled trial in this subject .

Method	30 patients with whiplash injuries were treated with aural-acupuncture .
Method	The points were chosen according to a special programme .
Result	Acupuncture proved an effective form of therapy for treatment of accident patients with whiplash injuries , representing a valuable supplement to the field of rehabilitation .

Background	The influence of fish oil and safflower oil contained in the common Japanese diet as the main dietary polyunsaturated fatty acid source on plasma fatty acids in ten female student volunteers ( 21-22 years old ) was investigated .
Method	The subjects were divided into two groups and fed the experimental diets for five days .
Method	The total daily fat intake in the fish diet and safflower oil diet was 54.4 g and 56.2 g , respectively , and the fat derived from fish and safflower oil was 16 g and 23 g , respectively .
Result	The proportion of linoleic acid was reduced in the plasma of subjects fed the fish diet and increased in the plasma of subjects fed the safflower oil diet .
Result	The plasma levels of eicosapentaenoic acid ( EPA ) and docosahexaenoic acid ( DHA ) were significantly elevated in the fish diet group .
Result	The ratio of EPA/arachidonic acid ( AA ) was higher , and those of n-6 / n-3 and n-9 / n-3 were lower in the plasma of subjects fed the fish diet when compared to the results obtained from plasma of subjects fed the safflower oil diet .
Result	From these results , it seems likely that fish oil in the common Japanese diet is a favorable source of plasma EPA and DHA even in such short term supplementation and with such a small amount of daily consumption .

Background	Serum lipid responses to dietary modification are partly determined by genetic factors .
Method	The objective of the present study was to investigate the influence of the Pro12Ala polymorphism of the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor-gamma2 ( PPAR-gamma2 ) gene on serum lipid and lipoprotein responses to n-3 fatty acid supplementation .
Method	A total of 76 men and 74 women ( age 49 + / -8 years , body mass index 26.5 + / -3.0 kg/m ( 2 ) ) participated in a controlled multi-center study .
Method	Subjects were randomly assigned to consume either fish oil supplements ( 3.6 g n-3 fatty acids/day containing 2.4 g of EPA and DHA ) or placebo capsules containing olive oil for 3 months .
Result	At baseline , the Pro12Ala polymorphism was not associated with serum total and lipoprotein lipid concentrations or lipoprotein lipase activity in the fasting state .
Result	After the 3-month study period , carriers of the Ala12 allele presented a greater decrease in serum triacylglycerol concentration in response to n-3 fatty acid supplementation than did subjects with the Pro12Pro genotype when the total dietary fat intake w
Result	Changes in serum total cholesterol , serum LDL cholesterol and HDL cholesterol concentrations were similar among the genotypes in the n-3 fatty acid supplementation group and in the placebo group .
Result	In conclusion , the Pro12Ala polymorphism of the PPAR-gamma2 gene may modify the inter-individual variability in serum triacylglycerol response to n-3 fatty acid supplementation .

Method	Seven hundred ninety-three patients had coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) surgery within 30 days after acute myocardial infarction ( AMI ) between August 1982 and July 1987 .
Result	Hospital mortality was 5.7 % .
Result	Age , surgical priority , prior CABG surgery , congestive heart failure ( CHF ) , and type of AMI were associated with increased hospital mortality by logistic regression analysis of nine independent variables .
Result	When the analysis was carried out separately for men and women , the same predictive variables were identified for men , but only surgical priority and age were predictive of operative mortality for women .
Result	Elective CABG surgery can be carried out at low risk following AMI in stable patients regardless of the interval between AMI and surgery .
Result	Patients who undergo urgent or emergency surgery and those who have CHF , Q wave infarction , or a history of prior AMI are at increased risk .

Background	At the beginning of 1995 Israel implemented a health reform .
Background	A new National Health Insurance Law came into effect , mandating compulsory health insurance for all Israeli citizens .
Background	However , while the individual 's right to health services is grounded in law , the basket of services provided under this law includes no components that can contribute to oral health of the population .
Background	The country 's oral health system has always had minimal government involvement and relies largely on private funding .
Background	As such , it can serve as an appropriate model for observing the impact of such policy on economically weak population groups , and on the extent of system equity .
Background	The research goals were to examine gaps among various populations in service accessibility , knowledge and attitudes , preventive health behaviors , and perceived health within this unique oral healthcare system .
Method	The study population consisted of residents of Israel aged 22 + and living in the community -- approximately 4.5 million persons .
Result	The data were gathered through telephone interviews based on a random sampling of the computerized telephone directory of Israel 's domestic telephone company .
Result	The response rate was 82 % , with 1,067 respondents representing the adult population of Israel .
Result	The current study found significant gaps among income groups for knowledge , attitudes , preventive oral-health behaviors and perceived oral-health .
Result	The findings can serve as a red flag for over-reliance on private funding in the health system , and may indicate the need for rethinking about the current oral healthcare policy in Israel .

Background	Body weight ( BW ) mainly depends on a balance between fat storage ( lipogenesis ) and fat mobilization ( lipolysis ) in adipocytes .
Background	BW changes play a role in insulin resistance ( IR ) , the inability of insulin target tissue to respond to physiological levels of insulin .
Background	This results in inhibition of lipogenesis and stimulation of lipolysis .
Background	Weight gain leads to IR whereas , weight loss improves insulin sensitivity ( IS ) .
Method	The aim of this study was to evaluate the effect of weight loss and recovery of IS on the expression of genes involved in lipogenesis and lipolysis in weight losing dogs .
Method	Gene expression was studied in both subcutaneous and visceral adipose tissue .
Method	Obese dogs received a hypoenergetic low fat high protein diet ( 0.6 x NRC recommendation ) .
Method	Before and after weight loss , IS was assessed using the euglycaemic hyperinsulinaemic clamp .
Method	Gene expression of IRS-2 , SREBP , intracellular insulin effectors , ACC , FAS , FABP , ADRP , PEPCK , lipogenesis key proteins , perilipin and HSL , lipolysis key proteins were quantified using real-time RT-PCR in subcutaneous and visceral fat .
Result	BW decreased from 15.2 + / - 0.5 to 11.4 + / - 0.4 kg ( p < 0.05 ) over 78 + / - 8 days .
Result	When obese , dogs were insulin resistant .
Result	After weight loss , IS was improved .
Method	In the subcutaneous adipose tissue , the expression of only the IRS-2 was increased .
Method	In the visceral adipose tissue , the expression of the genes involved in the lipogenesis was decreased whereas one of the genes implied in the lipolysis did not change .
Result	The expression profile of genes involved in lipid metabolism , as measured after weight loss , is indicative for a lower lipogenesis after weight loss than in obese dogs .
Result	Our results also confirm dramatic differences in the lipid metabolism of visceral and subcutaneous fat .
Result	They should be completed by comparing gene expression during weight losing and normal weight steady state .

Background	In this paper , we describe the conceptual bases and methodology used to assess women 's and providers ' perception of the quality of antenatal care , as part of a large randomised trial in four developing countries .
Background	Information has been obtained by applying both qualitative and quantitative methodologies .
Background	The focus group discussions and in-depth interviews have contributed useful insights into the cultural milieu in which care is provided , users ' and providers ' expectations , and their concept of quality .
Background	Based on these findings , we developed two standardised questionnaires , one being administered to a representative sample of pregnant women ( n = 1600 ) and the other for all care providers .
Background	In this paper we present some of the findings of the focus group discussions and in-depth interviews with women in one country as an example of the kind of information we have obtained .
Background	Women expressed their point of view concerning a reduced number of visits , type of provider , information that they get during clinical encounters and interpersonal relations with health professionals .
Background	The qualitative information , together with the data we obtain from the surveys , will highlight the aspects that will have be to considered if the new model of care is to be introduced on a routine basis.Measurement of the subjective dimension of the quali
Background	The World Health Organization ( WHO ) Antenatal Care Randomized Controlled Trial , underway in 53 clinics in Argentina , Cuba , Thailand , and Saudi Arabia , will apply both quantitative and qualitative methodologies to an assessment of client and staff satisfac
Background	Specifically , the study addresses user and provider perceptions of quality in the context of a wide spectrum of ethnic backgrounds , social strata , organization of health services , and medical cultures .
Method	The research instrument consists of questions that explore the preferences of 1600 women and their providers in terms of the number of prenatal care visits , provider type and gender , time spent in the waiting room and with the provider , and amount and app
Result	Preliminary results from focus groups and in-depth interviews indicate that women are concerned about the safety of the reduced number of visits during pregnancy ( four for low-risk women ) inherent in the experimental regimen , prefer to receive care from s
Result	Such qualitative information , together with data obtained from questionnaires , will highlight areas that must be addressed if the new prenatal care model is to be introduced on a routine basis.americasarab countriesargentinaasiabehaviorcaribbeancross sect

Background	Obesity is characterised by growth hormone ( GH ) abnormalities , including a blunted response to stimulation and a ` paradoxical ' increase after meals .
Background	The blunted GH release is reversed by a surgical intestinal bypass procedure .
Background	However , this does not mean that normal GH dynamics have been restored .
Background	The present study assessed whether post-surgical weight reduction in obese patients normalised the modulation of GH release produced by metabolic fuels .
Method	Ten obese female subjects , aged 23-54 y , were studied before and after biliopancreatic diversion ( BPD ) .
Result	All patients , after surgery , had experienced a significant reduction in body weight ( mean body mass index ( BMI ) 25.78 + / - 1.01 kg/m2 vs 44.68 + / - 1.73 kg/m2 ) .
Method	Two groups were also studied as controls : Ten normal body weight female subjects and ten patients suffering from anorexia nervosa ( AN , mean BMI 17.46 + / - 1.12 kg/m2 ) .
Method	We have studied the GH response to a GH releasing hormone ( GHRH ) bolus ( 1 microg/kg i.v. , at 13.00 h ) before and after a standard meal .
Result	In post-BPD subjects , the GH response to GHRH in the fasting state , was clearly augmented in comparison with the pre-BPD values ( peak values 18.06 + / - 4.56 vs 3.24 + / - 0.68 microg/L ) .
Result	In post-BPD subjects the postprandial GH response was further augmented in comparison with the fasting test ( peak 30.12 + / - 4.99 microg/L , P < 0.05 ) .
Result	This pattern was similar to that observed in anorexic patients .
Result	The surgical procedure restores a normal GH response to GHRH in the fasting state , but the ` paradoxical ' GH response after meals remains present , suggesting a persistent GH derangement in such patients , which is not related to body weight per se .
Result	The surgical procedure makes obese patients similar to anorexics , in the relationships between metabolic fuels and GH secretion .
Result	The persistence of the GH postprandial response to GHRH in post-BPD subjects suggests a role for metabolic fuels in the regulation of somatostatin ( SRIF ) secretion .

Background	Bone is the most common site of breast cancer metastases .
Background	Skeletal metastases may be associated with harmful and painful events such as fractures , spinal cord compression , and hypercalcemia .
Background	By inhibiting osteoclasts and bone resorption , bisphosphonates can interrupt the process of bone destruction and decrease the risk of skeletal complications .
Method	A review of the literature was undertaken regarding the use of bisphosphonates in breast cancer management , with particular attention to prospective , randomized clinical trials that have influenced the treatment of bone metastases .
Result	Large prospective , randomized trials have demonstrated that bisphosphonates are effective in reducing skeletal-related complications from metastatic breast cancer .
Result	For many patients with osseous lesions from breast cancer , bisphosphonate therapy is a useful intervention in managing their disease .
Result	Bisphosphonates are the treatment of choice for hypercalcemia of malignancy and bisphosphonates reduce the risk of pathologic fractures , spinal cord compromise , the need for radiation or surgery to bone , and bone pain .

Background	To determine the incidence , duration and symptoms associated with acute confusion/delirium among traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) neuro-rehabilitation admissions .
Method	Prospective evaluation of neurobehavioural impairments following TBI among inpatient neurorehabilitation admissions .
Method	Eighty-five consecutive TBI model system patients were evaluated using measures of orientation , cognition , motor restlessness and delirium .
Method	Fifty-nine individuals met Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders -- Fourth Edition Delirium Diagnostic Criteria ( DDC ) on initial evaluation and 42 of these resolved delirium during inpatient rehabilitation .
Method	Multivariable logistic regression analyses revealed significant unique associations of the Galveston Orientation and Amnesia Test ( GOAT ) , Delirium Rating Scale , Cognitive Test for Delirium and time elapsed since injury with DDC status .
Result	Findings indicate that delirium is common among neuro-rehabilitation admissions with TBI .
Result	Use of a single measure ( e.g. GOAT ) will result in poor characterization of the multi-faceted symptom complex shown by patients with post-traumatic confusion .

Background	The authors performed an analysis of retrospectively obtained data to compare the outcomes of pediatric patients admitted to their institution for traumatic injuries resulting from car , motorcycle , and all-terrain vehicle ( ATV ) accidents .
Method	The authors conducted a retrospective review of Columbus Children 's Hospital 's Trauma Registry data collected between January 1993 and December 2003 .
Method	Data obtained in patients admitted with motor vehicle-related injuries were compiled for a total of 1608 patient records .
Method	Data regarding sex , age , hospital length of stay ( LOS ) , Glasgow Coma Scale ( GCS ) score , revised trauma score , injury severity score ( ISS ) , and use of a protective device were analyzed .
Method	Of 1608 patients , 1257 ( 78 % ) were injured in automobile accidents , 123 ( 7.6 % ) in motorcycle accidents , and 228 ( 14.2 % ) in ATV accidents .
Result	Injuries sustained in all vehicle types peaked during the summer months .
Result	Patients involved in automobile crashes presented with significantly lower GCS scores than those injured in motorcycle and ATV accidents ; however , there was no statistically significant difference in LOS among all three injury modalities .
Result	Protective devices were underutilized in all three motor vehicle categories but , when used , were associated with significantly higher GCS scores , ISSs , and shorter LOSs among patients admitted after automobile accidents .
Result	The correlation of seat belt use with better outcomes underscores the necessity to improve motor vehicle safety education for children , who are less likely to be restrained as they age .

Background	The use of antidepressants during pregnancy has undergone considerable scrutiny with respect to safety issues , though limited data with respect to dose management and symptom resolution is available .
Background	Previous reports on tricyclic antidepressants ( TCAs ) have demonstrated the need to adjust maternal dose later in pregnancy to maintain therapeutic serum concentrations .
Background	However , there is no data on the dosage of selective serotonin uptake inhibitors ( SSRIs ) required to maintain symptom resolution in women treated for major depression during pregnancy .
Method	The purpose of this study , then , was to assess the medication dosage requirements of SSRIs during this time .
Method	In this naturalistic study , pregnant women with a primary diagnosis of major depression were followed prospectively through pregnancy at monthly intervals with symptom assessment .
Method	Subjects were included in data analysis if they presented prior to 28 weeks gestation , were treated with SSRI monotherapy , received all psychiatric treatment during the pregnancy at the Emory Pregnancy and Postpartum Mood Disorders Program , and achieved e
Method	Medication selection was based on personal treatment history or family treatment history ( if any ) , and the published data on SSRIs in pregnancy .
Method	All medication dose adjustments were based on depressive symptoms as measured by the BDI and a psychiatric interview ( ZNS ) .
Method	Thirty-four pregnant women were included in final analysis .
Result	Two thirds of the subjects ( n = 22 ) required an increase in their daily dose of medication to maintain euthymia .
Result	The dose increases occurred at 27.1 + / - 7.1 weeks gestation , with mean BDI scores of 16.4 + / - 9.6 , compared to a mean treatment response BDI of 6.9 + / - 5.4 .
Result	Subject 's age , education , past personal and familial psychiatric history were not significantly associated with dose adjustment .
Result	These novel data on SSRI daily dose in pregnancy parallels the extant literature with tricyclic antidepressants ( TCA ) .
Result	Further work to determine the predictors of dose adjustments will provide guidelines for minimizing fetal exposure to both medication and maternal mental illness .

Background	Our genetic make-up , shaped through millions of years of evolution , determines our nutritional and activity needs .
Background	Although the human genome has remained primarily unchanged since the agricultural revolution 10,000 years ago , our diet and lifestyle have become progressively more divergent from those of our ancient ancestors .
Background	Accumulating evidence suggests that this mismatch between our modern diet and lifestyle and our Paleolithic genome is playing a substantial role in the ongoing epidemics of obesity , hypertension , diabetes , and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease .
Background	Until 500 generations ago , all humans consumed only wild and unprocessed food foraged and hunted from their environment .
Background	These circumstances provided a diet high in lean protein , polyunsaturated fats ( especially omega-3 [ omega-3 ] fatty acids ) , monounsaturated fats , fiber , vitamins , minerals , antioxidants , and other beneficial phytochemicals .
Background	Historical and anthropological studies show hunter-gatherers generally to be healthy , fit , and largely free of the degenerative cardiovascular diseases common in modern societies .
Result	This review outlines the essence of our hunter-gatherer genetic legacy and suggests practical steps to re-align our modern milieu with our ancient genome in an effort to improve cardiovascular health .

Background	Obstructive sleep apnea , a common indication for adenotonsillectomy in children , has been linked to behavioral morbidity .
Background	We assessed psychiatric diagnoses in children before and after adenotonsillectomy and examined whether baseline sleep apnea predicted improvement after surgery .
Method	Subjects of this prospective cohort study were children ages 5.0 to 12.9 years old who had been scheduled for adenotonsillectomy ( n = 79 ) or care for unrelated surgical conditions ( n = 27 , among whom 13 had surgery after baseline assessment ) .
Method	Before intervention and 1 year later , subjects underwent structured diagnostic interviews and polysomnography .
Method	The main outcome measure was frequency of DSM-IV attention and disruptive behavior disorder diagnoses at baseline and follow-up .
Result	At baseline , attention and disruptive behavior disorders were diagnosed in 36.7 % of adenotonsillectomy subjects and 11.1 % of controls ( p < .05 ) ; attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder was found in 27.8 % and 7.4 % , respectively ( p < .05 ) .
Result	One year later , group differences were nonsignificant ; attention and disruptive behavior disorders were diagnosed in only 23.1 % ( p < .01 ) , and 50 % of subjects with baseline attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder no longer met diagnostic criteria .
Result	Obstructive sleep apnea on polysomnography at baseline did not predict concurrent psychiatric morbidity or later improvement .
Result	Attention and disruptive behavior disorders , diagnosed by DSM-IV criteria , were more common before clinically indicated adenotonsillectomy than 1 year later .
Result	Surgery may be associated with reduced morbidity , even among subjects lacking polysomnographic evidence of obstructive sleep apnea .

Background	The aim of the study was to evaluate factors influencing quality of life ( QOL ) in Moroccan postmenopausal women with osteoporotic vertebral fracture assessed by the Arabic version of ECOS 16 questionnaire .
Method	357 postmenopausal women were included in this study .
Method	The participants underwent bone mineral density ( BMD ) measurements by DXA of the lumbar spine and the total hip as well as X-ray examination of the thoraco-lumbar spine to identify subclinical vertebral fractures .
Method	Patients were asked to complete a questionnaire on clinical and sociodemographic parameters , and osteoporosis risk factors .
Method	The Arabic version of the ECOS16 ( Assessment of health related quality of life in osteoporosis questionnaire ) was used to assess quality of life .
Method	The mean age was 58 + / - 7.8 years , and the mean BMI was 28.3 + / - 4.8 kg/m2 .
Method	One hundred and eight women ( 30.1 % ) were osteoporotic and 46.7 % had vertebral fractures .
Method	Most were categorized as Grade1 ( 75 % ) .
Result	Three independent factors were associated with a poor quality of life : low educational level ( p = 0,01 ) , vertebral fracture ( p = 0,03 ) , and history of peripheral fracture ( p = 0,006 ) .
Result	Worse QOL was observed in the group with vertebral fracture in all domains except `` pain '' : Physical functioning ( p = 0,002 ) ; Fear of illness ( p = 0,001 ) ; and Psychosocial functioning ( p = 0,007 ) .
Result	The number of fractures was a determinant of a low QOL , as indicated by an increased score in physical functioning ( p = 0,01 ) , fear of illness ( p = 0,007 ) , and total score ( p = 0,01 ) after adjusting on age and educational level .
Result	Patients with higher Genant score had low QOL in these two domains too ( p = 0,002 ; p = 0,001 respectively ) , and in the total score ( p = 0,01 ) after adjusting on age and educational level .
Result	Our current data showed that the quality of life assessed by the Arabic version of the ECOS 16 questionnaire is decreased in post menopausal women with prevalent vertebral fractures , with the increasing number and the severity of vertebral fractures .

Background	Changes in amplitude of the soleus H ( S ( H ) ) - reflex and its neurographic correlates ( P ( 1 ) and P ( 2 ) waves ) after vibration of the soleus muscle have been evaluated as a function of mechanical stimulation frequency , duration of the conditioning train , and te
Background	Additional experiments aimed at assessing the nervous system mechanisms underlying the postvibration depression ( PVD ) have been performed .
Method	In particular , homonymous ( S ( HMR ) or S ( H ) ) versus heteronymous ( S ( HTR ) ) soleus response , evoked respectively by tibial nerve and femoral nerve electrical stimulation , the effectiveness of sub-H threshold tibial nerve conditioning volleys on the S ( HTR ) , an
Result	It was found that PVD occurs in the absence of changes in amplitude of the P ( 1 ) wave and the S ( HTR ) , is paralleled by a reduced effectiveness of tibial nerve-conditioning volleys on the S ( HTR ) and is shortened consistently by brief passive stretching of t
Result	It follows that PVD may be the result of a long-lasting reduction of the transmitter release from Ia presynaptic terminals depending , at least in part , on a protracted postvibration Ia afferent discharge caused by spindles thixotropy .
Result	These findings may provide a better understanding of the pathophysiologic mechanisms underlying spasticity in humans .

Background	A debilitating consequence of complete spinal cord injury ( SCI ) is the loss of motor control .
Background	Although the goal of most SCI treatments is to re-establish neural connections , a potential complication in restoring motor function is that SCI may result in anatomical and functional changes in brain areas controlling motor output .
Background	Some animal investigations show cell death in the primary motor cortex following SCI , but similar anatomical changes in humans are not yet established .
Method	The aim of this investigation was to use voxel-based morphometry ( VBM ) and diffusion tensor imaging ( DTI ) to determine if SCI in humans results in anatomical changes within motor cortices and descending motor pathways .
Result	Using VBM , we found significantly lower gray matter volume in complete SCI subjects compared with controls in the primary motor cortex , the medial prefrontal , and adjacent anterior cingulate cortices .
Result	DTI analysis revealed structural abnormalities in the same areas with reduced gray matter volume and in the superior cerebellar cortex .
Result	In addition , tractography revealed structural abnormalities in the corticospinal and corticopontine tracts of the SCI subjects .
Result	In conclusion , human subjects with complete SCI show structural changes in cortical motor regions and descending motor tracts , and these brain anatomical changes may limit motor recovery following SCI .

Background	Endometriosis is a common clinical disorder in women and usually presents with pelvic pain , infertility , or adnexal masses secondary to intracystic hemorrhage with the formation of an endometrioma .
Background	Endometriosis shares certain characteristics with malignant neoplasms , and malignant ovarian tumours have been documented in women with endometriosis .
Background	Endometriosis-associated ovarian cancer ( EAOC ) usually occurs in younger women , has favourable outcomes , and appears as either a low-grade tumour of endometrioid cell type or as a clear cell tumour .
Background	As it has been suggested that the pathologic features of `` atypical endometriosis '' may constitute a precancerous state , women with atypical endometriosis may be at an increased risk of developing EAOC .
Background	There are no prospective randomized trials assessing treatment regimens for EAOC .
Background	Most women receive treatment similar to other epithelial ovarian cancers .
Background	However , women with EAOC represent a subgroup of patients that may require different therapeutic options .

Background	Infection with human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) is often accompanied by neurological complications .
Background	One of these includes disorders affecting the peripheral and visual nervous system , especially during the acquired immunodeficiency syndrome ( AIDS ) stage .
Background	The peripheral neuropathies associated with infection by HIV are an assorted group of disorders , which include acute or chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy , multiple mononeuropathy and neuropathies related to the herpes zoster virus or cytom
Background	The most common and clinically important of the neuropathies is painful distal sensory polyneuropathy ( DSP ) .
Background	The most severely affected cranial nerves are V and VII .
Background	The isolation of HIV from the affected nerves suggests a direct role , but an immune mechanism is also possible .
Background	Although cytomegalovirus may be associated with a variety of peripheral nerve syndromes , its clinical presentation as a primary demyelinating polyneuropathy is unusual .
Result	DSP and antiretroviral toxic neuropathy are the most common HIV-associated neuropathies .
Result	Both HIV infection , by itself , and the neurotoxicity of certain drugs in tritherapy contribute to the development of painful peripheral sensory neuropathy .
Result	In researching into the cause of HIV-associated neuropathy further studies are needed to determine the relative roles played by the viral infection and the activation of the immunological factors that contribute to the pathogenesis of the damage done in a

Background	Canine aggressive behaviour is one of the most common problems being reported by dog owners .
Background	However , the biochemical basis of this phenomenon remains unclear .
Background	In humans , alterations in omega-3 plasma polyunsatured fatty acids and elevated omega6/omega -3 ratio have been linked to behavioural alterations , including aggression .
Method	Thus far , however , the relationship between plasma polyunsatured fatty acid status and aggression has not been investigated in the dog .
Method	In the present study we sought to investigate whether polyunsatured fatty acid status could be altered in plasma of pathologically aggressive Canis familiaris .
Method	Eighteen adult male German Shepherd dogs , aged 4.9 + / - 0.9 years , showing no clinical signs but aggression , were investigated .
Method	Eighteen healthy male dogs , aged 4.8 + / - 0.7 years , with a negative history of behavioural and neurological disorders served as controls .
Method	Baseline fasting plasma polyunsatured fatty acid composition was determined by gas chromatography .
Result	Compared to normal dogs , aggressive dogs showed lower docosahexaenoic acid ( 22:6 n-3 ) concentrations and a higher omega6/omega -3 ratio .
Result	In addition , they showed reduced cholesterol and bilirubin concentrations compared to their normally behaving counterparts .
Result	Altogether , our results suggest that low omega-3 fatty acids may adversely impact behaviour in dogs , resulting in greater propensity to aggression .
Result	However , given the cross-sectional design of our study , we can not claim any causal relationship between the presence of alterations in fatty acid status and canine aggressiveness .
Result	Whether omega-3 fatty acids supplementation may be useful to reduce aggressive behaviour in the dog deserves further investigation .

Background	This study evaluated the ability of the Orientation Log ( O-Log ) to predict cognitive outcome at rehabilitation discharge , as well as future neuropsychological outcome .
Background	The hypothesis was that patients who demonstrated better orientation upon admission would achieve superior functional cognitive outcome at discharge and on subsequent neuropsychological assessment .
Method	Sixty individuals receiving inpatient rehabilitation following a new-onset TBI participated .
Method	Orientation data was collected using the O-Log during morning bedside rounds .
Method	Outcome data was collected at 6 and 12 months post-injury .
Result	Significant correlations were found between the O-log and measures of memory , executive functioning , basic verbal skills , and estimated intellectual ability .
Result	When compared to the other predictor variables , step-wise multiple regression analyses revealed that the minimum O-Log score was the primary significant predictor of performance on six neuropsychological and functional outcome measures .
Result	Results of this study suggest that evaluating orientation with the O-Log during acute rehabilitation may reflect level of injury severity and aid in predicting cognitive outcome .

Background	The guidelines of the German Orthopaedic Societies regarding the treatment of lateral elbow epicondylitis were analysed on the ground of recently published reviews or randomised placebo-controlled trials ( RCT ) .
Background	For the acute phase , reviews or RCTs failed to show a clinical effect beyond placebo if follow-up was extended over 6 weeks .
Background	For the chronic phase a current Cochrane review failed to identify any controlled trial regarding surgical procedures during the last decades .
Result	Without an adequate control group , it is not possible to draw any meaningful conclusions about the value of this modality of treatment .
Result	Therefore surgery is not indicated before repetitive low-energy extracorporeal shock wave therapy ( ESWT ) has been applied .
Result	This novel treatment , under strictly standardized conditions , showed effects beyond placebo in independent randomised placebo-controlled trials for follow-up periods of 3 and 6 months .
Result	To date there exists no evidence-based therapeutic algorithm for the treatment of acute and chronic tennis elbow .
Result	Even medium-term effects should be regarded as either a placebo effect or natural regression to the mean .

Background	Traction lesions of the brachial plexus are becoming more frequent .
Background	Many of the lesions involve avulsion of nerve roots from the spinal cord .
Background	This very often results in severe pain which is associated with deafferentation .
Background	Although reference to this pain and the difficulty in its management has been made in several reports in the literature , there has been no long-term study of the natural history of this pain and the effects of various attempts to mitigate it .
Method	This series reports on a long-term follow-up of 275 patients of which is 108 had evidence of avulsion lestions .
Method	Of these 108 , 98 suffered significant pain .
Result	There is a remarkably constant description of the pain and the various activities that may affect it .
Result	Drugs are of very limited use and the most valuable method of treatment found in this series was transcutaneous electrical stimulation -- although , only one-third responded dramatically to this treatment .
Result	The single most effective manoeuvre that reduces pain is absorption by the patient in work .
Result	There remains a significant number of young men with severe pain who may expect to suffer such pain indefinitely .
Result	There is urgent need for new methods to be developed to control this pain .

Background	Agmatine is an endogenous neuromodulator that , based on animal studies , has the potential for new drug development .
Background	As an endogenous aminoguanidine compound ( 1-amino-4-guanidinobutane ) , it is structurally unique compared with other monoamines .
Background	Agmatine was long thought to be synthesised only in lower life forms , until its biosynthetic pathway ( decarboxylation of arginine ) was described in the mammalian brain in 1994 .
Method	Human arginine decarboxylase has been cloned and shown to have 48 % identity to ornithine decarboxylase .
Method	In neurons of the brain and spinal cord , agmatine is packaged into synaptic vesicles and released upon neuronal depolarisation .
Background	Initially , agmatine was conceptualised as an endogenous clonidine-displacing
Background	In addition to activity at these receptors , agmatine irreversibly inhibits neuronal nitric oxide synthase and downregulates inducible nitric oxide synthase.Endogenous agmatine is induced in response to stress and/or inflammation .
Background	Stressful conditions that induce agmatine include hypoxic-ischaemia and cold-restraint stress of ulcerogenic proportion .
Background	Induction of agmatine in the brain seems to occur in astrocytes , although neurons also synthesise agmatine .
Method	The effects of injected agmatine in animals include anticonvulsant - , antineurotoxic - and antidepressant-like actions .
Method	Intraperitoneal or intracerebroventricular injections of agmatine rapidly elicit antidepressant-like behavioural changes in the rodent forced swim test and tail suspension test .
Method	Intraperitoneal injections of agmatine into rats and mice also elicit acute anxiolytic-like behavioural changes in the elevated plus-maze stress test .
Result	In an animal model of acute stress disorder , intraperitoneal agmatine injections diminish contextual fear learning .
Result	Furthermore , intraperitoneal injections of agmatine reduce alcohol and opioid dependence by diminishing behaviour in a rat conditioned place preference paradigm.Based on these findings , agmatine appears to be an endogenous neuromodulator of mental stress .
Result	The possible roles and/or beneficial effects of agmatine in stress-related disorders , such as depression , anxiety and post-traumatic stress disorder , merit further investigation .

Background	Although there has been an increased interest in health care delivery for rural community populations , concerns remain regarding the lack of access to primary health care and specialty services ( such as palliative care ) , particularly in rural areas that a
Method	This survey was conducted to examine the perceptions of palliative care services in rural communities and toward identifying perceived barriers that interfere with accessing palliative care services .
Method	In conducting the study , personnel from various disciplines throughout the Community Cancer Care ( CCC ) network ( the largest private provider of oncology services in Indiana ) completed a survey that assessed their perceptions of the strengths and weaknesse
Result	These responses , which indicate discrepancies in perceptions among staff within sites , suggest problems of integration of palliative care in given locations .
Result	Results revealed three particularly problematic areas : accessing pain control , accessing psychological or psychiatric services or both , and overcoming barriers to hospice care .
Result	Although no significant differences were found for any variables between MU and adequately medically served ( AMS ) areas , in general palliative care is limited and unintegrated into oncology care .
Result	Confusion among staff at a particular oncology program likely contributes to the haphazard delivery and poor integration of palliative care .
Result	Conclusions are tempered by important study limitations but the results suggest the need for programs that improve delivery of palliative care in rural Indiana .

Background	Congestive heart failure ( CHF ) constitutes an important public health problem in Italy , evidenced by the high number of hospital admissions each year .
Background	Significant inter-hospital as well as interward differences in mortality rates for CHF patients that have been described may , in part , be explained by the differences in the severity of the illness of admitted patients .
Method	The goal of this study was to predict 30-day severity-adjusted mortality risk in patients with CHF admitted to wards of a teaching hospital in Siena , Italy , in 1997 .
Method	A 30-day mortality was determined by linking hospital discharge files with the Tuscany Mortality Registry database .
Method	The 3M all patient refined diagnosis related group ( APR-DRG ) software was used as a risk assessment method .
Result	The relationships between death and the following variables were studied by univariate analyses : APR-severity risk , APR-mortality risk , age , sex , length of stay and , discharge ward .
Result	Multivariate analysis was also performed to verify the associations between death and those parameters found to be significant by univariate analysis .
Result	Unadjusted mortality proportions ranged from 4.3 to 44.0 % .
Result	Logistic regression analysis demonstrated that APR-mortality risk , length of stay , and discharge ward were significantly and independently associated with 30-day mortality risk in patients with CHF .
Result	In summary , 30-day mortality risk varied significantly according to the ward of discharge in an Italian teaching hospital , even after adjustment for severity of illness .

Background	The purpose of this study was to assess grade , race , socioeconomic status and gender differences in perceptions of body size , weight concerns , and weight control practices between 4th and 7th grade students in South Carolina .
Method	Two random samples , consisting of a total of 1,597 children ( 53.1 % white , 51.97 % female , 44.9 % 4th graders ) participated in two questionnaire surveys .
Method	Both surveys included a series of seven female and seven male body size drawings , body image and weight concern questions , and questions pertaining to weight control practices .
Method	Responses to the questionnaire were analyzed using chi-square analysis and the General Linear Model .
Result	Using socioeconomic status ( SES ) , race , gender , and grade as independent variables , differences in ideal adult body size , opposite gender ideal adult body size , weight concerns , perceptions of family/peer weight concerns , perceptions of own body size and
Result	Analyses revealed that 4th grade males select a larger ideal adult body size and opposite gender ideal adult body size when compared to 7th grade males ( p < 0.0001 and p = 0.0078 , respectively ) .
Result	Fourth grade females indicated less personal concern about their weight than 7th grade females ( p = 0.0009 ) .
Result	Fourth graders also perceived less family/peer concern about weight than 7th graders ( p = 0.0027 ) and 7th graders described themselves as being more overweight than 4th graders ( p = 0.0039 ) .
Result	Blacks selected a significantly larger body size than white children for ideal adult ( p = 0.0287 ) and ideal opposite gender adult body size ( p < 0.0001 for males , p = 0.0030 for females ) .
Result	Blacks also perceived less personal and family/peer concern about weight when compared to whites ( p = 0.0083 ) .
Result	More whites reported that they were trying to lose weight , as compared to blacks ( p = 0.0010 ) .
Result	Males also selected significantly larger body size silhouettes than females for ideal adult body size ( p = 0.0012 ) .
Result	Males expressed less personal concern about weight ( p < 0.0001 ) , perceived less family/peer concern about weight ( p < 0.0001 ) , and were less likely than females to be engaged in weight loss ( p < 0.0001 ) .
Result	Females in the high SES category selected a significantly smaller ideal male adult body size than females in the low SES group ( p = 0.0124 ) and more females in the high SES category were trying to lose weight when compared to females in the low SES group
Result	This study indicates that early in a child 's sociocultural development , grade level , gender , race , and SES are influential in the perception of ideal adult body size and opposite gender ideal adult body size .
Result	These factors are also influential in determining concerns about weight and weight control practices .
Result	The findings of this study support the need to begin health and wellness education efforts early in childhood while taking into account racial , gender , age , and SES disparities .
Result	This knowledge can also be useful in targeting interventions for both obesity and eating disorders .

Background	Overall , this study demonstrates significant deficiencies in end-of-life care content in nursing textbooks .
Background	Defining palliative care , quality of life at the end of life , and issues of policy , ethics , and law are the foundation of end-of-life care .
Background	Analysis of these topics revealed a need to clarify concepts and to apply them within the context of end-of-life care .
Background	The analysis also demonstrated a need to transfer findings from palliative care research and concepts from hospice into basic education .
Background	In March 1999 the investigators convened a conference in New York in collaboration with a group of medical investigators analyzing EOL content in medical textbooks .
Background	The conference was also attended by publishers , editors , and authors of textbooks .
Background	The investigators were very encouraged by their interest in and commitment to correcting any weaknesses in their books .
Background	The investigators provided them with specific recommendations for improvement and resources for locating both appropriate content and authors with palliative care expertise .
Background	coh.org ) .
Background	Achieving the overall project goal of strengthened nursing education in end-of-life care will be reached through a variety of measures .
Background	Improving textbooks is but one important step .
Background	The various disciplines involved in palliative care can contribute to this project by working in collaboration with textbook publishers .

Background	There are 3 450 new cases of colorectal cancer in Norway annually .
Background	In half of the patients , metastatic disease will evolve with time .
Background	Palliative chemo - or radiotherapy can prolong disease - and symptom control when cure is not feasible .
Method	This paper is based on publications retrieved from a PubMed search , the authors ' knowledge of the field and on recent conference abstracts .
Result	Patients with metastatic colorectal cancer should initially be considered for surgery , and judged if secondary surgery is a possibility .
Result	Palliative chemotherapy is used to increase survival and maintain quality of life .
Result	5-FU/calsiumfolinat combined with oxaliplatin or irinotecan is usually given as first line treatment for patients below 75 years -- and most of them respond .
Result	Median survival is close to two years .
Result	Bevacizumab combined with an irinotecan regimen is an alternative first line treatment .
Result	Elderly patients are judged on an individual basis .
Result	Half of the patients will receive second line therapy with the alternative chemotherapy schedule .
Result	Cetuximab combined with irinotecan is a possible third line treatment .
Result	Palliative radiotherapy is most often used for inoperable rectal cancer , local recurrences , and bone or brain metastases .

Background	Public interest in the health benefits of seafood lipids , or of fish oils , is a most unusual phenomenon because for once the recommendations of health authorities to `` eat more fish '' are in accord with newer and popular attitudes .
Background	Media exploitation of the more sensational health aspects is also generally in favor of more consumption of seafood .
Background	The public is however still confused by the multitude of species of fish and shellfish available , and in a quandary over whether fatty fish are risky in terms of calories or cholesterol , or of more benefit than lean fish in terms of omega-3 fatty acids .
Background	Most direct questions on how much omega-3 fatty acids are useful in the diet of an average individual may never be answerable until long term studies with humans are carried out .
Background	It does appear that marine fish can be broken down into four convenient categories : lean ( including shellfish ) , low fat , medium fat and high fat ; and in this review it is suggested that these could contribute , per 100 grams , respectively about 250 , 750 , 1
Background	This intake can compare favorably with the alternative of commonly available fish oil capsules .
Result	Moreover this survey shows that at present the composite of total omega-3 fatty acids in fish and shellfish may contain roughly equal proportions of the functionally effective eicosapentaenoic acid , and of docosahexaenoic acid with its as yet unknown long

Background	An adolescent 15-yr-old male competitive gymnast presented to a university-based multidisciplinary spine institute with a persistent low-back pain for 18 mos .
Background	Although the results of x-rays were negative , his pain rendered him unable to compete in his sport any longer .
Background	A computed tomography scan was performed , which showed a bilateral pars fracture at L5 , without spondylolisthesis .
Background	A nuclear medicine bone scan revealed negative findings , confirming chronic nonunion .
Background	The patient completed a 4-wk course of physical therapy 6 mos before our intervention , without any relief of pain or radiologic evidence of healing .
Method	The patient was treated with a bone stimulator for 4 hrs/day and was recommended to wear a warm-and-form-type brace .
Method	Isometric core trunk exercises were also initiated .
Result	Only after 6 wks of treatment , the subject showed clinical improvement at the follow-up visit .
Result	Computed tomography scan performed 12 wks after the initial scan showed complete union of the fracture correlating with clinical improvement .
Result	Two years later , the athlete remains completely pain-free , is training regularly , and is able to compete on a national and , possibly , international level .

Background	Five patients ( 4 women ) with Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) and primary major psychiatric disorder ( PMPD ) meeting DSM-IV criteria for the diagnosis of bipolar affective disorder ( BAD ) were studied .
Method	Four patients had early onset PD .
Result	Four developed a severe psychiatric disorder a few years after starting dopaminergic therapy in presence of a mild motor disability and a mild cognitive impairment , with no evidence of cerebral atrophy at CT or MRI .
Result	Two patients developed a clear manic episode ; the other three presented a severe depressive episode ( in one case featuring a Cotard syndrome ) .
Result	None showed previous signs of long term L-dopa treatment syndrome ( LTS ) , hallucinosis or other minor psychiatric disorders .
Result	The two manic episodes occurred shortly after an increase of dopaminergic therapy and in one case rapid cyclic mood fluctuations were observed .
Result	At the onset of psychiatric symptoms , all patients had an unspecific diagnosis of chronic delusional hallucinatory psychosis ( CDHP ) .

Background	The aim of the study was to achieve earlier diagnosis of malignant cord compression ( MCC ) using urgent magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) for selected patients .
Method	A comparison was carried out of the current prospective audit of 100 patients referred by a general practitioner or a consultant over 32 months with both a previous national Clinical Research and Audit Group ( CRAG ) prospective audit ( 324 cases of MCC ) and
Method	A telephone hotline rapid-referral process for patients with known malignancy and new symptoms ( severe nerve root pain + / - severe back pain ) was designed .
Method	Patients were considered for urgent MRI after discussion with a senior clinician responsible for the hotline .
Method	Appropriate referrals were discussed with radiology and oncology ensuring timely MRI reporting and intervention .
Method	The main outcome measures are as follows time from referral to diagnosis ; time from the onset of symptoms to diagnosis ; and mobility at diagnosis .
Result	A total of 50 patients ( 52 % ) of those scanned had either MCC ( 44 ) or malignant nerve root compression ( 6 ) compared with the earlier rate of 23 out of 104 patients ( 22 % ) .
Result	Ten out of 44 MCC patients ( 23 % ) were paralysed at diagnosis , compared with 149 out of 324 ( 46 % ) in the CRAG audit .
Result	Time from reporting pain to diagnosis was 32 days compared with 89 days in the CRAG audit .
Result	Median time from referral to diagnosis was 1 day , again considerably shorter than the CRAG audit time of 15 days ( interquartile ( IQ ) range : 3-66 ) .
Result	In patients at risk of MCC , fast-track referral with rapid access to MRI reduces time between symptom onset and diagnosis , improves mobility at diagnosis and reduces the number of negative MRI scans .

Background	Many treatments are available for whiplash-patients , but to date , no evidence exists for their effectiveness .
Method	The objective of this systematic review was to assess the efficacy of conservative treatment in patients with whiplash-injuries ( rated as Whiplash-Associated Disorders [ WAD ] I or II ) .
Method	A computerized literature search of Medline , Embase , Cinahl , Psychlit and the Cochrane Controlled Trial Register through June 1998 was carried out .
Method	We also screened reference lists of publications of identified randomized trials and relevant systematic reviews .
Method	Studies were selected for inclusion if they fit the following criteria design was a ( randomized ) clinical trial ( RCT ) ; all patients had suffered a whiplash-injury ; the type of intervention was a conservative one ; pain , global perceived effect , or participation in daily activities was used as one of the outcome measures ; and the publication was written in English , French , German or Dutch .
Method	The methodological quality of the studies was independently assessed by two reviewers using the Maastricht-Amsterdam list .
Method	Three quality scores were calculated using this criteria list the Overall methodological Quality Score , the Internal Validity Score and the Delphi Quality Score .
Method	The conclusion of the review was based on articles that scored a quality score of at least 50 percent of the maximum available score on two out of three quality scores .
Method	Eleven studies met the inclusion criteria .
Result	A broad variety of conservative interventions were evaluated , and only one study was performed in chronic whiplash patients .
Result	Only three studies satisfied at least 50 percent on two out of three quality scores indicating poor overall methodological quality .
Result	A high rank correlation was observed among the three methods of quality .
Result	Because of the heterogeneity of patient selection , interventions and outcome measures , no statistical pooling was performed .
Result	This review indicates that active treatments show a beneficial effect on at least one of the primary outcome measures , preferably pain .
Result	In other words , rest and immobilization using collars are not recommended for the treatment of whiplash , while active interventions , such as advice to ` maintain usual activities ' might be effective in whiplash
Result	Nevertheless , caution is needed when attempting to draw conclusions regarding the efficacy of conservative treatments in whiplash-patients , because of the paucity of high-quality studies .
Result	No conclusions can be drawn about the most effective therapy for chronic whiplash-patients because only one low quality trial was identified .

Background	Active infection with herpes zoster may cause acute urinary retention , especially when it involves sacral dermatomes .
Background	Although frank retention usually develops days to weeks after eruption of the typical rash , bladder incompetence infrequently develops first , raising concern over other , more ominous etiologies .
Background	In the case presented , rash appearance was delayed until six weeks after the initial onset of urinary retention , a much longer interval than previously reported .
Result	Occult herpes zoster infection should be considered in patients presenting with an acute neurogenic bladder of obscure cause .

Background	The new non-benzodiazepine hypnotic , zopiclone , was investigated as a preanaesthetic medication in a randomized , double-blind , placebo-controlled study in healthy patients scheduled for minor gynaecological surgery .
Background	Initially a dose-finding study was conducted in which zopiclone 3.75 mg , 7.5 , and 11.25 mg was compared with diazepam 10 mg and placebo ; 7.5 mg was established as the optimum dose of zopiclone .
Result	In the main study zopiclone 7.5 mg was comparable to diazepam 10 mg at 20 , 40 , and 60 min after administration and more efficacious at 90 min .

Background	Vertebral compression fractures ( VCFs ) result in severe and disabling pain , diminished quality of life , and substantial medical costs .
Background	There exists no standard instrument with which to measure pain and functional status before and after treatment of VCFs .
Method	A questionnaire was specifically developed to assess pain and disability in patients with VCFs before and after undergoing percutaneous polymethylmethacrylate-augmented vertebroplasty .
Method	The first section of the baseline questionnaire ( before treatment ) contains 11 items that address the patient 's previous and current levels of back pain and distress .
Method	The follow-up questionnaire ( after treatment ) is similar in format .
Result	Among 72 vertebroplasty-treated patients , the internal consistency reliability of the 24 ADLs ranged from 0.87 to 0.98 , with similar results observed before and after treatment .
Result	Correlations of 0.29 to 0.72 were observed among the 24 ADLs and the internal measures of pain and distress measured on both visual analog and adjectival scales .
Result	Similar correlations ( range 0.35-0 .63 ) were observed between the questionnaire and 10 dimensions of the Oswestry Disability Index 's low-back pain questionnaire , an external instrument used to assess criterion-referenced validity .
Result	Evidence in support of the validity of the questionnaire was present before and after treatment .
Result	The Vertebral Compression Fracture Pain and Functional Disability Questionnaire appears to be a reliable and valid instrument for assessing back pain and functional ability in patients before and after treatment for VCFs .

Result	We have described motor control in people with different degrees of SCI by using surface polyelectromyographic recordings during single - and multijoint volitional motor tasks .
Result	We have shown that neurobiologic conditions of the injured spinal cord can be expressed in two main categories : `` new anatomy '' and `` reduced anatomy '' .
Result	The evidence for a variety of definite features of motor control elicited by volitional effort for the performance of a present or even clinically absent motor task suggests that we can benefit from animal experimental neurobiologic studies while we are p
Result	Reports on the successfully enhanced regenerating capabilities of the axons and improved connectivity within neuronal circuits after SCI encourage us to intensify our efforts in parallel with studies on the recovery processes found in experimentally induc

Result	Major themes identified for future research include the following : ( 1 ) Rigorous research protocols for fatty acid ( FA ) studies should be established to overcome errors introduced by small differences in chain length and degree of unsaturation .
Method	( 2 )
Result	Using cellular integration models consisting of endothelial cells , astrocytes , and neurons , investigation of functional lipidomics , cell-specific signaling by lipids , and nutritional considerations should be undertaken .
Method	( 3 )
Result	Educational programs should be undertaken for women of childbearing age on the health benefits of omega3 long chain ( LC ) polyunsaturated fatty acids ( PUFA ) from fish consumption vs risks of mercury in fish .
Method	( 4 )

Method	( 11 )

Method	( 12 )
Result	The relationship between LC-PUFA , stroke , and AD should be clarified , and neurogenetic metabolic diseases that could benefit from supplementation with omega3 LC-PUFA such as DHA should be identified .

Background	Clearly , changes in skeletal bone mass are one of the major issues of potential clinical concern in the health care of the thin premenopausal woman .
Background	Each of the three parameters of skeletal mass -- 1 ) initial pubertal growth , 2 ) rate of bone loss , and 3 ) superimposed estrogen-deficient osteoporosis -- may be negatively influenced by syndromes associated with low body weight and weight loss .
Background	Inherent in constitutional thinness and nutritional patterns of thin women are alterations in bone growth and rates of bone loss which may predispose to osteopenia and fracture in later adulthood .
Background	When these negative factors are compounded by hypothalamic/pituitary-mediated hypoestrogenism , decreased initial bone mass and true osteoporosis may result .
Background	We now possess excellent radiographic tools for monitoring bone mass but do not have the capability to predict fracture or diagnose osteoporosis .
Background	Urgently needed are longitudinal prospective studies of the dynamics of both trabecular and cortical bone growth and epidemiologic correlation as to the clinical impact ( fractures ) of decreased BMD in thin women .
Background	For the present , a physiologically oriented program directed toward prophylaxis -- maximizing initial bone mass , decreasing rates of adult bone loss , and minimizing active osteoporosis -- embracing early dietary calcium supplementation and hormonal therapy on
Background	Indeed , this bodily `` disease '' of osteopenia may not be a pathologic process of bone metabolism at all , but truly an `` ailment of the spiritual part '' -- secondary manifestations of sociologic and endocrinologic alterations inherent in the

Background	Proteomic technologies offer a high-throughput analysis of the expression of proteins in biological samples .
Background	The global analysis of the proteins in peritoneal dialysis ( PD ) fluid will provide a better understanding of the biological processes of the peritoneal membrane .
Method	The dialysate of nine paediatric PD patients was collected from peritoneal equilibrium tests with 3.86 % glucose .
Method	Proteins were separated on a 10 % SDS-PAGE gel and in-gel digested with trypsin .
Method	Peptide mixtures were analysed using nanoLC-MS/MS and results were searched against the NCBI database .
Result	A total number of 189 proteins were identified in the PD fluid of nine patients , with 88 proteins shared by all patients .
Result	These 88 proteins accounted for 47 % of the identified proteins and > 90 % of the total protein content in the analysed samples .
Result	Proteins were subdivided into eight different classes according to function .
Result	This study gives a representative overview of the proteins present in PD fluid .
Result	The proteins in PD fluid reflect plasma proteins as well as local peritoneal processes .
Result	Potentially interesting proteins are revealed .

Background	Acute or chronic neck pain can arise from degenerative processes , musculoskeletal trauma , or structural changes .
Background	For all patients presenting with neck pain , determining the presence of radiculopathy or myelopathy is an important step in initial assessment .
Background	Depending on the duration of pain , the work-up should include appropriate use of traditional and advanced imaging studies .
Background	For cases that do not suggest traumatic , structural , or rheumatologic origins , alternate considerations should include stress , depression , and -- because of its increased incidence in older persons -- cancer .
Background	Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory agents , mild oral analgesics , and short-term corticosteroid therapy are the mainstays of treatment , although physical therapy and traction can be helpful for some patients .
Background	The presence of a herniated disk , cord compression ( severe stenosis ) , tumor , or other structural lesion may require surgical decompression .

Background	There is increasing realization among health care administrative decision makers and service providers that we must measure the true value of expensive services by demonstrating the achievement of identified goals .
