Method	The objective of this study was to determine whether clients who received the home-based intervention for a hip arthroplasty would result in a more timely discharge home from hospital .
Method	Two hundred and eight clients receiving a total hip replacement at two acute care hospitals comprised the sample .
Method	One hospital included the more costly home-based pre-operative teaching by an occupational therapist as part of its protocol while the other provided comparative occupational therapy intervention within its hospital based pre-admission clinic .
Method	Discharge disposition and length of hospital stay were measured .
Method	Though no significant difference in either of these outcomes was found , a number of issues were raised indicating the complexity of resource allocation to this client population and the importance of the qualitative dimensions of care .
Result	The location for pre-operative teaching for total hip replacements was not found to impact the length of hospital stay nor whether clients are discharged directly home .

Method	STUDY DESIGN : Case report .
Background	To report a novel management strategy for neuropathic pain management after spinal cord injury .
Method	Outpatient spinal cord injury ( SCI ) clinic .
Method	The patient demonstrated two neuropathic pain syndromes , namely at - and below-level pain .
Method	These syndromes were recalcitrant to conservative measures and a decision was made to proceed with intrathecal therapies .
Result	The patient 's at-level pain was responsive to intrathecal hydromorphone but the below-level pain was unaffected by this intervention .
Result	Intrathecal ziconotide provided an opposite response with a positive effect observed on the below-level pain and minimal effect on the at-level pain .
Result	The combination of intrathecal ziconotide and hydromorphone provided effective relief for both components of the patient 's SCI associated neuropathic pain .
Result	The combination of intrathecal ziconotide and hydromorphone has the potential to provide significant pain relief for patients with neuropathic pain associated with spinal cord injury .

Background	Lung transplantation has emerged as an option to prolong and increase the quality of life in patients with end-stage pulmonary lung disease .
Background	In lung transplant recipients , because of the high potential for acute and chronic allograft rejection , optimal selection , dosage and delivery of immunosuppressive medications is critical .
Background	Cystic fibrosis ( CF ) , a multi-organ system disease that often includes pulmonary and gastrointestinal manifestations , represents the leading indication for bilateral lung transplantation .
Background	The gastrointestinal manifestations of CF , however , confound post-transplant management by causing significant variation in the rate and extent of absorption of orally administered immunosuppressive medications .
Background	Tacrolimus , a new calcineurin inhibitor , is increasingly employed as the primary immunosuppressive agent in lung transplant recipients .
Background	Unfortunately , tacrolimus itself exhibits variable bioavailability , particularly in CF transplant recipients .
Background	A novel approach to the absorption dilemma is administration of tacrolimus via the sublingual ( SL ) route .
Background	Little published information exists concerning the use of SL immunosuppression in transplant recipients .
Background	However , emerging evidence suggests that SL tacrolimus provides is an effective means of drug delivery particularly for CF lung transplant recipients .
Result	Preliminary results from a pilot study , demonstrate that SL delivery of tacrolimus achieves therapeutic serum levels , in lung transplant recipients with CF , over the first few postoperative months .
Result	In addition , the early postoperative use of SL tacrolimus has been associated with acceptable rates of transplant rejection and normal renal function in a cohort of 22 lung transplant recipients that included CF and non-CF transplant recipients .
Result	Potential pharmacokinetic advantages of the SL route of delivery include good permeability , rapid absorption , acceptable bioavailability and easy accessibility .
Result	From an economic standpoint , considerable cost savings could be achieved by using the SL rather than the intravenous route of drug delivery for tacrolimus .
Result	Comparative , prospective randomized trials are necessary to evaluate the long-term safety and efficacy of SL tacrolimus in lung transplant patients .
Result	Until such data are available , the use of SL tacrolimus should be considered in situations where alternative routes of delivery are unavailable or as part of ongoing research studies .
Result	Ultimately , SL tacrolimus may prove efficacious for short-term use in the early postoperative lung transplant recipients , particularly in patients with malabsorption problems such as CF transplant recipients .

Background	CF is a kind of diterpenoid which was first isolated and purified from Chinese tropical plants by our laboratory .
Background	Our previous works have demonstrated it could inhibit the proliferation of several malignant tumor cell lines and stimulate them to differentiate to normal cells .
Background	In this article we investigated the effect of CF on human hepatocellulor carcinoma HepG2 cell viability , differentiation , cell cycle distribution and G1 cell cycle related genes expression .
Background	We also detected the effect of retinoic acid ( RA ) which was used as positive control and the effect of combination CF+RA .
Result	Our data suggested that CF could be useful to induce growth arrest and differentiation in HepG2 cell lines , and could reverse the transformed phenotype .
Result	This anti-tumor effect was due to G1 arrest in cell cycle which was associated with an increase of p27 ( Kip1 ) and a decrease of cyclin D1 expression , so CF might be a useful targeted therapy strategy for HCC .
Result	Results also showed RA has a different mechanism from CF on G1 arrest , and CF has not synergistic anti-tumor effect with RA on HepG2 treatment .

Background	The aim of this study was to see whether results of anterior interbody lumbar fusion could be improved with the help of an external transpedicular device .
Method	Anterior interbody lumbar fusion was carried out in 83 patients , using the technique described by Suzuki .
Method	Fifty-six ( 67 % ) patients were fused with the Magerl-Schläpfer external fixator device as a posterior support .
Method	Twenty-seven patients had interbody fusion and a conventional plastic brace for support .
Method	The clinical and radiological results of anterior interbody lumbar fusion were compared between these groups .
Method	The mean follow-up time was 5 ( range , 2-10 ) years .
Method	A total of 128 levels were fused .
Method	There were no statistical differences in the clinical and radiological results between patients fused with or without the external fixator .
Result	There were many complications associated with the use of an external fixator device .
Result	We do not recommend the use of an external fixator in anterior interbody lumbar fusion .

Background	BioMarine 570 is well tolerated agent supporting the innate immunity .
Background	It was isolated from Greenland shark liver .
Method	To evaluate the effect of BioMarine .
Method	The 10 healthy , randomly chosen volunteers are included to the protocol .
Method	Volunteers are given 9 capsules of BioMarine a day for 30 days .
Method	The clinical and laboratory parameters were analyzed before and after the treatment .
Method	The following innate immunity parameters were analyzed C1q , C3 C4 and CH50 of complement level , CD4/CD8 ratio , Th1/Th2 cytokine polarization , reactive oxygen intermediates production ( ROI ) .
Result	Clinically no side effects were noted .
Result	BioMarine intake has increased the C1q level , increase CD4/CD8 ratio from 1.3 to 1.8 and polarized Th1/Th2 lymphocyte cytokine secretion towards Th1 .
Result	The modulation of ROI production by neutrophils was also noted .
Result	BioMarine has no affect on CD4 + CD25 + regulatory lymphocytes .
Result	Concluding BioMarine is save , effective and innate immunity supporting agent , can be effectively applied in people with disturbed immune system as harmless and effective agent normalizing the immune imbalance .

Background	A study was undertaken of 46 patients ( 19 cervical and 27 lumbar ) admitted to an inpatient rehabilitation unit following surgical decompression for myelopathy or cauda equina syndrome resulting from spinal stenosis ( SS ) .
Background	Individuals with SS represented 16 percent of all spinal cord injury ( SCI ) admissions .
Result	When compared to patients with traumatic SCI , patients with SS were significantly ( t-test , p < .01 ) older ( mean age 68 versus 39 years ) , more frequently retired/unemployed ( 89 percent versus 43 percent ) , more often married ( 57 percent versus 36 percent
Result	Significant ( p < .01 ) Functional Independence Measurement ( FIM ) changes for the SS patients were noted after rehabilitation in the categories of self-care , sphincter control and mobility/locomotion .
Result	Additionally , outcome comparisons with a group of traumatic SCI patients who had similar motor function revealed similar lengths of stay , discharge FIM scores and discharge-to-community rates .
Result	This study suggests that individuals with weakness secondary to SS represent a significant proportion of individuals with SCI , make significant functional gains following inpatient rehabilitation and can achieve functional outcomes similar to those of tra

Method	Using chart-review procedures , the authors examined the management of patients with a recognized alcohol problem in 12 medical facilities and 20 alcoholism programs throughout Alaska .
Background	The evaluation , which covered a one-year period , focused on the service delivery system rather than on treatment outcome , and sought to determine if problems of alcohol abuse were being solved .
Result	The authors found that a treatment plan was developed , followed up , and evaluated for 8 per cent of the problem drinkers treated in medical facilities and for 16.7 per cent of those in alcohol programs .

Background	Patients with severe decompensated congestive heart failure ( CHF ) commonly exhibit acid-base and electrolyte disturbances mainly due to the activation of several neurohumoral mechanisms as well as to drugs regularly used in this population .
Background	Magnesium deficit is not infrequently observed in CHF patients but its pathophysiology remains less well-studied as compared with other electrolyte alterations , such as hypokalemia .
Background	However , there is evidence that early detection and correction of magnesium abnormalities could obviate potentially deleterious arrhythmogenic effects .
Method	To assess the incidence of magnesium level disorders and analyze the underlying pathophysiological mechanisms in patients with CHF .
Method	Eighty-six consecutive CHF patients ( NYHA class III or IV ) admitted to our hospital over a period of 5 years were studied .
Method	Patients with diabetes mellitus , liver or renal failure , and chronic obstructive lung disease were excluded .
Method	All patients received conventional treatment with digoxin , diuretic agents and an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor .
Method	On admission , blood and urine electrolytes and renal function parameters were determined .
Method	Arterial blood gases and serum anion gap determinations were also performed .
Result	Hypomagnesemia was found in 15 [ n = 15 ( 17.4 % ) ] CHF patients .
Result	The majority of these patients also exhibited other electrolyte abnormalities , such as hypokalemia , hypocalcemia and hypophosphatemia .
Result	Inappropriate magnesiuria ( fractional excretion of magnesium > 4 % ) was evident in eight hypomagnesemic patients .
Result	A variety of associated conditions , including poor dietary intake , also favored magnesium depletion .
Result	Magnesium deficit is a common electrolyte disorder in CHF ( NYHA class III/IV ) patients and several interrelated mechanisms are implicated in its pathogenesis .
Result	Clinicians ' awareness of the incidence of hypomagnesemia in this population as well as its related pathophysiology could be useful for the early detection and appropriate treatment to inhibit its arrhythmogenic potential .

Background	To determine whether persistent metabolic dysfunction in normal-appearing frontal lobe tissue is correlated with long-term tissue atrophy .
Method	Prospective monitoring with retrospective data analysis .
Method	Single-center academic neurointensive care unit .
Method	Fifteen patients with moderate to severe traumatic brain injury ( Glasgow Coma Scale score 3-12 ) .
Method	None .
Method	Hourly cerebral microdialysis was performed for the initial 96 hrs after trauma to determine extracellular levels of glucose , glutamate , glycerol , lactate , and pyruvate in normal appearing frontal lobes .
Result	Six months after injury , the anatomical outcome was assessed by measures of global and regional cerebral atrophy using volumetric brain magnetic resonance imaging .
Result	The lactate/pyruvate ratio was elevated > 40 after traumatic brain injury in most patients , with a mean percent time of 32 + / - 29 % of hours monitored .
Result	At 6 months after traumatic brain injury , there was a mean frontal lobe atrophy of 12 + / - 11 % and global brain atrophy of 8.5 + / - 4.5 % .
Result	The percentage of time of elevated lactate/pyruvate ratio correlated with the extent of frontal lobe brain atrophy ( r = -.56 , p < 0.01 ) , but not global brain atrophy ( r = -.31 , p = 0.20 ) .
Result	The predictive effect of lactate/pyruvate ratio was independent of patient age , Glasgow Coma Scale score , and volume of frontal lobe contusion .
Result	Persistent metabolic crisis , as reflected by an elevated lactate/pyruvate ratio , in normal appearing posttraumatic frontal lobe , is predictive of the degree of tissue atrophy at 6 months .

Method	We examined the relationship between daytime symptoms and respiratory disturbance indices during sleep in 60 patients with sleep apnea syndrome who had an apnea index of more than 5/hr for at least one night .
Result	Daytime hypersomnolence , morning headache , and a history of traffic accidents did not correlated strongly with apnea index or with nocturnal desaturation .
Result	The same was true of daytime blood pressure and nocturnal micturition .
Result	Both hemoglobin concentration and the mean pulmonary arterial pressure in the daytime correlated significantly with indices of nocturnal desaturation and not with apnea index , but this might reflect the positive correlation between those variables and the
Result	These data suggest that diagnostic criteria should not be based on apnea index or desaturation alone .
Result	Long-term follow-up data on Japanese patients is needed to establish more rational diagnostic criteria and stage classification for sleep apnea syndrome .

Background	This report by The Swedish Council on Technology Assessment in Health Care ( SBU ) reviews , classifies , and grades the scientific literature on cancer chemotherapy in some major tumour types , describes the practice of chemotherapy in Sweden , compares practi
Background	The report is intended primarily for decision-makers at various levels , both practitioners and administrators .
Background	It is also of interest for the medical profession .
Method	The extensive body of scientific literature was reviewed according to strict criteria that reflected the scientific weight of the literature .
Method	Sixteen experts representing different disciplines ( oncology , surgery , internal medicine , health economy and quality of life research ) participated in the literature review .
Method	Each section was discussed within the project group and was reviewed by at least one , but usually two international researchers .
Method	Additional input was provided by national experts representing different scientific disciplines .
Method	For the final evaluation to be as close to the objective truth as possible , a concerted effort was made to guarantee objectivity and thorough assessment of current knowledge about the effects of chemotherapy on the selected cancers .
Method	The tumour types selected for this assessment include firstly those types where three investigations had shown an increased use of chemotherapy in Sweden during the latest decade .
Method	These were non-small cell lung cancer ( NSCLC ) , gastric cancer , pancreatic cancer , colorectal cancer and urinary bladder cancer .
Method	Secondly , the two tumour types comprising the greatest number of patients treated with chemotherapy in Sweden , breast cancer and haematological malignancies , were included .
Method	Among the haematological malignancies , the most prevalent ones , acute myeloid leukaemia ( AML ) , chronic lymphocytic leukaemia ( CLL ) , Hodgkin 's disease ( HD ) , aggressive non-Hodgkin 's lymphoma ( NHL ) of the large B-cell type and indolent NHL of follicular type were evaluated .
Method	These constitute about 75 % , of all haematological malignancies .
Method	Thirdly , ovarian cancer was included since chemotherapy has been extensively used and since , at the time of the planning of this overview , a group of very expensive drugs , the taxanes , had preliminarily shown promising results .
Method	A wealth of scientific literature has been published on cancer therapy .
Method	The review presented in this report is limited to scientific studies judged to be important for evaluating chemotherapy efficacy .
Method	Assessments of the content and quality of these studies , and a critical summary of the results in all stages of the selected tumours , have never before been attempted in this way .
Method	However , similar comprehensive overviews of certain stages of the tumours have previously been made .
Method	These overviews were also critically evaluated .
Method	Totally 1,496 studies involving 558,743 patients were reviewed .
Method	The survey of practice of chemotherapy use involved all departments of surgery , urology , gynaecology , internal medicine including haematologic units , pulmonary medicine and general and gynaecologic oncology at 16 hospitals in two health care regions in Sw
Method	During the 4 weeks of the survey , all patients with the diagnoses concerned who received chemotherapy were registered .
Method	The study included 1,590 patients .
Method	The working group 's general conclusions are summarised in the following points
Result	The literature on the effects of chemotherapy is extensive .
Result	Chemotherapy has a well-documented role in the curative and palliative treatment of patients with several types of cancer .
Method	The use of chemotherapy is of utmost importance for the possibility of cure in certain tumour types .
Result	In other tumours , chemotherapy increases the possibility of cure when added to local and regional treatments , particularly surgery .
Result	In the instances of no possibility of cure , chemotherapy may to a variable extent improve both patient survival and well-being .
Result	In Sweden chemotherapy is largely used in accordance with that documented in the scientific literature .
Result	The extent of both over - and under-treatment seems to be limited but can not be excluded at the individual patient level .
Result	The literature-based knowledge is scientifically of lower quality in the most chemotherapy sensitive tumours than in tumours showing more limited sensitivity .
Result	In the more sensitive tumours , positive effects on a symptomatic stage and survival were seen several decades ago .
Result	In those days , clinical treatment studies did not fulfil the current high quality requirements .
Result	Small life-prolonging effects of chemotherapy are sometimes very well documented in large , high quality scientific studies .

Background	Bioethics , and indeed much ethical writing generally , makes its point through narratives .
Background	The religious parable no less than the medical teaching case uses a simple story to describe appropriate action or the application of a critical principle .
Background	While powerful , the telling story has limits .
Method	In this paper the authors describe a simple teaching case on `` end-of-life '' decision making that was ill received by its audience .
Background	The authors ill-received example , involving the disconnection of ventilation in a patient with ALS ( Lou Gherig 's Disease ) was critiqued by audience members with long-term experience as ventilation users .
Method	In this case , the supposedly simple narrative of the presenters conflicted with the life histories of the audience .
Result	The lessons of this story , and the conflict that resulted , speak critically to the limits of simple teaching cases as well as the strengths of narrative analysis as a tool for the exploration of bioethical case histories.analytical approachbioethics and p

Background	Vertebral compression fractures ( VCFs ) may be defined radiographically or as a clinical event .
Background	The prevalence of these fractures in women aged 50 and over has been estimated at 26 % when defined as a reduction in vertebral height greater than 15 % .
Background	Retrospective reviews of case records have shown a clinical detection rate of VCF in white women of 153/100 ,000 person years .
Background	Of these clinically detected VCFs , 84 % were associated with pain .
Background	VCF may be defined as a clinical event characterised by loss of height and acute pain .
Background	The pain of acute fracture usually lasts 4 to 6 weeks with intense pain at the site of fracture .
Background	Chronic pain may also occur in patients with multiple compression fractures , height loss and low bone density but is probably due to structural changes or osteoarthritis .
Background	Radiographic VCF may not be symptomatic .
Background	The greater the deformity , the greater the likelihood of pain and disability .
Background	As height is lost , patients experience discomfort from the rib cage pressing downward on the pelvis .
Background	Patients develop a thoracic kyphosis , a lumbar lordosis , and a protuberant abdomen with prominent horizontal skinfold creases .
Background	The reduced thoracic space may result in decreased exercise tolerance and reduced abdominal space may give rise to early satiety and weight loss .
Background	Sleep disorders may also occur .
Background	Patients lose self esteem .
Background	Self care may become difficult .
Background	They are often depressed .
Background	They become fearful of further fracture .
Background	They have distorted body image and poor health perception .
Background	Patients with one vertebral fracture are at increased risk of peripheral fracture and further vertebral fracture .
Background	( ABSTRACT TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS )

Background	Tizanidine hydrochloride , an alpha ( 2 ) - adrenergic receptor agonist , is a widely used medication for the treatment of muscle spasticity .
Background	Clinical studies have supported its use in the management of spasticity caused by multiple sclerosis ( MS ) , acquired brain injury or spinal cord injury .
Background	It has also been shown to be clinically effective in the management of pain syndromes , such as : myofascial pain , lower back pain and trigeminal neuralgia .
Method	This review summarizes the recent findings on the clinical application of tizanidine .
Method	Our objective was to review and summarize the medical literature regarding the evidence for the usefulness of tizanidine in the management of spasticity and in pain syndromes such as myofascial pain .
Method	We reviewed the current medical and pharmacology literature through various internet literature searches .
Method	This information was then synthesized and presented in paragraph and table form .
Result	Tizanidine hydrochloride is a very useful medication in patients suffering from spasticity caused by MS , acquired brain injury or spinal cord injury .
Result	It can also be helpful in patients suffering from chronic neck and/or lower back pain who have a myofascial component to their pain .
Result	Doses should be started at low dose and gradually titrated to effect .

Background	Substantial research shows less favorable body-image experiences among overweight and obese persons relative to persons of average weight .
Method	The purpose of this investigation of body image was to compare 102 enrollees in a commercial , very-low-calorie diet program to 258 age - and weight-matched control subjects .
Result	Whereas enrollees were more strongly invested in their physical appearance , they held a more disparaging view of their looks .
Result	Relative to the control group , enrollees also felt less healthy , yet their evaluation of and investment in their physical fitness were more positive .
Result	Obese persons constitute a heterogeneous population , and those who seek rapid and extensive weight loss in commercial programs may have special body-image concerns and needs .

Background	The 14th myelographically demonstrated case of lumbosacral nerve root avulsion is presented with a summary of the previously reported cases .
Background	In most cases lumbosacral nerve root avulsion is associated with pelvic fractures and sacroiliac dislocation , which cause a stretching force to be applied to the nerves of the lumbar and sacral plexuses , and in turn to the nerve roots intradurally .
Background	This force causes nerve root avulsion in the intradural course of the nerve root .
Background	The myelographic defect is a pseudomeningocele or diverticulum-like outpouching created by the tearing of the arachnoid covering of the nerve roots .
Background	Myelography clearly indicates nerve root avulsion and surgical exploration is not indicated .

Background	To detect breast cancer susceptibility gene ( BRCA1 ) mutation in ovarian cancer and to look for correlations between BRCA1 mutation and hereditary ovarian cancer .
Method	Mutation of BRCA1 gene in 4 patients with hereditary ovarian cancer and 31 patients with sporadic ovarian cancer were screened by polymerase chain reaction-single strand conformation polymorphism analysis with non-isotopic silver staining method .
Result	2 mutations of BRCA1 gene were found in 2 of 3 patients belonged to hereditary breast-ovarian cancer syndrom ( HBOC ) which were located in exon 2 and 21 respectively .
Result	No mutation was found in 31 cases of sporadic ovarian cancer and 1 case of hereditary site-specific ovarian cancer .
Result	BRCA1 mutation was probably closely related to hereditary breast-ovarian cancer syndrome .
Result	Detection of BRCA1 gene mutation was helpful to diagnose HBOC families .

Background	To compare the outcome of second and third cycles of in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer to the outcome of first attempts at IVF with blastocyst transfer .
Method	Retrospective study .
Method	Private ART center .
Method	Three hundred and four patients undergoing treatment with in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer , 87 of which underwent at least one cycle of re-treatment after failing to achieve pregnancy in their first cycle .
Method	Bipronucleate oocytes were grown for up to 144 hours and subsequently transferred when at least one embryo attained the expanded blastocyst stage .
Method	Pregnancy and implantation rates .
Result	Pregnancy rates per retrieval were significantly higher for patients undergoing their first cycle of in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer ( 36 % ) compared to those undergoing their second ( 19 % ) or their third ( 9 % ) cycles of treatment .
Result	Implantation rates per embryo were also higher for first cycles of in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer ( 30 % ) compared to second ( 18 % ) or third cycles ( 8 % ) .
Result	Pregnancy and implantation rates decline dramatically in repeated cycles of in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer following one or more unsuccessful cycles of in vitro fertilization with blastocyst transfer .

Background	Spontaneous cervicocephalic artery dissection ( sCAD ) of more than two cervical arteries is rare .
Method	Vascular and potential sCAD risk factors , triggering events , clinical and neuroimaging findings , and outcome of patients with multiple sCAD were studied .
Method	Patients were drawn from prospective hospital-based sCAD registries .
Method	Of 740 consecutive patients with sCAD , 11 ( 1.5 % ) had three , and one had four ( 0.1 % ) sCAD .
Method	Eight of these 12 patients were women .
Result	One patient had additional dissections of the celiac trunk and hepatic artery .
Result	Vascular risk factors included hypertension ( n = 1 ) , hypercholesterolaemia ( n = 6 ) , current smoking ( n = 5 ) and migraine ( n = 6 ) .
Result	No patient had a family history of sCAD , fibromuscular dysplasia ( FMD ) or connective tissue disease .
Result	SCAD was preceded by a minor trauma in five and infection in four patients .
Result	Clinical manifestations included ischaemic stroke ( n = 8 ) , transient ischaemic attack ( n = 3 ) , headache ( n = 9 ) , neck pain ( n = 4 ) , Horner syndrome ( n = 5 ) , pulsatile tinnitus ( n = 2 ) and dysgeusia ( n = 1 ) .
Result	Brain MRI revealed ischaemic infarcts that affected one vessel territory in seven and two territories in two patients .
Result	The 3-month outcome was favourable ( modified Rankin scale score 0-1 ) in 10 patients ( 83 % ) .
Result	No new recurrent stroke or sCAD occurred during a mean follow-up of 50 ( SD 29 ) months .
Method	Multiple sCAD occurred preferentially in women and caused clinical symptoms and signs mainly in one vascular territory .
Method	In none of the patients was FMD or any other underlying arteriopathy apparent .
Method	The majority of multiple sCAD was preceded by a minor trauma or infection .
Result	Clinical outcome was favourable in most patients , and long-term prognosis benign .
Result	The data suggest that transient vasculopathy may be a major mechanism for multiple sCAD .

Background	We report here the first direct functional evidence of an increase in the tonic activation of postsynaptic 5-HT1A receptors by antidepressant treatments .
Background	Because 5-HT1A receptor activation hyperpolarizes and inhibits CA3 pyramidal neurons in the dorsal hippocampus , we determined , using in vivo extracellular recording , whether the selective 5-HT1A receptor antagonist WAY 100635 could disinhibit these neuron
Result	Unexpectedly , no disinhibition could be detected in controls .
Result	However , after long-term treatment with the tricyclic antidepressant imipramine , the selective 5-HT reuptake inhibitor paroxetine , the reversible monoamine oxidase-A inhibitor befloxatone , the alpha2-adrenergic antagonist mirtazapine , or the 5-HT1A recept
Result	Such a disinhibition was absent in rats treated with the nonantidepressant drug chlorpromazine , in rats receiving only one ECS , or in rats receiving multiple ECSs in combination with an intrahippocampal pertussis toxin treatment to inactivate Gi/o-coupled
Result	These data indicate that such antidepressant treatments , acting on entirely different primary targets , might alleviate depression by enhancing the tonic activation of forebrain postsynaptic 5-HT1A receptors .

Background	Ovarian cancer is the fourth most common cancer in women in the Western world .
Method	In a pilot scale study , we highlight changes in the total serum glycome of patients with advanced ovarian cancer that might shed insight into disease pathogenesis .
Background	These changes include increases in levels of core fucosylated , agalactosyl biantennary glycans ( FA2 ) and sialyl Lewis x ( SLe ( x ) ) .
Method	To investigate further which proteins contribute to these alterations , we developed technology to analyze simultaneously the glycosylation of protein glycoforms contained in single spots excised from a 2D gel ( < 1 ng protein ) .
Result	The acute-phase proteins , haptoglobin , alpha1-acid glycoprotein , and alpha1-antichymotrypsin from patients contained elevated levels of subsets of glycoforms containing SLe ( x ) .
Result	We also established that IgG heavy chains from patients contained twice the level of FA2 compared with healthy controls .
Result	Serum CA125 is the only biomarker that is used routinely , and there is a need for complementary markers that will improve both sensitivity and specificity .
Result	There was some preliminary indication that combinations of changes in the serum glycome might improve the separation of ovarian cancer and benign tumors ; however , a larger study using data receiver operating characteristic curves will be required to draw

Background	The aim of the present study was to investigate the role of transient receptor potential vanilloid 4 ( TRPV4 ) in mediating mechanical allodynia in rodent models of chronic compression of the dorsal root ganglion ( CCD ) .
Method	First , the levels of TRPV4 mRNA and protein expression in the dorsal root ganglion ( DRG ) were assessed using real-time RT-PCR and Western blotting analysis respectively at 7 , 14 , and 28 days post-CCD .
Method	Then , the effects of spinal administration of TRPV4 antisense oligodeoxynucleotide ( ODN ) and mismatch ODN on CCD-induced mechanical allodynia were evaluated .
Method	Lastly , the calcium responses to hypotonic solution and 4alpha-phorbol 12,13-didecanoate ( 4alpha-PDD ) were assessed following sham surgery , CCD , spinal application of TRPV4 antisense ODN and mismatch ODN .
Result	The results showed that the levels of TRPV4 mRNA and protein expression increased significantly at 7-28 days post-CCD when compared with the sham group , with the highest level at 7 days post-CCD .
Result	TRPV4 antisense ODN , but not mismatch ODN , partly reversed the CCD-induced mechanical allodynia .
Result	Additionally , TRPV4 antisense ODN had no effect on the baseline nociceptive response .
Result	The percentage of DRG neurons responsive to hypotonic solution and 4alpha-PDD and the fluorescence ratio of calcium response were also enhanced significantly in both the CCD group and the mismatch ODN group .
Result	These increased responses were significantly inhibited by TRPV4 antisense ODN .
Result	In conclusion , TRPV4 plays a crucial role in CCD-induced mechanical allodynia .

Background	There are two bradykinin receptor subtypes , designated B1 and B2 .
Background	Whilst both have been implicated in nociception , it is believed that there is a low level of constitutive expression of B1 receptors and that their expression is induced by inflammation or tissue damage .
Method	The present study investigated the role of B1 receptors in spinal nociceptive processing using an in vivo electrophysiological assay in decerebrate , spinalized rabbits , a species that shares close B1 receptor homology with the human receptor .
Method	Inflammation was induced in the paw by an injection of complete Freund 's adjuvant at least 1 h before recording single motor unit activity of the semitendinous/biceps femoris muscle in response to a noxious pinch of the foot .
Method	Control animals received an intraplantar injection of saline .
Method	The peptide B1 receptor antagonist B9858 was administered i.v. and caused dose-dependent and complete inhibition of the nociceptive spinal reflex ( ID50 = 1 mg x kg ( -1 ) ) .
Result	In control animals without paw inflammation , B9858 had no effect .
Result	These findings are consistent with other evidence that peptide B1 receptor antagonists inhibit spinal nociceptive reflexes only after induction of B1 receptors by inflammation and support the potential therapeutic utility of B1 receptor antagonists as ana

Background	To identify factors associated with specific categories of charges during acute inpatient rehabilitation treatment after traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) .
Method	Prospective observational study .
Method	A single Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems ( TBIMS ) center .
Method	Eighty-four consecutive TBIMS patients .
Method	One exploratory analysis also included all 350 patients with TBI admitted during 1999 .
Method	Not applicable .
Method	Average daily charges for specific categories of resource use ( eg , room and board , rehabilitation therapies , functional labs ) .
Result	Room and board and rehabilitation therapy accounted for almost 90 % of average daily charges .
Result	There was no linear component of change in average daily charges , but certain categories of charges were significantly higher during the first week than thereafter .
Result	Functional status at rehabilitation admission correlated with charges for respiratory , medical , and surgical supplies and with pharmacy and radiology , but not the other categories .
Result	Specific medical variables also correlated with specific charge categories .
Result	Focused chart reviews of patients with low and high charges in specific categories led to the formulation of additional predictive hypotheses .
Result	Certain categories of charges correlated with functional scores and acute medical variables that are known before admission to acute inpatient rehabilitation , allowing for better inpatient admission planning under prospective payment .
Result	Further research is needed to identify and correlate resource use that is bundled within the room and board category .

Background	The sinoatrial ( SA ) and atrioventricular ( AV ) nodes are specialized centers of the heart conduction system and are composed of muscle cells with distinctive morphological and electrophysiological properties .
Result	We report here results of immunofluorescence and immunoperoxidase studies on the bovine heart showing that a large number of SA and AV nodal cells share a distinct type of myosin heavy chain ( MHC ) which is not found in other myocardial cells and can thus
Background	The antibody used in this study was raised against fetal skeletal myosin and reacted with fetal skeletal but not with adult skeletal MHCs .
Result	Both atrial and ventricular fibers , as well as fibers of the ventricular conduction tissue were unlabeled by this antibody .
Result	Specific reactivity was exclusively seen in most cells in the central portions of the SA and AV nodes and rare cells in perinodal areas .
Result	However , a number of nodal cells , particularly those located in the peripheral nodal regions , were unreactive with this antibody .
Result	The myosin composition of nodal tissues was also explored using two antibodies reacting specifically with alpha-MHC , the predominant atrial isoform , and beta-MHC , the predominant ventricular isoform .
Result	Most nodal cells were reactive for alpha-MHC and a number of them also for beta-MHC .
Result	Variation in reactivity with the two antibodies was also observed in perinodal areas : at these sites a population of large fibers reacted exclusively for beta-MHC .
Result	These findings point to the existence of muscle cell heterogeneity with respect to myosin composition both in nodal and perinodal tissues .

Method	An 11-month-old infant presented with acute urinary retention .
Background	He had presented 3 months earlier with complaints of an enlarging abdominal mass that was initially diagnosed as a mesenteric cyst on ultrasonography .
Background	Voiding cystourethrogram revealed a large bladder diverticulum .
Result	Bladder diverticulum should be a differential diagnosis in children , especially male , presenting with urinary retention , fever and an abdominal mass .

Background	Metastatic bone disease is a frequent cause of morbidity in advanced cancer patients with a subsequent high incidence of skeletal complications ( fractures , hypercalcemia , spinal cord compression ) and severe pain .
Background	The osteolytic process is mainly characterized by an osteoclastic activity of bone resorption and inflammatory activity provoked by various cytokines and prostaglandins .
Background	Bisphosphonates represent a new class of drugs with inhibitory activity on bone resorption and on inflammatory processes which revealed themselves to be efficacious in a series of clinical conditions such as tumour-induced hypercalcemia , Paget 's disease ,
Method	The aim of this review of the literature is to show the analgesic efficacy of the different bisphosphonates in phase III studies carried out on patients with metastatic bone disease .
Method	Medline and Cancerlit database from January 1984 to February 1998 have been considered .
Result	From the analysis of the published studies it appears that bisphosphonates and , in particular , intravenous Disodium Pamidronate , are not only able to slow down the progression of the disease and to reduce the onset of skeletal complications but also have
Result	Bisphosphonates represent a further valid therapy to add to an already consolidated list of therapies such as radio , chemo and endocrine therapy , analgesic drugs , orthopaedic and physiatric in the pain management of patients with bone metastases .
Result	These drugs meet with the patients ' compliance , are well-tolerated as well as having a good cost/efficacy profile .
Result	It still remains to be seen if the newer and more potent bisphosphonates such as Ibandronate and Zoledronate can be administered differently from the intravenous route such as by mouth or by patch which are readily accepted by the patient and , moreover , i

Background	The authors assessed changes over time in antidepressant utilization among elderly subjects regarding the prevalence of antidepressant users , shifts in prescription patterns , and related financial implications .
Method	The authors conducted a population-based study of more than 1.4 million Ontario residents aged 65 years or older .
Method	Cross-sectional data regarding annual antidepressant utilization were obtained from administrative databases for 1993 to 1997 .
Method	Time series analysis was used to assess trends over time and to make future projections .
Result	The proportion of antidepressant users increased from 9.3 % of the elderly population in 1993 to 11.5 % in 1997 .
Result	Prescriptions for selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors ( SSRIs ) accounted for 9.6 % of antidepressant prescriptions dispensed in the first 30 days of 1993 and 45.1 % of those dispensed by the last 30 days of 1997 and were projected to increase to approxim
Result	Prescriptions for tricyclic antidepressants fell from 79.0 % in the first 30 days of 1993 to 43.1 % by the last 30 days of 1997 and were projected to decline to approximately 28 % by the end of 2000 .
Result	Annual antidepressant costs ( in Canadian dollars ) increased by 150 % , from $ 10.8 million in 1993 to $ 27.0 million in 1997 .
Result	Population shifts and an increase in the prevalence of antidepressant users accounted for at least 20 % of this increase , whereas the prescribing transition from tricyclic antidepressants to SSRIs accounted for at least 61 % of the increase .
Result	The introduction of SSRIs has had a substantial financial impact at the drug utilization level .
Result	Future research should address the appropriate balancing of the cost of newer agents versus their ostensible advantages .

Background	Improved understanding of the pathophysiology of systemic sclerosis ( SSc ) opens new therapeutic avenues in its treatment .
Background	The efficacy of disease-modifying agents remains limited however , and none has yet demonstrated its ability to improve survival in a prospective randomized trial .
Result	of traditional antifibrotic agents such as colchicine and D-penicillamine are disappointing .
Result	Cyclophosphamide ( CYC ) seems to be beneficial in interstitial lung disease associated with SSc .
Result	Organ-specific therapies may produce dramatic benefits .
Result	Examples include angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors for renal failure and epoprostenol for primary pulmonary hypertension .
Method	Several new therapeutic approaches are currently under evaluation , including high-dose CYC followed by peripheral stem cell transplantation , vasodilators , and antiinflammatory and antifibrotic agents .
Result	Physical therapy and rehabilitation may help to treat disability and loss of function in SSc patients .

Method	The aim of this study was to assess the long-term safety and efficacy of glatiramer acetate ( GA ) for patients with multiple sclerosis ( MS ) who received active treatment versus those on placebo for approximately 30 months ( 24-35 months ) before receiving GA
Method	Entry required two relapses in the previous two years and an Expanded Disability Status Scale ( EDSS ) score of 0-5 .
Method	Patients ( 251 ) were equally randomized to daily subcutaneous GA , 20 mg , or to placebo .
Method	After approximately 30 months , 208 patients continued in an open label study 101 continued on GA and 107 switched from placebo to active drug .
Method	Groups were well matched at randomization and entry to the open label study .
Result	Patients always on GA showed a steady decline in relapses : a mean of 1.5 per year at entry , a mean of 0.42 over the entire six years ( 95 % CI = 0.34-0 .51 ) , a 72 % reduction ( P = 0.0001 ) .
Result	They averaged a relapse every four + years ( yearly rate 0.23 in year six ) and 26/101 remain relapse free .
Result	Patients did less well if on placebo for 30 months , but relapses then declined , and by year six the rates were similar .
Result	Of patients always on GA , 69 % showed neurological improvement of > or = 1 EDSS steps or remained stable compared with 57 % if GA treatment was delayed .
Result	Of relapse-free patients always on GA over six years , only three of 26 ( 11 % ) were worse by > or = 1 EDSS steps , whereas nine of 21 ( 43 % ) in the placebo/active group were worse ( P < 0.03 ) .
Result	Disability , measured every six months , showed that the group of patients always on GA was relatively stable over the six years , while the group who received placebo for the first two-and-a-half years did significantly less well .
Result	Daily injections of GA were well tolerated .
Result	This longest ever organized MS treatment trial shows that delaying therapy with GA increases the risk of neurologic disability , reinforcing the rationale for using GA as a first-line treatment early in the course of relapsing-remitting MS.

Background	Necrotizing enterocolitis ( NEC ) is a gastrointestinal emergency in neonates .
Background	Whether NEC affects infants ' growth and development is controversial .
Method	The purpose of this study was to explore the clinical characteristics and outcome and to assess the effect of NEC on growth and neurodevelopment in infants .
Method	A total of 80 neonates admitted to the neonatal intensive care unit from January 1991 to April 2002 with definite , advanced NEC , including 48 with modified Bell 's stage II and 32 with stage III .
Method	Sixty six of the patients were premature .
Method	Very low birth weight ( VLBW ) preterm infants without NEC were used as matching controls for the 15 infants with VLBW .
Method	The growth and neurodevelopment of patients and controls were assessed using the Bayley Scales of Infant Development-II and compared at 6 and 18 months of corrected age .
Result	NEC developed an average of 27.7 days after feeding began .
Result	The most common initial signs were abdominal distension , decreased activity , hematochezia , and abdominal tenderness .
Result	Thirty four patients ( 43 % ) required surgical intervention .
Result	Three infants developed short bowel syndrome after surgical resection .
Result	The overall mortality was 24 % ( 19/80 ) and was mostly associated with extensive bowel involvement and NEC-related sepsis or multiple organ failure .
Result	Of the surviving 61 infants , 12 ( 20 % ) developed intestinal strictures , 2 in the ileum , 6 in the colon , and 4 in both ileum and colon .
Result	Compared with controls , the VLBW infants with NEC were shorter and had delayed psychomotor development at 18 months of corrected age .
Result	Mental development , however , did not differ significantly .
Result	Intestinal stricture was the most common gastrointestinal complication in this series of infants with NEC .
Result	Besides the bowel sequelae , VLBW infants who survive NEC are at risk for impairment of growth and neurodevelopment .

Background	It is well established that cholecystokinin ( CCK ) reduces the antinociceptive effect of opioids .
Background	The level of CCK and CCK receptors , as well as CKK release , exhibits considerable plasticity after nerve injury and inflammation , conditions known to be associated with chronic pain .
Background	Such altered CCK release coupled in some situation with changes in CCK receptor levels may underlie the clinical phenomenon of varying opioid sensitivity in different clinical pain conditions .
Background	In particular , neuropathic pain after injury to the peripheral and central nervous system does not respond well to opioids , which is likely to be caused by increased activity in the endogenous CCK system .
Background	CCK receptor antagonists may thus be useful as analgesics in combination with opioids to treat neuropathic pain .

Background	The symptoms associated with lumbar spinal stenosis can decrease quality of life and may cause patients to seek treatment .
Background	Except in rare cases of rapid neurologic progression or cauda equina syndrome , nonsurgical modalities should be the initial treatment choice .
Background	Activity modification , a variety of medications , epidural steroid injections , and other methods are recommended for pain reduction .
Background	A formal physical therapy program , which focuses on flexion-based exercises , may lead to improved patientfunction .
Background	symptoms .
Background	Adequate decompression of the neural elements and maintenance of bony stability are necessary for a good surgical outcome for patients with spinal stenosis .
Background	Laminectomy has long been the method of choice for thorough lumbar decompression .
Background	Preserving at least the lateral half of the facet joints bilaterally and bone in the area of the pars interarticularis minimizes the potential for iatrogenic instability .
Background	Numerous other decompression techniques have been described , including multilevel laminotomies , fenestration , distraction laminoplasty , and microscopic decompression .
Background	Arthrodesis , either with or without instrumentation , is also indicated in some patients .
Result	Several studies report that surgical treatment produces better outcomes than nonsurgical treatment in the short term ; however , the results tend to deteriorate with time .
Result	Lumbar decompressive surgery can be complicated by epidural hematoma , deep venous thrombosis , dural tear , infection , nerve root injury , and recurrence of symptoms .

Background	To compare the accuracy of whole-body position emission tomography ( PET ) using [ 18F ] fluorodeoxyglucose ( FDG ) with conventional radiological imaging techniques in identifying operable colorectal cancer metastases to the liver .
Method	A double-blind comparative study of FDG-PET as the criterion standard vs conventional radiological imaging methods as the criterion standard , in staging of recurrent colorectal cancer .
Method	Institutional practice in a tertiary referral center .
Method	Thirty-four consecutive patients with suspected colorectal cancer metastases recruited for the study between May 1993 and October 1994 .
Method	Conventional radiological methods of cancer staging included abdominal computed tomography ( CT ) ( n = 34 ) , chest x-rays ( n = 15 ) , and chest CT ( n = 19 ) to evaluate extrahepatic disease .
Method	Twenty-seven patients were subsequently considered to have apparently isolated cancer metastases to the liver .
Method	Anatomical resectability was assessed by magnetic resonance imaging ( n = 24 ) or CT angiography ( n = 3 ) in all study patients .
Method	The FDG-PET studies ( n = 34 ) were performed within 8 weeks of conventional radiological imaging .
Method	Malignancy of suspected lesions detected by means of FDG-PET and conventional radiological imaging was confirmed by histopathologic examination of resected specimens and percutaneous biopsy specimens and by serial CT scans demonstrating progression of disease .
Result	Unsuspected extrahepatic malignant disease that was missed by conventional radiological imaging was detected by FDG-PET in 11 patients ( 32 % ) .
Result	The PET-detected extrahepatic malignant disease included retroperitoneal nodal metastases ( n = 6 ) , pulmonary metastases ( n = 3 ) , and locoregional cancer recurrences ( n = 2 ) .
Result	The additional information afforded by PET consequently had an influence on the clinical management in 10 patients ( 29 % ) .
Result	The FDG-PET method enabled selection of patients with apparently curable colorectal cancer metastases to the liver for hepatic resection .

Method	PEDIATRICS ( ISSN Numbers Print , 0031-4005 ; Online , 1098-4275 ) .
Background	Published in the public domain by the American Academy of Pediatrics.Speech and language development is a useful indicator of a child 's overall development and cognitive ability and is related to school success .
Background	Identification of children at risk for developmental delay or related problems may lead to intervention services and family assistance at a young age , when the chances for improvement are best .
Background	However , optimal methods for screening for speech and language delay have not been identified , and screening is practiced inconsistently in primary care .
Method	We sought to evaluate the strengths and limits of evidence about the effectiveness of screening and interventions for speech and language delay in preschool-aged children to determine the balance of benefits and adverse effects of routine screening in primary care for the development of guidelines by the US Preventive Services Task Force .
Method	The target population includes all children up to 5 years old without previously known conditions associated with speech and language delay , such as hearing and neurologic impairments .
Method	Studies were identified from Medline , PsycINFO , and CINAHL databases ( 1966 to November 19 , 2004 ) , systematic reviews , reference lists , and experts .
Method	The evidence review included only English-language , published articles that are available through libraries .
Method	Only randomized , controlled trials were considered for examining the effectiveness of interventions .
Method	Outcome measures were considered if they were obtained at any time or age after screening and/or intervention as long as the initial assessment occurred while the child was < or = 5 years old .
Method	Outcomes included speech and language measures and other functional and health outcomes such as social behavior .
Method	A total of 745 full-text articles met our eligibility criteria and were reviewed .
Method	Data were extracted from each included study , summarized descriptively , and rated for quality by using criteria specific to different study designs developed by the US Preventive Services Task Force .
Result	The use of risk factors for selective screening has not been evaluated , and a list of specific risk factors to guide primary care physicians has not been developed or tested .
Result	Sixteen studies about potential risk factors for speech and language delay in children enrolled heterogeneous populations , had dissimilar inclusion and exclusion criteria , and measured different risk factors and outcomes .
Result	The most consistently reported risk factors included a family history of speech and language delay , male gender , and perinatal factors .
Result	Other risk factors reported less consistently included educational levels of the mother and father , childhood illnesses , birth order , and family size .
Result	The performance characteristics of evaluation techniques that take < or = 10 minutes to administer were described in 24 studies relevant to screening .
Method	Studies that were rated good to fair quality reported wide ranges of sensitivity and specificity when compared with reference standards ( sensitivity 17-100 % ; specificity 45-100 % ) .
Method	Most of the evaluations , however , were not designed for screening purposes , the instruments measured different domains , and the study populations and settings were often outside of primary care .
Method	No `` gold standard '' has been developed and tested for screening , reference standards varied across studies , few studies compared the performance of > or = 2 screening techniques in 1 population , and comparisons of a single screening technique across different populations are lacking .
Method	Fourteen good - and fair-quality randomized , controlled trials of interventions reported significantly improved speech and language outcomes compared with control groups .
Result	Improvement was demonstrated in several domains including articulation , phonology , expressive language , receptive language , lexical acquisition , and syntax among children in all age groups studied and across multiple therapeutic settings .
Result	Improvement in other functional outcomes such as socialization skills , self-esteem , and improved play themes were demonstrated in some , but not all , of the 4 studies that measured them .
Result	In general , studies of interventions were small and heterogeneous , may be subject to plateau effects , and reported short-term outcomes based on various instruments and measures .
Result	As a result , long-term outcomes are not known , interventions could not be compared directly , and generalizability is questionable .
Result	Use of risk factors to guide selective screening is not supported by studies .
Result	Several aspects of screening have been inadequately studied to determine optimal methods , including which instrument to use , the age at which to screen , and which interval is most useful .
Method	Trials of interventions demonstrate improvement in some outcome measures , but conclusions and generalizability are limited .
Result	Data are not available addressing other key issues including the effectiveness of screening in primary care settings , role of enhanced surveillance by primary care physicians before referral for diagnostic evaluation , non-speech and language and long-term

Background	Adrenoleukodystrophy , a sex-linked peroxisomal disorder that results in the impaired oxidation of long-chain saturated fatty acids and causes neurologic impairment , is a rare cause of Addison 's disease in children .
Background	Adrenomyeloneuropathy is the name given to a biochemically identical but milder and more slowly progressive variant of adrenoleukodystrophy that affects young adults , in whom adrenal insufficiency may long precede nervous system dysfunction .
Background	The transmission of adrenomyeloneuropathy , like that of most cases of adrenoleukodystrophy , is sex-linked .
Background	Because of a preponderance of male patients among a group of patients with the onset of adrenal failure in childhood , we questioned whether this condition might be the initial manifestation of adrenomyeloneuropathy .
Result	We therefore measured the plasma concentrations of very-long-chain saturated fatty acids in eight patients with adrenal insufficiency ; of these , five had elevated plasma hexacosanoic acid concentrations ( range , 2.42 to 6.43 mumol per liter ; mean normal le
Result	Magnetic resonance imaging showed clear evidence of brain involvement in all five patients .
Result	Reexploration of the family histories revealed additional missed cases .
Result	We conclude that the possibility of adrenomyeloneuropathy should be considered in any boy with Addison 's disease .

Background	The aim of this prospective study is to evaluate the efficacy of a less invasive approach for the operative treatment of lumbar canal stenosis .
Method	Using transmuscular dilatation this technique minimises surgical trauma .
Method	Through a working channel with a 11 mm outer diameter and under operative microscope guidance , decompression of the neural elements can be achieved .
Method	From November 1998 to December 2001 38 consecutive patients with a mean age of 73.2 years were operated upon using this technique .
Method	The study included 56 lumbar segments .
Method	The mean follow up was 32 ( 18-55 ) months .
Method	The Visual Analogue Scale ( VAS ) for back and leg pain together with the Oxford Claudication Score ( OCS ) were used to assess the functional results .
Result	The average operating time for one level decompression was 74 minutes and the average blood loss was 32 ml/patient .
Result	Two patients ( 5.2 % ) required revision by open surgery .
Result	The OCS improved from 29.4 preoperatively to 16.9 postoperatively ( p < 0.001 ) .
Result	VAS for back pain and leg pain also showed a significant improvement ( p < 0.001 ) .
Result	This less invasive approach is effective in decompressing lumbar canal stenosis .
Result	It has the advantage of early mobilisation and a short hospital stay , especially in elderly patients ( mean age here : 73.2 years ) .

Background	Health care for the elderly in the United States remains fragmentary and noncomprehensive despite concern for the needs of an expanding elderly population and a new emphasis on geriatrics .
Background	Model health care programs for the elderly have been few and not generally applicable to central city populations .
Background	A model health care program has been designed to offer a continuum of comprehensive , multidisciplinary health care to Milwaukee elderly .
Background	An acute care unit for the elderly , rehabilitation-oriented nursing home , outpatient clinic , home care service , outreach clinics , rehabilitation day hospital , Alzheimer 's Disease Day Care program , and acute geriatric psychiatric unit have been developed a
Background	The program serves chiefly the frail elderly , who are demonstrated to be markedly impaired physically , mentally , and socially , requiring the services of multiple professionals to enable the patients to achieve maximum independence .
Background	Alternatives to institutionalization are emphasized , and geriatric education and research programs are part of the model program .

Background	Congestive heart failure ( CHF ) is characterized by increased peripheral vascular resistance .
Background	Endothelin-1 ( ET-1 ) , a potent endothelium-derived vasoconstrictor , is present at increased concentrations in the plasma and contributes to the regulation of vascular tone in CHF .
Background	An endothelium-derived relaxing factor , nitric oxide ( NO ) , also regulates vascular tone , but endothelium-dependent NO-mediated vasodilation is blunted in CHF .
Background	An endogenous NO synthase inhibitor , asymmetric dimethylarginine ( ADMA ) , which inhibits NO production and endothelium-dependent relaxation , is present at increased levels in the plasma and plays a role in impaired endothelial function in CHF .
Background	However , at present , the relationship between ET-1 and impaired vascular relaxation in CHF is not well known .
Method	We hypothesized that ET-1 inhibits NO-mediated vasodilation via increased ADMA production in CHF , and that an endothelin receptor antagonist can prevent this increase in plasma ADMA levels .
Method	In the present study , we first examined whether circulating ADMA levels were increased in a dog model of CHF induced by 3 weeks of rapid ventricular pacing ( n = 5 ; 270 beats/min ) compared with normal dogs ( n = 5 ) .
Result	After 3 weeks of pacing , cardiac output had decreased significantly ( 1.56 + / -0.16 compared with 2.93 + / -0.25 litres/min ; P < 0.01 ) and systemic vascular resistance had increased ( 4653 + / -374 compared with 3227 + / -396 dyn.s.cm ( -5 ) ; P < 0.01 ) in dogs with CHF
Result	Plasma levels of both ET-1 ( 4.95 + / -0.83 compared with 2.12 + / -0.39 pg/ml ; P < 0.05 ) and ADMA ( 3.27 + / -0.49 compared with 1.91 + / -0.25 nmol/ml ; P < 0.05 ) were significantly increased in CHF dogs .
Result	A significant positive correlation was observed between plasma ET-1 and ADMA levels ( r = 0.72 , P < 0.05 ) .
Method	Secondly , we chronically administered an ET ( A ) receptor antagonist , TA-0201 ( 0.3 mg/kg ; n = 5 ) , to paced CHF dogs .
Method	Drug administration started on day 8 of pacing and continued throughout the experiment .
Result	TA-0201 significantly increased cardiac output ( 2.58 + / -0.24 litres/min ; P < 0.01 ) and suppressed the increases in plasma ADMA levels and systemic vascular resistance ( 2.36 + / -0.30 nmol/ml and 2423 + / -188 dyn.s.cm ( -5 ) respectively ; P < 0.05 for each ) compa
Result	In conclusion , ET-1 contributes to the regulation of vascular tone due , in part , to increased levels of an endogenous NO synthase inhibitor in CHF , and an ET ( A ) receptor antagonist can prevent the inhibition of NO production and the increased peripheral v

Background	Most of the predisposition to hereditary breast and ovarian cancer has been attributed to inherited defects in two tumor suppressor genes BRCA1 and BRCA2 .
Method	To explore the contribution of BRCA1 mutations to hereditary breast cancer among Indian women , we examined the coding sequence of the BRCA1 gene in 14 breast cancer patients with a positive family history of breast and/or ovarian cancer .
Method	Mutation analysis was carried out using conformation sensitive gel electrophoresis ( CSGE ) followed by sequencing .
Result	Three mutations ( 21 % ) in the BRCA1 gene were identified .
Result	Two of them are novel mutations of which one is a missense mutation in exon 7 near the RING finger domain , while the other is a one base pair deletion in exon 11 which results in protein truncation .
Result	The third mutation , 185 delAG , has been previously described in Ashkenazi Jewish families .
Result	To our knowledge this is the first report of a study of germline BRCA1 mutation analysis in familial breast cancer in India .
Result	Our data from 14 different families suggests a lower prevalence but definite involvement of germline mutations in the BRCA1 gene among Indian women with breast cancer and a family history of breast cancer .

Background	Calcitonin has been approved for the treatment of osteoporosis and other diseases involving accelerated bone turnover for approximately 25 years .
Background	The most commonly studied and prescribed form is salmon calcitonin , which has a greater efficacy in clinical use .
Method	A wealth of well-controlled clinical studies have demonstrated that calcitonin preserves or increases bone mineral density ( BMD ) and reduces the risk of vertebral fractures in osteoporosis .
Background	Recent studies have indicated that while a low BMD is correlated with an increase in fracture risk , increases in BMD alone do not explain the antifracture efficacy of antiresorptive therapies such as calcitonin .
Background	Therapies that moderately increase BMD may reduce fracture risk by reducing the rate of bone turnover and maintaining the integrity of the trabecular architecture , resulting in the preservation of bone strength and quality in osteoporotic patients .
Background	An advantage of calcitonin that is not shared by other antiresorptive therapies is its direct analgesic effect on bone pain .
Background	Calcitonin has been demonstrated to be clinically useful in improving pain , not only from the acute vertebral fractures of osteoporosis , but also in Paget 's disease , bone malignancies , and other sources of musculoskeletal pain .
Background	Drugs containing calcitonin may be approved for additional indications in the near future , and as more convenient routes of administration such as the oral route become available , the demand for the calcitonin peptide is expected to increase .

Background	The effect of the ganglioside GM1 on autotomy , a nociceptive behavioral marker for neuropathic pain , and substance P depletion was determined in a rat model of peripheral mononeuropathy , sciatic cryoneurolysis ( SCN ) .
Background	SCN is produced by the application of a cryoprobe to the common sciatic nerve using a freeze-thaw-freeze cycle .
Background	Due to structural sparing of the nerve , regenerative processes are not precluded .
Background	After this peripheral nerve insult , behavioral and neurochemical changes occur that support the use of SCN as a neuropathic pain model .
Background	These changes include : autotomy with coincident transient weight loss and paling of eye color suggestive of increased sympathetic activity , spontaneous nociceptive behaviors , touch-evoked allodynia , prolonged mechanical allodynia , ipsilateral decrease of
Method	Incidence and severity of autotomy were assessed after the intraperitoneal administration of GM1 ( 1 , 10 , and 20 mg/kg ) or saline injected daily for 2 days before SCN , the day of surgery , and for 14 days after surgery .
Method	In a subset of two rats from each treatment group , transcardiac perfusion was performed and spinal cords were processed for substance P immunoreactivity .
Result	GM1 at 10 and 20 mg/kg doses significantly attenuated autotomy as compared with saline-treated rats ( P = 0.007 and 0.0001 , respectively ) .
Result	However , GM1 , at the doses studied , failed to alter the spinal substance P depletion 21 days after SCN .
Result	These results indicate that the ganglioside GM1 may have a role in the clinical management of neuropathic pain after peripheral nerve injury .

Method	This paper aims to present an overview of the literature relating to the effects of endotracheal suctioning ( ETS ) in children and adults with severe traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) .
Background	TBI is the leading cause of death in children worldwide and continues to result in widespread mortality and morbidity .
Background	In intensive care , ETS is an essential nursing procedure that is undertaken but is known to produce some adverse effects in children .
Method	A comprehensive literature search was undertaken using a Parahoo and quality of reporting of meta-analyses ( QUOROM ) approach .
Method	A range of databases was searched to identify published papers with key search terms .
Method	The databases searched included Cochrane Library , Medline , PubMed Central , CINAHL , Proquest and Science Direct .
Method	This review is based on 21 papers ( with 433 patients in total ) , but specific papers in paediatric head injury children were extremely limited , and the evidence was largely dated and inconclusive .
Result	Although the majority of papers demonstrate an increase in intracranial pressure ( ICP ) with ETS , there are contradictory results with regard to recovery times .
Result	Further research is needed specifically into the effect of ETS on ICP and cerebral perfusion pressure of children with severe TBI , taking into account all the known confounding variables .

Method	At the end of lumbar microdiscectomy , we administered an emulsion of low-dose epidural morphine and vaseline sterile-oil as carrier for morphine delivery .
Method	To evaluate safety and analgesic efficacy of this compound and the impact on long-term epidural scar production .
Background	Epidural analgesia has been used with lumbar microdiscectomy for facilitating management of postoperative pain , shortening patients ' hospital stay and recovery time , and increasing the satisfaction rate.Several products have been used as barrier against t
Method	Two milligrams of morphine mixed with 2 mL of vaseline sterile-oil have been epidurally administered to 40 consecutive patients undergoing lumbar microdiscectomy , evaluating safety and analgesic effectiveness of the compound and the incidence of epidural
Method	Outcome measures included ( 1 ) visual analog scale ( VAS ) to assess the intensity of spontaneous low back and radicular pain , ( 2 ) straight-leg-raising maneuver to assess the degrees of leg elevation in relation to evoked-sciatic pain , ( 3 ) postoperative time to comfortable ambulation , ( 4 ) duration of postoperative hospitalization , ( 5 ) required amount of postoperative analgesics , ( 6 ) postoperative work time loss , and ( 7 ) follow-up lumbar magnetic resonance imaging or segmental computed tomography with contrast medium for quantitative evaluation of postoperative epidural fibrosis .
Result	Neither intraoperative nor postoperative clinically relevant adverse events , such as urinary retention , respiratory disturbances , or wound infections , were observed .
Result	At hospital discharge , patients showed a low pain intensity score ( mean VAS 11.3 mm + / - 0.88 ; mean straight-leg-raising 64.9 degrees + / - 14.6 ) , with low consumption of analgesics ( 31.2 % in hospital , 35 % at home ) .
Result	Mean hospital stay was 1.21 + / - 0.17 days ; mean postoperative work time loss was 22.23 + / - 1.97 days .
Result	At 1-week and 2-week control , mean pain intensity score was 10.7 + / - 2.3 and 9.3 mm + / - 1.3 , respectively.After a mean follow-up of 34.3 months ( range , 24-48 ) 12 patients episodes of transient lumbar and/or sciatic pain .
Result	At the last neuroradiological control , according to the 5-grade scale of Ross et al ( Neurol Res 1999 ) , epidural fibrosis scored 0 in 8 cases and 1 in 32 cases .
Result	Epidural application of morphine-vaseline sterile-oil compound after lumbar microdiscectomy proved to be safe and effective , improving postoperative pain control and return to function .
Result	At clinical and neuroradiological follow-up epidural fibrosis was acceptable .
Result	To confirm the efficacy of the compound , large prospective studies are warranted .

Method	To discuss the appropriate standard of care in randomized controlled trials of titrated therapies in critically ill patients .
Background	The debate over the appropriate standard of care in randomized controlled trials was sparked by the Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome Network trial of low tidal volume ventilation .
Result	In this trial , patients were randomized to either low or traditional tidal volume ventilation , and the investigators reported that low tidal volume ventilation significantly improved survival in patients with acute respiratory distress syndrome .
Result	However , it was argued that the control group used in this trial was not reflective of current practice patterns and that the improvement in survival may have been derived from patients in the control group being placed at increased risk .
Result	This debate forced intensivists to consider what defines an appropriate standard-of-care control group in randomized controlled trials of titrated therapies .
Result	If titrated therapies are to be studied safely , the mechanism behind the titration must be understood and incorporated into the control group .
Result	Failure to include a comparator group receiving current practice creates a study design that may jeopardize patient safety because there is no control group representing probable patient outcome outside of the trial .
Result	Additionally , randomizing patients to the extremes of a range of care without incorporation of a current practice control group prevents the investigators from making valid recommendations for changing current practice .
Result	The incorporation of current practice patterns into randomized controlled trials of titrated therapies is essential for producing generalizable results and safeguarding patients .

Background	Inadequate pain control is a dismaying reality in cancer patients .
Method	To review studies on cancer pain control interventions , and describe their findings with respect to participants ' attitudes and knowledge , pain management , and pain levels .
Method	Computer searches were made in MEDLINE from January 1962 , in PsychLIT from January 1974 , and in CINAHL from January 1982 to August 1999 , using a search strategy based on a combination of key words .
Method	Computerized listings from these sources contained 383 , 26 , and 85 articles , respectively .
Method	After exclusion of duplicates , abstracts , editorials , letters , and irrelevant articles , we retained for review 33 articles , of which 25 ( 76 % ) were interventions targeting health professionals , and 8 ( 24 % ) interventions targeting patients and family caregivers .
Method	Study reports were reviewed using the following structured framework
Method	Intervention Setting , Study Methods , Process Assessment , and Pain Outcome Assessment ( Attitudes and Knowledge , Pain Management , and Pain Relief/Quality of Life ) .
Result	Educational interventions can successfully improve cancer pain knowledge and attitudes of health care professionals , but without having much impact on patients ' pain levels .
Result	The most promising avenue for improving cancer pain control in ambulatory settings may be brief , nursing interventions targeting patients in combination with a daily pain diary .
Result	This review suggests that further progress may occur through incorporating a systematic and valid method of documenting daily fluctuation in pain levels , and ensuring that documented uncontrolled pain is followed rapidly by clinical reassessment and dose

Background	Resection of the small bowel can lead to malabsorption of fluid , electrolytes , minerals , and other essential nutrients , resulting in malnutrition and dehydration .
Background	Individualized and tailored nutritional management for patients with short bowel syndrome ( SBS ) helps to optimize intestinal absorption , leading to nutritional independence such that a patient can resume as normal a lifestyle as possible .
Background	Parenteral nutrition ( PN ) , used to supply the required nutrients following resection , is associated with a number of complications affecting patient morbidity and mortality .
Method	Attempts should be made to wean patients from PN to an oral diet as soon as possible .
Result	Dietary management is complex and needs to be individualized for each patient on the basis of his or her specific gastrointestinal anatomy , underlying disease , and lifestyle .
Result	In addition to nutrient intake , management of SBS also requires appropriate oral rehydration , vitamin and mineral supplementation , and pharmacotherapy .
Result	Several medications provide a useful adjunctive function to dietary intervention , including antidiarrheal agents , H2 antagonists and proton pump inhibitors , pancreatic enzymes , somatostatin analogs , antimicrobials , and trophic factors .

Background	To assess impairments , disabilities and handicap pattern in konzo .
Method	The study included 17 konzo subjects , of which three were males and 14 females ( mean age 21 , median 18 years ) .
Method	A detailed neurological examination was performed on all subjects .
Method	Subsequently , an assessment of impairments , disabilities and handicap was done with a constructed rating scale partially based on the ICIDH-2 framework .
Result	The overall disablement picture in all subjects consisted of motor dysfunction in lower limbs leading to limitations in walking and movement activities , and restrictions in mobility .
Result	Hip mobility was severely impaired in most cases ( 15/17 ) .
Result	Although konzo subjects showed normal muscle power in upper limbs ( 13/17 ) , they had impaired fine motor function ( 10/17 ) .
Result	Further studies are needed to assess the effectiveness of the WHO criteria for konzo in defining its forms .
