Result	The applicability of the ICIDH-2 framework in this study demonstrates the possibility of its use as a common language among researchers in the field of motor disorders .
Result	However , a revision is suggested of its taxonomy , and a definition of operational criteria to clarify the content of different qualifiers provided to assess the level of functioning or disability .

Method	By use of pentobarbital sodium to produce experimental congestive heart failure ( CHF ) in 40 rabbits , they were treated with xin-fu-ning IV ( XFN IV ) , the plasma atrial natriuretic factor ( ANF ) levels and atrial tissue ANF levels of rabbits were measured .
Result	The results showed that XFN IV had elevated ANF levels of the rabbits with CHF .
Result	It showed that XFN IV could improve endocrine function of heart , and it also showed good curative effect on CHF .

Background	The clinical outcome of acid-related disorders treated by proton pump inhibitors ( PPIs ) might be dependent on the polymorphically expressed cytochrome P450 ( CYP ) 2C19 , which is involved in PPI metabolism .
Method	We tested whether esomeprazole-induced healing of gastroesophageal reflux disease ( GERD ) is related to CYP2C19 genotype .
Method	Two hundred five patients with GERD ( Los Angeles classification grade A or B ) were included in a case-control study according to endoscopic outcome ( healed versus unhealed group , matched for confounders ) after treatment with 40 mg esomeprazole daily for 4
Method	The frequency of CYP2C19 genotypes was determined as the primary outcome measure for both groups .
Method	In a second trial plasma levels of esomeprazole and corresponding CYP2C19 and CYP3A4 metabolites ( 5-hydroxyomeprazole and omeprazole sulfone ) were monitored in 10 CYP2C19 wild-type patients with GERD after the first and last doses ( day 7 ) of 40 mg esomeprazole daily to calculate metabolic ratios .
Result	CYP2C19 wild-type ( n = 148 ) and heterozygous ( n = 51 ) or homozygous variant ( n = 6 ) patients did not differ with respect to baseline characteristics .
Result	The frequency distribution of CYP2C19 genotypes was not different between patients with complete ( 75/100 ) and incomplete ( 73/105 ) healing ( P = .65 ) .
Result	When a single esomeprazole dose and multiple dosing were compared , the low contribution of CYP2C19 to the elimination of esomeprazole decreased further by 50 % .
Result	In contrast , the CYP3A4-dependent formation of omeprazole sulfone increased by 40 % , and consequently , the metabolic ratio of omeprazole sulfone to 5-hydroxyomeprazole was elevated from 7.9 to 19.3 ( P = .0004 ) .
Result	In contrast to other PPIs , esomeprazole-induced healing of GERD is unrelated to the CYP2C19 genotype , which can be explained by the metabolic shift toward the CYP3A4-mediated pathway .

Background	BRCA1 and BRCA2 gene mutations confer a high lifetime risk to breast and ovarian cancers .
Method	We have screened cancer patients from 13 families with at least three breast and/or ovarian cancers from Lithuania for 5382insC , C61G and 4153delA BRCA1 gene mutations .
Result	One of three mutations was found in 9 of the 13 studied families ( 69 % ) .
Result	4153delA was the most frequently detected and accounted for 56 % of all identified mutation .
Result	5382insC and C61G accounted for 33 % and 11 % of found mutations , respectively .
Result	Significantly higher , than in other populations , incidence of 4153delA indicates that this may be founder BRCA1 mutation characteristic for Lithuanians .
Result	Our analysis shows that testing of 4153delA , 5382insC , C61G BRCA1 mutations should be extremely effective and inexpensive tool in testing Lithuanian population aimed to identify individuals with high risk of breast and ovarian cancers .

Background	This study was conducted to evaluate the effects of dorsal rhizotomy on upper-limb spasticity , functional improvement , coordination , and hand sensibility .
Method	Fifteen spastic upper limbs in 13 patients were selected and prospectively studied .
Method	Brachial plexus dorsal rhizotomy was performed in which two , three , or four dorsal roots were completely sectioned .
Method	Patients were followed up for at least 12 months after surgery ; the mean follow-up period was 15.6 months and the maximum period was 30 months .
Result	A remarkable relief of spasticity was observed in all cases .
Result	Recurrence was observed in only one patient and was caused by insufficient dorsal root section .
Result	Functional improvement was observed in all cases , and functional improvement in the hand was found to be related to the presence of active finger extension in the preoperative period .
Result	Even when extended dorsal root section was performed , no hand anesthesia , either total or partial , was observed .
Result	No patient lost movement ability in the postoperative period , and no ataxic limbs were observed .
Result	Brachial plexus dorsal rhizotomy is very effective as a treatment for upper-limb spasticity and results in functional improvement without loss of sensation in the hand .

Background	In the two decades after obstructive sleep apnea syndrome ( OSAS ) was described , it was considered a disease primarily of males .
Background	As a result , for many years , epidemiologic studies of the general population examining the prevalence of OSAS included only males and investigators examined almost exclusively males in their pathophysiologic studies .
Background	It has been widely recognized that OSAS in women is not as rare as it was originally believed .
Background	Whereas early studies of clinic populations suggested that females made up about 10 % or less of OSAS cases , later studies of the general population suggest that about a third of all cases are females .
Background	This suggests that there may be clinical under-recognition of OSAS in females .

Background	Obesity can result in alterations in cardiac structure and function even in the absence of systemic hypertension and underlying organic heart disease .
Background	Increased total blood volume creates a high cardiac output state that may cause ventricular dilatation and ultimately eccentric hypertrophy of the left ( and possibly the right ) ventricle .
Background	Eccentric left ventricular ( LV ) hypertrophy produces diastolic dysfunction .
Background	Systolic dysfunction may ensue due to excessive wall stress if wall thickening fails to keep pace with dilatation .
Background	This disorder is referred to as obesity cardiomyopathy .
Background	The presence of systemic hypertension in obese individuals facilitates development of LV dilatation and hypertrophy .
Background	Congestive heart failure may occur in such individuals , and may be attributable to LV diastolic dysfunction or to combined LV diastolic and systolic dysfunction .
Background	The sleep apnea/obesity hypoventilation syndrome occurs in 5 % of morbidly obese individuals and is potentially life-threatening .
Background	Treatment of obesity cardiomyopathy consists of weight loss , salt restriction , and diuretics .
Background	Digitalis and vasodilators may be useful in selected cases .
Background	Central obesity is probably a risk factor for the development of coronary heart disease .
Background	Alterations in lipid and insulin metabolism may facilitate development of coronary heart disease in obese patients .

Method	In a large population-based multiple sclerosis ( MS ) sample ( n = 7,951 ) , 116 twins were identified ( 1.4 % ) , of which it was possible to contact 97 .
Method	In 27 pairs , the twin of the patient with MS was dead .
Method	Among the 70 remaining pairs , 16 were excluded because either the index patient or their twin did not accept protocol requirements .
Method	The final sample included 54 pairs .
Method	Twin zygosity was determined by DNA fingerprint analysis .
Method	We found 17 monozygotic pairs and 37 dizygotic pairs .
Result	One of the 17 monozygotic pairs ( 5.9 % ) and 1 of the 37 dizygotic pairs ( 2.7 % ) were concordant for MS.
Result	In 42 of the clinically unaffected twins , magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) of the brain was performed , and 9 scans were classified as indicative of MS.
Result	Three of these 42 patients had abnormal visual-evoked potentials , but all 3 had normal MRI scans .
Result	The overall proportion of pairs in which the co-twin had some form of clinical , radiological , or electrophysiological abnormality was approximately 30 % ; this proportion was independent of zygosity .

Background	This is a self-directed learning module that reviews medical complications associated with spinal cord injury ( SCI ) .
Background	It is part of a chapter on SCI medicine in the Self-Directed Physiatric Educational Program for practitioners and trainees in physical medicine and rehabilitation .
Background	This article includes discussion of common medical complications that impact rehabilitation and long-term follow-up for individuals with SCI .
Background	Issues addressed include the rehabilitation approach to SCI individuals with pressure ulcers , unilateral lower-extremity swelling ( deep venous thrombosis , heterotopic ossification , fractures ) , along with the pathophysiology , assessment , and treatment of s
Background	To describe diagnostic and treatment approaches for medical complications common to individuals with SCI .

Background	The aim of this study was to systematically review economic analyses comparing drug-eluting stents ( DES ) to bare metal stents ( BMS ) in patients who undergo percutaneous coronary intervention to form an overall view about cost-effectiveness of DES and to c
Method	Electronic databases searched from January 2004 to January 2006 were Cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews ; DARE , HTA , EED ( NHS CRD ) ; MEDLINE ( R ) In-Process , Other Non-Indexed Citations , MEDLINE ( R ) .
Method	References of the papers identified were checked .
Method	We included randomized controlled trials ( RCT ) or model-based cost-effectiveness analyses comparing DES to BMS in patients with coronary artery disease .
Method	The methodological quality of the papers was assessed by Drummond 's criteria .
Method	Baseline characteristics and results of the studies were extracted and data synthesized descriptively .
Method	A decision tree model was constructed to evaluate the cost-utility of DES in comparison to BMS , where health-related quality of life was measured by the 15D .
Result	We identified thirteen good-quality economic evaluations .
Result	In two of these based on RCTs , DES was found cost-effective .
Result	In six studies , it was concluded that DES might probably be a cost-effective strategy in some circumstances , but not as a single strategy , and four studies concluded that DES is not cost-effective .
Result	One study did not draw a clear conclusion .
Result	In our analysis , the overall incremental cost-effectiveness ratio was Euros 98,827 per quality-adjusted life-years gained .
Result	Avoiding one revascularization with DES would cost Euros 4,794 , when revascularization with BMS costs Euros 3,260 .
Result	The evidence is inconsistent of whether DES would be a cost-effective treatment compared with BMS in any healthcare system where evaluated .
Result	A marked restenosis risk reduction should be achieved before use of DES is justifiable at present prices .
Result	When considering adoption of a new health technology with a high incremental cost within a fixed budget , opportunity cost in terms of untreated patients should be seriously considered as a question of collective ethics .

Method	A total of 27 men with multiple sclerosis underwent urodynamic evaluation as part of a prospective study of voiding dysfunction .
Method	Of 18 patients with detrusor-external sphincter dyssynergia 9 suffered serious urologic complications , including repeated episodes of urosepsis , vesicoureteral reflux and urolithiasis .
Result	None of the 9 patients without dyssynergia suffered any urologic complications .
Result	Urologic complications were correlated highly to the presence of detrusor-external sphincter dyssynergia and the severity of multiple sclerosis but not to duration of multiple sclerosis , age of the patient or type of dyssynergia .
Result	Although no treatment was without complications it appears that either anticholinergics plus intermittent self-catheterization or condom catheter drainage is superior to an indwelling catheter for initial conservative treatment .
Result	External sphincterotomy or urinary diversion may be necessary if conservative therapy fails .

Background	To advance our understanding of attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder and medication effects we draw upon the evidence for ( 1 ) a neurotransmitter imbalance between norepinephrine and dopamine in attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder and ( 2 ) an asymm
Result	It appears that attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder may involve a bihemispheric dysfunction characterized by reduced dopaminergic and excessive noradrenergic functioning .
Result	In turn , favorable medication effects may be mediated by a restoration in neurotransmitter balance and by increased control over the allocation of attentional resources between hemispheres .

Background	To find out an effective therapy for obesity induced by antipsychotic agents .
Method	One hundred and one cases of obesity who were being treated with antipsychotic agents were randomly divided into an observation group and a control group .
Method	The observation group were treated with electroacupuncture at Quchi ( LI 11 ) , Zusanli ( ST 36 ) , Fenglong ( ST 40 ) , Shangjuxu ( ST 37 ) and Xiajuxu ( ST 39 ) , once a day for 8 weeks ; and no treatment was given to the control group .
Method	The Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale ( BPRS ) was used for assessment of therapeutic effect and the Treatment Emergent Symptom Scale ( TESS ) for adverse effects .
Result	The clinically effective rate of the observation group ( 54.9 % ) was superior to the control group ( 10.0 % ) with a significant difference between the two groups ( P < 0.05 ) .
Result	The BPRS score-reducing rate was 24.92 % and 28.62 % in the both groups respectively , and with no adverse effects .
Result	Electroacupuncture has a good therapeutic effect on obesity induced by antipsychotic agents , and it improves the patient 's compliance with no adverse effect .

Background	An earlier publication showed that acupuncture and stabilising exercises as an adjunct to standard treatment was effective for pelvic girdle pain during pregnancy , but the post-pregnancy effects of these treatment modalities are unknown .
Background	The aim of this follow-up study was to describe regression of pelvic girdle pain after delivery in these women .
Method	A randomised , single blind , controlled trial .
Method	East Hospital and 27 maternity care centres in Göteborg , Sweden .
Method	Some 386 pregnant women with pelvic girdle pain .
Method	Participants were randomly assigned to standard treatment plus acupuncture ( n = 125 ) , standard treatment plus specific stabilising exercises ( n = 131 ) or to standard treatment alone ( n = 130 ) .
Method	Primary outcome measures pain intensity ( Visual Analogue Scale ) .
Method	Secondary outcome measure assessment of the severity of pelvic girdle pain by an independent examiner 12 weeks after delivery .
Result	Approximately three-quarters of all the women were free of pain 3 weeks after delivery .
Result	There were no differences in recovery between the 3 treatment groups .
Result	According to the detailed physical examination , pelvic girdle pain had resolved in 99 % of the women 12 weeks after delivery .
Result	This study shows that irrespective of treatment modality , regression of pelvic girdle pain occurs in the great majority of women within 12 weeks after delivery .

Background	Transformation of the OA-group toxins into fatty acid ester derivatives ( often designated `` DTX3 '' ) is common in many bi
Background	and after 3 and 6 weeks of
Result	Analysis of samples by HPLC-MS/MS and HPLC-MS ( 2 ) revealed some differences in identity and abundance of fatty acid moieties of the OA-group esters between species , but the 16:0 fatty acid esters dominated in both oysters and mussels , which is in accordanc
Method	A wider range of PTX2 SA-esters were detected compared to esters of the OA-group toxins in both mussels and oysters , and in oysters , both 140 , 184 and 205 fatty acid side chains were more common than 160 .
Result	OA-group toxins were esterified to a larger degree in oysters ( 83-93 % ) compared to mussels ( 21-41 % ) , and in mussels a higher proportion of OA was esterified compared to DTX1 and DTX2 .
Result	Contrary to what was observed for OA-group toxins , PTX2 SA was esterified to a larger degree in mussels ( 81 % ) compared to oysters ( 64 % ) .
Result	Calculations of depuration rates for all individual esters of each parent compound showed that the esters of DTX1 depurated significantly slower from both mussels and oysters compared to esters of OA , DTX2 and PTX2 SA , but overall the depuration rates of
Result	This indicated that differences in depuration rates are not causing the large species-specific differences in levels and profiles of these toxins .
Result	Instead , the results for the OA-group toxins suggested that a higher rate of esterification in oysters is the main factor causing the observed differences in the proportion of esters to free toxin .
Result	For PTX2 SA , large differences in ester profiles and a higher proportion of esters of PTX2 SA in mussels compared to oysters suggested differential assimilation and metabolic rate processes for the PTXs compared to OA-group toxins between these species .
Result	Hence , although produced by the same Dinophysis species , conclusions about the dynamics of one toxin group based on results from the other group should be avoided in future studies .

Method	This paper reports a systematic review of seven studies evaluating the efficacy of cognitive behavioural therapy ( CBT ) for persistent primary insomnia .
Background	Insomnia is one of the most common health complaints reported in the primary care setting .
Background	Although non-pharmacological treatments such as the CBT have been suggested to be useful in combating the persistent insomnia , the efficacy and clinical utility of CBT for primary insomnia have yet to be determined .
Method	A systematic search of Ovid , MEDLINE , psychINFO , PsycARTICLES , CINAHL , and EMBASE databases of papers published between 1993 and 2004 was conducted , using the following medical subject headings or key words insomnia , primary insomnia , psychophysiological insomnia , sleep maintenance disorders , sleep initiation disorders , non-pharmacological treatment , and cognitive behavioural therapy .
Method	A total of seven papers was included in the review .
Result	Stimulus control , sleep restriction , sleep hygiene education and cognitive restructuring were the main treatment components .
Result	Interventions were provided by psychiatrists except for one study , in which the CBT was delivered by nurses .
Result	Among beneficial outcomes , improvement of sleep efficacy , sleep onset latency and wake after sleep onset were the most frequently reported .
Result	In addition , participants significantly reduced sleep medication use .
Result	Some studies gave follow-up data which indicated that the CBT produced durable clinical changes in total sleep time and night-time wakefulness .
Result	These randomized controlled trial studies demonstrated that CBT was superior to any single-component treatment such as stimulus control , relaxation training , educational programmes , or other control conditions .
Result	However , heterogeneity in patient assessment , CBT protocols , and outcome indicators made determination of the relative efficacy and clinical utility of the therapy difficult .
Result	Therefore , the standard components of CBT need to be clearly defined .
Result	In addition , a comprehensive assessment of patients is essential for future studies .

Background	Intracytoplasmic sperm injection ( ICSI ) , treatment of severe male infertility allows an accurate evaluation of oocyte maturity at recovery after corona-cell removal .
Result	In cycles comprising a GnRH analog desensitization and a stimulation by hMG or FSH , 12 % of oocytes aspirated from follicles ( > 14 mm ) , 34 hours post-hCG are still immature , in prophase or metaphase 1 .
Result	They are able to achieve meiosis in vitro in 66 % of the cases and will be fertilized ( 2 PN ) by ICSI in 51 % of the cases as the in vivo mature oocytes of the same cohort .
Result	Nevertheless , the quality of cytoplasmic maturation and consequently of embryonic viability remains to be assessed as there still are few pregnancies arising from in vitro matured oocytes .
Result	ICSI also represents the only way to obtain normal fertilization in some exceptional but observed anomalies of oocyte maturation , particularly when there is a lack of zona reaction leading to repetitive polyspermy in conventional IVF .

Background	Prior to undergoing conservative pelvic surgery for improvement of fertility , there must be meticulous preoperative evaluation .
Background	This evaluation involves a history , all previous records and operative reports , psychologic evaluation , physical examination , hysterosalpingogram , laparoscopy , and tests for male factor and ovulation .
Result	In history taking , the physician is most interested in past evidence of infection .
Result	The emotional status of the patient must be considered , especially for those individuals who are seeking sterilization reversal .
Result	Often , with a history of previous pelvic surgery the rate of success is lowered .
Result	Physical examination is usually not useful in predicting final outcome of microsurgery ; however , it does determine the patient 's general preoperative status .
Result	Hysterosalpingography and laparoscopy are complementary procedures which are the cornerstone of the preoperative evaluation .
Result	The 1st gives evidence of the status of the uterus and the tube proximal to the block , if 1 exists .
Result	If the block is in the isthmic portion , the hysterosalpingogram will indicate how much of the tube is patent next to the corpus .
Result	Preoperative laparoscopy is necessary for proper and complete evaluation of pelvic status ; it allows the operator to visualize the distal segment of the tube .
Result	Laparoscopy indicates the extent of pelvic adhesion , ovary and tube involvement , mobility of the tube , extent of fimbrial involvement , and presence of disease .
Result	When all factors are taken are into consideration , the surgeon must determine whether the benefits of surgery will outweigh the risks .
Result	Patient age , emotional needs , other parameters of fertility , status of tubes and ovaries , etc. must all be taken into consideration.evaluationfamily planninghysterosalpingographyinfertilitylaparoscopyreproductionreversible sterilizationsterilization rever

Background	The purpose of this study was to investigate the effect of alendronate on metacarpal and lumbar bone mineral density ( BMD ) , bone resorption , and chronic back pain in postmenopausal women with osteoporosis .
Method	Eighty postmenopausal women with osteoporosis , 59-88 years of age , were divided into two groups of 40 each according to the site of BMD measurement : the metacarpus ( M ) and the lumbar spine ( L ) .
Method	All of them were treated with alendronate ( 5 mg/day ) for 12 months .
Method	Metacarpal or lumbar BMD was measured by computed X-ray densitometry or dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry in the M or the L group , respectively , at baseline and every 6 months .
Method	Urinary cross-linked N-terminal telopeptides of type I collagen ( NTX ) were measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay , and chronic back pain was evaluated by face scale score at baseline and every 6 months in both groups .
Result	There were no significant differences in baseline characteristics , including age , body mass index , years since menopause , urinary NTX level , face scale score , or number of prevalent vertebral fractures per patient between the two groups .
Result	Urinary NTX level was reduced and chronic back pain was improved similarly in both groups .
Result	Whereas metacarpal BMD did not significantly change in the M group ( 0.20 % increase ) , lumbar BMD increased by 8.15 % in the L group .
Result	These results suggest that although alendronate increases BMD of the lumbar spine , which is rich in cancellous bone , and improves chronic back pain , with suppression of bone resorption in postmenopausal women with osteoporosis , it may fail to increase cor

Background	Pronounced , unexplained preoperative tachycardia can be a formidable challenge for the anesthesiologist .
Background	Whereas the relationship between persistent intraoperative tachycardia and perioperative morbidity is indisputable , there is a lack of available data on unexplained preoperative tachycardia .
Background	The main objective of this case series is to stimulate research and discussion on this topic , so that guidelines can be developed to aid in management .
Method	We present three patients with pronounced ( > or = 130 beats x min ( -1 ) ) unexplained preoperative tachycardia who suffered adverse perioperative events that were garnered from quality improvement records at two teaching hospitals .
Method	In the first case , a 38-yr-old woman with a lumbar spinal tumour went into ventricular fibrillation after induction of anesthesia and was found on subsequent evaluation to have an abnormal cardiac re-entrant pathway .
Method	In the second case , an otherwise healthy middle-aged man developed a wide complex tachycardia with hypotension during foot surgery , with the subsequent cardiac evaluation being negative .
Method	In the third case , a young , healthy woman scheduled for a melanoma incision developed crushing , substernal chest pain accompanied by nausea and shortness of valve prolapse with regurgitation .
Method	Before rescheduling the procedures , therapeutic interventions were undertaken that facilitated successful completion of the surgeries .
Result	There are currently no data regarding the prevalence of unexplained preoperative tachycardia , and no guidelines to direct management .
Result	More research is needed on this important topic , including epidemiological data and management algorithm ( s ) .

Method	After shorts general considerations about physiologic and epidemiologic features relative to sleep , snoring and apneas in elderly , authors bring analysis of 30 snorers over sixty years .
Background	They all had a sleep recording , a ENT examination , and a pharyngeal C.T. scan .
Result	The main results are following : the high frequency of Sleep Apnea Syndrome ( SAS ) over 60 is to be carefully considered .
Result	So , Sleep recording appears necessary in the main part of this population .
Result	Cardiovascular , pneumologic and neurologic disease are very often associated , and do constitute elements of therapeutic choice .
Result	Velopharyngeal narrowing , without other level of superior airway closure , is the usual case .
Result	Therapeutic management is often difficult ; there is a choice , in apneic patients , between Uvulo-Palato-Pharyngoplasty ( UPP ) , sometimes impossible because of associated pathology , and nocturnal Continuous Positive Airway Pressure ( CPAP ) , which employment i

Method	Fifty Suffolk-crossbred wether lambs , with an initial live weight of 29 + / - 2.1 kg , were allocated to one of five concentrate-based diets formulated to have a similar fatty acid content ( 60 g/kg DM ) , but containing either linseed oil ( high in 18:3 n-3 ) ; fi
Method	Lambs were slaughtered when they reached 40 kg .
Method	Growth performance and intake were similar ( P > 0.35 ) among treatments .
Result	By contrast , gain : feed was higher ( P < 0.05 ) in lambs fed the fish oil compared with the linseed oil or PLS/algae diets .
Result	Total fatty acid concentration ( mg/100 g ) in the neutral lipid of the longissimus muscle was not affected by treatment ( P > 0.87 ) but was least ( P < 0.05 ) in the phospholipid fraction in lambs fed the linseed oil diet .
Result	Lambs fed either diet containing marine algae contained the highest ( P < 0.05 ) percentage of 22:6 n-3 in the phospholipid ( mean of 5.2 % ) , 2.8-fold higher than in sheep fed the fish oil diet .
Result	In lambs fed the fish/algae diet , the percentage of 20:5 n-3 was highest ( P < 0.05 ) , contributing some 8.7 , 0.8 , and 0.5 % of the total fatty acids in the muscle phospholipid , neutral lipids , and adipose tissue , respectively .
Result	The percentage of 18:3 n-3 in the phospholipid fraction of the LM was highest ( P < 0.05 ) in lambs fed the linseed oil diet ( 6.9 % ) , a value double that of sheep fed the PLS diet .
Result	By contrast , lambs fed the PLS diet had twice the percentage of 18:3 n-3 in the muscle neutral lipids ( 3.8 % ) than those offered the linseed oil diet , and 5.5-fold greater than lambs fed the fish/algae treatment ( P < 0.05 ) , an effect that was similar in
Result	The percentage of 18:2 n-6 was highest ( P < 0.05 ) in lambs fed the PLS diet , where it contributed 33.7 , 10.1 , and 11.2 % in the muscle phospholipid , neutral lipids , and adipose tissue , respectively .
Result	The highest ( P < 0.05 ) muscle PUFA-to-saturated fatty acid ( P : S ) ratio was obtained in lambs fed the PLS diet ( 0.57 ) , followed by the PLS/algae diet ( 0.46 ) , and those fed the fish oil or linseed oil diets had the lowest ratios ( 0.19 and 0.26 , respectiv
Result	The favorable P : S ratio of lambs fed the PLS/algae diet , in conjunction with the increased levels of 20:5 n-3 and 22:6 n-3 , enhanced the nutritional qualities of lamb to more closely resemble what is recommended for the human diet .

Background	Our aim was to find out which factors favor the occurrence of pain in adult patients with Scheuermann 's disease -- a juvenile manifestation of osteochondrosis of the spine , to study the clinical and radiological signs , the role of rehabilitation and the mea
Method	Descriptive and retrospective study about 45 adults treated by rehabilitation .
Method	A data sheet listed the patient 's occupation , current practice of sport , antecedents ( violent sport , traumatism , pain ) , presence of a family form , motive of consultation , clinical and paraclinical examinations and immediate and long-term results of rehabilitation .
Result	Average age 35 years ( 18 to 65 ) , male predominance ( 1.8:1 ) , occupational risk factors : 16 % ; only 24 % practiced sports currently .
Result	Antecedents : sports 49 % , spinal column traumatism 13 % , dorsal and lumbar pain during adolescence 16 % .
Result	Consultation motive : abnormal posture 4 % and pain 96 % .
Result	According to the examination : abnormal spinal column in 80 % of cases .
Result	According to radiography , our patients were divided into 49 % who were carriers of growth vertebral dystrophy and 51 % who were carriers of the real Scheuermann 's disease .
Result	The immediate results of rehabilitation were satisfactory , 75 % of the results were very good and good .
Result	Between six months and four years , 70 % of the results were very satisfactory .
Result	Exercises were observed in only 11 % of the cases , and stopped after two months on average .
Result	Scheuermann 's disease in adults is a different entity from that of the teenager for the major manifestation is pain and not aesthetic quality .
Result	The patient 's occupation is rather sedentary ; sport is beneficial .
Result	The functional rehabilitation is the basic treatment and recourse to surgery or dorso-lumbar braces is rare .

Background	To examine the hypothesis that , apart from prematurity , intrauterine growth status ( expressed as gestational age specific birth weight standard deviation scores ) , neonatal factors , and duration of dexamethasone treatment influence bone mineralisation in e
Method	In this prospective study , groups consisted of 15 preterm small for gestational age infants ( SGA group ) and 43 preterm appropriate for gestational age infants ( AGA group ) .
Method	A reference group contained 17 term infants .
Method	Body size is known to affect bone mineral content ( BMC ) , therefore postnatal bone mineralisation was measured when the study infants and controls had attained a similar body size .
Method	Bone mineral density ( BMD ) and BMC were determined by dual energy x ray absorptiometer of the lumbar spine ( L2-L4 ) .
Result	Both preterm groups had significantly lower BMC and BMD than the weight matched term reference group , but no difference was found in BMC and BMD between preterm SGA and AGA infants .
Result	In stepwise regression analysis , bone area , duration of dexamethasone treatment , weight at examination , and weight gain per week were the most significant factors , explaining 54 % of the variance of the BMC values .
Result	In particular , weight at examination , prematurity , and possibly dexamethasone treatment , but not intrauterine growth status , affect postnatal bone mineralisation .

Method	Chicks , 8 days of age , were housed in a wind tunnel at temperatures from 12 to 28 C in increments of 4 C.
Method	The tunnel was equipped with a microswitch , an infrared bulb located above the switch , and a small electric fan controlled by a rheostat .
Method	Following learning , chicks were exposed at each temperature to air speeds of 0 , .5 , 1.0 , and 1.5 m/s according to a Latin-square design .
Result	Chicks readily responded to air speed and temperature changes .
Result	For each increase of .1 m/s the effective environmental temperature dropped .6 C.

Method	STUDY DESIGN : Case description .
Method	To describe a case of traumatic subluxation in association with a congenitally absent cervical pedicle , and review the pertinent medical literature .
Background	The congenital absence of a cervical pedicle is a relatively uncommon developmental anomaly that is frequently mistaken for a unilateral facet fracture-dislocation in the context of acute trauma .
Background	Because there is little evidence of recovery after surgery , and the symptoms are usually not disabling , surgery is not recommended for most cases .
Method	A 62-year-old man presented with severe neck and right shoulder pain after falling .
Method	Plain radiographs and computed tomography of the cervical spine showed the typical features of a congenitally absent pedicle at C6 with anterolisthesis of C6 on C7 .
Method	We performed anterior interbody fusion at C6-C7 because of persistent neck pain and progressive instability .
Result	Complete restoration of the C6-C7 subluxation was achieved with resolution of the presenting symptoms .
Result	At 18 months follow-up , flexion and extension dynamic radiographs demonstrated good alignment with solid fusion at C6-C7 .
Result	Although conservative treatment is the primary treatment for this clinical entity , surgery is an alternative option for those patients who fail to achieve recovery after conservative treatment or exhibit instability .

Background	Obsessive compulsive disorder is a common and disabling disorder .
Background	A significant proportion of patients manifest a chronic course .
Background	Individual randomised controlled trials ( RCTs ) have shown that selective serotonin re-uptake inhibitors ( SSRIs ) are effective in this condition .
Background	Previous systematic reviews or meta-analyses summarising the evidence are methodologically problematic or limited in the scope of their analysis .
Method	To examine the efficacy and adverse effects of serotonin re-uptake inhibitors ( SSRIs ) versus placebo for obsessive compulsive disorder ( OCD ) in adults .
Method	CCDANCTR-Studies and CCDANCTR-References were searched on 12/11/2007 .
Method	Reference lists were checked .
Method	Experts in the field were contacted .
Method	All RCTs and quasi-RCTs examining the efficacy of SSRIs compared with placebo for OCD in adults were eligible for inclusion .
Method	Selection of studies and data extraction were carried out by two review authors independently , and quality assessment of studies was undertaken .
Method	Data analysis was conducted using Review Manager software .
Method	Summary measures were produced using the weighted mean difference ( WMD ) for continuous data and relative risk ( RR ) for dichotomous data , with 95 % confidence intervals ( CI ) .
Method	SSRIs were examined as an overall group of drugs , and as individual drugs .
Result	Seventeen studies were included in the review , involving 3097 participants .
Result	Based on all 17 studies , SSRIs as a group were more effective than placebo in reducing the symptoms of OCD between 6 and 13 weeks post-treatment , measured using the Yale-Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale ( YBOCS ) ( WMD -3.21 , 95 % CI -3.84 to -2.57 ) .
Result	The WMD for individual SSRI drugs were similar and not statistically different .
Result	Based on 13 studies ( 2697 participants ) , SSRIs were more effective than placebo in achieving clinical response at post-treatment ( RR 1.84 , 95 % CI 1.56 to 2.17 ) .
Result	The pooled RR was shown to be similar between individual SSRI drugs .
Result	Although reported adverse effects data were more limited , with few exceptions , the overall and individual adverse effects for the different SSRIs were always worse than for placebo and , in the majority of cases , the difference was statistically significan
Result	Nausea , headache and insomnia were always reported amongst the most common adverse effects in trials of each of the drugs .
Result	SSRIs are more effective than placebo for OCD , at least in the short-term , although there are differences between the adverse effects of individual SSRI drugs .
Result	The longer term efficacy and tolerability of different SSRI drugs for OCD has yet to be established .

Background	Prenatal long-chain polyunsaturated fatty acids ( LCPUFAs ) and trans-fatty acids may affect neurodevelopment .
Background	In healthy term children , we determined relationships between relative fatty acid contents of umbilical arteries and veins and neurodevelopment at 18 mo. .
Method	The study comprised a mixed group of 317 breast-fed , formula-fed , and LCPUFA formula-fed children .
Method	Study endpoints were the Hempel neurologic examination resulting in a neurologic classification and neurologic optimality score ( NOS ) , and the Bayley Psychomotor Developmental Index ( PDI ) and Mental Developmental Index ( MDI ) .
Result	Fifteen children showed minor neurologic dysfunction ( MND ) .
Result	The umbilical vein trans , trans-18 :2 n-6 content was higher in children with MND than in the normal group .
Result	The NOS was significantly reduced in infants with an umbilical vein docosahexaenoic acid ( DHA ) content within the lowest quartile .
Result	Umbilical vein arachidonic acid ( AA ) was related to NOS in univariate statistics but not in multivariate analyses .
Result	The sum of trans-fatty acids and that of C18 trans-fatty acids showed a negative association with NOS in both univariate and multivariate analyses .
Result	No associations were found between AA , DHA and total trans-fatty acids with PDI or MDI .
Result	In conclusion , neonates with a relatively low DHA status and those with high trans-fatty acid levels have a less favorable neurologic condition at 18 mo. .

Background	We evaluated the efficacy of physiotherapy , occupational therapy , and speech and language therapy in Parkinson 's disease by synthesizing six Cochrane systematic reviews .
Method	All randomised , controlled trials examining the efficacy of a paramedical therapy versus control intervention and all those comparing the efficacy of two forms of active therapy in Parkinson 's disease were included .
Method	Trials were identified by searching biomedical databases , reference lists , hand searching , and contacting investigators .
Method	The main outcome measures were quality of life , speech intelligibility , activities of daily living , and individual measures of motor and speech impairment .
Result	We identified 16 physiotherapy randomised controlled trials ( 399 patients ) , two occupational therapy trials ( 84 patients ) , and five speech and language therapy for dysarthria trials ( 154 patients ) .
Result	None of these studies examined nonpharmacological swallowing therapy for dysphagia .
Result	We were unable to perform meta-analysis of the results because the trials used heterogeneous therapy methods and outcome measures .
Result	The trials also had marked methodological flaws that could have introduced bias .
Result	In summary , we failed to find conclusive evidence of benefit for any form of paramedical therapy sufficient to recommend them in routine clinical practice .
Result	However , this lack of evidence is not proof of a lack of effect .
Result	Further large pragmatic randomised controlled trials are required to determine the effectiveness of paramedical therapies in Parkinson 's disease .

Background	The purpose of this study was to assess factors that affect the quality of performance and interpretation of sonography of adnexal masses .
Method	Two gynecologic sonographers performed blinded reviews of up to 3 sonograms within 5 years before surgery in 325 consecutive women who underwent oophorectomy ( 610 sonograms ) .
Method	Three 5-point quality scores were assigned ( with 5 being the best score ) on the basis of the technical quality of the images , accurate description of findings , and summary impression in the report .
Method	The location of the examination ( on-site , remote , or emergency department ) , type of fellowship , practice experience ( < 5 , 5-10 , or > 10 years ) , and specialty ( women 's imaging , abdominal imaging , or other ) of the radiologists were recorded .
Method	Analysis of variance was used to assess the impact of these multiple factors on quality .
Result	No significant differences were found among 31 radiologists on the basis of the type of training , years in practice , or number of examinations read .
Result	Average scores among radiologists for technical quality , findings , and impressions were 4.96 , 4.88 , and 4.83 , respectively .
Result	Radiologists who specialized in women 's imaging performed best in the quality of their impressions ( 4.86 versus 4.79 ; P = .029 ) .
Result	There were no significant differences in scores with respect to the examination location .
Result	Within this sample of radiologists , the technical quality of the examinations was not affected by the type of training or subspecialty practice .
Result	Reports of adnexal mass findings were accurately described by all radiologists , although specialization in women 's imaging improved the ability to provide an accurate impression .

Background	OBJECTIVE -- To determine whether the additional costs of preconception care are balanced by the savings from averted complications .
Background	Several studies have demonstrated the efficacy of preconception care in reducing congenital anomalies in infants born of mothers with pre-existing diabetes mellitus .
Method	RESEARCH DESIGN AND METHODS -- This study used literature review , consensus development among an expert panel of physicians , and surveys of medical care personnel to obtain information about the costs and consequences of preconception plus prenatal care com
Background	Preconception care involves close interaction between the patient and an interdisciplinary health-care team as well as intensified evaluation , follow-up , testing , and monitoring .
Method	The outcome measures assessed in this study are the medical costs of preconception care versus prenatal care only and the benefit-cost ratio .
Result	RESULTS -- The costs of preconception plus prenatal care are $ 17,519 / delivery , whereas the costs of prenatal care only are $ 13,843 / delivery .
Result	Taking into account maternal and neonatal adverse outcomes , the net savings of preconception care are $ 1720/enrollee over prenatal care only and the benefit-cost ratio is 1.86 .
Result	The preconception care program remained cost saving across a wide range of assumptions regarding incidence of adverse outcomes and program cost components .
Result	CONCLUSIONS -- Despite significantly higher per delivery costs for participants in a hypothetical preconception care program , intensive medical care before conception resulted in cost savings compared with prenatal care only .
Result	Third-party payers can expect to realize cost savings by reimbursing preconception care in this high-risk population .

Background	The reported incidence of bone complications after radiation therapy is quite low .
Background	The most commonly seen bone complication is insufficiency fractures of the pubis and sacrum .
Background	Treatment of insufficiency fractures consists of conservative care , and mineral replacement may be useful .
Background	The resolution of symptoms takes at least one year with these treatments .
Background	Vascular damage has an important role in the etiology of late radiation injury in normal tissues .
Background	Progressive ischemic changes further weaken the bone structure , which can cause fractures , and healing is also delayed .
Background	Pentoxifylline is a methylxanthine derivative that is shown to increase tissue blood flow .
Method	Here , we present a 63-year-old male patient with pelvic insufficiency fractures due to postoperative pelvic irradiation for rectal adenocarcinoma .
Method	The patient received pelvic radiotherapy to a total dose of 50.4 Gy with concomitant 5-FU .
Method	Six months after the completion of radiotherapy , the patient presented with severe pelvic pain .
Result	Pelvic magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) demonstrated abnormal signal intensity with insufficiency fractures at the sacrum and bone marrow edema near the fractures , but not an abnormal intensity that revealed bone metastases .
Result	Neither distant nor locoregional recurrence was observed at his work-up .
Result	The final diagnosis was insufficiency fractures of the pelvic bones owing to irradiation , and pentoxifylline ( 400 mg , 3 times daily , peroral , 1,200 mg/day ) was used for eight months as treatment .
Result	Dramatic clinical improvement was obtained in six months , and objective healing was revealed with MRI .
Result	We concluded that pentoxifylline is a cost-effective drug with minimal adverse effects in treating radiation damage of bone .

Background	To develop a reliable , objective and sensitive measure of axial trunk rotations in PD , which can be applied in an ambulatory setting .
Method	To quantify turning motion , two angular velocity transducers attached to the lower back measured angular velocity of the trunk in the yaw plane ( i.e. , around the longitudinal axis ) and the roll plane ( i.e. , medio-lateral movements ) in freely moving subjec
Result	Turn duration was longer in PD patients compared to controls .
Result	Peak yaw and peak roll angular velocities were lower in PD patients compared to controls during all turning tasks .
Result	This new approach to measure trunk sway during a simple turning task might serve as an instrument to objectively quantify turning while walking in PD .
Result	It proves difficult to objectively assess turning performance based upon history taking or clinical examination alone .
Result	Objective and easy measurement of axial turning in PD might be used for clinical evaluation , but also in a domestic setting as outcome measure in intervention studies .
Result	Further research should focus on the clinical relevance of the new quantitative approach described in this paper , e.g. , to detect freezing of gait episodes .

Background	The objective was to study the effectiveness of a modified washing toilet seat equipped with a CCD camera monitor and an electronic bidet to facilitate precise hitting of the anal area with water streams to stimulate bowel movement in patients with spinal
Method	There were 20 subjects , all of whom had traumatic SCI , were at least 5 mos post acute injury , and could change their position on the toilet seat while watching the monitor .
Method	Stimulation of bowel movement with the modified toilet seat was provided for a maximum of 30 mins .
Method	Success or failure to induce bowel movement was evaluated as related to injury level , ASIA impairment scale , and ability to voluntarily increase anorectal pressure , measured with a manometory .
Result	Bowel movement was successfully induced in 15 of the 20 patients ( 75 % ) .
Result	Success was not related significantly to injury level , ASIA impairment scale , or ability to voluntarily squeeze .
Result	Compared with their usual manner of bowel management , for which they spent more than 30 mins , time needed for successful bowel movement was shortened in 11 of 13 patients .
Result	No complications were observed .
Result	This preliminary study suggests that our newly modified washing toilet seat with a monitoring system could be a useful alternative for bowel management in patients with SCI .

Method	A retrospective study of 63 obese patients seen in a hospital outpatient nutrition clinic was reported .
Method	The majority suffered from one or more other medical problems .
Method	The relationship of amount of and rate of weight loss to various factors was examined .
Result	The multivariate analysis revealed that either the amount or rate of weight loss was greater in the patients who were more overweight initially , white , male , young , single , older at age of onset of obesity , visited the clinic for a longer period of time b
Result	Conversely , the amount or rate of weight loss was less in those patients receiving conjugated estrogens , oral contraceptives , propranolol , thioridazine HCl , and those who were receiving behavior modification as treatment.age factorsbehaviorbiologybody wei

Background	Eighteen well motivated patients with advanced chronic obstructive pulmonary disease , who had had at least four hospitalizations during the previous two years , were included in a home-based telemedicine study .
Method	A visiting nurse was equipped with a case containing a laptop computer and a number of medical devices , including an electrocardiogram recorder , spirometer , oximeter and blood pressure monitor .
Method	It also contained a videoconference camera , for realtime audiovisual connection with the hospital using the patient 's TV set .
Method	A single ISDN line ( 128 kbit/s ) was installed in each house before the study began .
Result	After nine months , there was a decrease in hospitalizations , emergency department visits and use of health services .
Result	The patient 's disease knowledge and self-management also improved .
Result	It seems likely that adopting telemedicine in everyday clinical practice could substantially improve the care of chronically ill patients .

Background	The significant morbidity and mortality associated with severe depression and its psychotic or melancholic subtypes necessitate effective and well-tolerated therapy .
Background	This review evaluates antidepressant treatments for patients with severe depression .
Method	Comparative clinical trials conducted on patients with severe depression were found by an English-language MEDLINE search ( 1985 to present ) .
Method	Additional studies were identified in article bibliographies .
Method	Search terms included depressive disorders , depression and severe , hospitalized , melancholic or melancholia , psychotic , and endogenous .
Result	Evidence for efficacy of SSRIs in severe or melancholic depression comes from a small but growing number of controlled studies with adequate samples , as well as meta-analyses and retrospective subgroup analysis of premarketing trials .
Result	In studies that defined response as a 50 % or greater reduction in Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression ( HAM-D ) scores , response rates ranged from 53 % to 64 % for SSRIs and 43 % to 70 % for TCAs .
Result	In separate trials on severe depression , venlafaxine and mirtazapine were both more effective than placebo and an active comparator .
Result	Nefazodone and bupropion were each found to be more effective than placebo in studies of severe depression .
Result	Venlafaxine and mirtazapine have been found to be more effective than fluoxetine .
Result	SSRIs and TCAs are comparably effective for the treatment of severe or melancholic depression .
Result	SSRIs and other newer agents appear to be better tolerated than TCAs , specifically lacking adverse anticholinergic and cardiovascular effects that may limit the use of TCAs .
Result	Emerging data with venlafaxine and mirtazapine in severely depressed patients with or without melancholia support the efficacy of these treatments .
Result	Nefazodone and bupropion were found to be effective in hospitalized depressed patients .
Result	Electroconvulsive therapy ( ECT ) or combined antidepressant therapy may be useful in some patients with severe depression .
Result	Patients with severe psychotic depression may respond better to an antipsychotic-antidepressant combination .

Background	A 78-year-old male patient had chronic , unrelieved abdominal pain due to mesenteric ischaemia .
Background	Unsuccessful pharmacological approaches included oral morphine plus coadjuvants as well as a sympathetic celiac plexus block which gave pain relief that lasted for 72 h.
Method	In order to obtain long-lasting relief , a trial epidural stimulating electrode was implanted after obtaining informed consent and Ethical Committee approval .
Result	Complete analgesia was achieved during a trial period of 2 weeks .
Result	Thereafter , a spinal cord stimulator was implanted .
Result	At the time of writing , 11 months after implantation , the degree of analgesia is complete .
Result	We believe that spinal cord stimulation may represent an alternative approach in controlling pain due to mesenteric ischaemia .

Background	The levels of Cognitive Functioning Assessment Scale ( LOCFAS ) is a behavioral checklist that includes behaviors commonly seen in patients during the earliest stages of recovery from traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) .
Method	The LOCFAS and the Disability Rating Scale were used four times each week to evaluate 28 patients who had had TBI ; this was done throughout their acute care hospitalization .
Method	The Glasgow Coma Scale , Stover-Zeiger Scale , and Expanded Glasgow Outcome Scale also were used to evaluate patients at their initial assessment and at the time of their discharge .
Result	Concurrent validity ( r > .85 ) , both at the initial assessment and discharge , and predictive validity ( r > .70 ) were high .
Result	The daily stability and interrater reliability ( r = .99 ) of the LOCFAS also were good .

Background	A majority of psychiatric medications are known to generate weight gain and ultimately obesity in some patients .
Background	There is much speculation about the prevalence of weight gain and the degree of weight gain during acute and longitudinal treatment with these agents .
Background	There is newer literature looking at the aetiology of this weight gain and the potential treatments being used to alleviate this side-effect .
Background	We found solid evidence that weight gain is often associated with the mood stabilizers , and antipsychotics and antidepressants .
Background	Only few weight neutral or weight loss producing psychotropics are available , and weight gain , outside of an immediate side-effect , may generate secondary side-effects and medical comorbidity .
Background	Given the likelihood of inducing weight gain with psychotropic medications and the longitudinal impact on physical health , a thorough literatu

Background	Since the advent of fiberoptic endoscopy and the introduction of colonoscopic polypectomy , a simple and cost-effective procedure has been available to deal with an exceedingly common problem , the colonic polyp .
Background	Although polyps in the gastrointestinal tract have a varied natural history , there is strong evidence that adenomatous colonic polyps have a potential for malignant degeneration and that virtually all colorectal cancers arise from adenomatous polyps .
Background	This article will review some basic features of the endoscopic approaches and problems associated with polypectomy .

Method	In a pilot study six patients with active ulcerative colitis and six healthy controls were given fish oil ( MaxEPA ) containing 3-4 g of eicosapentaenoic acid daily for a period of 12 weeks .
Result	There was a significant improvement in the patients ' symptoms and histological appearance of the rectal mucosa by the end of the treatment period .
Result	There was significant fall in neutrophil chemiluminescence during treatment in patients , whereas no change was observed in the control group .
Result	Neutrophil leukotriene B4 levels fell significantly during treatment .
Result	Serum from patients receiving fish oil was significantly less chemotactic for neutrophils compared with control serum .
Result	Eicosapentaenoic acid inhibited neutrophil chemotaxis and chemiluminescence in vitro .
Result	The omega-3 fatty acids , which occur naturally in fish oils , may exert a beneficial effect by decreasing the production of inflammatory mediators .

Background	At present there are no standardized recommendations concerning physiotherapy of individuals with traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) resulting in a high variability of methods and intensity .
Method	The aim of this literature review is to develop recommendations concerning physiotherapy in the post-acute phase after TBI on the basis of scientific evidence .
Method	METHOD : literature review : data bases : PubMed , PEDro , OT-Seeker , Cochrane and Cinahl .
Method	Keywords brain injury ( in PEDro , OT-Seeker , Cochrane ) , brain injury AND physical therapy ( in PubMed and Cinahl ) .
Method	Fourteen studies met the inclusion criteria and were grouped into sub-groups sensory stimulation , therapy intensity , casting/splinting , exercise or aerobic training and functional skill training .
Result	While for sensory stimulation evidence could not be proven , a strong evidence exists that more intensive rehabilitation programmes lead to earlier functional abilities .
Result	The recommendation due to casting for the improvement of passive range of motion is a grade B , while only a C recommendation is appropriate concerning tonus reduction .
Result	Strong evidence exists that intensive task-orientated rehabilitation programmes lead to earlier and better functional abilities .
Result	Although some recommendations for the effectiveness of physical therapy interventions could be expressed , there are many questions concerning the treatment of humans with TBI which have not been investigated so far .
Result	Especially on the level of activity and participation only a few studies exist .

Method	From this and the previous article , the following points may be offered in summary
Result	When comparing the elderly age group with the general population , the incidence of migraine headaches decreases with age , whereas other etiologies such as glaucoma , temporal arteritis , and cerebrovascular disease may assume a more prominent role in the di
Result	Patients in the geriatric population are frequently taking a multitude of medications , and it is extremely important to carefully evaluate these for possible precipitants of headache .
Result	Furthermore , in elderly patients with other potential medical problems , particular attention should be paid to the possibility of various systemic causes of headache .
Result	Therapy for specific headache disorders should be tailored to the individual patient .
Result	Consider the patient 's overall general , psychological , medical , and neurologic background .
Result	The physician must be aware of possible interactions of medications with the therapeutic intervention , as well as possible poor tolerance to specific medications due to preexisting medical or neurologic disorders .
Result	A complete history , obtaining information on the temporal pattern of headache , the distribution of pain , and precipitating and alleviating factors , is extremely important in evaluating the elderly patient .
Result	A careful physical examination , paying particular attention to possible disorders of extracranial structures , is indicated .
Result	A neurologic exam , including basic tests of higher cortical function , should be obtained .
Result	Important additional laboratory investigations include a complete blood count , erythrocyte sedimentation rate , and basic blood chemistries .
