Background	Mayo Clinic has a long-standing reputation as a leader in the basic and clinical sciences .
Background	However , there is little in the published literature about Mayo Clinic 's contributions to the delivery of health care services .
Background	This article is an overview of what Mayo brought to health care delivery between the 1860s and the 1980s , highlighting some of the lesser-known innovations that have influenced health care delivery on a national and international level such as the develop

Background	For the diagnosis and differential diagnosis of malignant tumors of the ovaries , transvaginal ultrasound is currently the preferred method .
Background	Ultrasound is indispensable for the pre-operative assessment of the biological significance of an ovarian tumor .
Background	With its aid , the indication for a surgical procedure can be established with a high degree of sensitivity and specificity and , where appropriate , the therapeutic approach definitively established .
Background	A further important application is screening for the early detection of an ovarian cancer .
Result	Although a high level of sensitivity and specificity can also be achieved for such an indication , an otherwise desirable screening procedure -- at least in high-risk groups and post-menopausal women -- is nevertheless controversial on account of the low preva

Background	Obesity is associated with increased morbidity and mortality from atherosclerotic disease .
Background	Lipid abnormalities contribute to the increased relative risk in obese subjects .
Background	Cholesteryl ester transfer protein ( CETP ) mass is increased in these patients and might mediate the atherogenic lipoprotein pattern observed in obesity .
Method	Twenty-one morbidly obese , middle-aged , female subjects participated in this prospective study .
Method	Subjects were examined before and 1 year after surgical treatment .
Method	Fat mass was determined by body impedance analysis ; CETP mass , by ELISA ; CETP activity , by exogenous substrate assay ; and LDL particle diameter , by gradient gel electrophoresis .
Result	Mean weight loss after 1 year was 28.7 kg ; mean fat mass loss was 22.6 kg .
Result	Mean CETP mass decreased from 1.81 to 1.32 microg/mL ( P = 0.008 ) ; mean CETP activity decreased from 244 to 184 nmol x mL ( -1 ) x h ( -1 ) ( P = 0.004 ) ; and in parallel , the mean diameter of LDL particles increased ( 256.8 to 258.4 A , P = 0.04 ) .
Result	We conclude that weight loss is associated with a pronounced decrease in CETP mass and activity and a consistent increase in LDL particle diameter .
Result	After 1 year of this prospective study in morbidly obese subjects undergoing weight loss by surgical treatment , it has been determined that some features of the atherogenic lipoprotein profile can be reversed .

Background	This study determined whether maternal glucose tolerance has a progressive effect on the length of gestation in singleton pregnancies and whether there is an increasing tendency towards spontaneous preterm birth with increasing glucose intolerance .
Method	A total of 2,168 consecutive Chinese women with singleton pregnancies who underwent the 75-g oral glucose tolerance test ( OGTT ) over a 24-month period were categorized by their OGTT 2-hour value ( mmol/L ) into the following six groups : 5.9 or less , 6.0-6 .9
Method	Women with a 2-hour glucose value of 8.0 or more mmol/L were considered to have gestational diabetes mellitus ( GDM ) and received diet treatment .
Method	Women who eventually required insulin were excluded from the final analysis .
Method	The mean gestational age , birth weight , incidence of preterm birth , large for gestational age ( LGA , birth weight > 90th percentile ) , and macrosomic ( birth weight > or = 4.0 kg ) infants were compared among the six groups .
Result	The incidence of preterm birth correlated significantly with increasing glucose intolerance .
Result	On further analysis , incidence of spontaneous birth before 37 weeks in the lowest to the highest 2-hour value groups was as follows : 5.5 % , 2.6 % , 3.7 % , 4.9 % , 8.5 % , and 10.3 % ( P = .015 ) and that before 32 weeks went from 0.4 % , 0.3 % , 0.8 % , 0.4 % , 2.2 % , to 3.4 %
Result	There was no significant difference in the incidence of LGA or macrosomic infants .
Result	Regression analysis confirmed that the OGTT 2-hour glucose value was an independent determinant of gestational length .
Result	Gestational glucose intolerance affects gestation length and incidence of preterm birth , which should be considered a confounding factor in the analysis of the neonatal outcome of GDM pregnancies .

Method	The purpose of this interpretive phenomenological study was to generate knowledge about the experience of living with the diagnosis of borderline personality disorder .
Method	Persons identified as meeting DSM-III-R ( American Psychiatric Association , 1987 ) or DSM-IV ( American Psychiatric Association , 1994 ) criteria for borderline personality disorder were invited to participate in a private interview focusing on what it means t
Method	The data were analyzed using the procedures of interpretive phenomenological data analysis ( Benner , 1994 ; Diekelmann , Allen , & Tanner , 1989 ) .
Result	Three themes were identified : ( a ) living with a label , ( b ) living with self-destructive behavior perceived as manipulation , and ( c ) living with limited access to care .
Result	The findings suggest that mental health care for persons with borderline personality disorder could be improved by confronting prejudice , understanding self-harm , and safeguarding opportunities for dialogue .

Background	To evaluate the feasibility of using a newly developed electromechanical gait device ( LokoHelp ) for locomotion training in neurological patients with impaired walking ability with respect to training effects and patients ' and therapists ' efforts and disco
Method	METHODS AND PROCEDURES : design : Case series .
Method	setting
Method	A neurological rehabilitation centre for children , adolescents and young adults .
Method	subjects
Method	Six patients with impaired walking function : two after stroke , two after spinal cord injury and two after brain injury .
Method	Intervention
Method	Twenty additional training sessions on a treadmill fitted with a newly developed electromechanical gait device and body weight support ( BWS ) , performed over a study-period of 6 weeks .
Method	Patients ' progress was assessed with the following instruments the Functional Ambulation Category FAC ( walking ability ) , the 10-metre walk test ( gait velocity ) , the Motricity Index ( lower limb strength ) , the Berg Balance Scale ( postural capacity ) , the modified Ashworth Scale ( spasticity ) and the Rivermead Mobility Index ( activity ) .
Method	After each therapy session , therapists completed a form , thereby indicating whether manual assistance was necessary and , if so , how much physical effort was expended and how much discomfort was experienced during the therapy session .
Result	The therapists also indicated on the form information about the patient 's effort and discomfort .
Result	No severe adverse events were observed during the locomotion training with the LokoHelp device .
Result	Patients improved with regard to Functional Ambulation Category ( FAC ) ( from mean 0.7 , SD = 1.6 , to mean 2.5 , SD = 2.1 , p = 0.048 ) , Motricity Index ( from mean 94 points , SD = 50 , to mean 111 , SD = 52 , p = 0.086 ) , Berg Balance Scale ( BBS ) ( from mean 20 poin
Result	Therapists required a low level of effort to carry out the training and seldom experienced discomfort .
Result	Patients described their effort during training as being low-to-exhausting .
Result	They rarely experienced discomfort , which was mostly related to difficulties with the BWS-System .
Result	Training intensity had to be adjusted in one patient who complained of knee pain .
Result	Locomotion training with the newly developed ` LokoHelp ' - system is feasible in severely affected patients after brain injury , stroke and spinal cord injury .
Result	In addition , our results indicate that the described alternative method of gait training may decrease the exertion needed by therapists to carry out the training .

Background	Here we report the first case of prenatally diagnosed fetal renal mesoblastic nephroma occurring after transfer of a cryopreserved embryo .
Background	A 37 year old woman , having immunological infertility , was treated by in-vitro fertilization ( IVF ) and embryo transfer .
Method	Following unsuccessful IVF using fresh embryos , the patient conceived after transfer of cryopreserved-thawed embryos .
Background	The chromosomal analysis identified a normal karyotype at 16 weeks ' gestation when amniocentesis was performed .
Background	The pregnancy course was uneventful until 28 weeks ' gestation when polyhydramnios associated with fetal renal tumour was detected using ultrasonography .
Result	A male infant weighing 2564 g was born via Caesarean section at 34 weeks ' gestation .
Result	A left nephrectomy was performed 5 days after delivery and the tumour was identified histologically as a mesoblastic nephroma .
Result	The postoperative course was uncomplicated to this point .

Background	To test the effectiveness of a home based developmental education intervention in improving outcome at 5 years for very preterm infants .
Method	The Avon Premature Infant Project ( APIP ) is a randomised controlled trial in which the parents of 284 babies born < 33 weeks gestational age received a developmental education programme , a social support intervention , or standard care .
Method	A term reference population was also recruited .
Method	This study reports outcomes at 5 years ( mean age 58 months 15 days ) for 187 ( 66 % ) of these children without disability .
Method	Outcomes were assessed using the British Ability Scales II for cognitive development , the Movement ABC for motor impairment , and the Child Behavior Checklist for behavioural problems .
Result	Preterm infants showed poorer cognitive performance than their term peers .
Result	Mean ( SD ) general conceptual ability ( GCA ) scores were : Portage 99.2 ( 15.7 ) ; parent adviser 100.3 ( 14.8 ) ; preterm control 101.1 ( 15.0 ) ; term reference 107.2 ( 13.4 ) .
Result	There were no significant differences between preterm groups in GCA scores indicating no effect of either intervention .
Result	Similarly , there was no significant effect of intervention on behavioural or motor outcomes .
Result	Further analyses , in which outcome data were adjusted for social factors , did not reveal any differences between the three preterm groups or by subgroups classified by a range of perinatal variables .
Result	The small advantage shown at 2 years of age is no longer detectable at 5 years .
Result	These results question the effectiveness of early intervention in enhancing cognitive , behavioural , and motor function at 5 years .

Method	A retrospective review .
Method	The purpose of this study is to document a series of cases of neurologic deficit following percutaneous vertebral stabilization , to identify patterns of neurologic injury , and to describe potential methods for avoiding these injuries .
Background	Percutaneous vertebral stabilization procedures , including vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty , have become a widely used for the treatment of osteoporotic vertebral compression fractures , primary and metastatic vertebral tumors , and traumatic burst fractures .
Background	Despite an increasing array of indications , there have been few reports of adverse events .
Background	Neurologic complications associated with vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty have been described previously as case reports and have generally been considered as infrequent and minor in severity .
Method	The clinical course of 14 patients with documented loss of neurologic function following percutaneous vertebral cement augmentation was retrospectively reviewed .
Method	The average patient age was 74.9 years ( range , 46-88 years ) with 3 male and 11 female patients .
Result	Four patients underwent a vertebroplasty procedure while 10 were treated with kyphoplasty .
Result	Six patients developed neurologic deficits acutely ( < 24 hours of procedure ) .
Result	The remaining 8 patients developed neurologic symptoms at an average of 37.1 days ( range , 3-112 days ) postprocedure .
Result	Neurologic deficits were recorded as ASIA A in 4 patients , ASIA B in 2 patients , ASIA C in 1 patient , and ASIA D in 7 patients .
Result	Twelve of 14 patients ( 85.7 % ) required revision open surgical intervention for treatment of their neurologic injury .
Result	Percutaneous vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty have been reported to be safe options for the treatment of painful osteoporotic vertebral fractures .
Result	Although complications are infrequent , there remains the potential for catastrophic neurologic injury .
Result	Physicians performing these procedures need to be aware of these potential complications and be prepared to respond in an emergent manner ( surgically ) if a need arises .

Background	State government entities have created a range of innovative electronic information systems to support their diverse and evolving roles in the health care system .
Background	Primary goals of these initiatives include improvement of traditional public health programs , meaningful oversight of providers , simplification of administrative procedures , and support of state purchasing decisions .
Background	We establish a taxonomy of state efforts , describing primary capabilities to ( 1 ) provide meaningful data to state decisionmakers ; ( 2 ) disseminate information to purchasers and consumers ; ( 3 ) coordinate and improve government services ; ( 4 ) establish mechan
Background	Reductions in the costs of technology and use of the Internet have dramatically increased state capabilities in recent years .
Background	Both the successes and failures of existing programs offer important lessons for states that are initiating new electronic communication initiatives .

Background	Balancing risks and benefits of fish consumption is now a high visibility public health topic .
Background	Many studies identify health benefits of eating fish , both for prenatal development and adult cardiovascular conditions , partly attributed to omega-3 ( n-3 ) polyunsaturated fatty acids or PUFAs ) .
Background	Many reports raise concerns about methylmercury and polychlorinated biphenyl effects on the developing fetal brain ( although adults , too , can manifest methylmercury effects ) .
Background	Most reports and advisories focus on recreational or subsistence fish , but the vast majority of people obtain most or all of their fish from commercial sources .
Method	Our analysis of the nine most common fish in New Jersey markets , yielded a weighted average methylmercury concentration of 0.23 ug/g ( ppm wet weight ) .
Background	There are great disparities in the amount and distribution of both PUFAs and contaminants ) in different fish species .
Background	Recognizing that both benefits and harm must be related to dose , we propose a compound dose-response curve , currently based on limited data , to identify a zone of benefit , above the benefit threshold and below the harm threshold .
Background	The duration of pregnancy and birth weight improve at a benefit threshold of about 8-15 g/day maternal fish intake .
Result	Meta-analyses reveal adult cardiovascular benefits around 7.5-22 .5 g/day bracket ( assuming an 8 ounce/227 g typical meal ) , yielding a midpoint also at 15 g/day , but this is an artifact of the intake stratification .
Result	Benefit asymptotes are harder to extract , but are above 45 g/day , and in some studies exceed 100g/day .
Result	Using the EPA Reference Dose of 0.1 ug/kg day as a methylmercury threshold , The fish intake threshold for harm converts to 27 g/day ( for a selection of common commercial fish averaging 0.23 ppm MeHg ) to 65 g/day for someone choosing fish low in MeHg ( 0.1
Result	However , these are worst case thresholds since the RfD includes uncertainty factors .
Result	Some people eat much more than 65 g/day .
Result	The shape of the dose-benefit and dose-harm curves require better data for estimating thresholds and asymptotes , which will impact the composite curve .
Result	We propose this approach clarifies the kinds of data needed to improve risk communication on `` what should I eat '' .
Result	Benefits from fish consumption are confounded by socioeconomic class and/or by the avoidance of more harmful foods that fish replaces , which may be as important a benefit mechanism as the PUFA content .
Result	Additional studies with better dose-reconstruction are needed and large scale intervention studies are desirable .

Background	Expression of nitric oxide synthase ( NOS ) mRNA in post mortem brain was studied in putamen , globus pallidus and subthalamic nucleus ( STN ) of neurologically normal control subjects and patients with Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) using in situ hybridization hist
Result	In PD , a significant increase in NOS mRNA expression was observed in the dorsal two-thirds of the STN with respect to the ventral one-third of the STN .
Result	A significant increase in NOS mRNA expression per cell in the medial medullary lamina of the globus pallidus was also observed in PD .
Result	NOS mRNA expression was significantly reduced in PD putamen .
Result	These findings provide evidence of increased activity of STN neurotransmitter systems in PD and demonstrate for the first time in any species that basal ganglia nitric oxide systems can be selectively regulated in response to changes in dopaminergic input

Background	Morphine-induced constipation can lead to therapeutic disasters by several mechanisms .
Background	It can be readily prevented by administration of appropriate laxatives , but the importance of this simple intervention is often overlooked .
Background	Problems resulting from uncontrolled constipation include not only fecal impaction and spurious diarrhea , but also pseudoobstruction of bowel causing abdominal pain , nausea and vomiting , and serious interference with drug administration and absorption .
Background	Cancer pain may also be exacerbated .
Background	All of these contribute unnecessarily to morbidity and costs of health care .
Background	A case that exemplifies many of these problems is presented and discussed .

Background	The systematic recording of birthweight seems to have begun in Paris in 1802 and now birthweight is an essential piece of information which is part of the statutory notification of birth .
Background	Low birthweight infants make a disproportionate contribution to perinatal mortality .
Background	Reducing the incidence of low birthweight is more significant , clinically , than a rise in mean birthweight .
Background	Genetic factors , important in determining ultimate size , do not seem to have much influence on birthweight .
Background	The variation in birthweight between different ethnic groups is well documented .
Method	Meredith ( 1970 ) reviewed the world literature .
Background	Low mean birthweights were recorded almost exclusively in Africa , India , and the Far East , whereas the high means occurred mainly among Europeans and white Americans .
Background	In areas with high levels of immigration , medical professionals are conscious of the need for accurate information about ethnic groups , but the subject is associated with numerous problems .
Background	To compare ethnic groups , for whatever purpose , the epidemiologist needs to negotiate a `` minefield '' of social variables , nutritional uncertainties , and racial sensitivities .
Background	The members of a given ethnic group share both a genetic inheritance and a similar geographical , social , and cultural background .
Background	All of these must be considered .
Background	Immigration has provided an opportunity to study the effect of social and cultural adaptation and to identify those features which are apparently immutable .
Background	At the recent conference at the Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists on the obstetric problems of Asian immigrants in Britain , it was shown that poor fetal growth is associated with deficiencies of minerals and protein due to dietary habits .
Background	Viegas et al. ( 1982 ) suggested that birthweights can be increased by giving protein supplements to Asian women during the 3rd trimester .
Background	In Israel the problems are very different .
Background	Israel contains a variety of immigrants at various stages of cultural assimilation .
Background	Marked differences have been observed between Jewish immigrants from Europe , the US , North Africa , and the Middle East who , although all Jewish , differed in cultural and genetic background .
Result	Babies born to mothers who came from North Africa were , on the average , heavier than those of other ethnic groups , in spite of lower social class .
Result	Yet , the birthweight advantage was eroded with adaptation to Israeli culture .
Result	The issue is whether these differences in birthweight matter.biologybirth weightbody weightcultural backgroundculturedemographic factorsenglandethnic groupsinternational migrationisraelmigrationphysiologypopulationpopulation characteristics

Background	In order to clarify whether or not marked changes in the social environment during the past 50 years in Japan may have altered the clinical phenotypes of multiple sclerosis ( MS ) , we retrospectively analyzed 143 consecutive patients with clinically definit
Result	Fifty-two patients were classified as Asian type MS showing a selective involvement of the optic nerves and the spinal cord , while 91 patients were considered to have Western type MS which demonstrated the involvement of multiple sites in the central nerv

Result	As a result , the proportion of Asian type MS significantly decreased in the patients born after 1960 as compared with those born from 1930 to 1959 ( P = 0.0121 ) .

Background	The aim of this study was to evaluate retrospectively the tolerability , safety and efficacy of antialdosterone therapy in patients with heart failure admitted to our ambulatory from June 1995 to September 2003 .
Method	One hundred and fifty-seven consecutive patients ( mean age 64 + / - 11.6 years ) were enrolled in the study ; they were in NYHA class I-IV , on ACE-inhibitor or angiotensin receptor blocker therapy , and were treated with canrenone if they were in NYHA class I -
Method	The mean follow-up was 38.7 + / - 21.2 months .
Method	Patients were divided into two groups according to either therapy ( group 1 : 124 patients , 79 % , on antialdosterone therapy ; group 2 : 33 patients , 21 % , on no antialdosterone therapy ) or ischemic and non-ischemic etiology ( group A : 71 patients , 45.2 % , and gr
Method	Serum creatinine and plasma potassium levels , left ventricular ejection fraction , NYHA class , adverse effects , and mortality were evaluated .
Result	The mean dose of canrenone was 37 + / - 19.9 mg/day .
Result	Creatinine levels did not change significantly whereas potassium levels slightly increased in group 1 vs group 2 ( p < 0.01 ) and in group A vs group B ( p < 0.01 ) .
Result	Treatment was discontinued by only 12 patients ( 8.1 % ) due to hyperkalemia in 8 cases ( 6.5 % ) , gynecomastia in 2 cases ( 1.6 % ) , urticaria in 1 case ( 0.8 % ) , and nausea in 1 case ( 0.8 % ) .
Result	Left ventricular ejection fraction increased in all groups ( p < 0.001 ) with the exception of the subgroup B/group 2 ( p = NS ) .
Result	The NYHA class improved significantly in group 1 ( p < 0.01 ) .
Result	The total mortality rate was 10.8 % ( 17 cases ) , of which 10.5 % ( 13 cases ) in group 1 and 12.1 % ( 4 cases ) in group 2 and due to sudden death in 3 group 1 patients ( 2.4 % ) and in 2 group 2 patients ( 6 % ) .
Result	This study shows a good tolerability , safety , and efficacy , and poor adverse effects of canrenone therapy in combination with ACE-inhibitors , angiotensin receptor blockers and beta-blockers in patients with chronic heart failure .
Result	Therapy should be monitored by serial clinical and laboratory controls and gradually titrated up to the maximal tolerated dosage .

Background	To assess the effect of assisted conception ( AC ) on retinopathy of prematurity ( ROP ) and ROP screening .
Method	Follow-up to the study by McKibbin et al. .
Method	Retrospective study utilising computerised databases of ROP screening , live births , AC and multiple births between 1st April 2000 and 31st August 2003 at St James 's Hospital ( SJUH ) Leeds .
Method	chi ( 2 ) tests of significance were used .
Result	ROP screening was undertaken in 11/265 ( 4.2 % ) of AC births versus 1.6 % of all SJUH births .
Result	This is significantly less than the 20.3 % of AC babies screened in McKibbin et al study ( P = < 0.01 ) .
Result	There was no ROP detected in the 11 AC babies .
Result	Of all AC births , 36.9 % were one of twins and 1.5 % from triplet births compared to 46.0 % one of twins and 18.6 % one of triplets in McKibbin 's study .
Result	The percentage of AC babies requiring ROP screening has fallen since McKibbin et al study which was performed between August 1991 and December 1994 .
Result	This appears to be at least partially due to the reduced multiple birth rates .
Result	This reduction in the multiple birth rates follows evidence that reducing the number of embryos transferred does not reduce the number of couples taking home a baby and Human Fertility and Embryology Association guidelines recommending ` no more than two e
Result	Changes in clinical practice at SJUH have significantly reduced the likelihood of AC babies requiring ROP screening and developing ROP .

Background	To date , five single base pair changes of the mitochondrial DNA have been reported to occur either exclusively or with increased frequency in Caucasian patients with Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) and it has been postulated that these mutations might be casuall
Method	To evaluate these findings , we analysed the frequency of all five polymorphisms in 100 cases of pathologically proven cases of PD .
Result	We were either unable to detect the previously described polymorphisms in our series or found them to be present with the same frequency among controls .
Result	Our data do not support the hypothesis of an involvement of the mitochondrial DNA in the pathogenesis of PD .

Background	Ovarian damage following cancer therapy is dependent on age at treatment as well as the type of therapeutic exposures .
Background	Older age and exposure to higher doses of alkylating agents and higher doses of radiation to the ovary are associated with a greater likelihood of ovarian failure .
Background	Acute loss of ovarian function during or shortly following treatment is relatively uncommon in females treated during childhood and adolescence but can be seen following myeloablative , alkylator-based cytoreduction ( e.g. , busulfan and cyclophosphamide ) fo
Result	For survivors who retain normal ovarian function after cancer therapy , there is an increased risk of premature menopause later in life .
Result	The risk factors associated with an early menopause include exposure to high doses of alkylating agents and abdomino-pelvic radiation .

Background	Animal and epidemiological studies confirm an impact of the fatty-acid composition in the diet on cancer development .
Method	We investigated the role of supplementation of the diet of female F344-rats with sunflower , rapeseed , olive or coconut oil on the formation of the promutagenic , exocyclic 1,N2-propanodeoxyguanosine adduct of the main lipid peroxidation product 4-hydroxy-2
Method	This adduct is considered as the predominant DNA adduct arising from lipid peroxidation .
Result	The correlations between adduct levels and the different fatty acids were not uniform for all organs .
Result	No clear relationships between fatty acids and adduct levels were found in the colon .
Result	Significant positive correlations were observed between linoleic acid , total polyunsaturated fatty acids ( PUFAs ) , vitamin E and DNA adduct levels in the small intestine and in the kidney .
Result	The results indicate an increasing effect on cancer risk in these organs as a result of high intake of linoleic acid .
Result	Inverse relationships between linoleic acid , PUFA and vitamin E intake and adduct levels were found in the glandular stomach and the lung .
Result	We could not confirm a chemopreventive effect of linolenic acid ( C-18 omega-3 PUFA ) on the formation of adducts in our animal study , as was shown in white blood cells of women in a previous study .
Result	A tendency towards a decrease in adduct levels was seen with monounsaturated fatty acids ( MUFAs ) in all organs except the lung .
Result	Saturated fatty acids showed a significant positive correlation with adduct levels in the mucosa of the glandular stomach and a significant inverse correlation in the small intestine .
Result	Saturated fatty acids are not considered to directly influence lipid peroxidation to a major extent .

Background	The majority of tissue Doppler indexes proposed to predict left ventricular ( LV ) reverse remodelling in cardiac resynchronization therapy ( CRT ) reflects LV asynchrony as assessed in ejection phase .
Method	We evaluated the predictive value of a new strain-imaging parameter reflecting the total amount of time spent by 12 LV segments in contracting after aortic valve closure .
Method	Fifty-nine patients who fulfilled current treatment recommendations were studied before and 6 months after CRT .
Method	Time to tissue Doppler systolic peak velocity ( Ts ) and time exceeding aortic closure ( ExcT ) in strain curves were measured in 12 LV segments .
Method	Ts standard deviation ( Ts-SD ) and sum of ExcT of overall 12 LV segments ( oExcT ) were analysed .
Method	After 6 months , responders were defined according to > or = 15 % LV end-systolic volume reduction .
Result	Responders ( 47 % ) when compared with non-responders ( 53 % ) had significantly higher baseline Ts-SD and oExcT values .
Result	Receiver operating characteristic ( ROC ) curve analysis demonstrated that an optimal cutoff value of 760 ms for oExcT yielded 93.5 % sensitivity and 82.8 % specificity .
Result	For Ts-SD at the cutoff of 32 ms , 82 % sensitivity and 39 % specificity were obtained .
Result	Area under ROC was significantly larger for oExcT than for Ts-SD .
Result	o-ExcT is able to predict LV reverse remodelling after CRT .

Background	With almost a million people dying by suicide worldwide each year , reducing the rate of suicidal behaviour is a priority in many countries .
Method	To examine whether additional psychosocial interventions following an episode of self-harm reduce the likelihood of subsequent suicide .
Method	We conducted a systematic review and meta-analysis of data from randomised controlled trials of interventions for people following self-harm .
Method	Likelihood of suicide was compared by calculating the pooled root difference in suicide rate with 95 % confidence intervals .
Result	We obtained suicide data from 18 studies with a total population of 3918 .
Result	Eighteen suicides occurred among people offered active treatment and 19 among those offered standard care ( pooled root difference in suicide rate 0.0,95 % CI -0.03 to 0.03 ) .
Result	The overall rate of suicide among people participating in trials was similar to that reported in observational studies of people who self-harm .
Result	Results of this meta-analysis do not provide evidence that additional psychosocial interventions following self-harm have a marked effect on the likelihood of subsequent suicide .

Background	Patients with Parkinson disease ( PD ) may be akinetic/rigid , be tremor dominant , or have comparable severity of these motor symptoms ( classic ) .
Background	The pathophysiologic basis of different PD phenotypes is unknown .
Background	This study assessed pallidal and striatal dopamine level patterns in different motor subgroups of PD and normal control brains .
Method	Globus pallidus and striatum dopamine ( DA ) levels were measured with high performance liquid chromatography in eight autopsy confirmed PD and five control frozen brains .
Result	DA levels in the external globus pallidus ( GPe ) of normal brains were nearly six times greater than in the internal pallidum ( GPi ) .
Result	In PD , the mean loss of DA was marked ( -82 % ) in GPe and moderate ( -51 % ) in GPi .
Result	DA loss of variable degree was seen in different subdivisions of GPe and GPi in PD ; however , DA levels were near normal in the ventral ( rostral and caudal ) GPi of PD cases with prominent tremor .
Result	There was marked loss of DA ( -89 % ) in the caudate and severe loss ( -98.4 % ) in the putamen in PD .
Result	The pattern of pallidal DA loss did not match the putaminal DA loss .
Result	There is sufficient loss of dopamine ( DA ) in external globus pallidus and the internal globus pallidum ( GPi ) as may contribute to the motor manifestations of Parkinson disease ( PD ) .
Result	The possible functional disequilibrium between GABAergic and DAergic influences in favor of DA in the caudoventral parts of the GPi may contribute to resting tremor in tremor dominant and classic PD cases .

Background	An understanding of normal cerebral autoregulation and its response to pathological derangements is helpful in the diagnosis , monitoring , management , and prognosis of severe traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) .
Background	Pressure autoregulation is the most common approach in testing the effects of mean arterial blood pressure on cerebral blood flow .
Background	A gold standard for measuring cerebral pressure autoregulation is not available , and the literature shows considerable disparity in methods .
Background	This fact is not surprising given that cerebral autoregulation is more a concept than a physically measurable entity .
Method	Alterations in cerebral autoregulation can vary from patient to patient and over time and are critical during the first 4-5 days after injury .
Background	An assessment of cerebral autoregulation as part of bedside neuromonitoring in the neurointensive care unit can allow the individualized treatment of secondary injury in a patient with severe TBI .
Background	The assessment of cerebral autoregulation is best achieved with dynamic autoregulation methods .
Background	Hyperventilation , hyperoxia , nitric oxide and its derivates , and erythropoietin are some of the therapies that can be helpful in managing cerebral autoregulation .
Background	In this review the authors summarize the most important points related to cerebral pressure autoregulation in TBI as applied in clinical practice , based on the literature as well as their own experience .

Background	An outpatient multimodal cognitive-behavioural treatment program ( MMCBT ) for chronic spinal pain was evaluated during an 18-month follow-up period .
Background	The treatment included a 1-day course for the patients ' work supervisors .
Background	The aim of the study was to evaluate the long-term effect of the treatment program as well as the effect of a work supervisor-training program on the patients ' return to work .
Method	The design was a matched cohort study with four repeated measures .
Method	Two groups of subjects suffering from non-specific spinal pain ( treatment group n = 67 , no treatment control group n = 29 ) were assessed with regard to pain intensity , sick-leave , pain coping ability and behavioural changes at work and in personal life .
Method	Recordings on supervisors attending the course and changes of supervisory behaviour were also obtained .
Result	The results show a significant between group difference in pain intensity and perceived pain coping ability at work , favouring the MMCBT group .
Result	Further , the MMCBT intervention enhances self-reported behavioural changes in areas within the subjects ' own control .
Result	There is not sufficient statistical support to accept the assumption of MMCBT being superior in reducing sick-leave , either with or without the education of supervisors .
Result	Even when supervisors changed their behaviour as reported by the patient , no significant effect was found on patients ' return to work .
Result	In conclusion , the MMCBT do not seem to be effective in reducing sick-leave compared to no treatment , but the MMCBT program is superior in decreasing pain intensity , enhancing self-reported behavioural changes in personal life and improving pain coping ab

Background	To determine whether nursing home residents with urinary incontinence ( UI ) have worse quality of life ( QoL ) than continent residents , whether the relationship between UI and QoL differs across strata of cognitive and functional impairment , and whether cha
Method	Retrospective cohort study using a Minimum Data Set ( MDS ) database to determine cross-sectional and longitudinal ( 6 month ) associations between UI and QoL .
Method	All Medicare - or Medicaid-licensed nursing homes in Kansas , Maine , Mississippi , New York , and South Dakota during 1994 to 1996 .
Method	All residents aged 65 and older , excluding persons unable to void or with potentially unstable continence or QoL status ( recent nursing home admission , coexistent delirium , large change in functional status , comatose , near death ) .
Method	UI was defined as consistent leakage at least twice weekly over 3 months and continence as consistent dryness over 3 months .
Method	QoL was measured using the validated MDS-derived Social Engagement Scale .
Result	Of 133,111 eligible residents , 90,538 had consistent continence status , 58,850 ( 65 % ) of whom were incontinent .
Result	UI was significantly associated with worse QoL in residents with moderate cognitive and functional impairment .
Result	New or worsening UI over 6 months was associated with worse QoL ( odds ratio = 1.46 , 95 % confidence interval = 1.36-1 .57 ) and was second only to cognitive decline and functional decline in predicting worse QoL .
Result	This is the first study to quantitatively demonstrate that prevalent and new or worsening UI decreases QoL even in frail , functionally and cognitively impaired nursing home residents .
Result	These results provide a crucial incentive to improve continence care and quality in nursing homes and a rationale for targeting interventions to those residents most likely to benefit .

Background	The utility of administering only the first deck of 64 cards from the Wisconsin Card Sorting Test ( WCST-64 ) in persons with Alzheimer 's ( AD ) and Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) was evaluated .
Method	There were 35 elderly subjects matched for gender , age , and education in each of four groups : controls , PD without dementia ( PDN ) , PD with dementia ( PDD ) , and AD .
Method	Additionally , the control and PDN subjects were matched for level of cognitive functioning as were the PDD and AD groups .
Result	Results revealed that demented persons performed significantly worse than nondemented subjects .
Result	The WCST-64 was also sensitive to the subtle executive deficits demonstrated by persons with PD without dementia .
Result	The findings support the use of the WCST-64 in elderly persons with AD and PD .

Background	In locally advanced colorectal cancer , combined modality treatment is a standard adjuvant therapy in USA and Europe .
Method	The basic issue of the timing of radiotherapy and chemotherapy and preoperative radio-chemotherapy versus postoperative radio-chemotherapy is being addressed in prospective trials .
Result	Preoperative radiotherapy proved that causes more radiosensitivity due to that oxygen tension within the tumour may be higher prior to surgery .
Result	Technically , there are two approaches of preoperative radiotherapy .
Result	The aim of this article is to report the inclusion criteria , indications , advantages and results of short course preoperative radiotherapy .

Background	The communication impairments that characterize severe dementia make pain assessment challenging .
Background	As such , pain problems often go undetected .
Background	Our goal was to determine whether systematic pain assessment leads to improved pain management practices and decreases nursing stress in comparison with a control condition .
Method	We adopted a 3-month comparative longitudinal design .
Method	Nursing staff regularly assessed dementia patients ' pain through the use of the Pain Assessment Checklist for Seniors with Limited Ability to Communicate ( PACSLAC ) .
Method	A second group of nurses completed an attention-control measure for a control group of patients .
Method	In addition , nursing staff regularly completed measures of work stress to investigate the effects of the workload associated with systematic pain assessment on nurse stress .
Result	Regular use of the PACSLAC improved pain management practices over time as reflected in increased usage of analgesic medications ( prescribed on as needed basis ) in comparison with the control group .
Result	As pain interventions increased , a corresponding decrease in observable pain behaviors ( as reflected on the PACSLAC assessments that were completed by the nurses ) was observed .
Result	In addition , nurses who used the PACSLAC reported decreased distress and burnout over time .
Result	This investigation provides strong support for both the importance of systematic pain assessment in long-term care and for the clinical utility of the PACSLAC in improving pain management practices and decreasing caregiver distress .

Background	Subclinical hypothyroidism is defined as an elevated serum thyroid-stimulating hormone ( TSH ) level with normal free thyroid hormones values .
Background	The prevalence of subclinical hypothyroidism is 4 % to 8 % in the general population , and up to 15 % to 18 % in women who are over 60 years of age .
Background	There is considerable controversy regarding the morbidity , the clinical significance of subclinical hypothyroidism and if these patients should be treated .
Method	To assess the effects of thyroid hormone replacement for subclinical hypothyroidism .
Method	We searched The Cochrane Library , MEDLINE , EMBASE and LILACS .
Method	Ongoing trials databases , reference lists and abstracts of congresses were scrutinized as well .
Method	All studies had to be randomised controlled trials comparing thyroid hormone replacement with placebo or no treatment in adults with subclinical hypothyroidism .
Method	Minimum duration of follow-up was one month .
Method	Two authors independently assessed trial quality and extracted data .
Method	We contacted study authors for missing or additional information .
Method	Twelve trials of six to 14 months duration involving 350 people were included .
Result	Eleven trials investigated levothyroxine replacement with placebo , one study compared levothyroxine replacement with no treatment .
Method	We did not identify any trial that assessed ( cardiovascular ) mortality or morbidity .
Result	Seven studies evaluated symptoms , mood and quality of life with no statistically significant improvement .
Result	One study showed a statistically significant improvement in cognitive function .
Result	Six studies assessed serum lipids , there was a trend for reduction in some parameters following levothyroxine replacement .
Result	Some echocardiographic parameters improved after levothyroxine replacement therapy , like myocardial relaxation , as indicated by a significant prolongation of the isovolumic relaxation time as well as diastolic dysfunction .
Result	Only four studies reported adverse events with no statistically significant differences between groups .
Result	In current RCTs , levothyroxine replacement therapy for subclinical hypothyroidism did not result in improved survival or decreased cardiovascular morbidity .
Result	Data on health-related quality of life and symptoms did not demonstrate significant differences between intervention groups .
Result	Some evidence indicates that levothyroxine replacement improves some parameters of lipid profiles and left ventricular function .

Background	We sought to determine if patients with Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) , taking dopamine agonists ( DAs ) and reporting unintended sleep episodes ( SEs ) , exhibit physiologically defined daytime sleepiness and can thus be differentiated from those taking DAs but not
Method	Twenty-four patients with abnormal Epworth Sleepiness Scale scores of > 10 who were taking DAs were enrolled into one of two groups : those with SEs ( SE + , n = 16 ) and those without ( SE - , n = 8 ) .
Method	Three consecutive days of testing included two nights of polysomnography followed by the Multiple Sleep Latency Test ( MSLT ) .
Result	Overall frequency of pathological sleepiness ( MSLT < 5 min ) was 42 % ( 10/24 ) .
Result	Mean levels of sleepiness , frequencies of pathological sleepiness , and naps with stage 2 or REM-sleep were similar between SE + and SE - groups .
Result	Sleep tendency was similar in patients prescribed pergolide , ropinirole , and pramipexole combined with levodopa .
Result	Polysomnography testing revealed no significant differences between the groups in total sleep time , sleep efficiency , sleep architecture , or presence of restless legs syndrome or periodic leg movements .
Result	There was no relation between degree of nocturnal sleep disturbance and level of daytime sleepiness .
Result	The results of this study suggest SEs in PD patients occur upon a background of excessive daytime sleepiness and are unrelated to nocturnal sleep or use of a specific DA .

Method	We examined the distribution of mRNA for the peptide cholecystokinin ( CCK ) with in situ hybridization in adult rat lumbar dorsal root ganglia following unilateral section of the sciatic nerve , as well as the effect of systemic CI 988 , a selective antagoni
Result	There was a dramatic increase in the number of neurons in dorsal root ganglia synthesizing the peptide cholecystokinin ( CCK ) after sciatic nerve section .
Result	Furthermore , the autotomy behavior of rats was significantly inhibited by chronic i.t. administration of morphine in conjunction with subcutaneous ( s.c. ) injection of CI 988 .
Result	Neither i.t. morphine nor s.c. CI 988 alone produced a comparable effect on autotomy .
Result	Our results suggested that up-regulation of the mRNA for CCK in primary afferents after nerve injury may be related to the clinical phenomenon of opioid insensitivity .
Result	Thus , coadministration of CCK antagonists in combination with opioids may offer a new approach in treating neuropathic pain .

Background	Injury in the home is extremely common , accounting for around a third of all injuries .
Background	The majority of injuries of children under five and people aged 75 and over occur at home .
Background	Multi-factorial injury prevention interventions have been shown to reduce injuries in the home .
Background	However , few studies have focussed specifically on the impact of physical adaptations to the home environment and the effectiveness of such intervention needs to be ascertained .
Method	To review the evidence for the effect on injuries of modification of the home environment with a primary focus on interventions to reduce physical hazards .
Method	We searched the following databases APId , ASSIA , British Nursing Index , CINAHL , Cochrane Library databases , Dissertation Abstracts , EMBASE , HealthSTAR , ICONDA , ISI Science ( and Social Science ) Citation Index , MEDLINE , National Research Register , PREMEDLINE , SIGLE and Urbadisk .
Method	Conference proceedings and reference lists were scanned .
Method	Experts in the field and trialists were contacted .
Method	Searches were not restricted to English language .
Method	Handsearching of relevant journals was not conducted .
Method	Randomised controlled trials , non-randomised controlled trials , controlled before-and-after studies and interrupted time series studies .
Method	All abstracts were screened by two reviewers for relevance , outcome and design .
Method	Two reviewers independently evaluated methodological quality and extracted data from each eligible study .
Method	We found 28 published trials and one unpublished study .
Result	Trials were not sufficiently similar to allow for the combination of data by statistical analyses , so this review takes a narrative form .
Result	Studies were divided into three groups based on the primary population sample : children , older people and the general population .
Result	None of the 11 childhood studies demonstrated a reduction in injuries that might have been due to environmental adaptation in the home .
Result	One study reported a reduction in injuries and in hazards but the two could not be linked .
Result	The majority of studies used hazard reduction as the outcome .
Result	Of the 15 studies in older people , none demonstrated a reduction in injuries due to hazard reduction , although two demonstrated a reduction in falls that could be due to hazard reduction .
Result	In the mixed age group there were two trials ; neither demonstrated an effect on injuries .
Result	There is insufficient evidence to determine the effects of interventions to modify environmental home hazards .
Result	Further interventions to reduce hazards in the home should be evaluated by adequately designed randomised controlled trials measuring injury outcomes .
Result	Recruitment of large study samples to measure effect may be a major consideration for future trials .

Background	Brachial plexus injuries ( BPIs ) are often devastating events that lead to upper-extremity paralysis , rendering the limb a painful extraneous appendage .
Background	Fortunately , there are several nerve repair techniques that provide restoration of some function .
Background	Although there is general agreement in the medical community concerning which patients may benefit from surgical intervention , the actual repair technique for a given lesion is less clear .
Method	The authors sought to identify and better define areas of agreement and disagreement among experienced peripheral nerve surgeons as to the management of BPIs .
Method	The authors developed a detailed survey in two parts one part addressing general issues related to BPI and the other presenting four clinical cases .
Method	The survey was mailed to 126 experienced peripheral nerve physicians and 49 ( 39 % ) participated in the study .
Method	The respondents represent 22 different countries and multiple surgical subspecialties .
Method	They performed a mean of 33 brachial plexus reconstructions annually .
Method	Areas of significant disagreement included the timing and indications for surgical intervention in birth-related palsy , treatment of neuroma-in-continuity , the best transfers to achieve elbow flexion and shoulder abduction , the use of intra - or extraplexal donors for motor neurotization , and the use of distal or proximal coaptation during nerve transfer .
Result	Experienced peripheral nerve surgeons disagree in important ways as to the management of BPI .
Result	The decisions made by the various treating physicians underscore the many areas of disagreement regarding the treatment of BPI , including the diagnostic approach to defining the injury , timing of and indications for surgical intervention in birth-related

Background	To what extent does the scientific literature have an impact on current clinical practice guidelines ( CPGs ) in trauma surgery ?
Method	We searched for CPGs on the initial management of multiply injured patients and assessed the quality of literature search and appraisal within these CPGs .
Method	Secondly , we compiled a list of all medical journal with relevance to prehospital trauma care .
Method	Lastly , we performed a hand search for randomised controlled trials ( RCTs ) in some of the German not in Medline indexed traumatological journals .
Result	We identified 22 CPGs of varying methodological quality .
Result	The American guidelines scored highest .
Result	Only 21 of the 38 journals ( 55 % ) in the field of prehospital trauma surgery were indexed in Medline , while 6 were covered only by Embase and 11 were indexed in neither of both databases .
Result	Hand searching four non-indexed German journals identified nearly 200 RCTs .
Result	Information flow between clinical research and CPG development remains difficult .
Result	Thoroughly performed literature searches have an important role in CPG development .

Background	In ventricular myocardium , the T-type Ca2 + current ( ICa , T ) , which is temporarily observed during fetal and neonatal periods , has been shown to reappear in failing/remodeling hearts .
Background	However , its pathophysiological regulation has not been elucidated .
Method	We utilized Dahl salt-sensitive ( DS ) rats with hypertension at the stage of concentric left ventricular ( LV ) hypertrophy ( 11 weeks old , LVH ) and at the heart failure stage ( 16 to 18 weeks old , CHF ) .
Method	Some were treated with bosentan ( 100 mg/kg per day ) during the period from LVH to CHF .
Result	In LVH , neither the presence of ICa , T ( measured in the freshly isolated LV myocytes ) nor an increase in alpha-1G mRNA expression were detected .
Result	This condition was associated with increases in tissue angiotensin II ( AII ) but not with endothelin ( ET ) -1 peptides .
Result	In contrast , in CHF , when the tissue AII remained elevated and ET-1 de novo increased , ICa , T was recorded in most of the cells ( -0.87 + / -0.18 pA/pF at -30 mV , P < 0.01 versus LVH ) .
Result	This was associated with a significant increase in the alpha-1G mRNA level .
Result	The chronic bosentan treatment eliminated both the elevation of alpha-1G mRNA level and ICa , T from the cells , whereas it did not affect the cell size and membrane capacitance .
Result	In addition , 48-hour exposure to ET-1 but not AII induced ICa , T in normal adult myocytes in culture from Sprague-Dawley rats .
Result	ICa , T channels reappear in failing but not in hypertrophied LV cardiomyocytes in a manner depending on the tissue ET-1 activation .

Background	The prevalence and profile of adults with a history of traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) has not been studied in large North American forensic mental health populations .
Background	This study investigated how adults with a documented history of TBI differed with the non-TBI forensic population with respect to demographics , psychiatric diagnoses and history of offences .
Method	A retrospective chart review of all consecutive admissions to a forensic psychiatry programme in Toronto , Canada was conducted .
Method	Information on history of TBI , psychiatric diagnoses , living environments and types of criminal offences were obtained from medical records .
Result	History of TBI was ascertained in 23 % of 394 eligible patient records .
Result	Compared to those without a documented history of TBI , persons with this history were less likely to be diagnosed with schizophrenia but more likely to have alcohol/substance abuse disorder .
Result	There were also differences observed with respect to offence profiles .
Result	This study provides evidence to support routine screening for a history of TBI in forensic psychiatry .

Background	Some prolonged and turbulent grief reactions include symptoms that differ from the DSM-IV criteria for major depressive disorder .
Background	The authors investigated a new diagnosis that would include these symptoms .
Method	They developed observer-based definitions of 30 symptoms noted clinically in previous longitudinal interviews of bereaved persons and then designed a plan to investigate whether any combination of these would serve as criteria for a possible new diagnosis of complicated grief disorder .
Method	Using a structured diagnostic interview , they assessed 70 subjects whose spouses had died .
Method	Latent class model analyses and signal detection procedures were used to calibrate the data against global clinical ratings and self-report measures of grief-specific distress .
Result	Complicated grief disorder was found to be characterized by a smaller set of the assessed symptoms .
Result	Subjects elected by an algorithm for these symptoms patterns did not significantly overlap with subjects who received a diagnosis of major depressive disorder .
Result	A new diagnosis of complicated grief disorder may be indicated .
Result	Its criteria would include the current experience ( more than a year after a loss ) of intense intrusive thoughts , pangs of severe emotion , distressing yearnings , feeling excessively alone and empty , excessively avoiding tasks reminiscent of the deceased , u

Method	To elucidate mechanisms of melanocortin action , we investigated the effects of a melanocortin receptor agonist ( melanotetan II [ MTII ] ) in lean C57BL/6J and obese ( DIO , ob/ob , UCP1-DTA ) mice .
Result	MTII administration ( 100 microg q.i.d. i.p. ) for 24 h results in similar weight loss but a more pronounced decrease of food intake in DIO mice .
Result	After 4 and 8 days of MTII treatment , however , the reduction in both food intake and body weight is more pronounced in DIO mice than in lean mice .
Result	MTII administration for 24 h prevents food deprivation-induced alterations in hypothalamic neuropeptide Y ( NPY ) and liver adiponectin receptor 1 and adiponectin receptor 2 mRNA expression , but does not alter hypothalamic mRNA expression of melanocortin 4
Result	NPY and agouti gene-related protein ( AgRP ) mRNA expression after 8 days of MTII is increased to levels comparable to pair-fed mice .
Result	In summary , 1 ) MTII is an effective treatment for obesity and related metabolic defects in leptin-resistant ( DIO , UCP1-DTA ) and leptin-sensitive ( ob/ob ) mouse models of obesity ; 2 ) the effects of MTII on food intake and body weight are more pronounced in

Background	Progress in the care of people with spinal cord injury ( SCI ) spans every aspect , from research in neuroregeneration to pharmacologic interventions .
Method	This article focuses on advances in rehabilitation interventions , which have employed bioengineering , computerization , and advanced therapeutic techniques .
Background	These interventions are being applied to functional deficits of the bladder , bowel , upper extremities , and respiratory system , as well as to improvements in ambulation and mobility .
Background	Functional electrical stimulation ( FES ) is being used to augment the function of the lower extremities , the upper extremities ( Freehand System ) , and the bowel and bladder ( Vocare System ) .
Background	Tendon transfer is a reconstructive technique used to improve upper extremity function ; it is sometimes combined with FES .
Background	Body weight-supported treadmill training is being used to improve ambulation in people with incomplete SCI , and advances in wheelchair technology are expanding options for mobility .
Background	Cushion design and pressure mapping are modalities being used to reduce the high risk for pressure ulcers in the SCI population .
Background	Research on shoulder stressors is being applied to transfer techniques , exercise regimens , adaptive equipment and wheelchair mechanics to minimize shoulder pain , another common complication .
Result	The effectiveness of rehabilitation interventions needs to be documented by evidence-based research .
Result	Researchers are focusing on the identification of outcomes measures that will form the basis for established standards of care for individuals with SCI .
Result	Perhaps the combination of conventional and newer therapies may enhance neurological recovery .
Result	Well-designed studies are needed before we can make this determination .

Background	Low bone mass , functional impairment , low muscle strength , and postural instability are predictors of the risk of fracture in an elderly person .
Background	The purpose of this study was to investigate the functional impact of an unvarying long-term exercise program to be carried out at home .
Background	The exercises had been shown to delay bone loss in an elderly population .
Method	At the Department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation , University of Vienna , postmenopausal women who had been stratified into exercise or control groups 5 to 10 yr ago were called in for a follow-up examination .
Method	Frequency of training , habits , and pain causing disability in activities of daily living were recorded .
Method	Walking velocity , muscle strength , and postural stability were measured .
Method	Functional assessment , blood analysis , and x-rays of the spine were performed additionally .
Method	One hundred twenty-four women aged 68.3 + / - 6.8 yr ( mean + / - SD ) underwent a follow-up investigation at the outpatient clinic .
Result	After 7.7 + / - 1.1 yr the compliance of the training group was still 36 % .
Result	Self-chosen gait velocity was slightly higher in the regular exercisers than in the controls .
Result	No intergroup differences were found for pain induced disability , muscle strength , body sway , and fracture rate .
Result	The pain disability index was significantly associated with corrected self-chosen gait velocity .
Result	The results suggest that an unvarying home-based exercise program may support general agility but does not yield enough force to improve muscle strength and postural stability in healthy , nondisabled , postmenopausal women who start exercising at the age o
Result	Further studies are needed to define more appropriate exercise programs for a comprehensive improvement of functional outcome in a population at high risk for osteoporosis .

Method	A prospective study was developed to quantify acute low back pain recovery .
Method	To compare traditional self-report measures of low back pain recovery with a quantitative measure of recovery .
Background	The magnitude of low back disorders in society continues to be a problem .
Background	To prevent secondary injuries , an understanding of recovery must be gained by comparing the natural course of recovery using several outcome measures .
Method	For this study , 16 occupational and 16 nonoccupational patients with low back pain were recruited .
Method	Recovery was monitored prospectively every 2 weeks for 3 to 6 months , using subjective work status , pain symptoms , activities of daily living , and objective functional performance probability ( trunk kinematics ) .
Result	Return to work underestimated the percentage of subjects impaired , as compared with all other outcome measures .
Result	Symptoms , activities of daily living , and functional performance probability all showed similar patterns of recovery for 0 to 12 weeks .
Result	At 14 weeks , there was a lag in functional performance recovery .
Result	Both symptoms and activities of daily living indicated that 80 % of the population was recovered , whereas functional performance indicated the figure to be 68 % .
Result	This prospective study demonstrates the natural course of recovery using several outcome measures .
Result	The objective kinematic functional performance measure of recovery quantifies a different aspect of impairment not evaluated by traditional subjective measures .
Result	Use of several outcome measures may lead to a better understanding of low back pain recovery or residual impairment , which may minimize the risk of recurrent injury .

Background	Acute low back pain with or without sciatica usually is self-limited and has no serious underlying pathology .
Background	For most patients , reassurance , pain medications , and advice to stay active are sufficient .
Background	A more thorough evaluation is required in selected patients with `` red flag '' findings associated with an increased risk of cauda equina syndrome , cancer , infection , or fracture .
Method	These patients also require closer follow-up and , in some cases , urgent referral to a surgeon .
Method	In patients with nonspecific mechanical low back pain , imaging can be delayed for at least four to six weeks , which usually allows the pain to improve .
Result	There is good evidence for the effectiveness of acetaminophen , nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs , skeletal muscle relaxants , heat therapy , physical therapy , and advice to stay active .
Result	Spinal manipulative therapy may provide short-term benefits compared with sham therapy but not when compared with conventional treatments .
Result	Evidence for the benefit of acupuncture is conflicting , with higher-quality trials showing no benefit .
Result	Patient education should focus on the natural history of the back pain , its overall good prognosis , and recommendations for effective treatments .

Background	The Secretary of Health and Human Services denies Medicare reimbursement for certain indirect costs associated with health care delivery .
Background	This Note reviews arguments supporting and opposing reimbursement of costs that providers incur in three common financial transactions : the use of equity capital , acquisition of providers , and loan financing .
Background	The Note considers the Secretary 's regulations in light of the congressional mandate to encourage efficient delivery of health care and concludes that current reimbursement policy promotes inefficiency .

Method	Twenty-four tenorrhaphies were performed at the mid-metatarsal region in 12 crossbred calves under xylazine-ketamine spinal analgesia .
Method	A 2.5-cm long gap was created in the superficial digital flexor ( SDF ) tendon and immediately repaired with carbon fibres in the animals of group I and with plasma-preserved tendon allografts in group II .
Result	Clinical examination revealed a slight increase ( P > 0.05 ) in rectal temperature , heart and respiratory rate for 2-4 days postoperation in both groups .
Result	Milder pain and exudation as well as earlier restoration of tendon gliding movements and weight bearing were observed in group I as compared to group II .
Result	Air-tendogram in the carbon fibre group on day 30 revealed restoration of continuity across the defect of the tendon .
Result	whereas , in the allograft group , a dense homogeneous swelling was seen along the flexors .
Result	Regression of peritendinous adhesions and swelling at the reconstructed site at later stages was seen in both groups .
Result	Angiography showed hypervascularization at the reconstructed site on day 14 in the carbon fibre group , however , in the allograft group the site appeared to be relatively avascular .
Result	On days 30 and 90 , blood vessels were normally organized in both groups .

Background	To investigate efficacy of three single dose radiation therapy ( RT ) regimens in the treatment of painful bone metastasis .
Method	Patient self-assessment by using pain chart enabled evaluation of response to treatment that consisted of either one of the three single fractions of 4 Gy ( group I ; n = 109 ) , 6 Gy ( group II ; n = 108 ) , or 8 Gy ( group III ; n = 110 ) .
Result	Patients in groups II and III had higher complete response rate than those in group I , but not significantly , and with no difference between group II and III .
Result	However , both patients in group II ( 73 % ) and group III ( 78 % ) had significantly higher overall response rates when compared to those observed in group I ( 59 % ) ( I vs II , p = 0.025 ; I vs III , p = 0.0019 ) , and with no difference between groups II and III ( p = 0.39 )
Result	Patients in group III had shortest time to the occurrence of any pain relief which was significantly better than those observed in group I ( Welch 's t-test , p = 0.012 ) , with no difference between group I and II and group II and III , respectively .
Result	There was no difference between the three treatment groups in duration of response and retreatment rate .
Result	No effect of histology or metastatic site treated was found .
Result	No pathological fractures or spinal cord compressions were observed during the 8 weeks post-RT .
Result	Results of this study seem to confirm that 8 Gy could be considered as probably `` lowest '' optimal single fraction RT in the treatment of painful bone metastasis , although single fraction RT of 4 Gy should not be easily discarded due to its applic
Result	Since single fraction RT of 6 Gy achieved results not different from that obtained with 8 Gy , further studies are warranted in order to get more informations about `` lowest '' optimal single fraction RT in the treatment of painful bone metastasis .

Background	There are few published studies assessing the efficacy of pharmacologic treatments for attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder ( ADHD ) among substance abusers seeking treatment .
Method	Eleven patients who met DSM-IV diagnostic criteria for cocaine dependence and adult ADHD were entered into a 12-week single-blind trial of divided daily doses of bupropion ( BPR ) .
Method	All patients received weekly individual standardized relapse prevention therapy .
Result	Treatment compliance and retention were good .
Result	Patients reported significant reductions in attention difficulties , hyperactivity and impulsivity .
Result	Self-reported cocaine use , cocaine craving , and cocaine positive toxicologies , also decreased significantly .
Result	In a previously published trial , 12 patients who met similar diagnostic criteria for adult ADHD and cocaine dependence were entered into a 12-week trial of divided daily doses of sustained-release methylphenidate ( MPH ) .
Result	Improvements observed on BPR were similar to , and did not differ from those previously observed with MPH .
Result	These preliminary data suggest that BPR may be as effective as sustained-release MPH , when combined with relapse prevention therapy , for cocaine abusers with adult ADHD .
Result	However , a future study directly comparing BPR to MPH in a double-blind placebo-controlled trial is needed .

Background	Economic restructuring in the health services industry in the USA exemplifies general patterns of economic change propelled by neoliberalism , especially industry privatization , diminished social services , and dependence on `` flexible '' labor and m
Background	Combined with the widespread entry of women into the labor force , an aging population , and minimal assistance for high quality long-term care at the end of life , these economic and social conditions raise a set of difficult policy questions for health ser
Background	Set in these broad contexts , this paper situates access to and experience of health services in the home , the hospital , and nursing facility , to demonstrate how economic changes have relocated and redefined health services in ways that distinctively impac
Background	This place switching of health services externalizes costs of subacute and `` daily life care '' ( the so-called custodial care ) to the sphere of the individual , their family , and communities .
Background	The theoretical analysis uses current geographical and philosophical approaches to place and space , and considers the tensions between institutionally managed health care space , and the patient 's experience of receiving health services in place .
Background	The place/space dilemma of health services provision is examined through several interrelated subjects : long-term care at the end of life , gendered characteristics of care giving , the limitations of Medicare and Medicaid , historical changes in hospital le
Background	The analysis is based on examples of stroke and incontinence care to demonstrate the importance of considering place and space issues in health care planning .

Background	Despite anecdotal reports that serotonin reuptake inhibitors may improve depersonalisation , there is no proven efficacious treatment for depersonalisation disorder .
Method	To investigate the efficacy of fluoxetine in the treatment of depersonalisation disorder .
Method	Fifty-four people who met DSM-IV criteria for depersonalisation disorder were recruited through newspaper advertisements , and 50 were randomised to a 10-week , double-blind trial of fluoxetine 10-60 mg/day or placebo .
Method	Primary outcome measures were the Dissociative Experiences Scale-Depersonalisation Factor , the Depersonalization Severity Scale and the Clinical Global Impression-Improvement ( CGI-I ) scale .
Result	Intention-to-treat analysis revealed that fluoxetine ( mean dosage 48 mg/day ) was not superior to placebo except for a clinically minimal but statistically significantly greater improvement in CGI-I score in the fluoxetine group prior to covarying for anxi
Result	Depersonalisation was significantly more likely to improve if comorbid anxiety disorder improved .
Result	Fluoxetine was not efficacious in treating depersonalisation disorder , despite the commonly reported clinical use of serotonin reuptake inhibitors for this condition .

Background	Vertebral fractures are the most common osteoporotic fracture and may result in back pain with functional limitations and diminished quality of life .
Background	Teriparatide [ rhPTH ( 1-34 ) ] has been shown to increase bone mass and reduce the risk of vertebral and other osteoporotic fractures .
Method	The aim of this study was to evaluate the effects of teriparatide on the risk of back pain in patients with osteoporosis .
Method	A systematic review of the literature was performed , and five trials were identified and included in our analyses .
Method	All trials were randomized , double-blinded , and parallel with either new vertebral fracture ( n = 1 ) or bone mineral density as the primary endpoint ( n = 4 ) .
Method	Four studies were in postmenopausal women with osteoporosis , and one was in men with idiopathic or hypogonadal osteoporosis .
Method	Two trials were placebo controlled , two trials were alendronate controlled , and one trial involved teriparatide plus hormone replacement therapy versus hormone replacement therapy alone .
Method	Reports of back pain , defined as new or worsened back pain after initiating the study drug , were obtained from adverse event databases , and the risk of back pain was analyzed using a multivariate Cox proportional hazards model .
Result	Results were not statistically heterogeneous ( P = 0.60 ) across trials , and there were no differences between groups administered teriparatide 20 or 40 mcg/day doses ( P = 0.64 ) .
Result	The rates of back pain , moderate or severe back pain , and severe back pain per 100 patient-years were numerically lower in the teriparatide versus comparator groups in each study .
Result	Compared with the pooled comparator , patients in the pooled teriparatide group had reduced risk for any back pain [ relative risk , 0.66 ( 95 % CI , 0.55-0 .80 ) ] , moderate or severe back pain [ relative risk , 0.60 ( 95 % CI , 0.48-0 .75 ) ] and severe back pain [ relat
Result	Separate meta-analyses comparing teriparatide versus placebo or antiresorptive drugs gave similar results .
Result	In conclusion , patients randomized to teriparatide had a reduced risk of new or worsening back pain compared to patients randomized to placebo , hormone replacement therapy or alendronate .

Background	To adapt and validate the Spanish language version of the Diabetes 39 instrument , which measures quality of life , for Mexican patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus ( DM-2 ) .
Method	The Spanish language version of the instrument was adapted to make it more comprehensible to Mexican patients .
Method	In a cross-sectional survey , the instrument was administered on two different days to 260 patients with type DM-2 .
Method	Glycated hemoglobin ( HbAic ) , total cholesterol , triglycerides , blood pressure , body mass index and waist/hip ratio were measured .
Method	Information about age , sex , time since diagnosis of diabetes , diabetes related complications and comorbidity was obtained .
Result	A total of 249 subjects completed the study , 62.7 % of which were women .
Result	Cronbach 's alpha coefficient was > or = 0.80 for the domains and 0.95 for the total score.The test-retest consistency for the total score was r = 0.82 , p = 0.01 .
Result	The median of the total score was 29 ( on a scale of 0-100 ) , which was considered the cutoff value for defining `` better '' ( < 29 ) and `` worse '' > or = 29 ) quality of life.A worse quality of life was associated with diabetes related complic
Result	The last three were identified as predictor variables for worse quality of life by logistic regression ( p < 0.05 ) .
Result	The adapted Spanish language version of Diabetes 39 is a reliable and valid instrument for measuring the quality of life of Mexican patients with DM-2 .

Background	The objective of this study was to demonstrate 1H MR spectroscopy ( MRS ) changes in cerebral metabolites after acute head trauma .
Method	Twenty-five patients ( 12 children , 13 adults ) were examined with quantitative 1H MRS after closed head injury .
Result	Clinical grade ( Glasgow Coma Scale [ GCS ] ) and outcome ( Rancho Los Amigos Medical Center Outcome Score [ ROS ] ) were correlated with quantitative neurochemical findings .
Result	N-acetylaspartate ( NAA ) , a neuronal and axonal marker , was reduced ( P < .03 -.001 ) .
Result	In children , a reduced NAA/creatine plus phosphocreatine ( Cr ) level and the presence of detectable lipid/lactate predicted bad outcome ( sensitivity , 89 % ; specificity , 89 % ) .
Result	The first MRS examination of all patients correlated with ROS versus NAA ( r = .65 , P < .0001 ) .
Result	Although most patients showed MRS abnormalities , striking heterogeneity of 1H MRS characterized the individual patients .
Result	1H MRS identifies multiple patterns of diffuse brain injury after blunt head trauma .
Result	There was a strong correlation between MRS and outcome .
Result	Future prospective studies will be needed to determine the clinical usefulness of MRS in predicting outcome from closed head injury .

Background	Generalized anxiety disorder ( GAD ) is a prevalent and disabling disorder characterized by persistent worrying , anxiety symptoms , and tension .
Background	It is the most frequent anxiety disorder in primary care , being present in 22 % of primary care patients who complain of anxiety problems .
Background	The high prevalence rate of GAD in primary care ( 8 % ) compared to that reported in the general population ( 12-month prevalence 1.9-5 .1 % ) suggests that GAD patients are high users of primary care resources .
Background	GAD affects women more frequently than men and prevalence rates are high in midlife ( prevalence in females over age 35 : 10 % ) and older subjects but relatively low in adolescents .
Background	The natural course of GAD can be characterized as chronic with few complete remissions , a waxing and waning course of GAD symptoms , and the occurrence of substantial comorbidity particularly with depression .
Background	Patients with GAD demonstrate a considerable degree of impairment and disability , even in its pure form , uncomplicated by depression or other mental disorders .
Background	The degree of impairment is similar to that of cases with major depression .
Background	GAD comorbid with depression usually reveals considerably higher numbers of disability days in the past month than either condition in its pure form .
Result	As a result , GAD is associated with a significant economic burden owing to decreased work productivity and increased use of health care services , particularly primary health care .
