Result	Median ICU and hospital lengths of stay were 3.2 and 24 days , respectively , for survivors and 1.6 and 3 days , respectively , for non-survivors .
Result	The ICNARC model , SAPS II and MPM II discriminated best between survivors and non-survivors and were better calibrated than raw GCS , APACHE II and III in 5,393 patients eligible for all models .
Result	Traumatic brain injury requiring intensive care has a high mortality rate .
Result	Non-survivors have a short length of ICU and hospital stay .
Result	APACHE II and III have poorer calibration and discrimination than SAPS II , MPM II and the ICNARC model in traumatic brain injury ; however , no model had perfect calibration .

Background	An interactive data management ( IDM ) system for the Spinal Cord Injury ( SCI ) Service was developed to collect self-reported patient data related to secondary medical complications and to provide feedback to the SCI rehabilitation team .
Background	The long-term objective is to improve clinical care through a process of staff review of current rehabilitation programs in the areas of prevalence , prevention , and management .
Method	Based on data from the first 99 SCI patients visiting the clinic and hospital after the installation of the IDM system , SCI patients reported high rates of current problems with spasticity ( 53 percent ) , pain ( 44 percent ) , and pressure ulcers ( 38 percent ) .
Method	Respiratory ( 12 percent ) and bowel ( 14 percent ) problems were less common current problems .
Method	The SCI staff questioned the reportedly high spasticity rates .
Result	They thought that the patients ' answers might have indicated simply the occurrence of spasticity , rather than the more important issue of severe spasticity that interferes with daily activities .
Result	The staff suggested several additional spasticity questions to add to the study .
Result	In other areas , only a small percentage of patients wanted to talk with a therapist about prevention of pressure ulcers .
Result	Patients who had urinary problems consistently reported five urinary signs ( e.g. , cloudy urine ) .
Result	The clinical staff found these data informative and stated that they should continue to be collected .

Background	The authors described the influence of specific medical conditions on clinical remission and response of major depression ( MDD ) in a clinical trial evaluating a care-management intervention among older primary-care patients .
Method	Adults age 60 years and older were randomly selected and screened for depression .
Method	Participants were randomly assigned to Usual Care or to an Intervention with a depression care-manager offering algorithm-based care for MDD .
Method	In all , 324 adults meeting criteria for MDD were included in these analyses .
Method	Remission and response was defined by a score on the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression < 10 and by a decrease from baseline of > or = 50 % , respectively .
Method	Medical comorbidity was ascertained through self-report .
Method	Cognitive impairment was defined by a score < 24 on the Mini-Mental State Exam ( MMSE ) .
Result	In Usual Care , rates of remission were faster in persons who reported atrial fibrillation ( AF ) than in persons who did not report AF and slower in persons who reported chronic pulmonary disease than in persons who did not report chronic pulmonary disease ;
Result	In the Intervention condition , none of the specific chronic medical conditions were significantly associated with outcomes for MDD .
Result	Because disease-specific findings were observed in persons who received Usual Care but not in persons who received more intensive treatment in the Intervention condition , our results suggest that the association of medical comorbidity and treatment outcom

Background	Women with endometriosis who are treated with in vitro fertilization ( IVF ) or intracytoplasmic sperm injection ( ICSI ) have a lower pregnancy rate compared to women with tubal factor infertility .
Background	It has been suggested that the administration of gonadotrophin releasing hormone ( GnRH ) agonists for a few months prior to IVF or ICSI increases the pregnancy rate .
Method	To determine the effectiveness of administering GnRH agonists for three to six months prior to IVF or ICSI in women with endometriosis .
Method	We used computer searches of the Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials ( CENTRAL ) , MEDLINE , EMBASE , the National Research Register ( NRR ) and the MDSG Specialised Register of controlled trials .
Method	We handsearched proceedings of annual meetings of the American Society for Reproductive Medicine ( ASRM ) and the European Society for Human Reproduction and Embryology ( ESHRE ) .
Method	We reviewed lists of references in original research and review articles .
Method	We contacted experts in various countries to identify unpublished trials .
Method	We included randomised controlled trials using any GnRH agonist prior to IVF or ICSI to treat women with any degree of endometriosis diagnosed by laparoscopy or laparotomy DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS
Method	Two independent review authors abstracted data ( HNS and JGV ) .
Method	We sent e-mails to investigators to seek additional information .
Method	We assessed the validity of each study using the methods suggested in the Cochrane Handbook .
Method	The data were checked by the third review author ( SD ) and any disagreement was resolved by arbitration with the fourth review author ( AA ) .
Method	We generated 2 x 2 tables for principal outcome measures .
Method	The Peto-modified Mantel-Haenszel technique was used to calculate odds ratios ( OR ) and assess statistical heterogeneity between studies .
Method	Three randomised controlled trials ( with 165 women ) were included .
Result	The live birth rate per woman was significantly higher in women receiving the GnRH agonist compared to the control group ( OR 9.19 , 95 % CI 1.08 to 78.22 ) .
Result	However , this was based on one trial reporting `` viable pregnancy '' only .
Result	The clinical pregnancy rate per woman was also significantly higher ( three studies : OR 4.28 , 95 % CI 2.00 to 9.15 ) .
Result	The information on miscarriage rates came from two trials with high heterogeneity and , therefore , results of the meta-analysis were doubtful .
Result	The included studies provided insufficient data to investigate the effects of administration of GnRH agonists on multiple or ectopic pregnancies , fetal abnormalities or other complications .
Result	The administration of GnRH agonists for a period of three to six months prior to IVF or ICSI in women with endometriosis increases the odds of clinical pregnancy by fourfold .
Result	Data regarding adverse effects of this therapy on the mother or fetus are not available at present .

Method	Key pecking of pigeons was maintained under a four-component multiple fixed-interval schedule with values of 1-min , 3-min , 5-min and 10-min .
Method	Each schedule value was correlated with a different key color , each of which controlled distinctively different performances .
Method	This schedule generated a range of response rates both within and across the different interval components that permitted a direct comparison of drug effects on local and overall rates of responding .
Result	d-Amphetamine , cocaine , imipramine and pentobarbital all increased low local response rates at doses that did not affect or decreased higher rates within each fixed interval .
Result	Similar effects were obtained when different overall rates of responding were analyzed except that imipramine and pentobarbital also increased the highest overall rates occurring under the 1-min schedule .

Method	Cluster-analytic techniques were used to categorize coping strategies ( CS ) measured by the Ways of Coping -- Revised Scale , and locus of control ( LOC ) beliefs measured by the Multidimensional Health Locus of Control Scale in 53 male traumatically brain-inju
Result	A cluster characterized by comparatively higher use of self-controlling and positive reappraisal CS and lower external LOC was associated with significantly lower mood disturbance and physical difficulties and a trend to be less depressed .
Result	The age of the neurologically injured patient and Taylor 's ( 1983 ) cognitive adaptation theory may be important aspects of recovery from TBI and other neurological conditions .

Background	A 47-year-old woman presented with a rare case of epidural hematoma of the clivus .
Background	The patient had bilateral occipital condyle fractures ( a comminuted fracture on the right side , an avulsion fracture on left side and a lower clivus fracture ) .
Background	On admission the patient was tetraparetic with left abducens palsy .
Background	Preoperative imaging showed no atlanto-axial or occipito-atlantal dislocation .
Method	The patient was operated with a posterior approach .
Method	An occipital craniectomy with C1 laminectomy was achieved without atlanto-occipital fusion .
Result	Two years after the trauma , the patient had mild left hemiparesis but was able to walk normally .
Result	Head motion was normal , but just mildly decreased by pain in flexion and extension .
Result	Imaging control did not show any occipito-atlantal instability .
Result	We describe the imaging features allowing precise diagnosis and discuss the management of a rare entity : bilateral occipital condyle fractures and epidural hematoma of the clivus .

Method	Tumor tissues from 29 women with borderline or malignant epithelial ovarian tumors were examined for the presence of human papillomavirus ( HPV ) DNA by the polymerase chain reaction ( PCR ) .
Method	The PCR analysis used a set of consensus primers that are complementary to highly conserved sequences in the genital HPVs ( M. M. Manos , Y. Ting , D. K. Wright , A. J. Lewis , T. R. Broker , and S. M. Wolinsky , Cancer Cells 7 , 209-214 , 1989 ) .
Method	Amplification products were detected by Southern hybridization with consensus oligonucleotide probes .
Result	A total of 70 paraffin-embedded tissue sections from ovarian carcinomas were tested and we did not detect genital-type HPV DNA sequences in any of these specimens .
Result	However , all of the tissue specimens were considered adequate for PCR analysis because a human cellular gene ( beta-globin ) was successfully amplified in each tissue specimen .
Result	In addition , HPV 16 DNA was found in a concurrent invasive squamous-cell carcinoma of the cervix from one ovarian cancer patient , indicating that the PCR was able to detect HPV in the lower genital tract of this individual .
Result	We conclude that there is no association between infection with the most common genital HPVs and borderline and malignant epithelial ovarian tumors .

Background	The focus on quality and accountability in healthcare has dramatically changed the manner in which clinical services are delivered .
Background	The traditional reliance on structural aspects of healthcare delivery has largely given way to a system that closely monitors processes and measures outcomes .
Background	Outcomes measurement has intuitive appeal because of its objectivity , global perspective on healthcare , and input from patients , providers , insurers , and payers in the healthcare delivery chain .
Background	Nevertheless , outcomes measures are destined to be closely linked to healthcare processes .
Background	Data from clinical investigations , interpreted using rigorously developed , evidence-based methodologies , must be used to provide feedback to those designing clinical processes and to continuously improve the quality of healthcare .
Background	As outcomes data will be crucial in evaluating the quality of services provided by managed care organizations in relation to their costs , it is imperative that osteopathic physicians become conversant with the history and evolution of outcomes measurement

Method	A randomised , comparative prospective clinical trial was planned to compare the early response to different rehabilitation methods for adhesive capsulitis taking into consideration the clinical efficacy and the cost effectiveness of the methods .
Method	Forty patients with adhesive capsulitis were randomised into two treatment groups .
Method	The first group ( CYR ) received the Cyriax approach of deep friction massage and mobilisation exercises three times weekly .
Method	The second group ( PT ) had daily physical therapy including hot pack and short wave diathermy application .
Method	Both groups concluded their treatments with stretching exercises and were also instructed to a daily home exercise program .
Method	The primary end point of the study was to reach 80 % of the normal passive range of motion ( ROM ) of the shoulder in all planes within a period of two weeks .
Method	Secondary end points were the overall ROM and pain response ( spontaneous pain , night pain and pain with motion ) to each treatment .
Result	19 patients in the CYR group ( 95 % ) and 13 patients in the PT group ( 65 % ) reached sufficient ROM at the end of the second week ( p < 0.05 ) .
Result	The improvement in shoulder flexion , inner and outer rotation values and the decrease in pain with motion were significantly better in the CYR group after the first week of treatment .
Result	The Cyriax method of rehabilitation provides a faster and better response than the conventional physical therapy methods in the early phase of treatment in adhesive capsulitis .
Result	The method is non-invasive , effective and requires fewer hospital visits for a sufficient early response .

Background	Despite an acknowledgement of the impact of serious mental disorders on informal caregivers , we still know little about how to best help them .
Method	The aim of the study was to evaluate the effectiveness of a two-phased carers ' intervention comprising family sessions followed by relatives ' groups .
Method	This intervention was designed to be of ` intermediate ' intensity , that is , one lying between brief educational programmes and long-term family psychoeducational treatments .
Method	An exploratory randomised controlled trial was conducted comparing the experimental support programme with ` standard ' care .
Method	All carers of patients with a psychotic disorder from a defined population were approached .
Method	Outcome measures were based on a ` stress-appraisal-coping ' model of caregiving .
Result	Despite concerted attempts to engage carers , only 42 % participated in the study .
Result	The carers ' programme did not offer any significant advantage on any of the outcome measures : psychological morbidity , negative appraisal , coping or social support .
Result	The severity of caregiving difficulties decreased over the study period for the group as a whole .
Result	There is still uncertainty about the most effective interventions for carers .
Result	Meeting ` needs ' may not improve caregiver distress .

Method	The purpose of this study was to investigate changes in lumbar flexion together with the pattern and level of muscle activity of selected erector spinae during a rowing trial.Design .
Method	Cross-sectional repeated measures design .
Background	Low back pain is a common problem in rowers .
Background	The amount of lumbar flexion occurring during rowing might influence the possibility of injury .
Method	Sixteen young adult school rowers participated in the study .
Method	Changes in lumbar flexion and muscle activity were recorded across the drive phase , at three stages of an ergometer based rowing trial .
Method	Lumbar flexion was calculated by computerised motion analysis of surface markers attached to the spinous processes of L1 and S1 .
Method	Surface electromyography techniques were used to examine the magnitude of activity from three erector spinae muscles .
Method	The median frequency of the electromyographic signal was examined to quantify fatigue in the erector spinae muscles during isometric maximal effort muscle activation prior to and after the rowing trial .
Result	Lumbar flexion increased significantly ( P < 0.05 ) during the rowing trial , as did the magnitude of electromyographic activity from sites over the lumbar multifidus , iliocostalis lumborum and longissimus thoracis muscles .
Result	The median frequency decreased significantly ( P < 0.05 ) in each muscle examined .
Result	The findings showed that rowers attain relatively high levels of lumbar flexion during the rowing stroke , and these levels are increased during the course of the rowing trial .
Result	Indirect evidence of muscle fatigue in erector spinae muscles was also apparent , and this observation may in part be responsible for the increased levels of lumbar flexion observed .
Result	Excessive lumbar flexion may influence the potential for injury to spinal structures .
Result	An awareness of increased lumbar flexion and muscle fatigue in the erector spinae muscles may be important for injury prevention programs for rowers .

Background	Osteoporotic vertebral compression fractures ( VCFs ) are associated with a series of clinical consequences leading to increased morbidity and even mortality .
Background	Early diagnosis and therapeutic intervention is desirable in order to remobilise patients and prevent further bone loss .
Background	Not all fractures are , however , sufficiently treatable by conservative measures .
Background	Here , vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty may provide immediate pain relief by minimally invasive fracture stabilisation .
Result	In cases of acute fractures , kyphoplasty has the potential to reduce kyphosis and restore the normal sagittal alignment of the spine .
Result	The complex nature of systemic osteoporosis , coupled with the intricate biomechanics of vertebral fractures , leads to a clinical setting which is ideally treated interdisciplinarily by the rheumatologist and spine surgeon .

Method	Our experience with intracavernous injection of prostaglandin E1 in spinal cord injured patients with neurogenic erectile dysfunction included 15 men .
Result	They received testing dosage starting from 5 micrograms with increasing dosage ( maximum 20 micrograms ) to achieve a rigid erection of Schramek 's grade 5 and lasting for at least 20 min .
Result	All of them had achieved functional erection adequate for coitus after treatment except one patient who had been proved to have venogenic impotence .
Result	We found that intracavernous injection of prostaglandin E1 had significantly improved the erectile condition .
Result	No systemic side effect or any other complication was noted except that pain at the injection site was complained of in two patients with incomplete lesion .

Method	In this study , telemedicine and the use of advanced telemedicine technologies are explained .
Background	Telemedicine is the use of modern telecommunications and information technologies for the provision of clinical care to individuals at a distance , and transmission of information to provide that care .
Background	Telemedicine can be used for decision making , remote sensing , and collaborative arrangements for the real-time management of patients at a distance .
Background	The use of telecommunications and information technologies in providing health services is determined .
Background	Telemedicine is described as combination of topics from the fields of telecommunication , medicine , and informatics .
Background	The medical systems infrastructure consisting of the equipment and processes used to acquire and present clinical information and to store and retrieve data are explained in details .

Background	The aim of this study was to evaluate the relationship of patient care variables to survival and functional outcome in the pediatric population with traumatic brain injury .
Method	Retrospective chart review .
Method	A 16-bed pediatric critical care unit in an academic community children 's hospital .
Method	A total of 320 consecutive pediatric patients with traumatic brain injuries admitted to our pediatric critical care unit between 1992 and 1996 .
Method	Patients were managed using our standard traumatic brain injury protocol .
Method	A total of 230 patient variables encompassing demographic data , prehospital , emergency department , and pediatric critical care unit care were recorded .
Result	A total of 79 patients were severely injured , with admitting Glasgow Coma Scale scores of < or = 10 .
Result	There were 18 deaths .
Result	Only two patients survived without cognition .
Result	Ninety-five of 302 survivors required inpatient rehabilitation .
Result	Of these , 73 were old enough to be compared using FIMTM scores .
Result	At the time of discharge from rehabilitation , 52 patients ( 71 % ) were functioning independently , 20 ( 27 % ) were moderately dependent , and one patient was completely dependent .
Result	Analysis of variables with respect to survival revealed that an inability to maintain a cerebral perfusion pressure of > or = 50 mm Hg on the first pediatric critical care unit day ( p = .0002 ) and the presence of bradycardia in the emergency department ( p =
Result	By using the regression equation generated from this model , we could correctly identify survivors and nonsurvivors with a predictive value of 94 % .
Result	The ability to maintain a cerebral perfusion pressure of > or = 50 mm Hg was the single most important predictor of traumatic brain injury survival in this study .
Result	This suggests that monitoring and optimizing cerebral perfusion pressure is critical to the management of these patients .
Result	The relationship between cognitive outcome and therapeutic interventions used to optimize cerebral perfusion pressure is unclear and requires further evaluation in a large prospective study .

Background	Fish contain essential long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids ( PUFAs ) , particularly docosahexaenoic acid ( DHA ) , an omega-3 ( or n-3 ) PUFA , but are also the main source of exposure to methylmercury ( MeHg ) , a potent developmental neurotoxicant .
Background	Since n-3 PUFAs support neural development and function , benefits deriving from a diet rich in n-3s have been hypothesized to protect against deleterious effects of gestational MeHg exposure .
Method	To determine whether protection occurs at the behavioral level , female Long-Evans rats were exposed , in utero , to 0 , 0.5 , or 5ppm of Hg as MeHg via drinking water , approximating exposures of 0 , 40 , and 400 microgHg/kg/day and producing 0 , 0.29 , and 5.50 pp
Method	They also received pre - and postnatal exposure to one of two diets , both based on the AIN-93 semipurified formulation .
Method	A `` fish-oil '' diet was high in , and a `` coconut-oil '' diet was devoid of , DHA .
Method	Diets were approximately equal in alpha-linolenic acid and n-6 PUFAs .
Method	As adults , the rats were first assessed with a spatial discrimination reversal ( SDR ) procedure and later with a visual ( nonspatial ) discrimination reversal ( VDR ) procedure .
Result	MeHg increased the number of errors to criterion for both SDR and VDR during the first reversal , but effects were smaller or non-existent on the original discrimination and on later reversals .
Result	No such MeHg-related deficits were seen when the rats were retested on SDR after 2 years of age .
Result	These results are consistent with previous reports and hypotheses that gestational MeHg exposure produces perseverative responding .
Result	No interactions between diet and MeHg were found , suggesting that n-3 PUFAs do not guard against these behavioral effects .
Result	Brain Hg concentrations did not differ between the diets , either .
Result	In geriatric rats , failures to respond were less common and response latencies were shorter for rats fed the fish-oil diet , suggesting that exposure to a diet rich in n-3s may lessen the impact of age-related declines in response initiation .

Background	The red flags raised by the 1990 clinical reports of increased suicidality associated with treatment with the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor ( SSRI ) fluoxetine were followed by anecdotal reports of similar symptoms with other antidepressants of the
Background	Recent discussions by Healy have argued in favour of a suicidogenic potential of the SSRIs .
Background	This paper reviews the relevant literature addressing the epidemiological data of Western populations and the data accumulated from clinical trial databases in several countries .
Result	The evidence currently available does not support the hypothesis that antidepressants or , more specifically , SSRIs cause increased suicidality in patients with depression , nor do they appear to do so in patients treated with these drugs for other reasons .

Background	The execution of sequential arm movements is critical to activities of daily living such as eating and grooming .
Background	It is known that movement sequences are bradykinetic in people with Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) and that antiparkinson medications improve the speed of movement sequences .
Background	However , it is unclear how muscle activity is modulated during sequential movements and what effect antiparkinson medications have on muscle modulation .
Method	We studied subjects with PD and age - and gender-matched control subjects making sequential reaching movements .
Method	Subjects with PD were tested before and after their morning dose of antiparkinson medications ( levodopa and/or dopamine agonists ) .
Method	We examined the effect of antiparkinson medications on the modulation of muscle activity ( i.e. , the ability to activate and inhibit each muscle throughout the course of a sequence ) .
Result	Results showed that the group with PD , before medication , moved more slowly and modulated muscle activity poorly compared to the control group .
Result	Antiparkinson medications improved movement speed as expected , although sequential movements remained slower than normal even after medication .
Result	Medication improved the ability to activate agonist muscle activity but did not improve the ability to inhibit antagonist activity .
Result	Instead , antagonist activity was also increased , resulting in minimal improvements in muscle modulation during sequential reaching movements .

Method	Liquid crystal thermography was used to determine low back skin temperature patterns in 62 patients hospitalized for low back pain and 22 college volunteers with no previous history of back pain .
Method	The patients were separated into four groups according to their diagnoses at discharge patients with 1 ) degenerative discogenic lesions , 2 ) acquired lesions , 3 ) congenital and developmental lesions , 4 ) back pain resulting from unknown causes .
Result	No significant differences were found between the average equilibrated thermogram temperatures of the control subjects ( 32.4 + / - 0.5 degrees C ) and patient groups .
Result	However , the temperature gradients found on the thermograms of patients with discogenic lesions ( 3.1 + / - 0.6 degrees C ) and acquired lesions ( 3.1 + / - 1.0 degrees C ) were significantly greater ( p less than .05 ) than those of the pain-free subjects ( 2.5 + / -
Result	Tenderness to palpation was associated with elevated skin temperatures in 80 percent of the patients studied .
Result	This study suggests that liquid crystal thermography may be a potentially useful tool for localizing soft tissue trauma in patients with low back pain .

Method	In the present study , chronic constrictive injury ( CCI model ) of the sciatic nerve or tight ligation of L5 and L6 spinal nerves ( Chung model ) produced both dynamic and static components of mechanical allodynia in rats .
Method	The two responses were detected , respectively , by lightly stroking the hind paw with cotton wool or application of pressure using von Frey hairs .
Result	Animals with spinal nerve ligation developed both types of responses at a faster rate compared to animals with the CCI .
Result	Morphine ( 1-3 mg/kg , s.c. ) dose-dependently blocked static but not dynamic allodynia .
Result	In contrast , pregabalin ( previously S-isobutylgaba and CI-1008 ) dose-dependently ( 3-30 mg/kg , p.o. ) blocked both types of allodynia .
Result	In CCI animals , two administrations of capsaicin ( 100 microg/50 microl ) into the plantar surface of the ipsilateral paw at 1-h intervals blocked the maintenance of thermal hyperalgesia without affecting either static or dynamic allodynia .
Result	The similar administration of a further two doses of capsaicin into the same animals blocked the maintenance of static allodynia without affecting the dynamic response .
Result	These data indicate that thermal hyperalgesia , static and dynamic allodynia are respectively signalled by C - , Adelta - and Abeta/capsaicin insensitive Adelta - primary sensory neurones .
Result	It is suggested that pregabalin possesses a superior antiallodynic profile than morphine and may represent a novel class of therapeutic agents for the treatment of neuropathic pain .

Background	The objective of this study was to examine alteration in head repositioning accuracy ( HRA ) , range of motion , and pain intensity in patients with chronic cervical pain syndrome without a history of cervical trauma .
Method	The study was a prospective , randomized , controlled trial .
Method	Forty-one patients with chronic cervical pain were randomly assigned to either a control group or a chiropractic treatment group .
Method	All patients were clinically examined , given general information on cervical pain , and provided with training instructions based on the clinical evaluation .
Method	The treatment included sessions with high-velocity and low-amplitude manipulation , proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation , ischemic compression of myofascial trigger points , and spinal rehabilitation exercises aiming to normalize cervical range of moti
Method	Subjective pain intensity , cervical kinesthetic sensibility , and CROM were recorded before and after the study period .
Result	There was no difference between the treatment patients and the control subjects at the beginning with regard to age , sex , subjective pain intensity , range of motion , and HRA .
Result	At the 5-week follow-up , the treatment patients showed significant reductions in pain and improvement of all HRA aspects measured whereas the control subjects did not show any reduction in pain and improvement in only one HRA aspect .
Result	No significant difference was detected in CROM .
Result	The results of this study suggest that chiropractic care can be effective in influencing the complex process of proprioceptive sensibility and pain of cervical origin .
Result	Short , specific chiropractic treatment programs with proper patient information may alter the course of chronic cervical pain .

Background	Percutaneously inserted spinal epidural neurostimulation has been derived as a simplified safe alternative to surgically implanted , dorsal column stimulation that is used in the effective treatment and control of spasticity and intractable pain .
Method	Twenty-seven tissue specimens from fifteen patients having had percutaneous epidural neurostimulation systems implanted were studied with the aid of light microscopy .
Method	The biopsies from tissues around the cables , around the receivers , and at the actual site of epidural stimulation ( at the metallic contact ) , were studied at time intervals varying from one week to two years postimplantation .
Result	Long-term results , which only show dense fibrous encapsulation of the cables and the receiver , substantiate clinical belief regarding the `` histological safety '' of this electronic modality .

Background	To describe the anaesthetic management and report the incidence of PDPH in three parturients who had experienced accidental dural puncture during labour and the subsequent deliberate intrathecal insertion of an epidural catheter .
Method	Inadvertent dural puncture with a 16-gauge Tuohy needle occurred during the first stage of labour at 3-4 cm cervical dilatation in all three women .
Method	The 20-gauge epidural catheter was immediately inserted into the subarachnoid space after accidental dural penetration .
Method	Intermittent intrathecal injections of lidocaine or bupivacaine with fentanyl were administered to provide analgesia during labour and delivery .
Result	Two of the women had spontaneous vaginal deliveries , whereas Caesarean section was performed in one case due to acute fetal distress during the second stage of labour .
Result	The intrathecal catheter was left in-situ for 13-19 hr after delivery and the women were questioned daily for symptoms of PDPH .
Result	None of the three women developed PDPH after dural puncture and intrathecal catheterisation with the epidural catheter .
Result	Immediate intrathecal insertion of the epidural catheter after accidental dural puncture during labour proved to be an effective prophylactic technique to prevent PDPH in these three parturients .

Background	The `` Standards , Options and Recommendations '' ( SOR ) project , started in 1993 , is a collaboration between the National Federation of Comprehensive Cancer Centres ( FNCLCC ) , the 20 French Cancer Centers and specialists from French Public Universitie
Background	The main objective is the development of clinical practice guidelines to improve the quality of health care and outcome for cancer patients .
Method	The methodology is based on literature review and critical appraisal by a multidisciplinary group of experts , with feedback from specialists in cancer care delivery .
Method	To develop clinical practice guidelines according to the definitions of the Standards , Options and Recommendations project for nutritional support in adult patients with advanced or terminal cancer .
Method	Data were identified by searching Medline , web sites and using the personal reference lists of members of the expert groups .
Method	Once the guidelines were defined , the document was submitted for review to 95 independent reviewers .
Result	The main recommendations for nutritional support in adult patients with advanced or terminal cancer are : 1 ) Palliative care has been defined in a consensual way and is governed by the law ( standard ) .
Result	Nutritional support is a palliative care which aim is to maintain and restore the `` well-being '' of the patient ( standard ) .
Result	2 ) Digestive symptoms and nutritional troubles are frequently noted in patients with advanced or terminal cancer ( standard , level of evidence B2 ) .
Method	Karnofsky index ( KPS ) and performance status ( PS ) are functional scores with a prognostic value and have to be used ( standard , level of evidence B2 ) .
Method	3 )
Result	Anorexia has a bad predictive value in patients with advanced or terminal cancer ( standard , level of evidence B2 ) .
Method	4 )
Method	In France , patients with advanced or terminal cancer are referred to medical institutions , palliative care units or remained at home ( standard ) .
Result	Patients need a multidisciplinary follow-up ( standard ) .
Result	An active participation of patients and/or their family circle is very important and physicians have to pay attention for their opinions ( standard ) .
Result	5 ) Dietetic counseling can help patients to improve their alimentation and its drawbacks ( standard ) .
Result	6 ) Palliative nutritional care often includes medicinal treatments ( standard ) .
Result	7 ) Artificial nutrition can slow down nutritional degradation , avoid dehydration and improve quality of life in patients with advanced stage cancer ( especially head and neck cancer for enteral nutrition and digestive occlusions for parenteral nutrition ) a
Result	9 ) The assessment of nutritional care in patients with advanced or terminal cancer has to include functional scores measurement , quality of life and satisfaction degree of the patient and/or their family ( standard , expert agreement ) .

Background	To evaluate the reliability and validity of a self-report FIM ( FIM-SR ) in two samples of adults with disabilities .
Method	Participants in a clinical trial of amitriptyline for pain ( n = 84 with spinal cord injury [ SCI ] , n = 38 with amputation ) provided responses to the study measures via telephone interview .
Method	Reliability was estimated using Cronbach 's alpha and test-retest correlation coefficients , and validity was examined by comparing FIM-SR scores with the Craig Handicap Assessment and Reporting Technique ( CHART ) by comparing the CHART scores between the participants with SCI and amputation , and by comparing CHART scores between subjects with different levels of SCI .
Result	In the SCI sample , the FIM-SR demonstrated adequate reliability , and correlational analyses supported the validity of the FIM-SR motor scales .
Result	In addition , the FIM-SR motor scales discriminated subjects with different diagnoses ( SCI vs. amputation ) and injury levels ( paraplegia vs. tetraplegia ) .
Result	The psychometric properties of the entire FIM-SR in the amputation sample and of the FIM-SR cognitive scales in the SCI sample were difficult to determine due to a ceiling effect in which these scale scores were skewed toward the top end of the range .
Result	The FIM-SR motor scales and total FIM-SR score are reliable and valid measures of perceived functional independence in individuals with SCI .
Result	However , all of the FIM-SR scales in the amputation sample , and the FIM-SR cognitive scales in the SCI sample , seem to be less useful measures of functioning due to subjects reporting high levels of independence .
Result	The FIM-SR should be retested in amputation samples with more variable levels of functioning .

Background	To determine the feasibility of contrast-enhanced three-dimensional ( 3D ) imaging of the prostatic vasculature using power Doppler imaging and to analyze whether semiquantitative judgments of 3D images with respect to symmetry and distribution of vascular
Method	3D power Doppler images were obtained before and after intravenous administration of 2.5 g Levovist .
Method	Subsequently , random and/or directed transrectal ultrasound ( TRUS ) - guided biopsies were performed .
Method	Vascular images were analyzed by two experts .
Method	Prostate vasculature was judged with respect to symmetry and vessel distribution using a ( scale ) grading system .
Method	Eighteen patients with a suspicion of prostate cancer either because of an elevated prostate-specific antigen ( greater than 4.0 ng/mL ; Tandem-R-assay ) or an abnormal digital rectal examination were included in the study .
Result	Prostate cancer was detected in 13 patients .
Result	Vascular anatomy was judged abnormal in unenhanced images in 6 cases , of which 5 proved malignant .
Result	Enhanced images were considered suspicious for malignancy in 12 cases , including 1 benign and 11 malignant biopsy results .
Result	Sensitivity of enhanced images was 85 % ( specificity 80 % ) compared with 38 % for unenhanced images ( specificity 80 % ) and 77 % for conventional gray-scale TRUS ( specificity 60 % ) .
Result	Of 6 patients who showed no B-mode abnormalities , vascular patterns were judged abnormal in 4 cases , of which 3 were malignant .
Result	Contrast-enhanced 3D power Doppler angiography is feasible in patients with suspicion of prostate cancer who are scheduled for prostate biopsies .
Result	The sensitivity of power Doppler 3D imaging for the detection of prostate malignancy increased from 38 % ( 5 of 13 ) to 85 % ( 11 of 13 ) after administration of intravascular microbubble contrast ( Levovist ) , and specificity was found to be 80 % ( 4 of 5 ) for bot
Result	Thus , the use of Levovist when combined with the power Doppler display mode and 3D image reconstruction offers a promising new research area that might prove useful in prostate cancer detection in the future .

Background	We reviewed all pediatric cases referred for emergent/urgent therapy ( requiring treatment within 48 hours ) to identify frequency , patterns of presentation , and efficacy of therapy .
Background	We defined five categories of emergent/urgent therapy based on irradiated site and/or signs : Group I , spinal cord compression ; Group II , respiratory compromise ; Group III , infradiaphagmatic distress ; Group IV , intracranial signs ; Group V , pain .
Method	From 2/1/88 -3 / 1 / 94 , 104 children with 115 problems were referred by specialists at the Children 's Hospital of Philadelphia .
Method	Diagnosis , nature of the emergency , and response were examined .
Method	Responses were categorized as complete resolution , improvement or stabilization , and progression .
Result	The 104 children represented 12 % of referrals during the study period .
Result	The most common tumors were CNS PNET and gliomas ( 20 % ) ; and neuroblastoma ( 20 % ) .
Result	Forty-five problems occurred with newly diagnosed tumors and 70 after progression .
Result	Ninety-one episodes were managed with radiation therapy and 24 with other modalities .
Result	Patients with spinal cord/cauda equina ( n = 33 ) compression improved ( 55 % ) or stabilized ( 30 % ) .
Result	Patients with respiratory compromise from thoracic ( n = 14 ) or abdominal ( n = 5 ) disease had a response rate of 72 % .
Result	Eight patients in group III had a 66 % response .
Result	In Group IV ( n = 16 ) , 63 % had complete responses and 19 % had stabilization .
Result	Group V ( n = 15 ) patients had a complete or partial response of 93 % .
Result	Approximately 10 % of children referred for radiation therapy required emergent/urgent treatment .
Result	Eighty percent of patients achieved stabilization or showed improvement in signs and symptoms , indicating that radiotherapy is a valuable and reliable component of multimodal care in such situations .

Background	There is growing evidence that cyclic alternating pattern ( CAP ) and arousals are woven into the basic mechanisms of sleep regulation .
Method	In the present study , the overnight sleep cycles ( SC ) of 20 normal subjects were analyzed according to their stage composition , CAP rate , phase A subtypes and arousals .
Method	Individual SC were then divided into 10 normalized temporal epochs .
Method	CAP parameters and arousals were measured in each epoch and averaged in relation to the SC order .
Result	Subtypes A2 and A3 of CAP in non-rapid eye movement ( NREM ) sleep , and arousals , both in REM and NREM sleep when not coincident with a A2 or A3 phases , were lumped together as fast electroencephalographic ( EEG ) activities ( FA ) .
Method	Subtypes A1 of CAP , characterized by slow EEG activities ( SA ) , were analyzed separately .
Result	The time distribution of SA and FA was compared to the mathematical model of normal sleep structure including functions representing the homeostatic process S , the circadian process C , the ultradian process generating NREM/REM cycles and the slow wave act
Result	The relationship between SA and FA and the sleep-model components was evaluated by multiple regression analysis in which SA and FA were considered as dependent variables while the covariates were the process S , process C , SWA , REM-on and REM-off activitie
Result	Regression was highly significant ( P < 0.0001 ) for both SA and FA .
Result	SA were prevalent in the first three SC , and exhibited single or multiple peaks immediately before and in the final part of deep sleep ( stages 3 + 4 ) .
Result	The peaks of FA were delayed and prevailed during the pre-REM periods of light sleep ( stages 1 + 2 ) and during REM sleep .
Result	SA showed an exponential decline across the successive SC , according to the homeostatic process .
Result	In contrast , the distribution of FA was not influenced by the order of SC , with periodic peaks of FA occurring before the onset of REM sleep , in accordance with the REM-on switch .
Result	The dynamics of CAP and arousals during sleep can be viewed as an intermediate level between cellular activities and macroscale EEG phenomena as they reflect the decay of the homeostatic process and the interaction between REM-off and REM-on mechanisms wh

Background	To evaluate the efficacy of acupuncture as a treatment for chronic pain and secondary symptoms after spinal cord injury ( SCI ) and to identify disease-specific variables associated with response to treatment .
Method	A within-subjects design consisting of a 7 ( 1/2 ) - week no-acupuncture baseline period followed by a 7 ( 1/2 ) - week treatment period and a follow-up assessment 3 months posttreatment .
Method	Medical rehabilitation research center .
Method	Twenty-two people with SCI who experienced moderate to severe pain of at least 6 months ' duration .
Method	A course of 15 acupuncture treatments was administered over a 7 ( 1/2 ) - week period .
Method	Numeric Rating Scale of pain intensity ; ratings of interference with activity , individualized symptom rating , Center for Epidemiologic Studies-Depression Scale ; Speilberger State Trait Anxiety Inventory , and General Well-Being Schedule .
Result	Ten patients ( 46 % ) showed improvement in pain intensity and pain sequelae after treatment .
Result	However , 6 patients ( 27 % ) reported an increase in pain that was still present 3 months after treatment .
Result	About 50 % of the study sample reported substantial pain relief after acupuncture treatment , suggesting that acupuncture may provide pain relief for at least a subgroup of individuals with SCI .
Result	Future research is needed to determine what part of this effect is because of acupuncture versus nonspecific effects such as placebo effects and regression to the mean .

Background	The aim of this study was to determine whether a 3-year treatment with strontium ranelate could delay the progression of spinal osteoarthritis ( OA ) .
Method	This study was a post-hoc analysis of pooled data from the Spinal Osteoporosis Therapeutic Intervention ( SOTI ) and TReatment Of Peripheral OSteoporosis ( TROPOS ) trials performed on 1105 women with osteoporosis and concomitant radiological spinal OA at bas
Method	The presence and severity of osteophytes , disc space narrowing and sclerosis in the lumbar intervertebral spaces was graded according to a validated method , and an overall OA score was calculated for each intervertebral space .
Method	Back pain ( measured on a five-point Likert scale only in SOTI ) and health-related quality of life ( SF-36 questionnaire ) were assessed at baseline and after 3 years .
Method	Patients who suffered an incident or progressive vertebral fracture during the study were excluded from the analysis .
Result	The proportion of patients with worsening overall spinal OA score was reduced by 42 % in the strontium ranelate group , compared with placebo ( RR , 0.58 ; 95 % CI , 0.42 to 0.79 ; p = 0.0005 ) .
Result	Significantly more patients in the strontium ranelate group experienced an improvement in back pain after 3 years , compared with placebo ( p = 0.03 ) , while no significant difference was observed in terms of health-related quality of life between these pati
Result	The results of this post-hoc analysis suggest that strontium ranelate could reduce the progression of the radiographic features of spinal OA and back pain in women with osteoporosis and prevalent spinal OA .

Background	We sought to determine the components of irritable bowel syndrome ( IBS ) clinical trials that correlate with higher levels of placebo response .
Method	We performed a systematic review of placebo-controlled trials in patients with IBS to assess which variables correlate with a higher placebo response .
Method	Placebo responses for global symptom improvement and for decreased abdominal pain were assessed .
Method	Univariate and multiple linear regression analyses were conducted .
Result	Higher rates of global improvement correlated with frequency of administration of study intervention ( r = .31 , P = .03 ) , duration of the study ( r = .28 , P = .04 ) , and overall treatment effect of the active agent being studied ( r = .33 , P = .02 ) .
Result	Higher rates of decreased abdominal pain correlated with the frequency of intervention ( r = .39 , P = .02 ) and overall treatment effect ( r = .40 , P = .01 ) , whereas lower placebo response rates correlated with year of the study ( r = -.36 , P = .03 ) , media
Result	On multivariate analysis , global improvement in the placebo group was associated significantly with intervention frequency ( P = .0079 ) , overall treatment response ( P = .0031 ) , and parallel study design ( P = .0044 ) .
Result	Decreased abdominal pain was associated significantly with frequency of intervention ( P = .0061 ) and overall treatment response ( P = .0128 ) .
Result	In IBS studies , higher placebo response rates correlated with frequency of the intervention and with overall treatment effect of the active agent being studied .
Result	In designing IBS trials , it may be possible to minimize placebo response by less frequent dosing .
Result	In treating patients with IBS , it may be possible to harness the placebo response and maximize therapeutic response rates by more frequent dosing .

Background	To assess whether losses in physical functioning are related to the natural menopause , hysterectomy , or calendar time during midlife , after adjustment for body size and smoking .
Method	A longitudinal assessment of physical functioning was conducted from 2000/01 through 2005/06 in a population-based sample of 544 women at midlife enrolled in the Michigan Bone Health and Metabolism Study .
Method	Longitudinal mixed models were used to relate menopausal status to measures of physical functioning .
Method	Perception of physical functioning was assessed with the Medical Outcomes Study Short-Form 36 questionnaire .
Method	Eight performance-based measures of physical functioning were also included .
Result	Women with hysterectomy ( with or without estrogen from ovarian conservation or exogenous replacement ) had reduced levels of functioning and greater rates of change in the 2-lb lift ( P < .005 ) , sit-to-stand ( P < .01 ) , timed stair climb ( P < .01 ) , timed
Result	Diminished functioning in postmenopausal women was observed in hand grip ( P < .005 ) , 2-lb lift ( P < .05 ) , sit-to-stand ( P < .05 ) , velocity ( P < .05 ) , and perceived physical functioning ( P < .05 ) .
Result	Based on regression analyses , there was greater loss in women with hysterectomy compared with natural menopause .
Result	Level of functioning among postmenopausal women with exogenous hormone replacement was similar to premenopausal women on eight of nine physical functioning measures .
Result	Hysterectomy , even with availability of an estrogen source , seems to be a `` risk '' state for diminishing physical function at midlife , and this may initiate a vulnerable stage for future compromised quality of life .

Background	Patients with multiple sclerosis who develop progressive disability from onset without relapses or remissions pose difficulties in diagnosis , monitoring of disease activity and treatment .
Background	There is a need to define the diagnostic criteria for this group more precisely and , in particular , to describe a comprehensive battery of investigations to exclude other conditions .
Background	The mechanisms underlying the development of disability and the role of MRI in monitoring disease activity in this clinical subgroup require elucidation , particularly in view of the lack of change on conventional imaging in the presence of continuing clin
Background	The prognosis is poor and there are currently no treatment trials for this form of the disease .

Background	Neuropathic pain is characterised by hyperexcitability within nociceptive pathways that manifests behaviourally as allodynia and hyperalgesia and remains difficult to treat with standard analgesics .
Background	However , antidepressants have shown reasonable preclinical and clinical anti-nociceptive efficacy against signs and symptoms of neuropathic pain .
Method	To ascertain whether inhibition of serotonin ( 5-HT ) and/or noradrenaline ( NA ) and/or dopamine ( DA ) re-uptake preferentially mediates superior anti-nociception in preclinical pain models .
Method	The 5-HT re-uptake inhibitor fluoxetine ( 3-30 mg/kg ) , the NA re-uptake inhibitor reboxetine ( 3-30 mg/kg ) , the dual 5-HT and NA re-uptake inhibitor venlafaxine ( 3-100 mg/kg ) and the dual DA and NA re-uptake inhibitor bupropion ( 3-30 mg/kg ) were tested afte
Result	Reboxetine and venlafaxine dose-dependently attenuated second-phase flinching in the formalin test ; fluoxetine attenuated flinching only at the highest dose tested , whereas bupropion was ineffective .
Result	In the chronic constriction injury ( CCI ) and spinal nerve ligation models of neuropathic pain , hindpaw mechanical allodynia was significantly attenuated by fluoxetine and particularly by bupropion .
Result	Reboxetine and venlafaxine were completely ineffective .
Result	In contrast , reboxetine and venlafaxine reversed thermal hyperalgesia in CCI rats , whereas bupropion and fluoxetine were either minimally effective or ineffective .
Result	Fluoxetine , reboxetine and venlafaxine transiently increased the tail-flick latency in uninjured animals .
Result	Anti-nociceptive doses of drugs had no effect on motor function .
Result	Combined re-uptake inhibition of 5-HT and NA appears to confer a greater degree of anti-nociception in animal models of experimental pain than single mechanism of action inhibitors .
Result	The selective attenuation of mechanical allodynia by bupropion suggests that the additional re-uptake of DA may further augment 5-HT/NA re-uptake mediated anti-nociception after nerve injury .

Method	A multi-center longitudinal study .
Background	To estimate the current trend in the incidence of first kidney stone among persons with spinal cord injury ( SCI ) and to delineate the potential contributing factors .
Method	Twenty-one Model SCI Care Systems throughout the United States .
Method	A longitudinal cohort of 8314 subjects enrolled in the National SCI Database between 1986 and 1999 was used to estimate and compare the incidence of first kidney stone with a previous report of 5850 SCI patients injured between 1973 and 1982 .
Method	A Cox regression analysis was performed to identify risk factors for stones , including age , race , gender , severity of injury , and method of urinary drainage .
Method	These variables have been routinely collected , on a yearly basis , by the collaborating SCI centers .
Result	During the 12 years , 6 months of case ascertainment , 286 incident stone cases were documented .
Result	The risk was greatest during the first 3 months after injury ( 31 cases per 1000 person-years ) , quickly decreasing and leveling off later ( eight cases per 1000 person-years ) .
Result	It was estimated that within 10 years after injury , 7 % of persons with SCI would develop their first kidney stone .
Result	There was no evidence that the risk has changed over the past 25 years ( P = 0.96 ) .
Result	During the first year post injury only , a significantly increased risk of stones was observed in Caucasians and persons aged 45 years or older .
Result	A positive association of the severity of injury and requiring instrumentation for bladder emptying with kidney stones was found after the first year post injury .
Result	The type of urinary drainage , including indwelling , intermittent , and condom catheterization , had no significant differential effect on stone formation at either risk period .
Result	The highest risk of kidney stones is within the first few months post injury .
Result	Little progress has been made in reducing this risk .
Result	Although inability to control bladder function is an important risk factor after the first year post injury , for those who need bladder management , the type of urinary drainage does not appear to be an important factor in determining risk .

Background	An innovative stenting technique to treat a difficult case of a fusiform aneurysm of the intracranial vertebral artery ( VA ) , with restoration of the vessel lumen , is described .
Background	A 58-year-old patient experienced sudden pain in the upper cervical spine , followed by a severe headache .
Background	He underwent computed tomographic evaluation , which demonstrated subarachnoid hemorrhage in the prepontine cistern .
Background	A fusiform aneurysm of the distal right VA and critical stenosis of the left VA were detected in digital subtraction angiograms .
Background	The patient experienced a new subarachnoid hemorrhaging episode , and urgent endovascular treatment was planned .
Method	The patient underwent angioplastic and stenting procedures in the left VA , with good results .
Method	Forty-eight hours later , an endovascular procedure was performed to treat the right VA aneurysm .
Method	We decided to use a graft stent ( Jostent graft stent ; Jomed , Conroe , TX ) instead of a balloon to preserve the arterial lumen .
Result	The complete procedure was well tolerated by the patient , and he was discharged , without symptoms , 48 hours later .
Result	The patient was discharged , without neurological deficits , 48 hours after completion of the endovascular procedure , with clopidogrel ( 75 mg/d ) and aspirin ( 325 mg/d ) therapy .
Result	This treatment was discontinued after 4 weeks .
Result	According to our search of the medical literature , this is the first clinical case in which an intracranial fusiform aneurysm was permanently sealed with a graft stent .

Background	Family caregivers of U.S. servicemembers with polytraumatic injuries ( injuries to multiple body systems ) need support and information to care for their family members .
Background	Providing information to patients ` families may reduce stress and increase coping abilities .
Background	Because the field of polytrauma research is new and evidence is lacking , providers rely on traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) research to guide their practice .
Method	This article presents a narrative literature review on the information needs of families of patients with TBI .
Method	It summarizes the types of needed information , the most appropriate time to provide information , and the best approaches for providing information .
Result	Future research on information needs is critical if polytrauma rehabilitation providers are to effectively support families in their caregiving roles .
Result	Such research likely will benefit caregivers of patients with polytrauma who acquire their injuries as civilians , as well .
Result	Research gaps are identified with regard to the information needs of families of patients with TBI ; these gaps also are applicable to polytrauma caregivers .
Result	Additional research areas are highlighted in light of the new polytrauma population .

Background	This study investigated the effect of traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) on time - , event - , and activity-based prospective memory using a laboratory paradigm developed in the literature on ageing ( Einstein , McDaniel , Richardson , Guynn , & Cunfer , 1995 ) .
Method	The participants were 12 individuals with severe long-term TBI and 12 community controls .
Method	Participants were asked to answer general-knowledge questions on a computer for two sessions .
Method	The time - and event-based tasks were embedded in this filler activity .
Method	Participants were also required to carry out activity-based actions at the end of the two sessions .
Result	Participants with TBI performed significantly worse than did controls on all three prospective-memory tasks , indicating that TBI affects not only retrospective but also prospective memory .

Background	Patients with myocardial hibernation have reversible left ventricular dysfunction after revascularization .
Background	Viability testing can identify those patients whose left ventricular dysfunction is primarily due to hibernation rather than scar .
Result	Patients with a substantial amount of hibernating myocardium seem to have a better outcome with revascularization than medical therapy .
Result	Patients with poor viability do worse after revascularization than patients with good viability .

Background	Opioids are commonly used for pain relief clinically and reduce hyperalgesia in most animal models .
Background	Two injections of acidic saline into one gastrocnemius muscle 5 days apart produce a long-lasting bilateral hyperalgesia without associated tissue damage .
Method	The current study was undertaken to assess the effects of opioid agonists on mechanical hyperalgesia induced by repeated intramuscular injections of acid .
Method	Morphine ( mu-agonist ) , [ D-Ala ( 2 ) , N-Me-Phe ( 4 ) , Gly-ol ( 5 ) ] - enkephalin ( mu-agonist ; DAMGO ) , 4 - [ ( ( alpha ) R ) - alpha - ( ( 2S ,5 R ) -4 - allyl-2 ,5 - dimethyl-1-piperazinyl ) -3 - methoxybenzyl ] - N,N-diethylbenzamide ( delta-agonist ; SNC80 ) , or ( 1S-trans ) -3,4 - dichloro-N-methyl-N - [ 2
Method	Mechanical hyperalgesia was assessed by measuring the withdrawal thresholds to mechanical stimuli ( von Frey filaments ) before the first and second intramuscular injection , 24 h after the second intramuscular injection , and for 1 h after administration of the opioid agonist or vehicle .
Result	Morphine , DAMGO , and SNC80 dose dependently increased the mechanical withdrawal threshold back toward baseline responses .
Result	The reduction in hyperalgesia produced by morphine and DAMGO was prevented by H-D-Phe-Cys-Tyr-D-Trp-Arg-Thr-Pen-Thr-NH ( 2 ) ( CTAP ) and that of SNC80 was prevented by naltrindole .
Result	U50 ,488 had no effect on the decreased mechanical withdrawal thresholds .
Result	Thus , activation of mu - and delta - , but not kappa - , opioid receptors in the spinal cord reduces mechanical hyperalgesia following repeated intramuscular injection of acid , thus validating the use of this new model of chronic muscle pain .

Background	Hemorrhoidal disease is a common pathology in patients with chronic spinal cord injury ( SCI ) .
Method	We describe our experience with the primary approach to this problem at the Proctology Division of the Sheba Medical Center .
Method	We treated 29 patients ( 26 men ) with paraplegia due to SCI between 1995 and 1999 .
Method	The mean age was 49 years ( range , 22-74 years ) .
Method	All patients had hemorrhoids in stages ranging between II and IV .
Method	Main complaints were rectal bleeding ( 83 % ) , difficulties in evacuation ( 38 % ) and discomfort or pain ( 28 % ) .
Method	Eleven patients ( 38 % ) were treated conservatively ( e. g. diet , hygiene and laxatives ) , while 18 patients ( 62 % ) underwent either banding or sclerotherapy of hemorrhoids or both .
Result	No major complication were observed .
Result	In 28 of 29 patients ( 96 % ) , there was a significant reduction or cessation of bleeding and/or relief of symptoms ; one patient ( 3 % ) required hemorrhoidectomy .
Result	Of the 28 successful treatments , 16 ( 57 % ) had partial reduction of bleeding or relief of symptoms , while in 12 ( 43 % ) response was complete .
Result	Of those who were treated conservatively , 9 ( 82 % ) had partial and 2 ( 18 % ) had complete relief of symptoms .
Result	Of those who had banding/sclerotherapy , 7 ( 41 % ) had partial and 10 ( 59 % ) had complete relief .
Result	We also examined the effect of perianal sensation on the treatment outcome .
Result	Of 16 patients with complete anesthesia , 11 ( 69 % ) had partial and 5 ( 31 % ) had complete relief , whereas of the 12 patients with preserved sensation , 5 ( 42 % ) had partial and 7 ( 58 % ) had complete relief .
Result	In conclusion , the approach of banding or sclerotherapy of hemorrhoids in SCI patients is safe and effective .
Result	When sensation of the perianal region is preserved , the outcome seems to be better .
Result	The cause of SCI has no impact on the treatment results .
Result	There was no difference in the outcome of treatment between patients with stage II and stage III hemorrhoids ; patients with stage IV hemorrhoids seem to do worse than those with stages II and III .

Background	Previous studies have retrospectively reported the positive effects of percutaneous vertebroplasty .
Background	The purpose of our study was to evaluate prospectively the effects of vertebroplasty on mobility , analgesic use , pain , and SF-36 ( short-form 36-item ) scales for patients with painful vertebral compression fractures that are refractory to medical therapy .
Method	We prospectively followed 167 patients who received 207 vertebroplasty treatment sessions for stabilization of 264 symptomatic vertebral compression fractures between August 1999 and January 2003 .
Method	The average age of patients was 74.6 years ( SD = 12.2 years ) , and 76 % were women .
Method	Pre - and postprocedural measurements of pain , mobility , analgesic use , and SF-36 scales were compared at 1 month after the procedure and between 6 months and 3 years after the procedure with the SF-36 scales .
Result	Respective pre - and post-treatment pain scores were 8.71 ( SE = 0.1 ) and 2.77 ( SE = 0.18 ; P < .00001 ) .
Result	Respective pre - and post-treatment analgesic use scores were 2.93 ( SE = 0.9 ) and 1.64 ( SE = 0.09 ; P < .00001 ) .
Result	Respective pre - and post-treatment activity levels were 2.66 ( SE = 0.1 ) and 1.64 ( SE = 0.11 ; P < .00001 ) .
Result	There was a statistically significant improvement on nine of 10 SF-36 scales ( P < .001 ) after 1 month and on eight of 10 SF-36 scales ( P < .02 ) at long-term follow-up .
Result	Percutaneous vertebroplasty offers statistically significant benefits in decreasing pain , decreasing use of analgesics , and increasing mobility in appropriately selected patients .
Result	Percutaneous vertebroplasty also offers a statistically significant benefit in most SF-36 scales at both short - and long-term follow-up .

Background	To compare the efficacy of two clinically accepted methods of progesterone supplementation during IVF .
Method	Prospective randomized trial .
Method	A university-based IVF program .
Method	Three hundred fourteen stimulated IVF cycles between January 1993 and October 1994 .
Method	Patients were assigned to one of two luteal phase progesterone regimens by a random permuted block design .
Method	In protocol A , 12.5 mg of IM progesterone was given 12 hours before oocyte retrieval ; in protocol B , 25 mg of IM progesterone was given on the day of oocyte retrieval .
Method	Main Outcome Measure ( s ) Clinical pregnancy .
Result	Patient demographic characteristics , including age , diagnosis , number of oocytes retrieved and fertilized , and number of embryos transferred , were not different between the two groups .
Result	There was no difference in the rate of cycle cancellation between the groups .
Result	One hundred forty ETs were performed in patients assigned to protocol A and 142 in patients assigned to protocol B.
Result	The clinical pregnancy rate in group A was 12.9 % compared with 24.6 % in group B. CONCLUSION ( S ) : The administration of progesterone before oocyte retrieval is associated with a lower pregnancy rate than the administration of progesterone after oocyte retri

Method	Although the bladder neck is elevated during a pelvic floor muscle ( PFM ) contraction , it descends during straining .
Background	This study aimed to investigate the relationship between bladder neck displacement , electromyography ( EMG ) activity of the pelvic floor and abdominal muscles and intra-abdominal pressure ( IAP ) during different pelvic floor and abdominal contractions .
Method	Nine women without PFM dysfunction performed maximal , gentle and moderate PFM contractions , maximal and gentle transversus abdominis ( TrA ) contractions , bracing , Valsalva and head lift .
Method	Bladder neck position was assessed with perineal ultrasound .
Method	PFM and abdominal muscle activities were recorded with a vaginal probe and fine-wire electrodes , respectively .
Method	IAP was recorded with a rectal balloon .
Result	Bladder neck elevation only occurred during PFM and TrA contractions .
Result	PFM EMG and IAP increased during all tasks from 0.5 ( gentle TrA ) to 45.7 cmH ( 2 ) O ( maximal Valsalva ) .
Result	Bladder neck elevation was only observed when the activity of PFM EMG was high relative to the IAP increase .

Background	Epidemiological studies show a markedly increased risk of cerebral palsy following the combined exposure of infection and birth asphyxia .
Background	However , the underlying mechanisms of this increased vulnerability remain unclear .
Method	We have examined the effects of a low dose of bacterial endotoxin on hypoxic -- ischaemic injury in the immature brain of rats .
Method	Bacterial endotoxin ( lipopolysaccharide 0.3 mg/kg ) was administered to 7-day-old rats 4 h prior to unilateral hypoxia -- ischaemia and the neurological outcome was determined 3 days later .
Method	Rectal temperature and cerebral blood flow was measured during the study and the expression of CD14 and toll-like receptor-4 mRNA in the brain was examined .
Result	We found that a low dose of endotoxin dramatically sensitizes the immature brain to injury and induces cerebral infarction in response to short periods of hypoxia -- ischaemia that by themselves caused no or little injury .
Result	This effect could not be explained by a reduction in cerebral blood flow or hyperthermia .
Result	In association with the sensitization of injury we found an altered expression of CD14 mRNA and toll-like receptor-4 mRNA in the brain .
Result	These results suggest that the innate immune system may be involved in the vulnerability of the immature brain following the combination of infection and hypoxia -- ischaemia .

Background	Ursodeoxycholic acid possesses choleretic and cytoprotective properties and in cystic fibrosis ( CF ) it is used to treat the hepatobiliary symptoms of the disease .
Method	This study investigated the effects of this bile acid on the transport function of the small intestine in normal and CF mice .
Method	The effects of ursodeoxycholic acid were monitored as changes in short-circuit current ( SCC ) in stripped sheets of small intestine from normal ( Swiss MF1 ) and transgenic CF ( Cftr ( tm2Cam ) ) mice .
Method	In ileal sheets from Swiss MF1 mice , mucosal ursodeoxycholic acid caused a biphasic increase in SCC .
Method	The first phase was reduced by lowering the mucosal Na + concentration , while the second phase was inhibited by ( Cl - ) - free conditions , serosal furosemide or mucosal diphenylamine-2-carboxylic acid ( DPC ) , suggesting an initial Na + - dependent bile acid absorp
Method	Serosal application of ursodeoxycholic acid to the ileum and mucosal or serosal application to the mid-intestine and jejunum elicited a secretory response only .
Result	Secretion was Ca2 + - dependent , but did not involve neural mechanisms .
Result	Mucosal mast cells , histamine and serotonin ( 5-HT ) were implicated in the secretory response .
Result	Responses in tissues from transgenic wild-type mice were similar to those obtained with Swiss MF1 mice , but the secretory response to mucosal or serosal application of the bile acid was impaired in CF tissues .
Result	In ilea from CF mice the initial absorptive phase of the response to mucosal ursodeoxycholic acid was still observed .
Result	It is concluded that ursodeoxycholic acid induces secretion throughout the murine small intestine by a mechanism that involves degranulation of mucosal mast cells .
Result	In the ileum Na + - dependent absorption can also be detected .
Result	The secretory response is defective in CF intestine , but the absorptive effect is still present .

Background	Although adolescents in Reunion have a pregnancy rate of 77/1000 , twice that of France , there are no published studies on the themes of adolescent pregnancy and parenthood .
Method	105 women under 18 including 20 aged 14 who gave birth in 1 maternity center were analyzed for sociofamilial characteristics and perinatal complications .
Result	The educational level of the adolescent mothers was low and 47 % had stopped school before the pregnancy .
Result	1/3 expected to find employment or return to work after delivery .
Result	19 % were already in consensual unions at the time of pregnancy and 34 % had entered such unions after delivery .
Result	It was the 2nd pregnancy for 11.5 % .
Result	Only 8.5 % used contraception .
Result	The age difference with the partner was over 5 years for more than half .
Result	68 % had known the father for more than 1 year .
Result	At the time of pregnancy , 35 % lived in families with 2 parents and 36 % in households headed by their mothers .
Result	Heads of 50 % of all their households and 80 % of those headed by the mothers were unemployed .
Result	44 % had more than 6 siblings .
Result	20 % had 1 or more sisters who were adolescent mothers .
Result	Comparison with a group of 62 adolescents seeking abortions at the same center indicated several factors that appeared to encourage continuation of the pregnancy ; including being below age level in school , absence of plans for education or employment , lim
Result	Risk factors at the level of the family included absence of the father , maternal tolerance , poverty , and sisters who were single mothers .
Result	27 % states retrospectively that they would have preferred to terminate the pregnancy , but all stated they were satisfied after the delivery .
Result	41 % had problems in pregnancy or delivery .
Result	10.5 % had toxemia and 23 % had low birth weight babies .
Result	5.7 % had caesareans , mainly for eclampsia and acute fetal distress .
Result	There was 1 stillbirth and 2 cases of cogenital malformations .
Result	14 newborns were transferred were transferred to the neonatology unit for various problems , including 6 weighing under 2000 g.
Result	Compared to the general population , the rate of fetal growth retardation was 3 times higher and that of neonatal pathology requiring transfer to the neonatology unit was 2 times higher among adolescent mothers .
Result	Prenatal care was inadequate in many cases .
Result	35 % of 14-year-old mothers had 3 or fewer prenatal visits.adolescent pregnancy -- complicationsadolescentsadolescents femaleafricaafrica south of the saharaage factorscontraceptioncontraceptive usagedelivery of health caredemographic factorsdeveloping count

Background	The rising prevalence of type 2 diabetes in the UK has necessitated a change in the delivery of diabetes care , with a shift of focus from hospital to community .
Background	The National Service Framework for Diabetes has enshrined this approach , and the new General Medical Services ( GMS2 ) contract rewards primary healthcare professionals for developing high-quality diabetes care .
Background	New approaches cross the primary/secondary care divide and are patient focused .
Background	The evolution of diabetes care in the UK is illustrated by service developments in Newham , East London .

Background	To compare the pattern of familial aggregation of psychopathology in children who are good responders ( GR ) to methylphenidate ( MPH ) versus those who are poor responders ( PR ) .
Method	A total of 118 clinically referred children ages 6 to 12 years , diagnosed with ADHD participated in a double-blind , placebo-controlled , randomized 2-week crossover trial of MPH from 1999 to 2004 .
Method	A low dose of 0.5 mg/kg of body weight of MPH divided in two equal doses was used .
Method	Family history was obtained by interviewing at least one key historian relative of each subject using Family Interview for Genetic Studies .
Method	Information was collected on 342 first-degree and 1,151 second-degree relatives of children with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder .
Result	Forty-four subjects showed mild or no improvement ( PR ) and 74 showed moderate or very much improvement ( GR ) on MPH over placebo .
Result	First-degree relatives of GR subjects were at significantly higher risk of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder than the relatives of PR subjects ( p < .05 ) .
Result	Second-degree relatives of the GR were at significantly higher risk of antisocial personality disorder compared to the relatives of PR subjects ( p < .05 ) .
Result	The significantly higher presence of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder in the first-degree relatives and of antisocial personality disorder in the second-degree relatives of GR children suggests that this group may , at least partially , be distinct

Background	The aims of the study were to describe the prevalence and associations of mental health disorder ( MHD ) among a cohort of HIV-infected patients attending the Victorian HIV/AIDS Service between 1984 and 2000 , and to examine whether antiretroviral therapy us
Background	It was hypothesized that HIV-positive individuals with MHD would have poorer treatment outcomes , reduced responses to highly active antiretroviral therapy ( HAART ) and increased mortality compared with those without MHD .
Method	This is a retrospective cohort of 2981 individuals ( 73 % of the Victorian population diagnosed with HIV infection ) captured on an HIV database which was electronically matched with the public Victorian Psychiatric Case Register ( VPCR ) ( accounting for 95 % o
Method	The prevalence , dates and recorded specifics of mental health disorders at the time of the electronic match on 1 June 2000 are described .
Method	The association with recorded MHD , gender , age , AIDS illness , HIV exposure category , duration and type of antiviral therapy , treatment era ( prior to 1986 , post-1987 and pre-HAART , and post-HAART ) on hospitalization and mortality at 1 September 2001 was assessed .
Result	Five hundred and twenty-five individuals ( 17.6 % of the Victorian HIV-positive population ) were recorded with MHD , most frequently coded as attributable to substance dependence/abuse or affective disorder .
Result	MHD was diagnosed prior to HIV in 33 % and , of those diagnosed after HIV , 93.8 % were recorded more than 1 year after the HIV diagnosis .
Result	Schizophrenia was recorded in 6 % of the population with MHD .
Result	Hospitalizations for both psychiatric and nonpsychiatric illness were more frequent in those with MHD ( relative risk 5.4 ; 95 % confidence interval 3.7 , 8.2 ) .
Result	The total number of antiretrovirals used ( median 6.4 agents vs 5.5 agents ) was greater in those with MHD .
Result	When adjusted for antiretroviral treatment era , HIV exposure category , CD4 cell count and antiretroviral therapy , survival was not affected by MHD .
Result	MHD is frequent in this population with HIV infection and is associated with increased healthcare utilization but not with reduced survival .

Background	Clinically , chronic pain and hyperalgesia induced by muscle injury are disabling and difficult to treat .
Background	Cellular and molecular mechanisms underlying chronic muscle-induced hyperalgesia are not well understood .
Method	For this reason , we developed an animal model where repeated injections of acidic saline into one gastrocnemius muscle produce bilateral , long-lasting mechanical hypersensitivity of the paw ( i.e. hyperalgesia ) without associated tissue damage .
Method	Since acid sensing ion channels ( ASICs ) are found on primary afferent fibers and respond to decreases in pH , we tested the hypothesis that ASICs on primary afferent fibers innervating muscle are critical to development of hyperalgesia and central sensitization in response to repeated intramuscular acid .
Result	Dorsal root ganglion neurons innervating muscle express ASIC3 and respond to acidic pH with fast , transient inward and sustained currents that resemble those of ASICs .
