Result	Mechanical hyperalgesia produced by repeated intramuscular acid injections is prevented by prior treatment of the muscle with the non-selective ASIC antagonist , amiloride , suggesting ASICs might be involved .
Result	ASIC3 knockouts do not develop mechanical hyperalgesia to repeated intramuscular acid injection when compared to wildtype littermates .
Result	In contrast , ASIC1 knockouts develop hyperalgesia similar to their wildtype littermates .
Result	Extracellular recordings of spinal wide dynamic range ( WDR ) neurons from wildtype mice show an expansion of the receptive field to include the contralateral paw , an increased response to von Frey filaments applied to the paw both ipsilaterally and contral
Result	These changes in WDR neurons do not occur in ASIC3 knockouts .
Result	Thus , activation of ASIC3s on muscle afferents is required for development of mechanical hyperalgesia and central sensitization that normally occurs in response to repeated intramuscular acid .
Result	Therefore , interfering with ASIC3 might be of benefit in treatment or prevention of chronic hyperalgesia .

Background	Nitric oxide ( NO ) has been implicated in immune mediated cellular cytotoxicity and inflammatory processes including multiple sclerosis ( MS ) .
Method	We aimed to assess NO production in MS patients and to delineate its involvement in different stages .
Method	The stable end-products of NO ; nitrite ( NO2 - ) and nitrate ( NO3 - ) were analysed both in serum and CSF ( cerebrospinal fluid ) of patients with MS and non-inflammatory neurological diseases .
Method	Nitrite levels were quantified by calorimetric assay based on the Griess reaction .
Method	Nitrate levels were examined spectrophotometrically .
Result	MS patients exhibited significantly increased serum and CSF levels of NO2 - + NO3 - compared with the control subjects .
Result	CSF NO2 - + NO3 - levels were raised significantly in MS patients with both relapsing remitting ( RR ) and secondary progressive ( SP ) course .
Result	There was no significant difference between RR and SP MS patients with regard to NO metabolites .
Result	No significant correlation was found between NO metabolites and disability score , disease progression index , MRI ( magnetic resonance imaging ) activity and development of cortical atrophy on MRI .
Result	This study provides further evidence for excessive NO production both in CSF and peripheral blood of MS patients .
Result	Excessive CSF NO2 - + NO3 - levels being more increased than the levels in sera supports pathological inflammatory process within CNS ( central nervous system ) in both stages of MS.
Result	Another implication for the role of NO and INOS inhibitors in the treatment of MS patients with both RR and SP courses was also suggested .

Background	To investigate the additional diagnostic value of sural nerve biopsy of 64 patients in whom chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy ( CIDP ) was considered , as sural nerve biopsy is recommended in the research criteria of an ad hoc subcommittee to
Method	Firstly , the additional diagnostic value of sural nerve biopsy was analysed with multivariate logistic regression .
Method	Six clinical features ( remitting course , symmetric sensorimotor neuropathy in arms and legs , areflexia , raised CSF protein concentration , nerve conduction studies consistent with demyelination , and absence of comorbidity or relevant laboratory abnormalities ) were entered into a logistic model .
Method	Afterwards , all significant features identified from this model , as well as the results of sural nerve biopsy were forced into a second logistic model .
Method	Secondly , the diagnostic performance of a neurologist experienced in diagnosis of peripheral nerve disorders was studied by receiver operating characteristics ( ROC ) curve analysis .
Result	The results of the first logistic analysis showed that CSF protein concentration > 1 g/l ( odds ratio ( OR ) = 38.5 ) and neurophysiological studies consistent with demyelination ( OR = 51.7 ) were strong predictors of CIDP .
Result	When forcing the significant features and the sural nerve biopsy data into the model , an independent predictive value of sural nerve biopsy could not be found .
Result	The neurologist was able to discriminate patients with and without CIDP ( area under the curve ( AUC ) = 0.95 ) .
Result	His diagnostic performance did not improve significantly by offering him the results of sural nerve biopsy .
Result	Any additional diagnostic value of sural nerve biopsy in the diagnosis of CIDP could not be shown .

Background	Clinically unrecognized intravascular volume overload may contribute to worsening symptoms and disease progression in patients with chronic heart failure ( CHF ) .
Method	The present study was undertaken to prospectively compare measured blood volume status ( determined by radiolabeled albumin technique ) with clinical and hemodynamic characteristics and patient outcomes in 43 nonedematous ambulatory patients with CHF .
Result	Blood volume analysis demonstrated that 2 subjects ( 5 % ) were hypovolemic ( mean deviation from normal values -20 + / - 6 % ) , 13 subjects ( 30 % ) were normovolemic ( mean deviation from normal values -1 + / - 1 % ) , and 28 subjects ( 65 % ) were hypervolemic ( mean devia
Result	Physical findings of congestion were infrequent and not associated with blood volume status .
Result	Increased blood volume was associated with increased pulmonary capillary wedge pressure ( p = 0.01 ) and greatly increased risk of death or urgent cardiac transplantation during a median follow-up of 719 days ( 1-year event rate 39 % vs 0 % , p < 0.01 by log -
Result	Systolic blood pressure was significantly lower in hypervolemic patients than in those with normovolemia or hypovolemia ( 107 + / - 2 vs 119 + / - 2 mm Hg , p = 0.008 ) , and hypotension was independently associated with increased risk of hypervolemia in multivar
Result	These findings demonstrate that clinically unrecognized hypervolemia is frequently present in nonedematous patients with CHF and is associated with increased cardiac filling pressures and worse patient outcomes .

Background	To investigate heritability and continuum versus categorical approaches to attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder ( ADHD ) , using a large-scale twin sample .
Method	A cohort of 1,938 families with twins and siblings aged 4 to 12 years , recruited from the Australian National Health and Medical Research Council Twin Registry , was assessed for ADHD using a DSM-III-R-based maternal rating scale .
Method	Probandwise concordance rates and correlations in monozygotic and dizygotic twins and siblings were calculated , and heritability was examined using the De Fries and Fulker regression technique .
Result	There was a narrow ( additive ) heritability of 0.75 to 0.91 which was robust across familial relationships ( twin , sibling , and twin-sibling ) and across definitions of ADHD as part of a continuum or as a disorder with various symptom cutoffs .
Result	There was no evidence for nonadditive genetic variation or for shared family environmental effects .
Result	These findings suggest that ADHD is best viewed as the extreme of a behavior that varies genetically throughout the entire population rather than as a disorder with discrete determinants .
Result	This has implications for the classification of ADHD and for the identification of genes for this behavior , as well as implications for diagnosis and treatment .

Background	Highly sensitized ( HS ) patients ( > 85 % panel-reactive antibodies ) have a lower chance of receiving a donor kidney .
Background	Within Eurotransplant the Acceptable Mismatch ( AM ) program was developed to increase the chances of HS patients to receive a crossmatch-negative donor kidney .
Method	The standard crossmatch in the AM program is based on complement-dependent cytotoxicity .
Method	In this study we wanted to determine the clinical relevance of human leukocyte antigen donor-directed antibodies ( DDA ) detected by the single antigen ( SA ) bead technique , in the pretransplant sera of HS patients transplanted in our center through the Euro
Result	From 34 AM patients , 27 were transplanted with 1 to 5 mismatches and 7 received a 0-mismatched graft .
Result	From the mismatched patients , retrospectively , 13 proved to possess pretransplant DDA by SA whereas 14 did not .
Result	No antibodies were found in the 0-mismatched group .
Result	Comparison of the DDA + and DDA - patients in the human leukocyte antigen-mismatched donor/recipient combinations revealed a trend to an earlier and higher number of rejection episodes in DDA + patients ( P = 0.08 ) .
Result	No detrimental effect of DDA on graft survival was observed .
Result	This single-center study showed that in the AM program DDA detected by SA , and not by less-sensitive methods , may be related to acute rejection episodes but is not detrimental to long-term graft outcome .
Result	These findings question the increasing use of more-sensitive screening techniques for the allocation of organs .

Background	Polyunsaturated fatty acids ( PUFAs ) modulate immune responses particularly by affecting T cell function and are applied clinically as adjuvant immunosuppressants in the treatment of various inflammatory diseases .
Background	However , the molecular mechanisms of PUFA-induced immunosuppressive effects are not yet elucidated .

Method	Lipid rafts were isolated by discontinuous sucrose density gradient ultracentrifugation .
Method	The lipids in raft and soluble fractions from EPA-treated and control T cells were extracted and separated by gas chromatography .

Result	Effective incorporation of EPA to rafts was not only in the exoplasmic but also in the cytoplasmic membrane lipid leaflet .
Result	EPA treatment altered the lipid environment in lipid rafts .
Result	EPA presented an inhibiting effect on Jurkat T cells proliferation and inhibited IL-2Ralpha expression on the surface of T cells.CONCLUSIONS : Our data provided evidence for an important modification in lipid composition of membrane lipid rafts and T cell

Background	Activation of peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor ( PPAR ) - alpha , a member of the nuclear receptor superfamily , modulates inflammation and tissue injury events associated with spinal cord trauma in mice .
Background	Palmitoylethanolamide ( PEA ) , the naturally occurring amide of palmitic acid and ethanolamine , reduces pain and inflammation through a mechanism dependent on PPAR-alpha activation .
Method	The aim of the present study was to evaluate the effect of the PEA on secondary damage induced by experimental spinal cord injury ( SCI ) in mice .
Method	SCI was induced by application of vascular clips to the dura mater via a four-level T ( 5 ) - T ( 8 ) laminectomy .
Result	This resulted in severe trauma characterized by edema , neutrophil infiltration , and production of inflammatory mediators , tissue damage , and apoptosis .
Result	Repeated PEA administration ( 10 mg/kg i.p. ; 30 min before and 1 and 6 h after SCI ) significantly reduced : 1 ) the degree of spinal cord inflammation and tissue injury , 2 ) neutrophil infiltration , 3 ) nitrotyrosine formation , 4 ) proinflammatory cytokine expr
Result	Moreover , PEA treatment significantly ameliorated the recovery of motor limb function .
Result	Together , the results indicate that PEA reduces inflammation and tissue injury associated with SCI and suggest a regulatory role for endogenous PPAR-alpha signaling in the inflammatory response associated with spinal cord trauma .

Method	One hundred thirty consecutive patients with metastatic spinal cord compression ( MSCC ) were entered in a therapeutic protocol in which radiation therapy ( RT ) played the main role .
Background	When MSCC is diagnosed by clinical-radiologic methods such as myelography with or without computed tomography ( CT ) or magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) , steroids are given and RT treatment started within 24 hours .
Background	When diagnostic doubts exist or stabilization is necessary , surgery precedes RT. .
Background	Chemohormonal potentially responsive tumors are also treated with chemotherapy or hormonal therapy .
Method	Twelve patients ( 9.2 % ) underwent surgery plus RT , and 118 ( 90.8 % ) received RT alone .
Result	Thirteen ( 11 % ) early death patients were not evaluable .
Method	The 105 evaluable cases that received RT alone were analyzed .
Method	Median follow-up was 15 months ( range , 4 to 38 months ) .
Result	Response among patients with back pain was 80 % .
Result	In cases with motor dysfunction , 48.6 % improved , and in 33 of 105 patients ( 31.4 % ) without motor disability there was no deterioration .
Result	Forty percent of patients with autonomic dysfunction responded to RT. .
Result	Median survival time was 7 months with a 36 % probability of survival for 1 year .
Result	The median duration of improvement was 8 months .
Result	The most important prognostic factor was early diagnosis .
Result	Radiosensitivity of tumor was only important in paraparetic patients in predicting response to RT. .
Result	Complete myelographic block significantly diminished response to RT. .
Result	Vertebral collapse did not influence response or survival .

Background	To characterize the matched maternal and cord plasma and the amniotic fluid concentrations of iodide in preterm and term human pregnancies .
Method	Specimens were collected at the delivery of 121 singleton pregnancies ( 92 at term , 29 preterm ) with no pre-existing medical complications .
Method	Plasma unbound iodide concentrations were measured by the difference between the protein bound iodine and the total iodine measured spectrophotometrically .
Method	Total iodide was measured in amniotic fluid .
Result	Maternal plasma iodide concentrations were 1.6 + / - 0.4 mcg/dL ( mean + / - S.D. ) for preterm deliveries and 1.5 + / -0.5 mcg/dL for term deliveries .
Result	Cord plasma iodide concentrations were 1.4 + / - 0.5 mcg/dL for preterm deliveries and 1.7 + / - 0.7 mcg/dL for term deliveries .
Result	Cord plasma iodide concentrations at birth correlated highly with maternal levels ( p < 0.001 ) .
Result	The cord : maternal plasma iodide ratio for all pairs was 1.2 + / - 0.7 .
Result	The average cord : maternal plasma iodide ratio was not significantly different between the preterm ( 0.9 + / - 0.4 ) and term ( 1.3 + / - 0.8 ) deliveries .
Result	Amniotic fluid iodide concentrations did not correlate significantly with cord plasma concentrations .
Result	Cord plasma concentrations of iodide correlate with paired maternal levels , indicating that , unlike the rabbit and other species , the human conceptus does not highly concentrate iodide .

Background	Epidemiological studies suggest that adiposity in children may be associated with a reduced level of physical activity .
Background	Children with Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder ( ADHD ) are physically hyperactive as of early childhood and have been shown to exhibit higher levels of motor activity than normal .
Method	The aim of our study was to assess if the prevalence of overweight and obesity is lower in a population of boys with ADHD in comparison with the German healthy male reference population of the same age .
Method	Patients were investigated from 1999 until 2001 upon referral to the inpatient and outpatient unit of the Department of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry of the University of Aachen .
Method	A total of 97 male patients ( mean age 10 + / -2 y ) with a diagnosis of ADHD according the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders ( DSM-IV ) , who were free of potentially orexigenic medication and who had no further comorbid diagnosis apart from
Method	BMI standard deviation scores ( BMI-SDS ) were calculated and compared to age-adapted reference value of the German population .
Result	Patients ' mean BMI-SDS was significantly higher than the age-adapted reference values of the German population ( P = 0.038 ) .
Result	Our sample included significantly more subjects than expected with a BMI > or = 90th percentile ( 19.6 % , P < 0.001 ) and > or = 97th percentile ( 7.2 % , P = 0.007 ) .
Result	Surprisingly , being ` hyperactive ' in the sense of the DSM-IV diagnosis of ADHD does not prevent the development or persistence of overweight and obesity in children .
Result	The examination of these children might be a helpful approach in the investigation of the relationship between obesity and its contributing psychological and behavioural factors .

Method	Seventy two spinal cord injured subjects ( 63 males and 9 females ) with long-standing lesions ( mean 110 months , range 43-187 ) were admitted to the Sunnaas Hospital for routine examination ( questionnaire , neurological status , radiography , urodynamics , blood
Method	The subjects were divided into three groups with Low - ( peak VO2 less than 15 ml/kg/min ) , Medium - ( 15 less than VO2 greater than 25 ) and High - ( VO2 greater than 25 ) endurance capacity .
Result	The rate of urinary tract infections ( UTIs ) and osteoporotic leg bones , was significantly reduced with increasing oxygen uptake ( p less than 0.05 , X2 test ) .
Result	Differences in scores for ADL-independency ( ADL = Activities of daily living ) and ambulation on crutches with braces , were even more pronounced between the L , M and H groups ( p less than 0.001 ) .
Result	The same trends , although not always statistically significant , were also observed in a homogeneous group of paraplegic patients ( n = 43 , injury level below T6 ) .
Result	The results emphasise the importance of regular physical endurance activities to patient well-being , because relatively high endurance capacity was found to be related to less frequent medical complications , and to a higher degree of ADL self-independency

Background	To examine the performance of two widely used outcome measures in public adult mental health services .
Method	As part of a larger study , clinical staff in eight New Zealand District Health Board areas collected consumer outcomes data for a period of 6 months .
Method	Among other measures , the Health of the Nation Outcome Scales ( HoNOS ) and Life Skills Profile ( LSP-16 ) were completed at the start and end of episodes of care , as well as at 90-day reviews .
Result	The performance of these two measures was examined in relation to compliance with the data collection protocol , item completion rates , certain psychometric properties , the relationship between them and the relationship of each instrument to the age , sex ,
Result	Compliance with the HoNOS was superior to the LSP-16 , but the reverse was true for completion .
Result	The two instruments were strongly correlated , but not enough to suggest that one may substitute for the other .
Result	A five-subscale structure for the HoNOS was supported .
Result	Certain HoNOS subscales were associated with age , but the total score was not , and differences between the sexes were small .
Result	Some large diagnostic differences were observed on both instruments .
Result	All LSP-16 summary scores and all HoNOS summary scores apart from Depression were higher ( worse ) in involuntary episodes .
Result	Only one LSP-16 item , relating to work potential , was related to age and men generally scored higher ( worse ) than women .
Result	From a technical perspective , the HoNOS and LSP-16 appear suitable for routine collection .
Result	New Zealand has adopted the HoNOS for routine use but not the LSP-16 because of local concerns about its appropriateness and acceptability .
Result	The clinician-rated measures reported here need to be complemented by both consumer-rated and family/carer measures .

Background	No somatic treatment has been found to be effective for chronic fatigue syndrome ( CFS ) .
Background	Antidepressant therapy is commonly used .
Background	Fluoxetine is recommended in preference to tricyclic agents because it has fewer sedative and autonomic nervous system effects .
Background	However , there have been no randomised , placebo-controlled , double-blind studies showing the effectiveness of antidepressant therapy in CFS .
Background	We have carried out such a study to assess the effect of fluoxetine in depressed and non-depressed CFS patients .
Method	In this randomised , double-blind study , we recruited 44 patients to the depressed CFS group , and 52 to the non-depressed CFS group .
Method	In each group participants were randomly assigned to receive either fluoxetine ( 20 mg once daily ) or placebo for 8 weeks .
Method	The effect of fluoxetine was assessed by questionnaires , self-observation lists , standard neuropsychological tests , and a motion-sensing device ( Actometer ) , which were applied on the day treatment started and on the last day .
Result	The two groups were well matched in terms of age , sex distribution , employment and marital status , and duration of CFS .
Result	There were no significant differences between the placebo and fluoxetine-treated groups in the change during the 8-week treatment period for any dimension of CFS .
Result	There was no change in subjective assessments of fatigue , severity of depression , functional impairment , sleep disturbances , neuropsychological function , cognitions , or physical activity in the depressed or the non-depressed subgroup .
Result	Fluoxetine in a 20 mg daily dose does not have a beneficial effect on any characteristic of CFS .
Result	The lack of effect of fluoxetine on depressive symptoms in CFS suggests that processes underlying the presentation of depressive symptoms in CFS may differ from those in patients with major depressive disorder .

Background	To evaluate the status of transmyocardial laser revascularization ( TMLR ) from an evidence-based perspective to help hospitals make resource management decisions .
Method	Qualitative systematic review of the clinical literature .
Method	We searched the reference databases MEDLINE , BIOSIS , EMBASE , SciSearch , and Current Contents to identify all articles related to TMLR published between January 1985 and March 1997 .
Method	We collected , analyzed , and summarized clinical studies in evidence tables .
Method	The cumulative evidence available in the medical literature regarding the safety and effectiveness of TMLR encompasses approximately 2000 patients treated worldwide , primarily those with medically refractory angina .
Result	Preliminary data suggest that TMLR has an acceptable survival rate and effectively relieves angina in approximately 75 % of patients .
Result	Data showing improved myocardial perfusion , cardiac function , or prognosis are inconclusive .
Result	The mechanism by which TMLR relieves angina is not yet known .
Result	Early evidence regarding TMLR suggests it will be useful for treating patients with end-stage coronary artery disease .
Result	Definitive recommendations await critical analysis of the results of ongoing randomized clinical trials , post-market surveillance studies , and third-party payer acceptance .

Method	The present study is a retrospective analysis of spinal fracture treatment with the Cotrel-Dubousset instrumentation technique .
Method	150 unstable injuries of the spine were treated with the CD implant at the University of Louisville -- Level I Trauma Center -- between February 1985 and March 1989 .
Method	There were 67 burst fractures , 48 compression fractures and 21 fracture dislocations , 8 flexion distraction fractures and 6 flexion rotation injuries .
Method	Ninety-three patients underwent anterior cord decompression and strut grafting followed by posterior CD instrumentation and posterolateral fusion .
Method	Fifty-seven patients had posterior CD instrumentation and fusion alone .
Result	No neurological deterioration after the procedure was observed , 33 patients improved neurologically .
Result	Hospital stay ranged between 7 and 60 days ( mean 20 days ) .
Result	114 patients had a minimum follow up of 6 months ( range 6-52 months ) .
Result	The mean follow up was 17.7 months .
Result	At final follow up 77.8 % of the patients had returned to work and 84.2 % of the patients were almost painfree .
Result	The mean loss of correction in the sagittal plane was 6.2 degrees ( range : 0 and 42 degrees ) at final follow up .
Result	As technical complications there were four hook cut outs ( 2.6 % ) of which two underwent reosteosynthesis and two did not effect the clinical or radiographic result .
Result	The high stability of the device provides a decreased risk of neurological deterioration , a decreased risk of posttraumatic kyphosis and early rehabilitation .

Background	Doctors need to identify and understand the professional behaviours of both themselves and others .
Background	In order for students to think critically about these issues we encouraged them to use the tenets of the General Medical Council 's Duties of a Doctor as a framework in which to reflect on the actions of healthcare professionals at work .
Background	Although the critical incident technique is a well-known process for encouraging reflection , little is known about its usefulness for assessment purposes in this setting .
Method	We aimed to discover the validity , feasibility and educational impact of the critical incident as an assessment method for first year students undertaking guided reflection in the context of their first exposure to multi-professional health and social car
Method	First year medical students submitted two critical incidents they had observed during multi-professional health and social care attachments and an evaluation of their experiences .
Result	Students engaged in the reflective cycle on the professional behaviours of others providing evidence of a varied range of situations .
Result	With adequate preparation , junior students are able to reflect on social and healthcare experiences using the Duties of a Doctor as a framework .
Result	Critical incidents are a valid and feasible method for assessing students ' reflections on professionalism , with good educational impact .

Background	One way of attempting to improve fetal growth has been nutrient supplementation for the mother when fetal growth is impaired .
Background	Different nutrients such as carbohydrates and amino acids have been suggested as treatments for impaired fetal growth .
Method	The objective of this review was to assess the effects of nutrient administration for suspected fetal growth impairment on fetal growth and perinatal outcome .
Method	We searched the Cochrane Pregnancy and Childbirth Group trials register .
Method	Date of last search 1 November 2002 .
Method	Acceptably controlled trials of nutrient administration for suspected impaired fetal growth compared to placebo or no treatment .
Method	Trial quality was assessed .
Result	Three studies involving 121 women were included .
Result	They were small and/or had methodological limitations .
Result	No difference was detected in the number of small for gestational age infants whose mothers had received nutrients compared to those who did not ( relative risk for calf blood extract 0.54 , 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) 0.20 to 1.47 ; for glucose 1.11 , 95 % C

Background	Spinal cord injury ( SCI ) is a devastating condition often affecting young and healthy individuals around the world .
Background	This debilitating condition not only creates enormous physical and emotional cost to individuals but also is a significant financial burden to society at large .
Background	This review was undertaken to understand the global impact of SCI on society .
Background	We also attempted to summarize the worldwide demographics and preventative strategies for SCI in varying economic and climatic environments and to evaluate how cultural and economic differences affect the etiology of SCI .
Method	A PUBMED database search was performed in order to identify clinical epidemiological studies of SCI within the last decade .
Method	In addition , World Bank and World Health Organization websites were used to obtain demographics , economics , and health statistics of countries of interest .
Method	A total of 20 manuscripts were selected from 17 countries .
Result	We found that SCI varies in etiology , male-to-female ratios , age distributions , and complications in different countries .
Result	Nations with similar economies tend to have similar features and incidences in all the above categories .
Result	However , diverse methods of classifying SCI were found , making comparisons difficult .
Result	Based upon these findings , it is clear that the categorization and evaluation of SCI must be standardized .
Result	The authors suggest improved methods of reporting in the areas of etiology , neurological classification , and incidence of SCI so that , in the future , more useful global comprehensive studies and comparisons can be undertaken .
Result	Unified injury prevention programs should be implemented through methods involving the Internet and international organizations , targeting the different etiologies of SCI found in different countries .

Background	Reactive oxygen species formation and release of pro-inflammatory/pro-atherogenic cytokines , that is , interleukin 1-beta and tumor necrosis factor-alpha , need the activation of the arachidonic acid cascade via the enzyme 5-lipoxygenase ( 5-Lox ) .
Background	5-Lox activity and expression are significantly increased in peripheral blood mononuclear cells ( PBMCs ) of end-stage renal disease ( ESRD ) patients on maintenance hemodialysis ( HD ) .
Background	Diets enriched with n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids ( PUFAs ) ( omega-3 ) have been associated to a lower incidence of coronary heart disease ( CHD ) and a reduction in atherosclerotic lesions .
Background	Omega-3 may interfere with the arachidonic acid cascade by inhibiting 5-Lox .
Method	Lipid peroxidation , leukotriene B ( 4 ) ( LTB ( 4 ) ) production , 5-Lox activity and expression were investigated in PBMC isolated from ESRD patients under maintenance HD before and after a 3-month oral supplementation with omega-3 at a daily dose of 2700 mg of n
Method	PBMCs from non-uremic volunteers were also investigated for comparison to normal parameters .
Result	Administration of omega-3 reduced significantly lipid peroxidation ( P < 0.0001 ) , LTB ( 4 ) synthesis ( P < 0.0001 ) and 5-Lox activity ( P < 0.0001 ) , with no effect on 5-Lox protein expression .
Result	After the 3-month washout , all parameters were comparable to those observed before treatment .
Result	Our results resemble those obtained after oral administration of vitamin E and are consistent with a reversible , dose-dependent inhibition of 5-Lox by omega-3 .
Result	Upregulation of 5-Lox may also be related to the increased mitochondrial damage and apoptosis of PBMCs observed in ESRD patients compared to non-uremic controls .
Result	Omega-3 may thus protect PBMCs of ESRD patients against oxidative stress .

Background	Chronic central pain is a frequent complication after spinal cord injury .
Background	Anticonvulsant drugs , among them valproate , have been recommended for treatment .
Method	In this paper we conducted a double-blind , cross-over study comparing valproate and placebo for severe chronic central pain .
Method	During the study , serum concentration of valproate , pain and side effects were registered and the dose was adjusted according to these .
Result	No significant analgesic effects of valproate could be demonstrated although serum concentration and dose reached a high level .
Result	Few studies of pain following spinal cord injury exist and we recommend that further studies be performed .

Background	Traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) is a major health problem , both in terms of the economic cost to society and the survivor 's quality of life .
Background	The development of devices to protect against TBI requires criteria that relate observed injury to measurements of head kinematics .
Background	The objective of this study is to find the best statistical correlates to impact-induced TBI in nonhuman primates using a qualified , self-consistent set of historical kinematic and TBI data from impact tests on nonhuman primates .
Method	A database was constructed and qualified from historical head impact tests on nonhuman primates .
Method	Multivariate logistic regression analysis with backwards stepwise elimination was performed .
Method	Variables considered are the peak rotational acceleration ( Omegamax ) , the peak linear acceleration ( Amax ) , and the number of impacts ( N ) .
Result	Bivariate combinations of angular acceleration and the number of impacts are the best correlates to all modes of TBI considered , i.e. , concussion , subarachnoid hemorrhage , brain contusion , and subdural hematoma .
Result	For a nonhuman primate with 100-g brain mass , the criteria that the probability of TBI is less than 10 % by injury mode are : Concussion : OmegamaxN ( 0.84 ) < 70 krad/s/s SAH : OmegamaxN ( 0.70 ) < 160 krad/s/s Contusion : Omegamax N ( 0.35 ) < 160 krad/s/s SD
Result	Based on this dataset , the best statistically based risk factor for all modes of TBI in nonhuman primates is the bivariate combination of rotational acceleration and number of impacts .

Background	Nociceptive inputs from primary afferents are primarily mediated at fast glutamatergic synapses onto second order neurons in the dorsal horn of the spinal cord through activation of AMPA/kainate and NMDA receptor subtypes of ionotropic glutamate receptors
Background	At these glutamatergic synapses several forms of short-lasting and long-lasting enhancement of synaptic transmission are known .
Background	Enhancement of excitatory synaptic transmission in nociceptive pathways is thought to be a key neural substrate underlying chronic pain , and thus the cellular and molecular mechanisms producing this enhancement represent potential targets for developing n
Background	Central to the mechanisms for pain hypersensitivity is the NMDA receptor , the activity of which is facilitated by convergent intracellular biochemical cascades in dorsal horn neurons .
Background	Cellular changes are not restricted to neurons in the dorsal horn , however , and there is growing evidence for involvement of glia , and of glia-neuronal signaling , in initiating and sustaining enhancement of nociceptive transmission .
Method	In particular , a role has emerged for microglia in pain hypersensitivity following nerve injury .
Result	This expanded understanding of cellular and molecular signalling mechanisms in the dorsal horn , that includes both neurons and glia , provides a basis of creating new types of strategies for management , and also for diagnosis , of chronic pain .

Background	Enuresis ( bedwetting ) is a socially disruptive and stressful condition which affects around 15-20 % of five year olds , and up to 2 % of young adults .
Background	To assess the effects of desmopressin on nocturnal enuresis in children , and to compare desmopressin with other interventions .
Method	We searched the Cochrane Incontinence Group trials register .
Method	Date of the most recent search March 2002 .
Method	The reference list of a previous version of this review was also searched .
Method	All randomised trials of desmopressin for nocturnal enuresis in children were included in the review .
Method	Comparison interventions included placebo , other drugs , alarms or behavioural methods .
Method	Trials focused solely on daytime wetting were excluded .
Method	Two reviewers independently assessed the quality of the eligible trials , and extracted data .
Result	Forty one randomised trials involving 2760 children ( of whom 1813 received desmopressin ) met the inclusion criteria .
Result	The quality of many of the trials was poor .
Result	Desmopressin was compared with another drug in four trials , and with alarms in seven .
Method	Desmopressin was effective in reducing bedwetting in a variety of doses and forms .
Result	Each dose of desmopressin reduced bedwetting by at least one night per week during treatment compared with placebo ( e.g. 20 microg : 1.34 fewer wet nights per week , 95 % CI 1.11 to 1.57 ) .
Method	Children on desmopressin were more likely to become dry ( e.g. RR for failure to achieve 14 dry nights with 20 mcg 0.84 , 95 % CI 0.79 to 0.91 ) .
Method	However , there was no difference after treatment was finished .
Result	There was no clear dose-related effect of desmopressin , but the evidence was limited .
Result	Data which compared oral and nasal administration were too few to be conclusive .
Result	While desmopressin was better than diclofenac or indomethacin , and comparison with tricyclic drugs ( amitriptyline and imipramine ) suggested that they might be as effective as desmopressin , the data were inconclusive due to small numbers .
Result	There were more side effects with the tricyclics .
Result	In one small trial , desmopressin resulted in more wet nights than alarms towards the end of treatment ( WMD 1.4 , 95 % CI : 0.14 to 2.66 ) and the chance of failure or relapse after alarms was less ( RR 9.17 , 95 % CI 1.28 to 65.90 ) .
Result	Although there were fewer wet nights during alarm treatment supplemented by desmopressin compared with alarms alone ( WMD -1.35 , 95 % CI -2.32 to -0.38 ) , the data are inconclusive about whether this is reflected in lower failure ( RR 0.88 , 95 % CI 0.52 to 1.50
Result	Desmopressin rapidly reduced the number of wet nights per week , but there was some evidence that this was not sustained after treatment stopped .
Result	Comparison with alternative treatments suggested that desmopressin and tricyclics had similar clinical effects , but that alarms may produce more sustained benefits .
Result	However , based on the available limited evidence , these conclusions can only be tentative .
Result	Children should be advised not to drink more than 240 ml ( 8 oz ) fluid during desmopressin treatment in order to avoid the possible risk of water intoxication .

Background	A substantial proportion of the population with congestive heart failure ( CHF ) has concomitant airway disease .
Background	Little information exists on the tolerability of carvedilol in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) .
Background	In this study , we assessed the tolerability and efficacy of carvedilol in patients with CHF and concomitant COPD or asthma .
Method	Between 1996 and 2000 , a total of 487 patients began receiving open-label carvedilol .
Method	Forty-three ( 9 % ) had COPD ( n = 31 ) or asthma ( n = 12 ) .
Method	Spirometry supported clinical diagnosis in all , and full pulmonary function testing supported diagnosis in 71 % .
Method	Sixty percent began carvedilol therapy in the hospital and underwent measurement of peak expiratory flow rates ( PEFR ) before and after dosing .
Result	In patients with COPD , mean forced expiratory volume in one second ( FEV ( 1 ) ) was 62 % + / - 13 % predicted , reversibility was 4 % + / - 4 % with bronchodilators , and FEV ( 1 ) / FVC was 62 % + / - 8 % .
Result	Mean PEFR was 325 + / - 115 liter/min before the dose and increased by 17 % 2 hours after the carvedilol dose ( p = 0.04 ) .
Result	In patients with asthma , mean FEV ( 1 ) was 80 % + / - 17 % predicted , reversibility was 13 % + / - 7 % , and FEV ( 1 ) / FVC was 74 % + / - 11 % .
Result	Mean PEFR was 407 + / - 161 liter/min before the dose with no significant change 2 hours after the dose .
Result	Carvedilol was introduced safely in 84 % of patients with COPD , with only 1 patient withdrawn from therapy for wheezing .
Result	In contrast , only 50 % of patients with asthma tolerated carvedilol .
Result	Survival at 2.5 years was 72 % .
Result	In survivors , left ventricular end-diastolic diameter decreased from 76 + / - 11 mm to 72 + / - 14 mm ( p = 0.01 ) , left ventricular end-systolic diameter decreased from 65 + / - 13 mm to 60 + / - 15 mm ( p = 0.01 ) , and fractional shortening increased from 14 % + / - 7
Result	Patients with CHF and COPD tolerated carvedilol well with no significant reversible airflow limitation , but patients with CHF and asthma tolerated carvedilol poorly .
Result	The effect of carvedilol on left ventricular dimensions and function in patients with concomitant airway diseases was similar to that seen in our general group of patients .
Result	Asthma remains a contraindication to beta-blockade .

Background	It was hypothesised from previous observational studies in the Faroes and Denmark that dietary marine n-3 fatty acids would prolong the duration of pregnancy and thereby increase the birth weight , by influencing the production of prostaglandins involved i
Method	Five hundred and thirty-three healthy Danish women were randomly assigned in the 30th week of pregnancy to fish oil ( 2.7 g n-3 fatty acids ( 4 1-g capsules Pikasol oil ) per day ) , olive oil ( 4 1-g capsules per day ) or no oil supplementation .
Result	The three groups differed in mean gestational age at birth ( ANOVA , p = 0.006 ) , with the fish oil group ranking highest and the olive oil group lowest .
Result	Babies born to women allocated fish oil had on average 4.0 ( 95 % confidence interval 1.5 ; 6.4 ) days higher gestational age and 107 ( 95 % confidence interval 1 ; 214 ) g higher weight at birth than babies born to women allocated olive oil ; the difference in gest
Result	Fish oil supplementation in the third trimester seems to prolong gestation while allowing continued growth of the foetus ; this effect seems to explain the difference between the Faroes and Denmark in pregnancy duration .

Background	To review the change in number of referrals to speech and language therapy for dysphasia and dysphagia over one decade .
Method	This retrospective study analyses data collected on an information system developed specifically for the use of speech and language therapists in the management of their services .
Method	Eleven health care providers used the system between 1985 and 1995 and recorded details of 73758 patients referred to speech and language therapy during that period .
Result	Whilst there were 12 times as many dysphasic patients as dysphagic patients referred to speech and language therapy in 1987 , the position was reversed by 1995 with twice as many dysphagic as dysphasic patients being referred to these services .
Result	Dysphagia in 1987 accounted for less than 1 % of the referrals to speech and language therapy .
Result	This percentage increased , until in 1995 20 % of referrals were for dysphagia .
Result	No causal relationship between the changes in referral to speech and language therapy for these two groups has been established in this study .
Result	However , there has been a significant increase in referral to speech and language therapy of people with dysphagia .
Result	Whilst referrals for dysphasia have increased , they represent a lower percentage increase and now receive less treatment per case than in 1987 .

Method	The pregnancy outcomes for 41 patients with high-risk pregnancies who had undergone antepartum fetal heart rate testing between July 5 , 1977 , and April 10 , 1980 , and demonstrated a nonreactive nonstress test ( NST ) and a positive contraction stress test ( C
Method	The estimated gestational ages of the time of the positive CST ranged from 28 to 44 weeks ' gestation .
Result	Of the 41 pregnant women with a positive CST , 30 were allowed to labor .
Result	The remaining 11 patients underwent immediate cesarean section ( 8 ) or were managed expectantly because of immature phospholipid profiles ( 3 ) .
Result	In the laboring group , 60.0 % had evidence of late decelerations .
Result	Cesarean section for persistent late decelerations was necessary in 33.3 % .
Result	The overall cesarean section rate for the positive CST group was 58.5 % .
Result	The neonatal outcome for these 41 pregnancies demonstrated 29.3 % of fetuses to be growth retarded and 17.1 % of fetuses to have congenital abnormalities .
Result	The overall perinatal mortality rate was 7.3 % .
Result	This investigation further substantiates the increased fetal and neonatal risks associated with a nonreactive NST and a positive CST .
Result	Induction of labor with direct fetal monitoring should be attempted in a term gestation where the cervix is ready for induction of labor and where rapid intervention by cesarean section is possible .

Background	The aim of this study was to determine whether the probability of osteoporosis and osteopenia was affected by the risk factors , physical examination findings , or radiological investigations such as spinal X-rays in postmenopausal women .
Method	We assessed risk factors such as use of hormone replacement therapy , physical activity level , calcium intake , smoking , caffeine consumption , long-term immobilization , previous history of fracture , family history of fracture , presence of certain systemic diseases ( hyperthyroidism or hyperparathyroidism ) , or use of medications ( corticosteroids or others ) , physical examinations , and presence of vertebral fractures on spinal X-rays .
Method	Patients ' bone mineral density ( BMD ) was evaluated using dual energy X-ray absorptiometry ( DXA ) in the lumbar spine , and we compared the risk factors between osteopenic and osteoporotic women according to DXA .
Method	We evaluated 235 postmenopausal women who attended our osteoporosis outpatient clinic .
Method	Those patients were divided into two groups as either osteopenic ( n = 67 , mean age 63.1 years ) or osteoporotic ( n = 168 , mean age 66.2 years ) according to WHO criteria .
Result	The lumbar spinal ( L1-L2 ) T-score values were -1.5 + / - 0.6 and -3.1 + / - 0.6 in osteopenic and osteoporotic groups , respectively .
Result	There were significant differences between the two groups in terms of mean age and lumbar BMD ( p = 0.009 and p < 0.001 , respectively ) .
Result	We also observed that vertebral tenderness on palpation , back pain , and existing vertebral fracture ( fx ) were significantly different between the osteopenic and osteoporotic groups ( p < 0.05 ) .
Result	As a result of the statistical analysis , we found an equation to determine osteopenic and osteoporotic women by using those four factors ( age , vertebral tenderness on palpation , back pain , and existing vertebral fx ) in multivariate stepwise logistic regre
Result	The equation is as follows : Y ( DXA ) = -2.9024 + 0.044 ( age in year ) + 0.819 ( vertebral fx ) + 0.877 ( pain ) + 1.136 ( vertebral tenderness ) .
Result	We can estimate whether a postmenopausal woman is osteopenic or osteoporotic based on these risk factors by using the stepwise logistic regression equation .

Background	This study was undertaken to determine if an AMPA ( LY215490 ) or an NMDA ( MK-801 ) glutamatergic receptor antagonist can reduce urinary tract dysfunctions related to detrusor hyperreflexia and detrusor-sphincter dyssynergia in awake , spinal cord-injured ( SC
Method	Experiments were performed on female Sprague-Dawley rats in which the spinal cord was completely transected at T ( 8-10 ) level , 2-3 weeks prior to performing an intravesical continuous infusion cystometrogram ( CMG ) .
Method	Bladder volume threshold ( VT ) for inducing voiding and voiding efficiency ( VE ) were determined by measuring voided volumes and residual volumes ( RV ) .
Method	After control CMGs were performed , cumulative intravenous doses of LY215490 ( 0.1 , 1 , and 10 mg/kg ) or MK-801 ( 0.03 , 0.3 , and 3 mg/kg ) were administered at 120-min intervals .
Result	03 and 0.3 mg/kg ) did not affect any parameters .
Result	A large dose ( 10 mg/kg ) of LY215490 decreased maximal voiding pressure ( MVP ) by 27 % and increased RV by 119 % and VT by 58 % but did not decrease VE .
Result	The highest cumulative dose ( 3 mg/kg ) of MK-801 significantly increased RV by 134 % and VT by 44 % and markedly decreased VE by 60 % and MVP by 18 % .
Result	The effects of LY215490 to reduce MVP and increase VT without changing VE suggest that an AMPA receptor antagonist might be useful in treating detrusor-sphincter dyssynergia and bladder hypertrophy after SCI .
Result	The effect of MK-801 to markedly reduce VE indicates that NMDA receptor antagonists may exacerbate neurogenic bladder dysfunction in SCI patients .

Background	Atrial fibrosis is an important substrate in atrial fibrillation ( AF ) , particularly in the setting of structural heart disease .
Background	In a canine model , congestive heart failure ( CHF ) produces significant atrial fibrosis and the substrate for sustained AF .
Background	This atrial remodeling is a potential therapeutic target .
Method	The objective of the present study is to evaluate the effects of the antifibrotic drug pirfenidone ( PFD ) on arrhythmogenic atrial remodeling in a canine CHF model .
Method	We studied 15 canines , divided equally into 3 groups : control , CHF canines not treated with PFD , and CHF canines treated with PFD .
Method	CHF was induced by ventricular tachypacing ( 220 bpm for 3 weeks ) , and oral PFD was administered for the 3-week pacing period .
Method	We performed electrophysiology and AF vulnerability studies , atrial fibrosis measurements , and atrial cytokine expression studies .
Result	Only canines in the untreated CHF group developed sustained AF ( > 30 minutes , 4 of 5 canines ; P < 0.05 ) .
Result	Treatment of CHF canines with PFD resulted in an attenuation of arrhythmogenic left atrial remodeling , with a significant reduction in left atrial conduction heterogeneity index ( median [ 25 % to 75 % interquartile range ] 4.96 [ 3.53 to 5.64 ] versus 2.52 [ 2.1
Result	Immunoblotting studies demonstrated the drug 's effects on multiple cytokines , including a reduction in transforming growth factor-beta1 expression .
Result	Treatment of CHF canines with PFD results in significantly reduced arrhythmogenic atrial remodeling and AF vulnerability .
Result	Pharmacological therapy targeted at the fibrotic substrate itself may play an important role in the management of AF .

Background	Who should be the judge of quality care -- the consumer or healthcare professional ?
Background	Traditionally , healthcare providers have decided what services consumers should receive and how consumers ' needs should be met .
Background	Current trends in healthcare delivery are changing this one-sided practice .
Background	Throughout the United States , to determine what constitutes quality care , accrediting bodies , insurers , consumer groups , providers , and governments are collecting and analyzing data on standards for clinical practice , patient outcomes , and perceptions of

Background	To compare the appearance of superficial lymph nodes on standard two-dimensional ( 2D ) ultrasound examination and on three-dimensional ( 3D ) ultrasound examination .
Method	Fifty two lymph nodes ( 35 cervical , 16 axillary , 1 inguinal ) in 52 patients were examined with ultrasound in 3D mode .
Method	In standard 2D grey-scale examination and on a C-plane of 3D mode ( parallel to the surface of the probe ) , the shape of a lymph node and its hilum were assessed .
Method	Final histopathological diagnoses included 36 lymphomas , 11 reactive or inflammatory lymph nodes , 3 metastases and 2 plasmocytoma infiltrations .
Result	The appearance of hilums and lymph nodes as a whole changed on a C-plane of 3D mode ( as compared with 2D presentation ) in 28 % and 37 % , respectively .
Result	The differences in lymph node shape on 2D and 3D ultrasound were apparent in a comparable percentage of reactive lymph nodes ( 45 % ) and lymphomatous lymph nodes ( 39 % ) .
Result	The differences in lymph node hilum shape on 2D and 3D ultrasound applied to 56 % of reactive lymph nodes and 20 % of lymphomatous lymph nodes .
Result	Three-dimensional imaging on a C-plane ( parallel to the surface of the probe ) may supply the examiner with different information concerning the shape of the lymph node and its hilum in comparison to standard 2D ultrasound .
Result	Changes in the shapes of hilum and lymph node occurred in reactive or inflamed lymph nodes as well as in lymphomas .
Result	Clinical significance of this fact demands further investigation .

Background	Previous conflicting results about the prognostic significance of estrogen receptor ( ER ) - beta in breast cancer may be explained by contribution of isoforms , of which five exist .
Method	Our aim was to elucidate the prognostic significance of ERbeta1 , ERbeta2 , and ERbeta5 by immunohistochemistry in a large cohort of breast carcinomas with long-term follow-up .
Method	Tissue microarrays were stained with ERbeta1 , ERbeta2 , and ERbeta5 antibodies and scored as percentage of positive tumor cells and using the Allred system .
Method	Nuclear and cytoplasmic staining was evaluated and correlated with histopathologic characteristics , overall survival ( OS ) , and disease-free survival ( DFS ) .
Result	Nuclear ERbeta2 and ERbeta5 , but not ERbeta1 , significantly correlated with OS ( P = 0.006 , P = 0.039 , and P = 0.099 , respectively ) , and ERbeta2 additionally with DFS ( P = 0.013 ) .
Result	ERbeta2 also predicted response to endocrine therapy ( P = 0.036 ) ; correlated positively with ERalpha , progesterone receptor , androgen receptor , and BRCA1 ; and correlated inversely with metastasis and vascular invasion .
Result	Tumors coexpressing ERbeta2 and ERalpha had better OS and DFS .
Result	Cytoplasmic ERbeta2 expression , alone or combined with nuclear staining , predicted significantly worse OS .
Result	Notably , patients with only cytoplasmic ERbeta2 expression had significantly worse outcome ( P = 0.0014 ) .
Result	This is the first study elucidating the prognostic role of ERbeta1 , ERbeta2 , and ERbeta5 in a large breast cancer series .
Result	ERbeta2 is a powerful prognostic indicator in breast cancer , but nuclear and cytoplasmic expression differentially affect outcome .
Result	Measuring these in clinical breast cancer could provide a more comprehensive picture of patient outcome , complementing ERalpha .

Method	There is limited randomized controlled trial ( RCT ) evidence for compulsory community treatment .
Method	Other study methods may clarify their effectiveness .
Background	We reviewed RCT and non-RCT evidence for the effect of compulsory community treatment on hospital admissions , bed-days , compliance and out-patient contacts .
Method	A systematic review of RCTs , controlled before-and-after ( CBA ) studies , and interrupted time series ( ITS ) analyses .
Method	Meta-analysis of RCTs .
Result	Eight papers covering five studies ( two RCTs and three CBAs ) met inclusion criteria ( total n = 1108 ) .
Result	There was no statistical difference in 12-month admission rates between subjects on involuntary out-patient treatment and controls .
Result	Survival analyses of time to admission were equivocal .
Result	All five studies reported decreases in the number of bed-days following involuntary out-patient treatment but this only reached statistical significance in one situation ; patients receiving the intervention were less likely to have admissions of over 100
Result	There was no difference in treatment adherence between the intervention and control groups in either RCT or two of the CBA studies .
Result	However , the third CBA study reported a statistically significant increase of nearly five visits in the mean number of overall contacts in the involuntary out-patient treatment group .
Result	The evidence for involuntary out-patient treatment in reducing either admissions or bed-days is very limited .
Result	It therefore can not be seen as a less restrictive alternative to admission .
Result	Other effects are uncertain .
Result	Evaluation of a wide range of outcomes should be included if this type of legislation is introduced .

Background	A functional capacity evaluation ( FCE ) is a detailed examination and evaluation that objectively measures the individual 's current level of safe functional abilities , primarily within the context of the demands of competitive employment .
Background	It measures the ability to perform functional or work-related tasks and predicts the potential to sustain these tasks over a defined time-frame .
Background	Measurements of function from an FCE are compared to the physical demands of a job or other functional activities , and are used to make return-to-work/activity decisions , disability determinations , or to generate a rehabilitation plan .
Background	Scientific evidence on validity and reliability is limited so far .
Background	An FCE is time-consuming and can not be recommended as a routine evaluation .

Background	Serotonin abnormalities may be involved in the etiopathogenesis of obsessive-compulsive disorder ( OCD ) .
Background	The silent G-to-C substitution at nucleotide 861 of the coding region of the 5-HT ( 1Dbeta ) receptor gene may be associated with liability to OCD .
Method	The aim of this study was to investigate this association in an Italian OCD study group .
Method	Genotyping for 5-HT ( 1Dbeta ) was performed for 79 nuclear families of probands with OCD .
Method	The transmission/disequilibrium test was used to determine transmission of the alleles from parents to offspring .
Result	Of the 79 families , 48 were informative for the analysis , i.e. , both parents were genotyped for 5-HT ( 1Dbeta ) , and at least one parent was heterozygous .
Result	No preferential transmission of either allele of the 5-HT ( 1Dbeta ) gene was observed .
Result	These data do not support a role for the 5-HT ( 1Dbeta ) receptor gene in conferring susceptibility to OCD .

Method	One hundred thirty-four patients suspected of having pancreas cancer successfully underwent gray scale ultrasound examination of the pancreas .
Result	The prospective ultrasound findings were correlated with the final diagnoses , laparotomy findings , and pathology findings .
Result	Fifty-four patients had pancreas cancer , confirmed by resection or biopsy in all cases .
Result	On ultrasonography , the pancreas was correctly reported to have abnormalities in sixty-one of seventy-eight patients ( 78 per cent ) and correctly reported to have no abnornalities in thirty-eight of fifty-six patients ( 68 per cent ) .
Result	A correct ultrasound diagnosis of pancreas cancer was made for forty-four of fifty-six patients ( 81 per cent ) , and there were thirteen false-positive reports .
Result	Ninety-four percent of cancers confined to the head of the pancreas and 70 per cent of cancers at other locations within the gland were detected by ultrasound examination .
Result	The correct ultrasound diagnosis was given for fifteen of seventeen patients with resectable pancreas cancer , the degree of associated pancreatitis ranging from minimal to severe .
Result	Analysis of the predictive values of positive and negative ultrasound examinations suggests that this test could be used to screen a population of patients with symptoms mildly suggestive of pancreas cancer .
Result	The importance of preselecting the level of confidence of a positive test result , a , ove which further investigation is indicated , is emphasized .

Background	This article addresses measures of importance to women of reproductive age in the first National Healthcare Quality Report ( NHQR ) and National Healthcare Disparities Report ( NHDR ) .
Method	The authors review each of the 4 components of quality of care effectiveness , safety , timeliness , and patient centeredness .
Method	The effectiveness component topics with relevance to women of childbearing age include breast cancer , cervical cancer , HIV , AIDS , mental health , and maternity care .
Method	The safety component includes 3 relevant measures of obstetric trauma .
Method	The quality aspects of timeliness of care and patient centeredness will be discussed in terms of women , although the NHQR and NHDR did not include them as a separate topic because the data were so limited regarding women .
Result	There is a foundation of knowledge about many aspects of quality health care for women of reproductive age .
Result	However , gaps are evident in some measures , usually due to insufficient data .
Result	Further development of the measure set would benefit from additional process and outcome variables that can link screening , diagnosis , and treatment with health outcomes .
Result	Such linkages will expand our knowledge and capability to improve health outcomes for women of reproductive age .

Background	Traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) subjects at Glasgow Outcome Scale levels 3 ( severe disability ) , 4 ( moderate disability ) , 5 ( good recovery ) , and an other-injury control group ( OIC ) were compared in terms of neuropsychological , psychosocial , and vocational fun
Method	Subjects were a sample of 100 patients with a moderate to severe traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) and a matched sample of 30 other-injury control subjects ( OIC ) enrolled in the UCLA Brain Injury Research Center study of TBI outcome .
Result	Overall , the results showed a systematic decrease in mean neuropsychological test performance as a function of increasing GOS severity , as well as an increased prevalence of symptoms of depression and lower ratings on measures assessing employability and
Result	TBI patients in the ` severe ' and ` moderate disability ' groups were distinctly inferior to the ` good recovery ' and ` OIC ' groups , who were quite similar to each other in terms of cognitive , psychosocial , and vocational outcomes .
Result	The results demonstrate overall support for the predictive and concurrent validity of the GOS 6 months post injury .
Result	Despite these results , which strengthen the utility and appeal of the GOS for multicentre studies , concerns still remain regarding GOS category 4 ( moderate disability ) , which was shown to lack sufficient discriminability in this study .

Method	In a prospective randomised study with a 2-year follow-up , 103 patients were randomised to anterior cervical decompression and fusion ( ACDF ) with a cervical carbon-fibre intervertebral fusion cage ( CIFC ) or the Cloward procedure ( CP ) .
Background	The purpose of the present study was to report predictors for fusion and also to investigate the importance of radiological variables for the clinical outcome .
Method	Gender , age , smoking habits , disc height , segmental kyphosis and type of surgical procedure were used as independent ( before surgery ) variables in a multiple regression model .
Method	Male gender , one-level surgery and CP treatment were significant predictors of fusion and explained 14 % of the variability of fusion status at follow-up .
Method	Number of levels operated on , however , did not influence the clinical outcome .
Result	Fifty-two per cent of the women and 17 % of the men in the CIFC group , and 25 % of the women and 8 % of the men in the CP group , had pseudarthrosis .
Result	Although patients with a healed fusion had significantly less pain intensity than patients with pseudarthrosis , radiological variables explained only 4 % of the variability of pain at follow-up .
Result	Apart from a significant correlation between preoperative kyphosis and neck disability index at follow-up , no significant correlation between either postoperative kyphosis or preoperative or postoperative disc height and clinical outcome was found .
Result	Neither degree of segmental kyphosis nor disc height was different between patients with healed fusion and pseudarthrosis .
Result	One can conclude that male gender and type of surgery were significant predictors for a healed fusion and that pseudarthrosis affected outcome .
Result	In contrast to the commonly held view based mainly on theoretical considerations , no effect on clinical outcome could be demonstrated for segmental kyphosis and disc height at follow-up .
Result	Overall , the study shows that the importance of radiological factors as predictors for fusion as well as clinical outcome is limited .

Background	Depression is the most prevalent psychiatric disorder in the elderly and several studies indicate that 10-15 % of persons over 65 years suffer from significant depressive symptoms .
Background	Despite the high prevalence , most cases of depression in the elderly remain unrecognized and untreated , maybe because of a different pattern of symptoms across age groups .
Method	The objective of the study was to compare symptomatology and diagnostic profile between younger and elderly DSM-III and DSM-III-R major depressed inpatients and to advise an appropriate depression scale for the elderly .
Method	The study covers 461 depressed inpatients evaluated with the Hamilton Depression Scale and the Newcastle 1965 Scale .
Method	To find differences between younger and elderly patients , the symptomatology was analyzed stepwise by principal component analyses , latent structure analyses and single item analyses .
Result	No clinically significant differences in symptomatology between younger and elderly depressed patients were found .
Result	The DSM-IV concept of Major Depression and the ICD-10 criteria for depression was not influenced by patients ' age .
Result	All patients were hospitalized and mainly endogenously depressed and generalization of the results to other populations should be made with caution .
Result	Only pretreatment data was analyzed .
Result	The DSM-IV concept of Major Depression and the ICD-10 criteria for depression can be used without modification for age .

Background	The purpose of this study was to examine symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) in a community sample of low-income pregnant women who met the DSM-IV diagnostic criteria for the disorder .
Method	Pregnant women ( N = 948 ) were screened for trauma , PTSD , depression , and co-occurring illicit substance use .
Method	PTSD symptoms were compared in traumatized pregnant women and a sample of nonpregnant traumatized women from the National Comorbidity Survey .
Result	Suicidal thoughts and a high degree of psychiatric comorbidity were common in pregnant women with PTSD .
Result	Pregnant women were selectively and significantly less likely to endorse reexperiencing symptoms of PTSD ( 29.5 % , N = 82 ) , compared to nonpregnant women ( 79.4 % , N = 464 ) .
Result	PTSD in pregnancy was associated with comorbidity , poor health behaviors , and lower recall of memory-related PTSD symptoms .
Result	Further prospective study is needed .

Background	Health-related quality of life ( HRQL ) is an important consideration in the management of patients with vertebral fractures .
Method	The purpose of this study was to examine patient-related factors that contribute to HRQL after vertebral fractures , including co-morbidities , medications , fracture history , family disease history , demographics , exercise , education and living environment .
Method	A total of 1,129 post-menopausal women ( mean age 67.2 , SD 11.9 years ) was studied from the Canadian Database of Osteoporosis and Osteopenia ( CANDOO ) .
Method	HRQL was measured using the mini-osteoporosis quality of life questionnaire ( mini-OQLQ ) .
Method	Separate multivariable linear regression analyses [ parameter estimates and corresponding 95 % confidence intervals ( CI ) ] were performed for each of the five mini-OQLQ domains symptoms , physical functioning , emotional functioning , activities of daily living and leisure domains .
Result	A strong positive association was found between HRQL and post-secondary education , a family history of osteoporosis , working and thiazide therapy .
Result	Exercise improved HRQL ; however , several hours a week were required to be meaningful .
Result	Living in long-term care had the most marked negative effect on HRQL .
Result	Smoking , past surgery of the hip or spine , sedatives , anticonvulsants , atherosclerotic disease and hypertension were also associated with a substantially decreased HRQL across several domains .
Result	Calcium channel-blockers , chemotherapy , corticosteroids , diabetes , migraines , the number of non-vertebral fractures and falls had a negative impact on selected domains .
Result	We demonstrated that several modifiable factors influence HRQL in patients with vertebral fractures , and physicians should be aware of these and other markers of reduced HRQL to enhance patient care .

Background	Colorectal cancer is an important disease in the Australian community .
Background	Whilst there has been much discussion about the appropriate management of local disease , particularly with respect to the issue of adjuvant therapy , there has been relatively little local discussion of treatment options in metastatic colorectal cancer .
Background	The critical principles underlying treatment in this setting are briefly outlined in the present article , indicating wherever possible what options could be considered standard , and based on the available literature , which approaches must still be conside
Result	Overall , the results of treatment in this group of patients remain poor .
Result	Further clinical trials are required to address the issues affecting patients with metastatic colorectal cancer .

Background	To evaluate the effect of group educational interventions in type-2 diabetes patients .
Background	To analyse what kind of group intervention has the best long-term effects .
Method	Systematic review .
Method	Review of electronic data bases CENTRAL , MEDLINE , EMBASE , CINAHL , and PASCAL , and of the bibliographic references of the studies selected .
Method	Contacts with experts to locate non-published articles .
Method	Selection of studies .
Method	Randomised clinical studies with controls and quasi-experimental studies that evaluate group education interventions aimed at type-2 diabetes patients over 18 years old .

Background	The prognosis for survival has improved dramatically for cancer patients over the past three decades .
Background	Advances in systemic therapy have prolonged survival even in those who can not be cured .
Background	The importance of managing spinal column disease and protecting the spinal cord has subsequently been amplified .
Background	Almost any patient presenting with detectable neurologic function and enough physical reserve to withstand an operation will benefit from a spinal stabilization , pain relief , and neural decompression ; there are few exceptions .
Background	Advances in surgical technique and biomaterials have not only improved survival and functional outcome , they have diminished many of the postoperative complications that plagued earlier treatment techniques .
Background	Methods of preventing or correcting iatrogenic deformity have improved outcome .
Background	Newer fixation techniques promise to eliminate many of the causes of hardware and fixation failure previously seen .
Background	Improved medical management , antibiotics , and preoperative planning , along with techniques of preoperative embolization and early postoperative mobilization have made surgical management much less risky .
Background	Vertebrectomy , considered a last alternative in the past , is now coming to be seen as the conservative approach to tumor management in many situations .
Background	Appropriate surgical treatment can have a dramatic impact on function and outcome in patients with tumors of the spinal column , and should never be dismissed as an option without serious consideration .
Background	Advances in fixation systems , local and systemic therapy , and in our understanding of the biology of cancer promise even greater improvements for the future .

Method	A quasi-experimental design was used to compare the Symptom Checklist 90-Revised profiles ( SCL-90-R ) from a group of patients with whiplash injuries ( n = 67 ) and a group with mixed musculoskeletal pain ( n = 91 ) .
Method	To test the discriminant validity of the characteristic SCL-90-R whiplash profile as proposed by Wallis and Bogduk using a multivariate statistical technique .
Background	On the basis of two studies by themselves and their colleagues , Wallis and Bogduk proposed a characteristic SCL-90-R profile evident in samples of patients with whiplash injuries .
Background	Their assertion has not been tested empirically in any published studies .
Method	The participants in this study consisted of 158 patients at a rehabilitation hospital who completed the SCL-90-R under standard instructions and subsequently were diagnosed by a team comprising a chiropractor , physical therapist , and physician .
Method	The participants were categorized as having whiplash-associated disorders or pain caused by other musculoskeletal injuries .
Method	A profile analysis following Hotelling 's method was used to determine the comparability of SCL-90-R profiles from the two groups .
Result	The profile analysis showed no statistically significant differences between the groups with regard to either the shape or the overall elevation of their psychological profiles .
Result	The SCL-90-R profiles from both groups were similar to those reported from other chronic pain syndromes , with elevations on the Somatization , Depression , Obsessive-Compulsive , and Psychoticism scales .
Result	The current study failed to support the validity of a distinctive SCL-90-R profile for patients with whiplash injuries .
Result	Instead , the results suggest that the psychological consequences of experiencing chronic pain from whiplash-associated disorders are similar to the psychological consequences of chronic pain from other musculoskeletal injuries .

Background	To review variations in outcomes in schizophrenia across individual , historical , and cross-cultural boundaries , as well as within specific domains of functioning .
Method	Research literature on the outcomes of schizophrenia appearing within the last 8 years was reviewed .
Result	First , a review of follow-up studies published in the developed world suggests that heterogeneity in outcome across individuals with schizophrenia remains the rule , with affective symptoms , later and acute onset , and responsiveness to biological treatment
Result	Negative symptoms are associated with poor outcome , cognitive impairments , and incapacity in social and work domains .
Result	Deterioration appears to occur within the first few months of onset if not already in the prodrome , with recent early-course studies finding longer duration of untreated psychosis associated with insidious onset , negative symptoms , social and work incapac
Result	Second , a review of recent cross-cultural and historical studies provides evidence that outcome varies across time and place , schizophrenia having a more favourable outcome in the developing world and becoming a more benign disorder over the course of thi
Result	Third , a review of studies of the domains of functioning within individuals identifies 4 relatively independent dimensions of depression and negative , psychotic , and disorganized symptoms .
Result	Cognitive deficits , which are associated with negative symptoms , also constitute a relatively stable dimension over time , showing neither marked deterioration nor improvement once established early in the course of disorder .
Result	The early appearance and stability over time of negative symptoms and cognitive impairments call for assertive intervention efforts early in the course of disorder to prevent chronicity and prolonged disability .

Background	Crisis resolution teams ( CRTs ) are being introduced throughout England , but their evidence base is limited .
Method	To compare outcomes of crises before and after introduction of a CRT .
Method	A new methodology was developed for identification and operational definition of crises .
Method	A quasi-experimental design was used to compare cohorts presenting just before and just after a CRT was established .
Result	Following introduction of the CRT , the admission rate in the 6 weeks after a crisis fell from 71 % to 49 % ( OR 0.38 , 95 % CI 0.21-0 .70 ) .
Result	A difference of 5.6 points ( 95 % CI 2.0-8 .3 ) on mean Client Satisfaction Questionnaire ( CSQ-8 ) score favoured the CRT .
Result	These findings remained significant after adjustment for baseline differences .
Result	No clear difference emerged in involuntary hospitalisations , symptoms , social functioning or quality of life .
Result	CRTs may prevent some admissions and patients prefer them , although other outcomes appear unchanged in the short term .

Background	Few options are available for patients with severe heart failure that is unresponsive to therapy with digoxin , diuretics , and vasodilators .
Method	The clinical responses and predictors of survival were studied in 41 consecutive patients with New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) class IV heart failure during long-term oral enoximone therapy ( mean dose 232 + / - 15 mg/day ) .
Method	The mean age was 60 + / - 1 years , and the initial left ventricular ejection fraction was 0.19 + / - 0.01 .
Method	The cause of heart failure was either coronary artery disease ( n = 23 ) or dilated cardiomyopathy ( n = 18 ) .
Result	Symptomatic improvement occurred in the majority ( 83 % ) of patients ; 24 % improved two or more NYHA classes .
Result	Although the 12-month mortality rate for the entire group was high ( 54 + / - 8 % ) , a subgroup of patients with dilated cardiomyopathy achieved a sustained benefit with a decrease in symptoms > 1 NYHA class , fewer hospitalizations , and a survival rate at 24 m
Result	Multivariate analysis identified the cause of heart failure , left ventricular ejection fraction , and clinical improvement within 60 days of enoximone therapy as predictors of a favorable long-term outcome .
Result	The presence of coronary artery disease was most predictive of early mortality ( p < 0.0002 ) , with only 5 % of patients surviving > 18 months compared to 66 % of those with dilated cardiomyopathy .
Result	Median survival rates were 132 + / - 31 and 921 + / - 214 days ( p < 0.001 ) for the coronary artery disease and dilated cardiomyopathy populations , respectively .
Result	Oral enoximone can provide symptomatic improvement and a palliative option for the majority of patients with refractory heart failure resulting from cardiomyopathy .

Background	Microgliosis is implicated in the pathophysiology of several neurological disorders , including neuropathic pain .
Background	Consequently , perturbation of microgliosis is a mechanistic and drug development target in neuropathic pain , which highlights the requirement for specific , sensitive and reproducible methods of microgliosis measurement .
Method	In this study , we used the spinal microgliosis associated with L5 spinal nerve transection and minocycline-induced attenuation thereof to ( 1 ) evaluate novel software based semi-quantitative image analysis paradigms for the assessment of immunohistochemical images .
Method	Microgliosis was revealed by immunoreactivity to OX42 .
Method	Several image analysis paradigms were assessed and compared to a previously validated subjective categorical rating scale .
Result	This comparison revealed that grey scale measurement of the proportion of a defined area of spinal cord occupied by OX42 immunoreactive cells is a robust image analysis paradigm .
Result	( 2 ) Develop and validate a flow cytometric approach for quantification of spinal microgliosis .
Result	The flow cytometric technique reliably quantified microgliosis in spinal cord cell suspensions , using OX42 and ED9 immunoreactivity to identify microglia .
Result	The results suggest that image analysis of immunohistochemical revelation of microgliosis reliably detects the spinal microgliosis in response to peripheral nerve injury and pharmacological attenuation thereof .
